review: Wouldn't let me order a coffee while holding my tiny dog.  I live on 11th st 2 blocks from this cafe in an apartment I've owned for 7 years.  That's a first for me In this neighborhood. Most will let you order inside and wait outside. They wouldn't take my order.

The selection of drinks and smoothies and food is wonderful. They've got something for everyone, including vegetarians and vegans. The staff was friendly too. Only downside was that the manager said they "no longer offer the free cook deal" offered here on Yelp. When I showed it to them they said "yeah...we should probably take that down." Not cool
I've been coming here for years and love it. The owners are great, the food is delicious and it's so unique. In the best part of town too! Definitely worth checking out.
The food is not good, the space is too small, and while I was there they messed up multiple guests order, including mine. Also does not appear clean. Never again.

First time here.  I'll be here again.  What you need to know: *Free wi-fi. *Good coffee. *Cheddar and Egg biscuit with Ham was delicious --- ask for it toasted. *Selection of wines and beer available. *A total of nine tables... each seats 2 people.  So yes, it's tiny. *Was here for two hours and there were always people in line; was almost always about five people deep.  For a tucked-away neighborhood spot, pretty impressive.  No fears though, service was pretty fast.  Only real downer is that there's no restroom.  Think it might be intentional; otherwise people like me would be here all day. :)

Great place for lunch.  Last time I went I got an absolutely delicious sandwich!  It was a prosciutto, aged asiago, argula and truffle oil sandwich on a baguette.  It was one of the cheaper options on the menu, which is why I went with it.  Service with a smile too!  It's a little small, with only about 6 tables so if you come to eat here, keep in mind that you might not be able to sit.
I was so happy to have discovered this place. It's everything you want in a cafe: cozy, quiet, friendly and good coffee.

So disappointed I wasted 10$ on this soup and sandwich special: warm pea soup (only choice) and ham and cheese ( basically tiny white bread w one slice of ham and one slice of cheese . I should have taken a picture in relation to my hand. I would be embarrassed to make a sandwich like that for a guest. This place is not for eating . Coffee might be ok, was too annoyed to stay and experiment further.

So I walked by this place a few times, and I have to say the idea of food in the jar peaked my interest, but millions of people have been putting food in jars and cans since I don't even know how long... At least over 120 years. Then one time I actually went in, perused the menu which was much much higher up in the air than my head, and it looked fine, but nothing special. So I swore that moment right then and there to ask what time it was, turn walk out the door, and never come back again. I might even start a new life, where I get my memory erased and then purposefully avoid, memento post-it-notes style, this restaurant and its location.  That's when Kate started talking about this place "Ancolie"... "What the hell was it" I asked. "Well, it's incredible place around the corner" she said. "They make food and put it in a jar." "Great!" People had been making food in a jar, for, I don't know, years I guess- how would I know, but I trust Kate and so off we went. When I went into the place k8 started raving. They have a quinoa jar and there are layers of delicious..." Her voice trailed off into the background, sort of fading, whisked away by... Had I... no, I thought, this place just seems so familiar, but something, I'm not sure.  Something not so specia- "Hey!  Try this!" "What is it?" I thought, it resembled some sort of thick green koolaid... "Just try it!  It's Matcha Tea with Almond Milk!" I took a sip- I BLAM remembered feeling like I wanted to know what time it was but didn't care, a flurry of phone calls, a scientist, darknet found, needles and a pair of old grey Adidas shoes good god the pain and BLAM BLAM BLANK BLANK blank blank blank-  "T.J.?"  "T.J.?"  "Yes, sorry I must have, I got dizzy- wow well what is this?!"  "It's matcha !  With almond milk !"   She exclaimed, often my wife spoke in a hybrid emoji English language she developed with her Japanese friend Tsubee.  "Wow.  Delicious."  Yes.  It was. It was the best thing I had ever tasted!  "Isn't it the best thing you have ever tasted!!??"  I loved it.  It was my favorite thing.  "Isn't it your favorite thing!"  Kate said.  "It is," I said- "it is."  I will give this place a five star review.  "You gotta give this place a five star review!"  "I will" I thought, and I I won't make it too weird.  "And don't make it too weird!"  "Yeah Kate, I'll do it right now.. just, can I have another matcha  with almond  ?"  "Yes bumble bee-- now get those thumbs a movin'!"  And so I did.  Why wouldn't I. I had drank the matcha. We all had.  You will too.  And then you will give them a five star review, because it's the best thing you've ever had and you won't think about time in there or whether things are special or not, you will just drink that drink.  You can eat, relax, whatever you want.  But you will drink that drink.  You will drink the matcha green tea with almond milk.  You will drink the matcha.  -witch docta

So fresh and delicious. You might not think salad will fill you up all the way, but it does. I guess were so used to those big nasty plastic bowls of rancid lettuce from OTHER establishments. Everything here is wonderful. I have not been disappointed yet. The staff and vibe is friendly and comforting. Oh no what did I do the word going to get out now about how awesome this place is..

I work in the building next door so I frequently go in for a Chai latte iced with Oat milk & I always say light ice because for $7 bucks I'm paying for the Latte not ice & I stress this all the time & I still get a cup full of ice. Think I'll go back to Starbucks at least they know how to follow instructions.

This place is like a hidden treasure in financial district. The entrance and the outer look doesn't attract people but inside is amazing. I tried hot matcha latte, it was better than I had before in other coffee shops. It was thick and creamy, just like the way I love it. The place has plenty of space and very clean bathroom too. I spent hours early in the morning and it was worth it. They have unique tastes that I want to try next time I go there. The staff was very nice, but when they give you your coffee they don't put the lid which is both good and bad depends on the people. I didn't care much but was afraid to spill when I try to put the lid on since the cup was brimful.
A nice and friendly little coffee shop in New York City!!  I was a little hesitant to try a Chai Tea other than Starbucks but it turns out Bean & Bean's Chai Tea tasted so much better!!!

Free wifi, moderate seating and outlets, baked goods, organic coffee roasted in-house, very friendly staff, slightly expensive for even organic coffee, but it probably contributes to friendly staff and them staying independent--decor similar to Starbucks, but much better in every way. I'm pretty sure their coffee is fair trade, but it seems they care more about their drinks being organic as that's clearly posted everywhere.  I had the honey latte since I'd never heard of that before. I asked about it and was told honey granules are mixed into a latte. It doesn't taste like honey so I'm guessing they offer it simply as a healthier sweetener to lattes. Came here around noon and there was plenty of seating for me to study and do work as a college student in finals season. Not sure what its like at other times during the day/weekends.  Glad I found this through a Yelp search and will be returning whenever I need a cafe at which to do work.

Excellent coffee - strong, dark and deep flavors. Roasting beans in-house goes a long way for wonderful tastes and smell. The coffee is priced very well, but some other items are a bit steep. A pretty straight forward menu with a good mix of specialty products such as the gelati, macarons, and vegan cookies. A seriously busy people-watching, macbook-loving, and cafe-socializing crowd - this place is almost always packed but oddly enough - a seat isn't impossible. The service is average and they could really work on adding just a bit of something as far as personality. Not all employees are knowledgeable about its products and menu, sometimes even outright puzzled at questions and lacking familiarity overall. But all-in-all, never bad service or a bad experience, just a bit slow and subdued at times. Everything is pretty consistent with the original location in downtown Manhattan as far as their product and culture. Just way (way!) more Asian-Americans at this Bayside outpost. An overall excellent addition to the area that looks like is here to stay.
An honest, well made cup of coffee.  Really the best coffee option near Wall St. Aren't we are tired of Starbucks at this point anyway.

It was such a cold day in the city that I stopped in this coffee shop to grab a hot cup of coffee. I was pleasantly surprised that they sold organic coffee and it was better than your typical Starbucks. I had the white chocolate mocha which was just perfect. Just enough sweet and coffee.

It's nice to see the one-cup-at-a-time motif, however small, takling hold here in NY. This independent organic coffee house makes a decent cup of joe, but I would like to see more premium options than the three offered here on a daily basis. 3.25 stars is about right for this place.

Stopped in because I was hungry and wanted a quick bite. The few menu items I was interested in unfortunately had pork in them so I could not partake. So sad. Instead, I went with a flat white and a brownie after reading all the great reviews. Yes, I replaced lunch with a brownie. That's what being a grown up is all abou  Service was good and timely. Pretty disappointed with the brownie. Other reviews said it was half rich chocolatey/half cake like. Sadly mine was not. I was so excited too because there was only one left and I got the last one. When I bit into my brownie, I found that it was extremely fudgey and not brownie/cake like at all. The 2 ingredients I tasted most was oil and sugar, not rich chocolate. So. Sad. I didn't finish it and ended up throwing more than half of it away! Yes, I threw chocolate away. A travesty, I know. And I think I paid like $3 for it.. T___T for my flat white and brownie, I paid about $9. Coffee didn't strike me as anything outstanding, and a bit bitter for my tastes. Probably wouldn't return here unless I happen to be walking by and in dire need of caffeine.

I rarely give reviews but I just have to say this place is awful. I used to come here a lot for meetings and sometimes for a place to work in between meetings but they have a no computer policy at the tables. Their servers are extremely rude to the point where they raised their voice and yelled at me for having my laptop out for 5 minutes to type out an email.  Their coffee is overpriced and their matcha latte has no matcha in it. At around 2pm it is so crowded, there are no seats. I recommend going elsewhere like La Colombe on Wall St, Joe & the Juice, Hole in The Wall on Cliff, or Blue Stone Lane on water. They all have better service, a better environment, and higher quality options at a much lower price.

Came to visit my daughter, who lives in the same bldg, thought I'd sit and have a tea w one of their avocado toast and check my emails. As soon as I pull out my computer, I'm asked to move to a high top table because they were busy and the low tops are for two or more?!? I'm frickin' 65 years old, just wanting to chill, but it was made quite clear they'd rather you not sit and do any work on a computer!! Cancelled my order and left! The place must have good food/coffee, because it was busy, but certainly not kind to the elderly!

Stepping inside Black Fox on a busy work morning or during an afternoon break immediately makes me feel calmer. The ambiance is beautiful and the music is perfect for relaxing or getting some work done.  The coffee? Amazing. Everything from cold brew, drip coffee (Americano), and espresso beverages (cappuccino) are extremely high quality.  They serve some good looking pastries and Underwest doughnuts. I also tried a slice of the Spanish tortilla, which was pricey but delicious.  The service is awesome too. The staff is super friendly and if you decide to stay your coffee is brought to you with sleek presentation.  I think this is one of the best coffee shops in FiDi!

Soy chai is good but apparently medical service animals are not welcome here so if you have a disability or disabling medical condition requiring you to have a service animal, best to go elsewhere.  Shout out to the barista who made me feel like my disability was a huge inconvenience for them. Didn't even get to finish my second drink because I just felt unwelcome and wanted to leave after that. Good times.  UPDATE in response to Daniel: Wow thanks so much for explaining all that! Lol. The thing is my dog is a seizure dog, he detects impending seizures for my safety. As such he is a service dog and NOT an emotional support animal. I tried explaining that to you in person when you kicked me out, but you were too busy telling me about all your years of experience in the food industry and how you know the laws regarding service animals. Whatever, man...I just really don't have the patience to deal with ppl like you.  Also, Cafe Grumpy has way better chai lattes than you guys.

This coffee shop is right under my hotel so I had to check it out. I think it's an Australian shop - great coffee, smoothies and breakfast. I love the avocado toast. The egg and sausage sandwich - the sausage is pretty spicy and not what I was expecting to eat first thing in the morning but delicious. The almond milk latte was delicious and had a hint of sweetness. They are busy at all hours of the day but I didn't have to wait long for my coffee.

Stumbled on this place the other day and was definitely not disappointed! Such a nice cozy vibe, love the interesting coffee selection! It is definitely a breath of fresh air from the other coffee shops in Lower Manhattan.  Was catching up with friends and we were going to go somewhere else, but all the tables were used by people working on laptops.  I like that Black Fox seems to have a no laptop policy, it totally kills the vibe when everyone is sitting taking up tables working with headphones on -  cafes aren't meant to feel like public libraries! Also love that it is pretty close by to the East River ferry so it is easy to get to from Williamsburg! Will definitely be back soon :)

A new cozy and local coffee shop in FiDi! It is a love-at-first-sight/sip coffee place for me. The high ceiling, big space, wood interior, and big windows are nice pluses! Barista warmly welcomes you upon entrance. I got an almond flat white to-go (although I would really love to hang out and spend more time here!). I appreciate the fact that baristas spend time making you a nice latte art even though you ordered it to-go! One sip, I can taste passion in it! it is very fruity (citrus taste?), rich, foamy with nice chocolaty/nutty aroma. That was not it... The after taste is sweet, which is similar to how good teas make you feel sweet but not thirsty in the end.  Highly recommend this nice coffee shop for coffee lovers/meeting/friends gathering. Bakeries and sandwiches also look delicious. I just wish they open on weekends!

This Aussie cafe opened one block from my apt back in last year and quickly became the hot spot for Wall Streeters as well as people living in the hood.  The space is modern and welcoming. Perfect to catch up with friend or just take a coffee break . They have oat milk and almond milk in addition to cows milk. Only wish they got soy as well :/  They made damn good latte :) $6 a pop , expensive but worth the splurge once in a while .

Espresso was fantastic! Breakfast was good, but honestly a little overpriced. Overall I think the place has the potential to be great, but the woman taking orders was very unpleasant, and ripe with attitude. I'm not sure if it was a race thing, or a sexist thing, but either way she did not like me, and I'm a wonderfully pleasant person. I will not be returning to this establishment, which is a shame, because their espresso really was fantastic.

I have been waiting to try black fox for almost a year, it was simply too far away from me! So today I'm more than happy to run here and eventually got a taste of their famous flat white.  Probably due to the fact that I was sitting inside rather than grabbing to go, my coffee was really foamy and the latte art well-drawn. The balance was also quite right, that I first discovered a bit of bitterness while left with sweetness afterwards. This special combination completely took charge of my tastebuds and I was left fully convinced. Loved each single sip of it!  I would have to make sure that I come back sometime future, just to have a difference experience of their latte, or even espresso. In my opinion, a good coffee shop simply brews coffee; while an outstanding one tries to attach their coffee with emotion. Black fox certainly belongs to the latter and I hope to see more of it!  Don't miss this hidden gem if you happen to be in this neighborhood.

Cute but expensive cafe in the Wall Street area. Several pastry options are available and the beverage options are rather comprehensive. Seating is also plentiful, and I was a fan of the chill atmosphere. However, not sure if I would come back if I'm getting things to go.

The ambience here is lovely, especially when you go in early in the morning before they get crowded with fashionistas and people in suits taking meetings and using laptops, which are limited to counter space so tables can be used for friends and people getting food. The food is great. Really kind of simple and savory. Rotating espressos and multiple espresso options! The filter coffee is probably their most stand out element though, nothing quite like getting a little pot to stay and sip from a little white-glazed ceramic cup. It's a great little cafe, hidden away down one narrow old street in the financial district.

Cold brew was great, they have a great selection of pastries (including the awesome Underwest Donuts), and the staff were fantastic. I have nothing but good things to say, they hooked me up even ten minutes after their official closing time. I love La Colombe coffee but this is my new go-to coffee stop when I'm in the fianacial.

This place absolutely has delicious coffee! Also quite spacious- a rare luxury. The food was quite good, albeit a little pricey for the quality. Barista seemed pretty spaced out, but hey- you do you, Miley.  Ham and Cheese Baguette- ok- but would have like a slice of tomato or lettuce or something Croissant; Heart-Eyes emoji because butter.  Coffee: YUM!
Awesome staff and my favorite coffee in the city (make sure to try their espresso). Never ordered the baked goods but they look amazing and the menu changes regularly.

tl;dr: awesome espresso, gorgeous place, very overpriced.  Food/coffee: This place seems to be Aussie owned/run, which explains the awesome espresso. I usually eat a flat white or a cortado, and they're both worthy of 5 stars. Delicious and pretty. I've had a muffin (fine, nothing special) and the smashed avo toast with a poached egg, which is REALLY good but like $11.  Space: beautiful coffee shop with high windows, a good amount of seating, mix of bar seats, communal tables, and small tables. A good place to go alone - they have newspapers and magazines and wifi, and you can face out at the window and people watch.  I took one star off just for pricing - I'd go here every day if not for that!

REVISED REVIEW Originally I gave this place 1-STAR for the snooty staff and overall pretentious vibe but have recently returned and believe they deserve an increase in stars!  Much better selection of food, although cost is very high (for example: $9.5 for avocado toast?!) even for fresh and made-to-order quality. I think the lunch options look delicious and hopefully warrant the purchase, if anything just to treat myself one time.  I'm a latte drinker so I can't comment on the specific tastes of the coffee, although I am aware they often offer unique beans and roasts often hard to find and very are limited to region and seasonal availability. I enjoy the fact that they have an espresso and coffee offering menu for your choosing despite I don't always understand how that translates into the taste. What ends up happening is that I order a latte but don't know which espresso for it to pull from. The staff should be a bit more receptive of this and eager to offer their suggestion.  Their latte was right on point in terms of taste, temperature and texture. Kudos for the added latte art!
One of my new favorite coffee cafes that is close to work. I had a good latte, probably one of the best coffees that I have had. The food was also deliciously good.

Service: The people who work here are really friendly - you can tell they care about their jobs! The line moves quickly (even if it looks long) and I've never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes for my drink. Ambiance: Its a pretty large space, especially compared to other coffee shops nearby. I've never done work here, but there is definitely enough room to find a table and stay for a while (they have "for here" mugs for this purpose). It would be a good place to meet a friend for coffee. Coffee: *I've only ever had their iced latte* - the iced latte was amazing! Not bitter at all. Price: A bit pricey, but nothing crazy for the area. Definitely worth it if you care about the quality of your coffee. Food: I haven't tried it yet - but they have a variety of options. There are a few items that would be enough for a full lunch.

Expensive but worth it - never knew iced coffee could taste so good before black fox. Their almond croissants are to die for. They have freshly baked chocolate cuip cookies in the afternoon, around 1:30-2pm, which are heavenly. If you are looking for water, dont go here - they only carry the expensive glass bottle type.
Great spot with great coffee, food and  service.  One star off because it's too loud to do anything other than talk or listen to the music. It's at bar-level volume. But other than that, dope spot.

Really top notch java.  And very cool, anti-Starbuck vibe.  I love the design and attention to detail - be it the decor, the food and the high level service.  It is MY FiDi go to place for amazing coffee.

This is one of the nicest coffee shops in the Financial District. The coffee, pastries (I had a pain au chocolat; have yet to try the food on the menu), and atmosphere are delightful. There are many kinds of spaces available - I've caught up with friends here, worked on papers here, etc. Wifi isn't offered, which is mildly inconvenient at first, but I quickly found it nice to disconnect. After a stressful morning, I ended up here to catch up on some reading and the staff was so incredibly friendly that it turned my day around. Can't recommend this coffee shop enough; thrilled it's here in the Financial District!

As good as coffee gets in NYC. An experience and product that has to be tasted to be believed. Would highly recommend the spot to anyone milling about the FiDi, though the coffee is definitely good enough to make a special trip to Black Fox just for the taste and experience. The best there is.

Got the dirty chai and it unfortunately tasted like only milk. Very little chai hardly any espresso.. will be going to another coffee shop immediately after to grab another!  Also got the chocolate almond croissant which was very mediocre and a bit stale.

Small, cute place. Got a cappuccino and a honey cappuccino. Both delish, not overly milky - preferred the sweetness of the honey. Parlor beans are really good! Potentially my new favorite coffee spot in NYC.
I absolutely adore this little coffee joint in NYC. Great place to spend the morning and people watch over a delicious cuppa.

This is definitely my new coffee spot!! The coffee is great, love the cold brew on tap, and the cappuccino is perfectly balanced. The baked goods are fresh and delicious. And most of all, the ambience is amazing. The exposed brick and light fixtures are both beautiful and calming and the space is intimate. Makes it perfect whether I'm with friends, alone for breakfast, or doing work. Love this spot, a great addition to this corner and this neighborhood!!!!
Nasty dry & stale pastries. Literally their so called croissants trash after two bites and honestly one was already one too many. No resemblance in flavor or texture to actual croissant.
I was ripped off. I purchased a smoked salmon sandwich that was arugula, tomato and a tiny sliver of salmon I wont be back.
Took 15 minutes with 2 people in line to get a hot coffee. Slow service and the baristas don't know what's going on.

A friend suggested this coffee shop to study since I needed to do some grocery shopping at Trader Joe's in the neighborhood. Boule & Cherie had quality coffee, outlets, a wide variety of pastries and quiches, WiFi, AND a bathroom! It was a great spot to get some studying done. It got kind of crowded on a Sunday afternoon, but actually not as bad as some other NYC coffee shops I have been to. Would definitely come again!

Their GOLDEN LATTE, a mix of turmeric and ginger, is so much yum !!! Granted I tend to like ginger regardless so those who don't like to taste it might not enjoy the earthiness this unusual flavor brings.  A lot of seating, so I was able to find a place to work even when it was a crowded hour. Woohoo!
Love this place: best blueberry muffin and white mocha in town; great selection of drinks; fast WiFi; cheerful and lovely ambiance
I wish the staff can pay more attention to the customers... like less chatting with each other and remember what the customer ordered... can't beat the location.
Great coffee and great menu but serves was terrible. I never heard "Hi!, "How are you? "Welcome! "Or "Thank you! Also Always girl has bad attitude.
This place has such potential it's too bad nothing is fresh at 10 o'clock in the morning.

I don't usually write reviews, but my experience here was so bad that I was compelled to. Terrible matcha lattes that have no matcha powder at all. I paid $5 for lukewarm milk foam with sprinkles of matcha on top. My drink was made in less than 30 seconds, which was the quickest, most half-assed job I've ever seen.  The guy at the counter was incredibly rude and condescending (also came across racist, I am Asian-American) when I asked if they had the matcha cronuts I saw on this Yelp page.  Me: "Do you happen to have the matcha cronuts today?" Him: "I don't know what those are. Are they American?" Me: "I saw photos of them on your Yelp page." Him: "I've never seen them before and I've been here for a year and a half."  Maybe he should do some research on his own place of employment to get an understanding of his job and general feedback??? I am also 150% certain that a young guy like him living in NYC knows what "matcha" means, and what a "cronut" is. More importantly, there is no reason to be rude to customers. Completely unacceptable. I will definitely not be returning, and will not recommend this place to anyone.  PRO TIP TO THE BUSINESS OWNER: Don't post pretty Yelp photos of products that are not actually offered, and please train your employees to provide proper customer service/decent human behavior.

I love exploring Midtown East because it is full of gems like this one. Their matcha latte is one of the best I've had in a long time. However this place is so small it makes me uncomfortable. I'll definently come back but I just wish this place is a little bigger.
Solid spot with an odd name given the location, and the Yelp checkin special made the purchase a bit easier.

The staff is very friendly and in my opinion, they have the best cold brew. It's New Orleans style which I assume means it contains chicory. I haven't asked so can't confirm. I normally don't like chicory coffee so if this cold brew is chicory, I'm even more impressed that it's so good. Also, a small is 16 oz. which is bigger than most other shops in the area and in general.

We hopped in a cab to go all the way across town because I heard such great things about this place. They were sold out of a lot by 6:30pm which is OK but the red headed girl that worked the counter was so beyond rude. I dont care how good the bakrd goods are, I won't go back.

Visiting from DC. Was very excited to find a gluten free bakery! Walked in and the red headed girl (6pm shift on Sunday night 2/17) was absolutely rude. She was not friendly, annoyed when I asked what she had. She was cleaning the counter and had all the food behind her so I couldn't see what was offered. I don't care how yummy the food is. I would suggest going elsewhere. Someone needs to tell this chick that attitude is everything.

Ah, it makes sense! I ordered a scone and muffin and felt it was dry and chalky. I ventured to this bakery because of the high ratings, not realizing it was gluten-free. The scone left my stomach feeling a little uneasy. I'm not gluten free, so I really can't compare these items to other gluten free pastries...but I can say it's not as good as other bakeries that use gluten and dairy. I'm glad it exists for those with allergies!
Dang I wish we could get bagels this good in Houston. The Astros are better than the yankees, but New York  bagels have no equal in Texas.
Paid $120 for half a gluten-free sheetcake.  That's a hard pass.

Look, I'm not only gluten-free, I eat quite a low-carb diet; very little sugar.  But it was a friend's birthday, also gluten-free, so I thought of getting her a gluten free birthday cake.  I found By the Way Bakery on Google but it turns out I'd already had some of their amazing cookies in Hastings on Hudson where they have another branch--didn't realize at first it was the same outfit.  I asked my friend which kind of cake she would like, and she said the Lemony Lemon layer cake.  Now, that would not have been my first choice, but it was her birthday.  Wowee Zowee!  It turned out to be one of the best cakes I've ever eaten, gluten free or not.  So if you're hell bent on having sugar, By the Way Bakery is a great choice.
This Bakery is a gem in the Neighbourhood Gluten free pastries. My favorites are the delicious coconut cake and yummy brownies.
Excellence is at play here.  Impossibly moist gluten free cakes, that are never overly sweet.  I am a BIG fan, and do the uptown trek with glee.

I don't write reviews often, but when it comes to service I am a bit of a stickler. I left knowing they did not value my time or my patronship, which is really a bummer because their baked goods looked delicious.  Hoping to get my friend a gluten-free dairy-free cake for her birthday party, I called a day before and was informed they cannot make orders less than 48 hours in advance. Completely understandable. But! - they say- come in tomorrow and we make cakes for purchase. They go pretty quickly and it is a first come first serve, so you might want to get here early. We open at 8.  "Great! hopefully I will be able to grab one" I said. "hopefully." she replies.  Fine. So I get up extra early so I can get there before work, go all the way uptown, wait in line for them to open, and hope, as one of the first people, I can get one of the amazing looking cakes! I overhear the very sweet woman in front of me asking for a cake as well. She had come in nice and early to grab a cake also for a party- someone in the same boat as me. The lady behind the counter says: Sorry! We don't sell cakes right now, we are still putting away orders and cant sell any cakes at this time.... The other woman, rightfully, says then why did you tell me to come in at this hour to buy one? I wish you would have told me that. I chime in to verify: sooo no cakes right now? Even though you told this nice woman and myself to come to your place of business at the time you open to buy one of your stupid cakes? "no" she says "We can't put any cakes on hold either... but maybe come back in a couple hours? Probably 2 hours or so". ok well I have a job and I'm certainly not coming back here again because chances are in 2 hours your not going to have any cakes to sell me. The other customer and I are severely disappointed to say the least.  It's the poor attitude and absolute disregard for this woman's and my time and efforts that bother me. Even if they had made a mistake and tried to still help us, anyone can understand that. But they offer us no other solutions or any recourse for giving us their false and misleading information except for a half-hearted sorry and then asking "sooo what can I get you?". Nothing. Although, I would really like that hour back please.
Such a great place to find delicious treats that are both GLUTEN and DAIRY free! The red velvet cake is my go to treat for any special occasion. The staff here is super friendly and helpful.

Yes!!! By the way bakery is one of the amazing gluten free and dairy free bakery in the city!!! Although it's gluten free they developed method giving the taste like traditional bakery... It is just right... But I put only 4 star here because I felt it's overly sweet. If I only had Chocolate chip bundt cake, I would give 10 stars!!!! And almond cookie!!!! Those are  Fabulous!!!!

We came here because of my glutarded wife and we heard good things. Well now I have great things to say. The customer service rep was so perky I was starting to wonder how there was any coffee left in the machine. Side point is they don't charge extra for putting soy milk or almond milk in your coffee. I tried a piece of their banana nut muffin when I voluntarily had my wife shove a piece down my throat and I couldn't believe it was gluten free! It was so moist and delicious that I wanted to rip away the rest from my wife and eat it all in one bite, but then I remembered I live with this woman so I just watched her finish the muffin with my jealous eyes. Pricey, but right on par with gluten free prices. Just don't show up between 10-11am bc they aren't the bakery just the front and they don't get restocked until about 11am

Went on a trip to NYC with a group of 7 people, 4 of which are gluten free (including me). The 4 of us decided that dessert had to be bought and this bakery was only a mile from the restaurant where we had lunch, so we embarked on our gluten free dessert journey. I was very impressed. They had samples of the lemon poppyseed cake in a bowl on the counter. Everyone loved the taste and texture of the cake. Sometimes gluten free desserts can be dry and crumbly, but nothing we got from here had that problem. My mom and I both got brownies and they were probably the best gluten free brownies I've had. They were rich but not too rich and I'm still impressed at how they weren't dry or crumbly at all. I also got a ginger cookie and it was really good too. It had a nice ginger flavor without being overwhelming. The shop is pretty small, but I guess that's not unusual in NY. It probably only fits maybe 10 people at once. Both the girls that work there were really nice and they had a good selection. If you're gluten free and visiting/living in Manhattan, I would definitely recommend this bakery.

I loved the brownies at By the Way Bakery so much that when I realized I wasn't going to be able to stop by to pick up a few before they closed on my last night in NYC I asked a friend to get them for me.  Thankfully, they were happy to help out.  Also, the samples I tried were really good.  I have to admit that I was skeptical when I saw they were gluten free and was happy to be proved wrong.  I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town!

Baked goods are good, and I'm glad they are here cause there aren't many GF bakeries in the city.  But man, it's overpriced.  I've baked and I know some of the ingredients can be pricey but geez... And it goes with the fact that the portions are small too.  It's a little frustrating.

I love this bakery. They have a great selection of delicious treats that you would never know where gluten-free. Yes, of course it's pretty expensive, but if you're a celiac, it's worth every penny. They're also kosher and vegan too, And, they serve stumptown coffee. My only wish is that they were open later and there was room to sit down.
Super friendly staff! I had the Blueberry/Corn muffin n it was amazing! I also had a sugar cookie and truth be told u wouldn't even know its gluten free cause it's so tasty.
Just do it! Gluten free and dairy free cookies that are amazingly soft and don't fall apart as soon as you bite in. Totally worth the price... and the calories =)

They have muffins! So delicious! They have several other baked goods too - almond cookies, small spiral cakes, brownies, etc. very small little place. Unfortunately, there are seating areas and I don't recall seeing any coffee.

THANK GOD FOR THIS BAKERY! My husband is allergic to gluten, dairy, nut flower and coconut! - so needless to say finding dessert is a big challenge. So many dairy free desserts use coconut flour or coconut oil and a lot of gluten free goods use almond flour. BTWBakery makes delicious cookies and brownies that he can eat and I (as someone who can eat gluten) love as much as he does. The staff is very nice and helpful. My only complaint is that they don't stay open later in the day so that I'd be able to pick up dessert after work ... although maybe it's for the best or I'd be getting way too many desserts!

Nice minimalist designed space and pretty good strong coffee but for $6 I've had better around the city.  Only reason I wouldn't come back here is because of nasty baristas. There are plenty of coffee shops like this in the city, I don't need to spend my money and feel crappy afterwards. They need to chill and smile once in a while to customers.
Coffee was good but service very poor. They told us we have to leave because they are closing but Very rude, will never comeback Very disappointed.

The first thing that struck me when I came to this place was how a few people were having lattes in a large bowl! But I ended up having a skinny cortadito both times I visited. Coffee was good and I really liked the vibe in here.  There are some very interesting drink options on the menu though, and I really should come back to try them. There's also homemade nut milks e.g. almond, cashew, coconut (slightly pricey though) and pastries like donuts, croissants, cookies. The cafe was full both times I visited, but I noticed that the sofa seats don't get occupied for too long as compared to the window seats :)

I'm big on espresso mocktails And was really intrigued by the menu of this place.  I got espresso, Mexican coke, bitters over ice.  It was interesting, but not tasty. This was clearly someone who wanted to come up with something unique for the sake of it being unique.  I'd come back to try maybe a standard latte or something not so hipstery
Great place to sit and get work done, kind staff and solid pastries. Coffee is great and if you're into hand pressed nut milks then you've come to the right place. Free wifi gives it the 5th star

Love the coffee here. Super homey vibe. I really love that they have dairy-free since I'm lactose intolerant, so that helps. They have a Vegan flat white that is amazing! Super tasty. I will definitely be coming back. :)

My overall experience with Bari in this particular location was bad.  I ordered iced cappuccino on ritual app. When I got into the shop I told the guy that I want light ice. He said, "we don't have iced cappuccino." I told him him it's on the menu. He checked and got back to me to confirm they DO have iced cappuccino. When I got my coffee the cup was full with ice cubes! I checked back with him on my light ice request, he/she then poured out like 1/3 of my coffee and handed back to me! I literally saw coffee being poured out with ice! Does light ice mean less coffee too? A friend of mine got hot chocolate, which they have a sign saying "best hot chocolate in NYC", it tastes like hot chocolate powder you can buy from grocery store, very sweet and nothing special. Another friend got hot cappuccino and it was watery. Service was bad and they didn't make coffee right.

I love the hot chocolate from here. It's rich, creamy and absolutely delicious. I stop by this shop quite a lot in the morning when I'm near the area. I highly recommend to give this place a try if you like hot chocolate and happen to be in the area. You won't be disappointed.  My only other recommendation would be to drink the chocolate when it's still warm. It will become so thick when it cools down and you won't want to drink it afterwards.

I feel reluctant to write this review since the place is getting more crowded by the day but I have to tell the truth and nothing but the truth. Since hard working Tanya asked me to try the hot chocolate (with a smile sweeter than the hot chocolate itself), I got hooked on it - the taste and the richness are amazing! I also love the southern European elegant decor and the music adds an additional flavor to my morning routine.
Best Coffee in Midtown!  The service is always great, especially from Tonya!

For a cafe that boasts that they are the highest rated on Front Street, they don't seem to be trying very hard to stay that way. I went yesterday with my family on Father's Day and was met with with rude service and mediocre coffee. Look through my reviews - you'll see that I rarely, if ever rate businesses this low if that's any indication of how upsetting this experience was.  My family came in on a slow Sunday afternoon, and decided to grab some coffee to stay. The barista was curt and dismissive, and didn't seem interested at all in taking my order.  We sat down and waited to receive our drinks while other later customers were served before us. I looked around, and we were the only patrons to not get latte art - even customers with paper to-go cups had some semblance of effort put into their milk foam while my sister's espresso drink was just plain.  My iced mocha was overly sweet and there was not enough ice, so it basically was a lukewarm chocolate coffee drink.  The staff basically ignored us after that, even when I tried to get their attention for another coffee. They were inattentive and stood deeper in the kitchen watching something on their phone.  I was embarrassed to bring my family here. I had looked for a highly rated cafe around the Seaport area to impress them and instead ended up subjected ourselves to poor treatment and subpar coffee at Cafe Patoro.

Friendly waitstaff, delicious PDQ bites with guava jam, and literally the most scrumptious almond croissants make this place a MUST.  The drip coffee is great and the lattes even more so.   You won't be sorry!

My favorite thing about Cafe Patoro, after four consecutive daily visits, thus far, is the incredibly warm and obliging staff, and the extremely inviting environment they create: a perfectly comfortable and charming scenario to enjoy some lovely pastries, to which I will frequently return.  In my opinion, the p̣o de queijo ("pdq") are a little expensive, because even though they are delightful little creations, it's really only one big bite (or two little bites) for $2, so it would be a lot more encouraging if they were priced at 3 for $5, which would also encourage sharing or buying a dozen of them for the office. And as tasty as these little treats are, my favorite items so far have been the Ham and Cheese puff-pastry and their signature fresh Cornbread with Coconut.

Looked up a near by bakery, so that we can get my co-worker a birthday cake! The guy on the phone was so professional and friendly! I wanted to get the Dulce De Leche cake that was on the menu but he told me they only had chocolate.  Minutes later he called me back and said they can have it for me in 10 minutes.  The cake was freshly made.  So warm inside and DELICIOUS! My co-worker was so happy and felt so special.  Thank you sooo much Cafe Patoro! Even broke my diet today LOL
PDQs we're ok. Had better. The garlic was my favorite. Wished the olive and original had a lot more flavor. Turkey cheese empanadas were good hot cheesy goodness. Will come back to try others.
Delicious cortado, pesto pao de queijo and brigadeiro cake. Relaxing sitting area and friendly staffs!
Love the PDQ's. The staff is so friendly and respectful and the shots of espresso are perfect.

Had the worst experience here - how disappointing since I was looking forward to it.  First, this location is at the bottom of an apartment complex, so I'm not even sure it's a real storefront with the full menu. Regardless, when we walked in there was no one at the counter - an AA guy eating his food looked up in annoyance and walked over to take our order. Excuse me, I believe this is your job.  Ordered a ice green tea latte. The guy clearly kept looking over at the iPad to see if we would tip. I didn't like the initial lack-thereof greeting, so I didn't tip, surprise surprise. The coffee was also $5+ already.  By this time, the guy was clearly not bothering to hide his annoyance. He grabbed the physical tip jar from the other side of the counter and moved it in front of us. The audacity.  I ignored him. He proceeded to dump ice to the top of the cup.  Management: I am expecting a proper apology for this awful experience. Highly recommend reconsidering all your staff. The coffee was no better than anything I get from Starbucks.

A true definition of a hole in the wall. Small location a few streets north of K-town and not truly in its own space since seating is next to the elevator. Extremely small space. I got the matcha latte and like some other reviewers have said, it's not sweet. That helped with expectations.  It's a bit pricey for the size at a little over $5, but it was quite good. Rich, creamy, and healthy thanks to the absence of sugar. They also have a small selection of baked goods and some savory items.

Not a fan of this place. I ordered the super smoothie bowl ($9), which I feel is average $$ for a bowl in the city. However, the taste was so bland. I couldn't even finish it. My friend ordered the same and ended up throwing it away.  The place is really cute - tiny but cute! Unfortunately the food was not great. Will most likely not come back...

Great service and pastries (vegan) but I ordered a golden turmeric chai which is supposed to be made with almond milk but it was clearly made with regular milk. Not too pleased. I tried it after I had left and didn't have time to come back.
John behind the counter is exceptionally kind and good at giving advice. He was right: the matcha Arnold Palmer is really refreshing.
Good latte, not my favorite in the city but still enjoyable. Matcha dough-sant pretty fair also

I went yesterday in this place because is close to my job and I take the mozzarella sandwich I ask can have hot and they give me cold sandwich and I said ok Today I went for the breakfast and I take omelette sandwich and I ask which bread you use and guy told me we use plain croissant and also I said I would like my sandwich hot . Ok I take the sandwich and I go back to work I open the box the croissant was whole wheat and the sandwich was cold so I went back and I told them I don't like the whole wheat stuff and I ask if I can have toast my sandwich because I don't like cold the girl take the croissant and put in the microwave now this sandwich is disgusting is mushy not Crunchy and the best part is the croissant is that I will never go back in this place they don't listen and don't understand

AWFUL. I just received my 3 desserts and they are so small they fit into 18cmX11.5 cm box.  I really can't believe the portion size is this small, this is like the total opposite of the SuperSize me option from the Golden Arches, it's like Minimize Me portion option( if it were available).  I love having a nice dessert and what is astonishing is that one piece of cake from Harbs is the size of all three that i ordered.  If you take the largest piece of cake in the picture, it might be size wise the same as ONE slice from harbs but not weight/quality.  Can't overstate how disappointed I am... I will never order from this place again.  25 dollars for something you can buy at costco for 10$ and Costco taste better..  PLEASE be more accurate in your description for your portion sizes, because my cats dinner weighs more than all three of these pieces combined.

I hate this review, as this was the most exciting place for me when I saw it on seamless. I can now have cake delivered!!  However, it sounded better than it was. It's got potential with the concept, but the cake is not so good. Dry cake delivery.  Don't do it. I'm still in waiting for the day the the bakery Two Little Hens is getting delivered.

Not a fan of them leading you to believe you're going to get a decent size piece of cheese cake and you end up getting a sliver. On the top is their pic from seamless, the other is the actual slice. Galaxy 8 for scale.

Coffee Clock was an impulse stop.  It caught my eye and I popped in to warm up after what had turned out to be a cold breakfast elsewhere.  They have cakes by the slice for $7 plus.  They have a couple of seasonal specialty coffee drinks (currently along the lines of pumpkin spice and caramel apple).  They have a drink on the regular menu called Honey RAF Coffee.  I asked what this was and the cashier said it was honey, coffee, and milk mixed together.   I decided to try it.  When the barista gave it to me, it had a nice smell; the heat warmed up the honey and produced a pleasing scent.  It was topped with a nice thick layer of foam that was enjoyable.  Underneath, however, I feel like the honey was masking poor or average-tasting coffee.  Once the foam was gone it was kinda meh.  I appreciate that they had a short list of specials.  There is a lot of space in the back and I appreciated getting warmed up.  They also get points for having 8oz drinks on offer.  As others have noted, they have a printer available for customers to use.
Nice, clean environment, courteous staff, and delicious vanilla lattes :)

I can't speak to the other drinks and dessert, but do NOT order a smoothie. It was just powder, ice and soy milk.  I didn't taste any of the A̤a?. Maybe the others are fine but don't order the A̤a? smoothie.
Very cute place. Delicious coffee and I loved the yogurt parfait and honey cake. Definitely going back!

Working as a doorman on the upper east side,this is my favorite coffee place. With the great coffee is also the best cheesecake to enjoy your day.The store is comfortable and the staff is always welcoming.Also a plus is that shop is located right next to the Second Avenue subway.

The worse cashiers ever my mom went to go get coffee today and this new cashier called her nasty for no reason. She handed her the money and the cashier just called her  "nasty", she should definitely get fired.

I've given this spot several tries...but this was the last. The blonde chick behind the counter has the most horrible attitude I've ever witnessed from someone in the service industry. She was nasty when I handed her a torn bill last time, she said "I'm not taking this" and then dropped it in front of me on the counter. Today, as she hands me my completely burnt to black egg and avocado sandwich she says "here". If you think I'm exaggerating or just an upset customer, stand by for 30 seconds and witness the attitude with other people as well. This spot would be doomed if it relied on repeat business from it's customers.

Fabulous!! Simply Fabulous! Beats out Starbucks in a heartbeat. Service is wonderful, they're so friendly and accommodating. It's a pleasure to walk in. Coffee is fresh and delicious! Chai Tea Latte is amazing!  Have had 3 in the last 2 days! Croissants & Danish are fresh and delicious! Not Starbucks garbage. CORVO a wonderful find! I am thrilled

I never write reviews but felt compelled to do so. I got a large iced latte and egg/tomato croissant sandwich and I paid...under $6 total. And it's really good coffee and a freshly made sandwich. Great spot!!
The best coffee in the city! The staff is always so friendly there. The best service, best pastries/sandwiches, and the best price in the city! These guys will kill the market!

Hype falls extremely short of reality. I went here based on the ratings and can't believe the outcome. The venue was busy but I did get a table to meet a friend. Service was good enough, but the espresso was far worse; over-brewed, very bitter, burnt, and near zero crema. Now the atmosphere, it was a cold day, they had inadequate heating (my toes were numb); the table wobbled and my coffee spilled. Unbelievably, they seek direct input via a payment app, I've given them a chance to respond, 4 days no response.

this coffee house on 36th st off 7th ave has good coffee, especially the cappy but the sweets are even better . the donuts are yummy as well as the muffins and cookies and it's not dunkin donuts crap they are serving. i stopped by after a my post office run and line was not that long. the layout is simple with communal type tables with stools and window and side counter seating as well. all is displayed for easy viewing and menu board is simple to understand. got a large decaff cappy and 2 donuts (yes 2, i was hungry and skipping lunch was on my menu. the folks behind the counter are friendly and make a mean tasty cup of morning jolt. prices are a bit high as the donuts are 3 bucks a pop but they are yummy and filling so it's worth it. overall it's a decent coffee joint that serves quality and you won't confuse it with dunkin donuts .

A little oasis from the hustle/bustle of 8th Ave, Culture is a breath of fresh air.  Quiet enough during midday, but really ramps up (gets loud) during the afternoon coffee crush. My Americano was great, and the chocolate chip cookie was fresh out the oven (they bake them at this location). A reason to come back in itself. Music was well curated, not too pretentious or obtrusive.  They've developed a nice little "culture" here.

They have the best chocolate chip cookies in midtown! Sometimes they are so popular that they're sold out mid day - totally ruins my day. I would try their other pastries but I couldn't resist their chocolate chip every time. Their flat white and latte are not bad too.  It's pretty comfortable sitting at the cafe, which has an industrial design to it.

Nice. Glad it was here. Quiet, uncrowded respite from the bustle of 8th Ave, and the lines at other, more commercial ventures. Had a peppermint tea and a house-made oatmeal cranberry bar, which was delicious! I'll come back if I'm in the area.

The cashier messed up our order and the service was very disorganized. The three of us ordered coffee with 3 different bagels/toast and they sent out the order in pieces, forgetting completely about the third bagel. Aside from that the cashier gave us attitude and threw the bagel on the table after we notified them twice about the mess up. There's no need to be an rude if you're the one with the bad service.

Loved it here. It's a nice and chill spot to grab a bite and/or do some work. I went for a quick bite. The staff were so inviting, friendly, and courteous.  I ended up getting an oat milk latte and the bacon and cheese croissant, which was SOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOD!!!!!! The menu was clear, the place was clean, and the staff were all friendly. I'm definitely going back. The latte was also amazing, which was topped off with cinnamon and nutmeg.  Definitely stop by. It's a nice spot.

The  stars are for the waiter in this restaurant. This is not my favorite in New York. Come after the good comments so had also high expectation. Staffs are friendly and tried to help. I ordered a avocado and steak topped with veggies, but they severed me sth else, the waiter helped me to change it to the one that I ordered. But what came out to me again was a sandwich, excuse me....I hate bread and I didn't read any bread description in the menu, so I took the highest priced dish and hoped it was sth different.13.5$for a cold sandwich that I don't fancy at all. I could have not walked 4km back and forward for this restaurant. Any shop on street could have a nicer sandwich than this.  Btw I immediately had stomach problems on the walk home. It was a struggle.

I work in the area and found this place after searching on Yelp for a new spot.  I ended up ordering online and using their 15% off code to order to go.  I decided to go with the chicken panini that came with cheese, pickled onions (on the side), and roasted red peppers. Though the sandwich was pretty good, I have to say that the chicken was a bit overpeppered in my opinion--and I really like pepper. Also, even with the discount, the sandwich was $10, which seems a bit steep for the size of the dish.  Overall, this is a cute little place in the neighborhood, but the food may be a little overpriced.

I love this place! It's about time to have a great and awesome place around my hood. I love their coffee, chocolate chip cookie, & salted pretzel croissant (oh my goodness, it's so soft and yummy).  I'm not a vegan but I ordered this Veggie Royale (Grilled Portabello Mushroom, Avocado, Baby Spinach, Honey Caramalized Onions, Roasted Peppers, Dill Pesto, & Toasted Sesame Tofu Mousse on a Salted Pretzel Croissant. Holy Cow! It's SOOOO GOOD! I think I just turned Vegan starting today :).  Ambience is nice and the customer service is superb! The first time I came here, I felt like I've been coming here for years which by the way they just opened a few months ago.  Last but not least, they bake their own baked goods and the coffee beans is local in Harlem...Woohoo!

I am so happy to see a wonderful new coffee establishment in the neighborhood. I was so disappointed when two of my favorite coffee shops closed at the same time (rise n grind & east Harlem caf̩). East Harlem has been lacking in the coffee scene, but things have changed with Dear Mama.  I made it a point to visit DM after seeing it on Yelp. I live around the corner, and so it appealed to me. One step inside and this place is gorgeous! So beautifully decorated with friendly staff. The art on the wall gives the place so much character.  I ordered a green tea donut (from underwest donuts) and a lemon poppyseed loaf. Both were good, although the loaf could have had a little more lemon flavor to it. The barista informed me that they had a buy 2 get one free deal on pastries, and he recommended the carrot and raisin loaf (I can't remember the name). It was okay, and had too many raisins for my taste.  I also got a chai spice latte. This is did not like. However, it was my fault seeing that I only like vanilla lattes and not spice but I decided to go out on a limb. Next time I'll try the cappuccino.
This is one of  favorite places to do work in the neighborhood - great service, coffee, and snacks !
My new favorite place for breakfast! Friendly staff, good coffee and great food. The biggest surprise is that they make croissant sandwiches with lox! It's like little Paris in East Harlem, lol

I love this coffee shop! Great place to get away to and spend the day hanging out or a quick bite to eat.   The food is fantastic - the Caesar salad with anchovies is yummy and the croissant with salmon is delicious. Make sure you try the chocolate chip cookies.  Gluttonous but out of this world! Their drink selection is very original and the staff have been well trained to prepare the finest latte!  Been here multiple times and plan on coming back. Highly recommend!

Quite possibly the most beautiful coffee shops now in Manhattan. You might mistake it for a cafe you'd find at the Guggenheim or Moma. Could sit for hours. Check out the Smurf art! Modern quirky design - SO spacious. Also the coffee is amazing and the service is great! Highly recommend the cold brew. Can't wait to try a doughnut!
that's definitely the place you should be familiar with it, great coffee, meal and , of course, friendly and hospitable staff!!!:)

This place looks adorable and I've always wanted to go in when I pass by on runs! I was  unsure if they were really open at 7:15. I walked into an empty storefront and called into the abyss, and was greeted by a very ungrateful yes .  Post- 5 am workout, I mentioned I was hungry and asked what's good that's low carb - ready to BUY a meal - and   greeted with a blank stare. I got a coffee but i think the quality may be distorted by the sour taste the service left in my mouth.  The last thing I want to do is shake off bad attitudes when i need my morning coffee. I will not return to this location and doubtful I'll try FIKA before noon - or ever again. Back to mobile ordering for me!

This review if for the matcha tea latte (iced w/ the standard almond milk) and a croissant.  The croissant was very good. The drink was pretty good, I love matcha but I do like my drinks slightly sweet, this is not that.  Still good and I drank it but I feel like other places do this better for my I personally like in this type of drink, but this one is probably better for you lol also some may prefer it not being sweet.  I'll have to try something else next time and see, over all it was a decent place for a morning bite to eat and drink
Great place to go to get work done. Tons of open space and seating. The cafe has a really cool atmosphere with floor to ceiling windows. Love this place!!

The coffee here is fantastic.  The pastries are just alright, but nothing special.  The place is airy and bright, a wonderfully spacious and comfy place to meet friends or get work done. Not enough plugs though.  If this place wasn't so dang far from the subway I'd definitely be coming back more often. But having been here twice at what otherwise is peak time (weekend late morning) this FIKA location seems to always benefit from that distance by being wonderfully calm and not-crowded.  It's a little too cold for my taste inside, management could chill with the AC a bit.  Btw- This is going to sound weird but the two bathrooms here are very clean and have this super neat hand wash/dry combo setup you just gotta try out!

After having visited Sweden a few years back, my interest was piqued when I discovered Fika. This is my favorite location, thanks in large part to the ample seating and friendly staff. Their chocolate truffles are no joke. I usually stick with their iced Americano or latte, and yes they have soy milk.  Given that I'm usually studying/have little time for a regular meal in some cases, their protein bar does wonders. It's rare to say a protein bar tastes good, but these are addicting. Luckily they're super filling, so one is enough for a while. If I could, I'd buy these in bulk.  The only drawback is the relative lack of outlets, but that's I guess in line with the idea of a fika being a break, not a time to work.

I come to FIKA every other Thursday to have lunch and work from here. I love it's food and the space. It is so nice to have so much natural light! My only concern, all the chairs are filthy. They need to get washed or changes asap as this diminishes the quality of the space.

Just tried this place for the first time. It is a very welcome addition to a neighborhood that had very few decent food options until about five years ago. Apartment buildings are springing up everywhere so thankfully the bodegas and filthy joints are beginning to disappear. Fika is helping to clean up the block in the mid-50s.  The food was pretty good and I was happy that I was able to order half a sandwich, even though they don't make that very clear on the menu board. Saved some money and still had plenty to eat. Unfortunately, there wasn't much smoked salmon in the wrap I got, but for six dollars I guess I shouldn't expect much. The food is fresh and there is a good variety. I stayed away from the baked goods, but they looked nice too.
Awesome. Love the space. Love the colors. Love the outlets :) outdoor seating.. Great place to work or relax. Must try the truffles. Completely different than other spots around here!!!

Almond bite looked good, so I ordered it, with a small coffee. Cashier asked for $6.50. I asked how much the almond bite was. She says "like $3.00". I say ""like" $3.00? How much is it?" She says she will give me a receipt.  Receipt shows $3.50. I tell cashier. She ignores me.  Coffee not bad, almond bite not very good. Won't go back.

We followed recommendations from yelp. Looking for good coffee and a bite to eat. Coffee was ok. We took the SPICY AVO toast costing 7 $. It was very dissappointing to recieve one slice of bread with avocado spread for this outrageous price.

What's the value-prop of the coffee shop that is not Starbucks? We're local, we're hipper, you're hipper, you're too smart to give your money and time and physical presence to a corporate monster? Great, all fine, but when not backed up with solid coffee, it's all for naught.  * Loud music at 6.25am * I must do my own payment work, typing and tapping and signing on an iPad that spins back and forth * Et encore, du caf̩ absolument ̩xecrable! Stale. Unforgivable.  I can let all the rest go, the hipper-than-thou attitude, the up-sell, the stupid music... but not the coffee. How hard IS it to make a decent cup of coffee? Why must the grounds be so stale that they are past bitter and well into sour?  Conclusion: the folks working there, and likely the owners, must not really like coffee themselves. They should go work at Dunkin Donuts.

The job had a special going with Gregory's coffee so I decided to oblige. I've walked past this place weekly for close to 3 years and have never went in since I am kinda loyal to Starbucks. The staff at the counter was super friendly and was more than happy to explain all the matchup of coffees and teas. They also offer various baked goods but lords knows I love a good iced chai latte but this time I decided to get it "dirty". A dirty chai has a shot of espresso and hit the spot for my afternoon pickup. The small but well decorated coffee shop is great for coffee dates and offline meetings. I will be sure to make this my new coffee spot, just wished there were more locations throughout the five boros.

I usually get coffee from other spots in the area, but when I stop by because of convenience, I'm always satisfied. The lines in the morning are annoying, but they have fresh baked pastries that are unique and I think that's what sets them apart. Definitely better than Starbucks.  Their Aeropressed single origins are pretty good. The espresso here is very robust here but a charred note? I usually get a cortado and some sugar or a cappuccino (very smooth here). Their Walnut Banana Bread is really good, not too dense. They also have a giant Rice Krispie treat made with Chex, which is my guilty pleasure.  They woo me now and again by dropping $2 in my LevelUp account every few months.  There is a lot of space to sit/work with laptops, but they are usually taken. I have to say this place has some of the happiest workers I've ever encountered, they are always smiling and friendly to everyone! They're never impatient when waiting for your order and also offer suggestions if you're new. Lastly, the tall brunette lady that walks around (manager) is also very friendly and warm to everyone. In fact, she made my Aeropressed coffee one day! Thank you!  Recommended: Banana Walnut Bread, Cappuccino, Aeropressed single origins, Cold Brew, Iced Teas, Chex Rice Crispie
***Quick service, decent options***  There's not much to say except if you're in need for a quick coffee fix, Gregory's Coffee is a great option.

Love this place. Been here many times, good strong caffeine and pastries. Nice people and feels like a neighborhood shop in Boston or Idaho...Definitely not your typical Manhattan chug-em out fast coffee shop. Great place to sit or take away your coffee.
Needed coffee to go but was walking dogs.  They were very rude about them despite the fact I held them the entire time.  I guess it's back to Starbucks for us

The Gregory's food and coffee are good. However some of the staff at this location have serious customer service issues. Some of them are not helpful and give a lot of attitude. I've tried going back many times to give this place the benefit of the doubt, but after the fiasco experience I had today-it was the last straw. Never again.
Man does this place get busy! Line was out the door the first time I visited. Can't go wrong with their cold brew :) glad I found a local coffee spot!

I got the cold brew iced coffee with almond milk and vanilla. I'm sorry but I can't get over how good my coffee is. Also I'm usually a really fast drinker with my morning coffees but I've had it for half an hour. I'm really cherishing every sip. It's making me so damn happy. 1. The cup: quality is a+. Very thick and had a cute photo of Gregory and you could tell they put in a lot of work to making sure they have great quality cups. Also I noticed in their cafe by the straw area they had a big tub of lemon water for people to take with thick posh plastic cups. This also goes for their straws. Amazing texture and quality. 2. The aroma. You could just tell by the smell of the brew how dope it is. Sends shivers down my spine. 3. The fricken taste. I don't even know where to begin. From the second the coffee reaches my mouth through the straw it's like this crazy sensation. I just want to hug it. The strong coffee flavor. That fricken brew though. I can't explain it. And they put the perfect proportion of coffee to almond milk and vanilla. Like wow. The atmosphere of the place was great. It had a whole rustic Brooklyn coffee shop vibe that's hard to find. You could tell how much effort and happiness went into my cup of coffee. Service was great. Baristas were so happy to be there and serve me. And it wasn't even that expensive

This is the next Gen Starbucks. They do Aeropress which is great. But their organization is poorly done. Can't tell you how many times I've ordered this and they call it out and someone takes off with it. Take names for drinks. Step it up. If you're going to run it like the titanic Starbucks get better organized.
After walking by this coffee shop a few times, I finally went in, and I wasn't disappointed. The cappuccino was awesome!

Maxed out on caffeine but want something to sip on? Try the peanut pleaser smoothie. Simple ingredients (soy milk, PB, banana + whey protein) -- but oh so tasty. Slurped it down in 5 minutes on the go!

Really nice spot with open seating - they have free samples of their pastries often which is cool  I always get a skim mocha with little less chocolatr than a normal one- only con is that their drinks are never hot

horrible service? we order on yelp ?they didnt put the cable on and didnt get order?we were waiting for half hour?when we ask the lady work here?she was impatient and being rude. She was being unhappy face

Terrible service. They called to tell us they didn't have the coffee flavor I wanted but neglected to say they were out of the apple fritters. So that wasn't in the bag at all when it was delivered. We asked for milk and sugar and we got coffee with nothing. The lox was dry along with the bread it came on. Maybe the food and service are better in person but we will not be ordering from here again. Really bad food for the price.

Nice decor, plenty of seating space, good amount of outlets, and the music isnt too loud! The AC is a bit cold but otherwise it's a nice place to work or have a coffee. And the "get up greg" smoothie, which has cold brew in it,  is my new favorite thing so I'm glad this location serves it, it's not listed online or in the menu in the loyalty app.

Gregorys Coffee will always and forever make me think of my friend India; she worked at one of the original locations near Penn Station five summers ago for a whopping three weeks before starting her PhD program, but I remember always traveling down there just to get her to make me dirty chais. Ahhhh, memories from the summer of 2011...  Anyways...  I needed a place to crash for a few hours between the end of my work day and a 7:30 p.m. dinner. I wasn't too keen to the idea of sitting in my office for another two hours, and sitting at a Starbucks didn't appeal to me, either. After some searched, I was excited to see that Gregorys opened an UES location near Hunter College (...and I'm even more excited to see one will be opening soon, just one block away from my UES office! YASSSS!). I entered and was pleased to see a cheery place with lots of seating up front and in the rear. I ordered my chai and a piece of chocolate rugelach to and retreated to the rear to cozy up with my book for a few hours. The rugelach was delicious with a good balance of cinnamon and chocolate, and the chai borders more on authentic rather than just some chai concentrate; the notes of anise were omnipresent, which I liked.  I'm glad there is a Gregorys in this part of the city. And once its location on 68th and 1st opens, I know I'll be saying buh-bye to Starbucks when my mid-day chai cravings hit.

very friendly staff and a great ambience! I could see myself working here with a laptop for several hours in the lounge area in the back.  however, as for things to buy/not buy- I ordered a latte, which was lovely. on the other hand, I also bought a boston creme doughnut which I would not recommend; the inside was partially soggy/raw dough, which was a little disappointing.

I ordered a cold brew and a croissant here. Both were mediocre. The cold brew was way too acidic and also not cold enough. The croissant was also pretty hard. I think it was towards the end of the day though, so the baked goods had been sitting out for a while.

Loved their macchiato shot and americanos! Still pretty quiet atmosphere, they have more seats when you actually go deep inside the store, and the staff seemed to be all friendly and nice! I often drop for coffee during my school break.
The coffee and service gets 5 stars! Out of TP in the bathroom gets 3 stars. Their almond milk latte was one of the creamiest I have had. I love the little tables tucked in the back of the shop.

Good coffee and a nice number of seats. Very spacious. The music is a bit too opposite to the feel of a coffeeshop (they play edm and upbeat, fast pop) to be uber productive if doing work. But still, a very nice place to have a conversation with friends.
Decent coffee, very loud music which makes customers speak even louder to hear each other.  The staff is generally nice but not able to turn down the music.

Rude barista (brunette with glasses).  Waited for my drink for well over 15 minutes. When I asked about my drink, all she said is that it's coming and very defensively said that my drink takes longer to make. Another few minutes pass and then the barista asks me what drink I ordered. Turns out she forgot to make my drink but barked at me before when I asked about it.

I was in the area very early (for me anyway) at 7:30 and was pleasantly surprised to find this shop open!  I really liked the vibe upon entering, dark enough to be cozy but warm and bright enough to be welcoming for a rainy morning. It's got a very Brooklyn-feel for a Manhattan coffee shop honestly. It feels very comforting, like they'd like you to stay awhile, maybe that's to do with the oversized furniture, and the warm lights but it's very nice.  I was greeted by the barista as I walked through the door, and she gave me a second to check out their extensive menu. I ended up getting a small cold brew (they only have small and large in iced drinks). In the subsequent times I've been back whoever is at the register has always been friendly. The condiment bar was very well set up and in keeping with the rest of the shop. They were well stocked and had honey, which is always a plus.  The coffee as very good and reasonably priced and it seemed like a lovely environment. I'll definitely be back and try some of their other selections. I am pleased to have found this place!  I've now tried their hot drip coffee (excellent), cold brew (stellar), iced green tea green tea (perfectly brewed), and an iced latte (divine). I also had the berry scone which was delicious, perfect amount of density and sweetness. I really love this place, even though they've gotten more crowded lately, I'm still always able to find a seat. Such a gem!

By far my go to coffee spot in the morning. Nevermind that there is a Starbucks across the street but I'd rather come by here. The decor the music the baristas all cool af. The many different choices of coffee is more than adequate for anyone. I personally like the cold brew and with nitro but my favorite is the dirty chai. Also their non GMO muffins and scones are also very good. Love this place a lot. Would love to just come here one day and chill out especially to the dope tunes they play.

Hip little stop to enjoy a perfectly made cortado or chai tea...also had a beautiful selection of pastries. The service was fast friendly and very knowledgeable! The playlist was most enjoyable as well as the selection of seating and books to enjoy during your visit! By far one of if not my most favorite coffee shop in Manhattan!
One of my favorite casual sit down coffee places in NYC. Came here 5 years ago and finally came back 5 years later. Love it here - nothing has changed, not even their light and delicate lattes.

This coffee shop is great. It's warm, has a bathroom for customers, free WiFi, and  really nice staff. I was visiting New York and needed a place to work. They were so nice and made me feel right at home! Heir peanut butter latte is also super good. I'll definitely be back when I'm in town!
We were wowed by the positive energetic greeting from the second we walked through the door - superb!  The Chai latte and pumpkin latte were excellent!
The people work there with dirty hands  and they reuse the milk and never wash the container.it takes me only 15 min to see this neglect .

Nothing can beat a warm cup of coffee on a freezing winter morning after a short run in the city, and UES is never short of great caffeine spots. Just look at that huge donuts even bigger than my palm, or the apple turnover that was still glittering, or even the almond croissant...  By the time I got there, a short line was already formed, so expect some wait even just after they open their door. Happy hour is after 5 everyday, and discount on pastries will be provided then.

Great coffee - but clearly my very patronage was a disturbance to the barista who seemed like he would rather have been doing any one of a thousand things in lieu of serving customers...so, unfortunately, I won't be a return customer. NYC is already overrun with establishments featuring indifferent/passive-aggressively hostile customer service. I don't need to help keep another one of these places in business.
Great, friendly people are working there, best way to tune up for the day and have some great latte and almond croissant. The place is nice and close to subway.

The service was rude by the owner,  she looked at me weir do to the fact that i was wearing my natural hair, as a black woman i would love to enjoy my coffee and not feel like i am at the zoo, in which i will be the Animal in the cage.
