The food was good it was just the service. I do not recommend this place at all. It need to be more versatile, with the employees too.  Not my cup of coffee!!!!!

Came in here and got a tropical sensation. It was nasty and tasteless. I spoke to the owner Lindsay and she had a nasty attitude explaining to me about the menu, in the end she rudely gave me a refund. I will never be back to this hole in the wall shop
Love this shop not just for coffee but work as well! Great music, nice vibes! Free WiFi! Bathroom available Nice people who work there too!

Nice coffee shop, decent coffee, nice tea and smoothies. Love the Avo-holic Shake! Decent prices and fresh ingredients. Very nice service, friendly staffs and decent speed. Not crowded at all so pretty quiet and chill. Good to read and relax, study, work, or catch up with friends. Quite a few tables and seats and welcome to take them to go as well. Nice and cute interior.

This place was found by accident. I was looking for caffebene but found this Idea Coffee.  This place looked local and cozy so I went in.  I didn't notice the lightbulb drink menu because I was craving for some good matcha latte.  Next time I come back I'm definitely getting the lightbulb drink.  I ordered a hot matcha latte. Very good for the price; I ordered medium to go.  I forgot to sweeten the drink but it's ok. I still liked it. I would definitely try iced matcha latte next time for my sweet-toothness.  Mini Cannoli  was only 1.50 so I'll try this next time too!

Came here for a quick coffee stop during my morning run, so unfortunately I did not get the super trendy light bulb drinks. Green, yellow or red, make your choice! They also offer the blue light bulb in April, so come and get it before it is gone!  Lovely decoration inside too, felt like at home. Coffee was ok.

A little under $6 for a medium iced coffee, what a time to be alive.  The inside is nice, but definitely just like a typical starbucks vibe, no big comfy coffee house chairs/couches.  The coffee itself was ok, nothing special that I could speak too, and the cost was absorbent. They have a gimmick coffee with coffee served in a lightbulb, if coming here I'd recommend ordering that, otherwise it's the same quality at a higher price of gregorys, think, etc.

I came here initially for the trendy light bulb juice on Instagram. And luckily their location is pretty close to my office in Flatiron. This is a brand new coffee shop which is very clean and spacious. I ordered all 3 flavors of light bulb juice. The light bulb container is really cool with a small LED light on it. The juices taste delicious but also very healthy, and I was told that they were made of real natural fruits and vegetables. BTW you can take the light bulb container with you, it is a reusable cup. This is NYC, $7.25 for a special light bulb cup and healthy juice, I don't understand why someone said this is quite pricy. Their pizza bagels are also pretty good, in case you want to eat something there, I highly recommend it.
Their iced dirty chai is perfection, and the staff is super sweet to boot. Can't wait to try the Green Light next time we're in!

I have had iced black tea, which is adorable. There are two slice of lemon and fresh mint have been put nicely on the top of the tea. Decor of the shop is beautiful with plenty of seats. It is definitely a good spot for have a rest, chew the rag with friends or family, loiter time away, study or work on one's computer. Some reviews mentioned that hot chocolate is a way to go, I will try it out next time for sure.

Came here for a quick snack and got the Tropical Sensation smoothie and NY Pizza Bagel. Both were delicious! The smoothie was pretty large and sweet, just what I needed in this heat wave. The pizza bagel was also very tasty - it consisted of an everything bagel with cheese, tomato sauce, and pepperoni on top. It was only one half of the bagel though, so I was still kinda hungry afterwards. Also the ambiance is really cozy and cute - the high ceilings make it feel really spacious even though it's not a big space. Definitely recommend this spot for a quick bite!

Coffee was mediocre. Two of their special waffles listed on their menu are no longer served, so it would have been nice if there were some kind of indication prior to ordering. When I received my waffle, it was fine except for random black pieces of what I think was plastic? Unclear.

I ordered a caramel latte macchiato, which was nice - not too sweet. Nothing extra ordinary for the price. It's my first time here and it has a relaxed ambience. I actually got in the store to work for a bit but there was no wifi and I didn't get any help from the staff either, so that was a downer.
I decided to finally give this place a try after working nearby for over a year. That was a mistake. The iced coffee tastes like dirt. Real bad.
$4 coffee half undrinkable. Overhyped just for the location. Go to a bodega save your $.
Love this place. The cold brew or iced coffee are all I ever get. It's the perfect spot to grab a coffee while you wait for your table to be called at Cookshop! :D  Edit 11/2016: amazing lattes.
The coffee here is fine but honestly, you're paying for the name. I got an iced latte that cost $6... If it's nice, sit outside in the patio area.
A cozy coffee space. There is an inner court which is quiet and separate from externality. Dog friendly.

A beautiful and lovely cafe spot with lots of space to lounge and relax, indoors and outdoors. Very stylish atmosphere in the lobby of the Highline Hotel filled with dark leather couches and wooden tables. The outdoor area has even more tables and chairs if you find yourself here during on warm days.  Iced latte is always my go-to at cafes because I realize lots of cafes don't know how to make a decent latte! Intelligentsia's latte ended up being super milky, I could barely taste the espresso. Maybe I'll go for something else next time, but the overall atmosphere here will keep me coming back.

Intelligentsia coffee beans: yes! Ambience: yes! Location: meh. I had Intelligentsia coffee for the first time in Chicago and I was hooked. I drink a lot of coffee and make it a point to try coffee made with different beans and brewing methods, and I had not tasted anything like Intelligentsia before. After a little research I learned about the Chemex brewing method and suspect that that is what made the coffee taste fantastic. I was elated when I found out that there was at least one Intelligentsia location back home in NYC, and was even happier when my (pretty expensive) cup of Joe from here was reminiscent of my Chicago Intelligentsia experience. The only thing I don't like is how out of the way this place is, but I will definitely be going back the next time I'm in the area.

Yeay, Intelligentsia is finally here.  They've just opened and It seems the baristas have been through espresso boot camp. The cappuccinos I've had have been true to their Chicago counterparts.  The baristas have all been cute and sweet and I hope they stay that way. No New York mean-mugs or hipster pretense.  I wish the space felt more home-y. Or wasn't on 10th Ave..... (Open one in the Village or HK).  But hey, Intelligentsia is legitimately,  finally here. And this is the gold standard.

Even though it's in a hotel it's some of the best coffee I've ever had. Their latte is great. It's a nice stop to chill after a lot of waking. The coffee chain is considered to be the best by coffee aficionados.

Good coffee! My friend and I were wandering the Highline, then spotted the Highline Hotel so we went over to visit. The hotel is gorgeous by the way. I would love to stay there if I could. As soon as you walk in, the coffee bar is right in the lobby. The coffee is really good. GAH. The place is so nice. I just love it. If it was closer to my apt I would go all the time. They also have a truck outside the hotel. There are little tables and everything too. Super cute.
Coffee was cold even though we asked it to be extra hot. When i changed the coffee it was marginally warmer didn't bother for changing it again.

Basic with a capital "B".  I went in one afternoon for a latte and an afternoon snack.  I decided on a chocolate bar near the register, to go with my latte.  With no price in sight, I figured, "how much could it be? $3, $4?"  When the cashier said, "your total is $18.95," I was dumbfounded.  I paid and moved along as the line behind me was long.  I asked the guy making my latte how much the chocolate bar was, still in shock from the snack that cost more than lunch.  He said they are $12.  I asked why the bars were $12 and he responded, "why are you paying $6 for a latte?"  He said it was because they are "artisanal."  I said they should put an "artisanal" sign next to it so people know what they are getting into.  But you know what, Rude, you're right.  Why am I paying $6 for a latte that is half the size and double the price of what I could get at D&D or Starbucks.   Definitely didn't make a repeat customer out of me with that attitude.  As for the chocolate bar...#tasteslikeHersheys
Excellent latte, the house granola/yogurt/fruit was incredible. Friendly staff and nice space where I was able to sit for a while, read and plan my day!

OMG -  this place was absolutely wonderful for a quick, healthy, sit down breakfast.  Everything on the menu looked wonderful.  We decided to go with their sweet potato avocado toast, and one of their toasts with a spicy tomato sauce and egg.   So So good.  Definitely plan to come back.

Great espresso coffee and baked goods (if a little pricey!). The lunch options are nutritious and delicious! :)  Because they've just opened there are always spare seats. Possibly also because there's no wifi :p
Really great coffee, great atmosphere, friendly service, little mason jars for water.. what more could you ask for? :)

Being from California, I'd like to think I know my avocados and coffee. I had the poached egg and avocado and a cappuccino from here. I was disappointed with both. The avocado with the poached egg was very sour for some odd reason and there was waaaay too much olive oil. It was piled on top of a sweet potato and topped with some sesame seeds and what I believe to be fennel seeds (not completely sure). The combination of it all was not bad but weird. I ended up picking around the things I liked and didn't like. I usually never have a bad cup of coffee when I visit NY, but for some reason their cappuccino held an over powering citrus taste. Again, it wasn't bad, just weird. Most coffee shops I visit their service is usually friendly, accommodating, helpful, etc but their service was just ehh. Overall, not impressed.

Good morning! I am drinking the new Kenya pour over. It is outa this world good, bright with notes of citrus and berry. The staff remembers me and is always helpful. If your looking for the quickest cup and you don't care about quality there are many other places. If you want good food and great coffee in mid town then this is one of the top places.

We are always looking for good coffee places while traveling. Specifically single origin coffee which has become a favorite to drink. While in CA we just buy beans and do a pour over at home. However while traveling it becomes harder to find good places just because we are unfamiliar with the area. We found this place with all the right set up and the coffee was freshly roasted. You have the option of pour over hot or cold.  I've never had a cold pour over but it sounded interesting. The hot pour over was perfectly put together. Fresh beans, right temperature, and timing made the coffee taste clean. We got the Papa New Guinea and the Peruvian pour over. Both very well brewed (not sure if that's the right word for pour over. Still pretty new at the specialty coffee scene.). We shared an avocado toast which was tasty. They had a topping to the avocado toast which was new to me but gave the avocado toast better flavor than just salt.  Pickled is the best term I can come up with.  (They were little balls. Again excuse my silly lack of language skills.). The place is simple with bare brick walls as well as black subway tile on one side and white subway tile on the other.  Nice place to sit for coffee as well as order from a menu full of breakfast/lunch items. They also had pastries like donuts and muffins to choose from but I was too full to try any. Been eating my way through New York City and I would definitely come back here for specialty coffee.

Wow, they totally just lost three customers. Two of my friends and I are pretty regular at this cafe, and every time the service is terrible. They are NEVER friendly to us. But we take it since we like the atmosphere of the cozy cafe. I always get a chai since I don't drink coffee, which is made from a concentrate so not good either.  But this time we sat and were working on our laptops on a Friday afternoon (as pretty much everyone does in a coffee shop in the 21st century). We all bought drinks and I bought an extra granola bar bc they have no good healthy breakfast food options-- btw this granola bar was $3.  One of the staff came up to us and instructed us to all squish into one small table "because we were together." Each table only fits one laptop. And we should be able to sit where we would want. When we explained that we were working and needed the space she said (very rudely) "Well we are cafe for people to hang out." When we then explained that if we needed to move we have to leave, since we wouldn't have place for our laptops so we could work, she just walked away.  We left and didn't make a scene but definitely never going here again.

The female owner of this coffee shop has been extremely RUDE to me on more than one occasion and it blows my mind how she gets away with treating customers this way. I can only hope she does not treat her very nice employees in the same regard. Good coffee but I'm sadly officially boycotting this coffee as of today (after going here 3 years) due to the unsolicited and blatant disrespect from the owner.

HAPPY HOLIDAY SEASON SHOPPING! I HAVE VERY FEW PET PEVES HOWEVER MY BIGGEST ON DOING RETAIL BUSINESS IS WHEN A CASHIER PUTS MY CHANGE ON THE COUNTER!!! AS IF IT WAS  OK TO TAKE MY MONEY FROM MY HAND BUT NOT RETURN AS A FULL TRANSACTION!!! Younger People please be aware if you work in retail or stores or bars! Many senior people and people of color will take offense to this because during JIm Crow period in American History this was how store owners showed they did not want to do business with people of color. Very sad thing  I was just at Java Girl Inc on East 66th  Street and got coffee and this young English women took my money then just placed my change in front of me as I looked at her ... I said guess you don't like my business? She said why? Because you did not return my change ? She said it's there? I said transaction is complete when customer gets change in hand... Then I explained ... BE AWARE AND WATCH YOU MIGHT LEARN ,,,
A quaint little coffee shop to meet up. Quiet area near Sloan Kettering. Plenty of coffee bean choices for sale.

Hmm this one is tough...I really enjoyed the ambience, the little shop was cute and has had a warm home-feeling; yet the espresso itself was, really disappointing - a bit on the light side and did not carry enough flavor from the espresso beans.  Definitely stop by and visit if you plan on taking some hand-made decorations; yet I would suggest a pass for coffee purposes.  10 dollar minimum for card.

Favorite coffee shop in the neighborhood, I haven't got a chance to try their teas but their coffee's pretty good. Friendly staff (especially during the weekend) and the atmosphere's so cozy you can either read a book or catch up with friends

Charming, cozy, warm = cramped. For the sake of courtesy, stay away if you have just eaten a monster burrito or hit up an unlimited brunch, because the tables and chairs barely fit, let alone the people. After downing several cups of tea, I was dying for a bathroom but there just didn't seem to be enough space for one. Barista was a bit stiff and seemed to have a problem explaining what loose tea leaf was, but maybe I was just having problems digesting my monster carnitas burrito and couldn't understand basic English.  Also, do not get the egg salad sandwich with dill on croissant. Utterly flavorless. The dill was nowhere to be found.  I know cilantro gets a bad rep because certain members of the populace think it tastes like bitter soap, but on the whole, spices are our friends!  Also, I'm sorry to the guy whose coat got splattered on when I tripped over my feet and spilled half of my $3 hot chocolate everywhere. It looked really expensive. I was going to offer to pay for the dry cleaning but you huffed and packed everything up in a hurry, and then I got to sit on your nicely warmed-up cushion, so I like to think everything balanced out in the end. For me.

This place is so cute and unique. The UES does not have places like this. The space is more important to me than what they actually sell. The few times I've been here I honestly have just taken away how the space makes me feel. So defer to other reviewers for food and drink quality. Just know that it's worth going to, if only to lift your spirits.  This is a good place to meet a friend for a quick coffee. It's too small and cramped for studying or a long, drawn-out catch up with a friend. There's a 10 dollar credit card minimum, so always carry cash, or treat your friend to a drink :)
$10 credit card minimum at a coffee shop is ridiculous. Coffee isn't very good and the food is all natural and tastes like bark. Don't waste your time

I was pleased to find this little "hole in the wall" next door to my new apt. With a Starbucks on every other corner, Java Girl is a breath of fresh air. Tired of lattes and cappuccinos,  I go for the brewed coffee which, in my opinion, is 10x better than anything Starbucks offers. With a variety of beans and roasts Java Girl has something for everyone's taste buds. Small 12 oz runs 1.80 and the large 18 oz is 2.20. In addition to coffee they carry delicious croissants and cookies to munch on.  A few "rules" as other have noted: no outside food, CC min. of $10. Some reviewers seem disturbed by these. But they're not  unusual or outrageous requests. Many businesses follow the same practices. The venue is truly a hole in the wall with minimal and cramped seating. But whenever I walk pass the windows I always see groups of people enjoying their coffee and company. Java Girl is truly a neighborhood gem.

Well, as you should do when visiting a new place, we tried things Java Girl was known for - mocha, chai, and a good ole cup of coffee.  All satisfied as good as anything and then some.  Not to mention the croissants/pastries were great and the mood and decor of the place is awesome.  Tips - if you are used to more classic versions of chai, Java Girl's are sweet, so ask for less vanilla/sweetener if you're going to try a chai creme.  If you are used to Starbucks' version of a mocha, get Java Girl's "hot chocolate with espresso".  Their regular mochas are quite unsweet.

I really tried to like this place because it is small & cozy, but the hot chocolate is not good, and the smoothies - don't even get me started (literally once they just took a yogurt parfait with granola out of their fridge and put it in my "mixed fruit" smoothie - it was disgusting).  Gave it a few tries, but can't say I'll ever go there again.

My go to tea place on the upper east side. Great fresh tea and quaint interior with rustic wooden paneling. Four comfortable outside chairs as an added bonus. Sitting outside in the shade on a blazing hot NYC summer day.

Amazing local coffee shop, they have great iced teas and flavored iced coffee's, also delicious and fresh pastries. The ambience is perfect for relaxing they also have wifi. I would say however it is a little pricey, around $4.50 for a large ice coffee is crazy but I guess since it is a local shop they have to keep up somehow.

Come for the coffee, stay for the ambiance.  If you want a cute place with a nice vibe, chilled out music, and some zen, come here, it's a great place to read a book or get some work done while you sip on your caffeinated beverage of choice.  I really only drink the drip coffee here, and as far as coffee goes, it's pretty good and reasonably priced. If you are a coffee connoisseur, you may be disappointed in their cup a joe - it's nothing extraordinary.  The staff are helpful, and the handful of regulars are always chatting it up outside, which helps maintain a nice community vibe - a rare treat on the Upper East Side.
My absolute new favorite cafe in the neighborhood. Lovely baristas/os and truly delicious coffee. Curious about the B rating, but not enough to stop coming.

Worth stopping by given the dearth of options beyond Starbucks in the neighborhood. They sometimes make to go holders out of a pack of gum with a piece attached to help with that coffee breath - much appreciated mid afternoon.  Definitely on the cozy side, haven't tried to hang out there too long given the space but have seen some people who looked poised for some major camping there.

Sweet, cute coffee place. Very much a local coffee house. NOT Starbucks - which is great right? I loved the smell in the place, roasted coffee. Wonderful.  There's a very chilled atmosphere here and the staff are bit dozy, relaxed.
I have constant cravings for their dirty chais. Espresso and chais are out of this world.  Just wish they had a lower credit cards minimum $10, and wifi! Prices about $5 for a large chai.

Love the place but wow the help isn't friendly at all!  I stood at the counter and watched the girl cleaning up...then when she realized I was standing there she didn't even say a word to me...she just stood in silence waiting for me to order.  I asked her about vegan options and she said "I have no idea" WOW ok thanks for your help!! Anyway I sill like the place...it's very cute and comfortable, a nice place to relax, but no wifi if you plan on working.    I did find out (after having to ask many questions) that a lot of the soups are vegan.  I would give this place 5 stars if they the help would smile and at least pretend they are happy you're there!

Stopped in this afternoon for two coffees. It seems by the other comments I have to use the word "adorable" to describe it. I was in and out with good, hot coffee. The counter girls were friendly and quick.

Great coffee shop on the UES. As soon as I took my first sip of coffee I was hooked. Now I swing by at least once a week when out walking my dog for a coffee/tea. And if there is a chair available and the weather is nice. I stay.

What a nice stop for a coffee and scone. was walking to a meeting and had some time before so i took a chance on Java Girl. The staff is friendly and the cafe was very nice, danesi for a cappuccino.  i also bought a couple of 1/2 pound bags of coffee for home. I will stop back when i am back in the area.

What a cozy place to spend a morning! Yummy homemade nibbles and great chai + cute bookstore vibe inside. There's a little outdoor seating if you don't mind your chair being chained to the table. But they memorize your drink order quickly and don't mind if you stay a while and read.
Really chilled. My coffee house fantasy.  Perfect.  Also stunning almond croissants!

Yelp lead me to this cafe. My friend and I were looking for a place to drink coffee and converse before attending a nearby art show. After reading the mixed reviews on yelp, I was pleasantly surprised by Java Girl. I thought the coffee was good, the decor adorable and the atmosphere quite welcoming. I found the service to be good and the music playing was great. It brought me back to the 90's!  My friend and I ended up staying longer than intended and we both agree that Java Girl has a lot to offer.

My neighborhood coffee shop.  Love the location, love that it's not Starbucks, love the friendly service.  Cute setting, limited seating, dog friendly.  The unfortunate thing is the coffee is nothing spectacular.  The vanilla iced lattes are great, but the typical $5 price tag.  You would think for the number of times I frequent I would get a discount.

This place is absolutely adorable. Mismatched antique chairs, old wooden tables and beautiful Mexican paper laterns make the atmosphere really cozy and original. The coffee was great and they have a huge selection of loose-leaf teas. The food also looked great... but we didn't try it. Outside lawn chairs, wooden benches, a bird feeder and a lounging black cat gave the place a really homey feel and created a sense that your in a quiet lazy neighborhood. Perfect for a Saturday morning. I had read a lot of bad reviews about this place on Yelp and was totally bummed because it is so close to my apt and adorable from the outside. Thankfully I ignored the hype and tried it anyways. It is definitely my new favorite coffee shop in the City.

Greatest undiscovered coffee shop in New York City.  Because of its out of the way location, on 66th street between 1st and 2nd Avenue, not many people know about this spot.  I lived on 66th street for 6 years and went there almost every day, and not just for coffee.  They have a tiny kitchen, that churns out high quality pressed sandwiches.  The tuna melt is great, made with freshly chopped veggies and not too much mayo.  I also really enjoy the turkey sandwich.  The coffee is outstanding, blows away just about every other place in the city.  It is pretty small, but I always seem to be able to grab a table and sit for a while- though sometimes you might share it.  It's not all about high speed internet in here either, it is a social vibe with some good satellite radio tunes, usually something latin or maybe Jazz (or even Latin jazz).  Go often enough, and they'll remember you name.

Both the cashier and the barista were surly and rude. They definitely did not make me feel like a welcome customer. And on top of it, my caf̩ au lait was burning hot, she way over-steamed the milk to the point of scalding. My son's chai latte was also unbearably hot and burning. Buyer beware! Hospitality is clearly not important to this shop. With plenty of other coffee options in the neighborhood, I will not return.
The $7 latte is apparently a thing... and not a particularly good latte either! The place is also tiny and the staff are reluctantly helpful. Never again!

Had a cappuccino which was pretty good by NY  standards. After living in Europe and drinking Italian espresso and Turkish coffee, US coffee no matter how good is just OK...  I liked that Joe actually serves in China and not just paper....paper is awful!  A little out of the way but so much better than Starbucks puke!

It's a chain coffee shop but the small interior with about 10 seats inside works to proVide a cozy vibe. NO WIFI I repeat there is no wifi here. There's is one person who wrongly assumed that there is wifi but I assure you there is no free wifi here. The TWC type of wifi is here but if you are not a local and don't have an account then you are out of luck. There is also no bathroom.  Coffee however, the cortado to be specific, is perfect. Their chai latte is also yums. They also have underwest donuts here.

I was so happy when Joe opened near my office this year. The baristas are talented and friendly, and it is always a pleasure to stop in.  I love the pistachio agave cookies, and also appreciate the more healthful breakfast/snack options they have available (think kale and hard boiled eggs).  It's also great that they are open until 8 so that you can grab a quality espresso beverage before heading to a show at Lincoln Center.

I spend half my money energy and time in coffee shops and looking for the perfect cup . Being a coffee snob ain't easy and well while I say that it's easy too ... Too many places to choose from and they are just as good with some being Exceptional. Joe for me is a chain but a local one. Before they decide to go the Shake Shack and Magnolia way ! And though I may not be a fan of the ones who expand I understand some of them just have to :) This Joe Iam particularly fond of one its in my hood and closest to get hands on coffee just as when I open my eyes but also this Joe has the best best best Baristas .... They - fewer they may be ( as I see the same ppl everyday) are like real Artists and friendly too ! Also my one place for the best Cortados in town if u don't want a Stumptown or an  Abraco !
Great coffee, but it's cash only and there is seldom any seating. It's not far from Central Park, which means you can take it to go enjoy elsewhere.
I had a cappuccino and a muffin, so not much. The service is slow, i wonder how they do with more people ordering. There is outside seating, and the place is clean, the service friendly...
Friendliest baristas. Coffee is great especially the cold brew.

Good little local coffee chain spot in upper west side. It is especially nice in the warmer months when they have outdoor seating. Otherwise it is a really tiny shop, and always crowded, so not always a great place for meeting people! I like their iced chai lattes. And they have a few (limited) gluten free food options. Service is ok, but usually they are trying to move customers through since there is usually a line. Overall it is a solid spot near Lincoln Center to grab coffee that is not Starbucks or a bodega.

Honestly used to love this place. Great coffee. Great atmosphere. The barista that works the register has been so rude my girlfriend and I on numerous occasions that we will no longer be going back unless it's taken care of.  You are a barista, not a celebrity, not the most important person in the room.  Get over yourself and treat your customers with some kindness - or at least decency.

Honestly I loved this place. great coffee and atmosphere. BUT today, myself and a co-worker came into Khave Coffee as we usually do on random days of the week. We  usually go to the 9th Ave location. The staff there are typically also so friendly and welcoming. I actually deleted my Starbucks app because Kahve had great coffee and amazing people. However today I experience an awful trip to Kahve. I met the rudest barista and an embarrassing moment over my reward card. Basically I ordered two drinks. one for my self and one for my co-worker (it was my turn to treat) I  had an four different cards with all different stamps. I had an snowflake, a flower, stars and little feet. I had one card complete filled which I wanted to redeemed. Yet the barista refused to honor my card because he calmed they only used one kinda stamp and it was not the one I currently had filled. Like I mention before I have cards with for different things on them. I paid for my drinks but was beyond embarrassed with the whole express. The barista basically called me a liar in front of my co-worker and the other customers waiting online. I would go as far as saying if I was not an Latina woman he probably would have not treated my the way that he had. I am very unhappy with Kahve and the service I was provided by Ulas at the 10th ave location.

Glad to have Kahve in the neighborhood. An addition to great coffee shops nearby. My favorite is there Almond Chai and Cuban Coffee so good! Love the ambiance and music too. They have a good amount of space. The staff here is very friendly. If i want to just chill, sit down, listen to good music with a good cup of coffee, this is where i go.  I haven't tried their pastries though. Maybe because Sullivan St. Bakery is nearby. Love the bread and pastries there. Same goes with Jolly Goat coffee - love their Cafe Americano. But then Sullivans and Jolly Goat doesn't have the space that Kahve has.

I like this place.  I like that the people are always nice, I like that the service is (usually) quick, and I like that they always have unique flavors. The pricing is around Starbucks pricing, but I feel better knowing it is going to a smaller shop like this.  I'm hoping to try their food and pastries at some point - but for now it is just the coffee and teas :)

Love the tea selection! They have flavored teas, green and black teas, and herbal teas. They also have a great coffee selection if that is your thing.  Plugs and high-top tables available if you want to come in and use your laptop. Very friendly staff. Free wifi, just ask for the password.  Fresh baked pastries are also available.  So glad this place moved into my neighborhood.

Love coming here to do work. Not too many seats, but I suppose I've lucked out at 'off times'.  Sunny, welcoming, clean, the girl who works the mornings is such a sweetheart.  Coffee is outstanding.  They have whatever you'd like.  They've recently added wine etc to the menu, too.  Almost hesitated writing because I don't want to lose my 'hidden gem'-- but I want them to survive and do well!  They have various sweets, too, though I admit I've only had the coffee and teas.  Glad this gem is here.  But pricey, but such is the way of these smaller coffee shops these days.  (Music is great but quite loud, so you may want headphones-- just a heads up)

The owner is evil. S/he puts a bathroom right where you can see it but then won't allow the waitstaff to give you the key because it's 'Employees Only', in an area with an already scarce bathroom scene (Soho). Beetroot latte is mediocre. Looks like pink milk and tastes about the same (the beet flavor is so mild it's basically non-existent). Also, when I found out that they wouldn't let me use the restroom, I asked to cancel the transaction (because if I have to go elsewhere to hunt for a restroom, I'd rather spend on food and beverages where I can actually enjoy them without a full bladder) the barista refused and suggested that I just leave without the beverage for which I already paid. Lastly, the coffee was acrid, acidic and burnt. Tasted like the equipment hasn't been cleaned properly since they opened.

Great coffee place in SOHO - right when you get off the subway too! I was able to get a lavender latte, which is not found in every coffee shop. Cute little place to sit while you work for a little while or stop to take a break from the NYC madness! Would go back again!

Such a cute little classic NYC coffee spot. It's light, airy, lots of natural light. It has a cozy, but clean and chic vibe. There are only maybe 4 tables, and it is very small. There is no restroom. BUT they have wifi and outlets at every seat. My favorite part is that the tea is loose , excellent flavors. They are known for their coffee and have lots of paraphernalia that makes them seem super legit and trendy.

Service is great. Friendly baristas! I'm a frequent customer of their flat-whites! The ratio of coffee to milk is on point. Their lattes can be warmer (I always ask for extra hot lattes) and has slightly too much milk in general. Their cheddar scones are pretty good, definitely should ask them to warm it for you. They have seasonal coffee and tea so definitely try them out!

I really like their cappuccino, it's perfectly made to go with almond croissant. I work about 15 min walking distance from the coffee room and it's such a rewarding experience to start the morning relaxed & in good mood having my big Prologue breakfast.  The coffee room is right at the corner of Lafayette & canal, and it's feels like the zen corner of all the craziness of soho & Chinatown with everything decorated in marble white, clean & minimal that makes it unique.  There is a framed sign of wifi & password right next to the counter the minute you walk into the store, so you know that everything is prepared for you even without asking. Of course, the staff & owner are very friendly & helpful to answer any questions you have about the coffee & the area.  I'm still curious about their rose brew, it must taste amazing, will definitely visit again next Tuesday for it.
Great coffee spot!!! Very spacious and friendly staff! Even though they're a coffee room their hot chocolate is amazing. Have to go back to try their teas soon.

Stopped by the cafe. Dim and dramatic looking. All was well until I appreciated two dead flies in my glass of cold brew. Server took it away with no reaction and then for some reason returned with a to-go cup of iced coffee that I had not asked for. Then she tried to bring us a check when we were about to leave, apparently not considering that wild sanitation violations might be cause to consider otherwise. Thankfully the manager was appropriately horrified by this whole situation and reacted appropriately by waiving our tiny check (only other item was a cappuccino, since they forgot to bring the pain au chcolat I ordered). Not sure what else you need to hear to know that you should check out somewhere else.

$5+ for a plain cup of coffee and they can't even give you a lid that doesn't fall off and burn you.  I don't know what sort of idiots run this place and skimp on something, but it's a legitimate mess and a safety hazard.  Find literally any other coffee place except this and you'll be better off.

Best hotel bar hands down! If you get lucky enough your bartender might be Beata! She's amazing, makes this amazing espresso drink with kahlua and Baileys that's over the top! She's so sweet and knowledgeable about all things New York!  Highly recommend a drink before having a burger at burger joint!

I grabbed a quick drink with a girl friend while staying here on a work trip. Lots of teams attending the US Open were here but regardless, the staff were friendly, quick and the atmosphere of the bar is really lovely with deep velvet couches, a nice wine selection and they bring delicious complimentary bites---quick fried stuffed olives, smoked mixed nuts and other bites. It was a very relaxed place where everyone was just hanging out having casual drinks with no rush by the staff. Note--large wine pours :). I would gladly go back for drinks if I stay at the hotel again.

Lovely setting for tea, coffee and light fare during the day.  The danishes are amazing. The tea is served very traditionally. A nice change from a cup of hot water and a tea bag.  This place makes the wait for Norma's bearable.

This really is a one star review, but the flavor of the coffee makes it two.  On Christmas morning, after my jaunt around Manhattan, I needed breakfast, badly.  Sadly, my Yelp app failed to update on things that were "open" that morning, and I wandered into here for some grub.  I wanted a full breakfast, but what I got was a mishmash of items and horrible service.    I'll start with the food/drinks- I ordered a pain du chocolat (which they were out of) so I had to settle for a croissant.  I added a fruit cup, bellini, and latte.  The beverages were both fabulous, and well worth the wait.  The food was meh and not worth the money.    The atmosphere could be cozy if it wasn't so cold outside and the doors weren't constantly opening and closing.  A frigid draft ran through me roughly every two minutes.    Now onto the service...I often cringe when I see reviews from others- wondering if they have ever spent time in the service industry: dealing with difficult people, being short-staffed and in the weeds, and having to work their asses of since all income is based on tips and whether or not the person in front of you knows how to do math (much like how the written English language has deteriorated, I believe that we are doomed as a society based on math skills).  Unlike those who have never received $2.62 on a $40 check (my service was just fine, just angst-ridden teenagers who apparently spent all their money on attitudes), I have spent many, MANY years in the service industry.  I currently wait tables because I need the money and it's a nice way to keep me humble.  Working in the service industry has made me infinitely more and less patient when I'm out enjoying the service of others.  Wait, that didn't sound right.  In any case, I am VERY patient when I see a server who is clearly overwhelmed but trying very hard to make each and every table know that they are special.  I am EXTREMELY impatient when I see a server who is busy, but doesn't bother to let me know that a) I exist, b) that I am worth her time, and c) that she is worth my tip.    I sat there for a good 10-15 minutes before I was even acknowledged (a "hi, I'm busy but I'll be right back" goes a long way), got my order taken at ludicrous speed, got my food dropped off with nary a word, and got my check with as much enthusiasm as someone delivering chlamydia results.  Service sucked- there's no way around it.  It's not like I go around wearing a sign that says "hi, I'm  a server too" (as I shouldn't have to), and I realize that on Christmas Day she was probably short-staffed, but she really was crappy.  And by she, I mean the blond of European roots.    For the prices I expected more.  For the service, I hope she didn't expect 20%, because she sure didn't deserve it.
Calm, tasty, relaxed, high quality, hidden gem, just a few of the things that come to mind when I think of this place.

Yes, its beautiful inside (the photos will tell you that much) and yes there is nice music playing, and the ceilings are very high, but to me this was still a somewhat cramped kind of space, especially for the price you'll need to pay.  The lovely lounge chairs seem to fill up quickly.  This is not a place to go if you have a group of over 3 people.  One person was kind enough to let my friend and I share space with them.  I wouldn't mind if the prices weren't completely STUPID.  Pint of Guinness for $12?  A bottle (I assume 12 oz) of Ommegang for $9?  Glasses of wine that start at $16?  Seriously, I doubt the bottles of the wines they offered were more than the price per glass.  I would have been OK paying $18 for a glass of Brunello di Montalcino, but $18 for a glass of Beaujolais is a bit too much.  I can only assume that most of Knave's clientele have enough money to play with that the excessive pricing isn't an issue.  You could consider this a good romantic spot to bring a date for a drink IF you can find a comfortable place to sit that you won't need to share at some point.  (seriously, at those prices part of the cost should be total privacy)  However,  if you are just looking for a place to go and aren't blessed with a plethora of spending money I think you should probably look elsewhere for a drink.  I would be willing to come back here for an espresso drink of some kind.  It seems like this is their strong suit, so its possible I've mis-judged the place.  I'll give it a shot after another trip to Burger Joint, and I might just need to revise the rating up a bit.

Knave uses some excellent counter culture coffee and the baristas are skilled which is a great recipe for excellent coffee and there are also nice lemon and anise flavored cookies served with each cup. The drinks served are also good and I do like the atmosphere of the place. Service is not great,usually slow and not very friendly. If I would disregard the prices it would be great but the fact that they charge $6 for a cappuccino is just way too much even in New York. My advise would be to go to the Burger Joint (in the same hotel) have lunch and then ask for the receipt that gives you 2 for 1 coffees at Knave.

Checked into the hotel but had to wait on my room as it was not ready yet.  Not a problem, I expected that since it was only 1pm and they upgraded me to a suite.  I decided to stop by this coffee bar for a cappuccino and surf the Internet to pass some time by as it is too damn cold outside.    The bar lounge area is very Old World.  Flickering candles with marble tables, marble flooring, Victorian chairs of dark wood and leather cushions.  They also have plush ottomans.  A very cozy place indeed.    The prices for their beverages are a little pricey.  I did not think the coffee prices were to bad, $6 for a cappuccino.  Beer was running $9-$12, wine $14 and brunch cocktails were about $18.  This is a really cool place to just lounge around and enjoy conversation with friends.  I did notice most people did not stay long.  Probably due to the prices of the drinks.    I like the place and will be back for coffee as there is no coffee making equipment in the room.
Horrible service. Ran out of hot chocolate and pain au chocolat. Very slow service and surly waitress!

Wanted to have a drink here almost entirely for the design, which I loved. Drinks didn't disappoint. Service good. Bar snacks tasty. Most glaring suggestion: If you're going to serve fried olives (or fried anything), make sure they always come to the table warm. I'd give it a 3.5 if I could.

I'm a big fan of La Colombe Coffee but this shop is pretty awful.  Beyond the lack of cleanliness, the staff there is just rude.  I wouldn't go back unless your desperate.  Their coffee is great. Very strong but top notch.  I'd walk a few blocks and go to another shop with better service and that isn't filthy.

They ran out of the coffee I ordered, (maybe a half inch from the brim of the cup was missing) and insisted on giving me a free biscotti! They made my experience really great. I'll definitely be coming back!

Huge line but the coffee is great. I had a latte and an almond croissant (they ran out of pretzel even though it was like 11 am, bleh). Not really anywhere to sit so don't try to hang out here. It seems more spacious than the soho location, though.  Edit 10/2017: I do wish they made chai lattes here but I had a flat white and it was amazing. Also love the prosciutto croissant!

I absolutely LOVE this coffee, the black and tan really is the best coffee around. I find myself going there rarely now because of the SLOW SERVICE! this is by far the slowest moving coffee shop around. They have one person ringing off of two registers, who is also pouring drip coffee as well as serving pastries. The staff is very nice but it really is absolutely zero rush even during rush hour times. You have a line wrapped around the corner and it could take anywhere from 10-25 minutes to get a coffee because of how SLOW the service is. They should have two people ringing, coffees are literally sitting on the counter waiting since the pay line takes twice as long as ordering.

Generally there is great coffee here. It's super fresh and the staff are always friendly. The lattes are amazing but not always hot which is a pet peeve of mine but nothing to deter me from going. The almond croissants are hands down the best!!

This place is alright and I need a little afternoon pick me up. I got an Ethiopian double espresso which was dark, fruity and acidic the way African espressos tend to be. I liked my espresso here more than Stumptowns. Since this is by Bryant park it's pretty busy but the line moves quickly. There's also Blue Bottle just across the street if you like them too.

I used to love La Colombe Coffee for the high quality of coffee and atmosphere. Only the atmosphere remains. The coffee is now just the same average quality as Starbuks. I ordered cappuccino. The foam was weak and the coffee did not taste good.
Awesome place to get some beverages and treat. Highly recommended! Stuff all nice and super friendly!

You will never find better coffee than here at La Columbe. The staff is knowledgable and friendly. The atmosphere is great, and did I mention the coffee? Whether you want an espresso, latte, draft, or cold brew. You can't go wrong.

Was not impressed at all. Super cramped and unorganized. The guy couldn't figure out our order and was rude. Ordered a simple hot chocolate and was not worth the price. Save your money and go someplace else.

Breakfast sandwich was best i ever had !  The ciabatta was so soft , scrambled eggs cooked perfect and than ham was delicious . Martin and the lovely French owner were awesome . Will be back for sure !

Stumbled upon this little place when I was looking for a place with coffee and food... and both are amazing. Not to mention the owner of the shop is very welcoming and makes sure everyone is satisfied! Yep.

This review is based on my experience with Lena's delivery via Seamless. Although I live very close by (and am a long time neighborhood resident), I haven't visited their physical location yet. Ever since they popped up on Seamless, I've been regularly ordering their baguette sandwiches and coffees. Haven't tried their pastries yet. Their delivery is faster than any other place I order from, including Bully's and Cozy S&B, which are both a little closer to me. Lena's uses UberRush, FWIW.  My main point is that whenever I order, their coffees and sandwiches have always been high quality and super fresh; like top notch, bliss-out, honest French simplicity. I'm slightly addicted. For however long Lena's is around, I'll be happy to say they're my neighbor.
Awesome European sandwich and coffee spot my new favorite in the are the owner brought in the delivery him self thank you Pier loved the food

The black dude with dreads was a complete ass hole. He appeared as if he hated his life and his job ... the other location is amazing ... stay away from here until he learns customer service and what basically everything the company stands for "be happy "!!! Coffee was amazing though ...

Really nice place.  Shame more people don't check it out.  Its in a weird abandoned mini mall in the NY Mercantile Exchange building next to a hair salon.  Only the random weird financial guy like me and tourists who got lost trying to find ground zero hang out here.  Its really off the beaten path.  Espresso is very good with a very unique taste - they say its the Ethiopian beans they use.  Flat whites are out of this world.  I almost never drink coffee with milk but these are so thick and creamy its out of this world.  You need a freakin straw to drink this stuff its so thick.  Try the flat white.  Profits go to charity.  Plus Hugh Jackman's a pretty cool dude.  Take your drink outside in good weather and look out over the water to that great view of the Statue of Liberty.  Nice.  Btw, very friendly staff.

Customer service is on vacation! My wife and I stopped here this afternoon for a coffee after reading Yelp reviews. The latte coffee was average and the service was less than friendly. We each ordered a scone. Mine was dry but my wife's was so dry it just crumbled when she broke it in half. I took them back and complained that they were dry. The server stated "all our pastries are baked fresh every day. I can give you another." That was it - no apology. I said again that they can't have been cooked today and be that dry. She repeated her assertion. No offer if a refund. I left in disgust. There are better coffee houses in the area and pastry shops where the pastries are edible!

I'm addicted to the Flat White coffee drink...it's smooth & creamy!  The barristas have always been friendly and very willingly to help their customers.  I will incorporate a new routine to go every afternoon for the Flat White!

I had wanted to try this place for a long time and was excited to hear that it was in Eataly in NY. I really liked the coffee! My problem was with the lack of service. From the moment I ordered to the moment I got my coffee I was surprised as to how slow and lackluster this experience was! The person taking the order and the person making the drink were hard to hear because they barely looked at you when they spoke. They were grumpy and it also seemed like they didn't enjoy being at this place. This was an evening and they had one customer prior to me ordering. It was a very uncomfortable experience and I for one will never go back. I had even tipped them in advance! And, it took a while because they made my drink caffeinated even though I had asked for decaf!  :(

had to try the hot chocolate here since well why not? it was warm out (at least for us) the other night so we stopped in here on the way back to our hotel. the hot chocolate wasn't bad, it just seemed too bitter tasting for me.... I love a thick hot chocolate but maybe it would have been to just sip it instead of walking around drinking it? who knows but either way it wasn't my favorite. I liked Mariebelle way more (thick delicious hot cocoa)

Absolutely delicious coffees and other treats. Lavazza coffee is amazing. The hot chocolate is divine - it is thick creamy European style hot chocolate! It's tough to get a seat though in this busy little cafe.
the hot chocolate here looks tiny but there is a reason for it!  it's so thick and rich. literally "hot" "chocolate".  bon appetit!

Way overpriced and the man at the counter (not sure if owner/manager) was more interested in talking to his friend who was drinking a coffee at the other side of the counter than help me. He was distracted and careless and even forgot to give me the croissants I ordered. He took them out, put them on the side, made my detox coffee (which he couldn't even explain to me after I asked for clarification twice regarding what it was), charged me then just started making a coffee for someone else. I told him that he forgot my pastries and then he apologized but told me he forgot to charge me for them. It was over $20. Definitely not worth it.

The avocado toast is delicious! It was generously topped and I love the crunch of the sunflower seeds. I love lemon and the avocado had plenty of it. The salad it came with was so good as well. There is mint and cucumber water in the back of the store as well. The place is beautifully decorated and service was good. There are only 3 tables though.
My fave new spot!! Awesome coffee and pastries and food delicious!!! I live in the neighborhood finally a cool coffee spot!

I stumbled upon Le Reveli while taking a stroll thru upper east side with my girlfriend. We were starving and she noticed this boutique coffee shop. The staff was super friendly - I ordered a  pastrami panini which is to die for and she ordered a tuna melt. I finished my food so quickly I even got to take a bite of hers. Amazing all around. On the way out Soner (the owner) recommended we try the cheesecake. I took one taste and it did not last until an after dinner treat. You will not be let down and I will be back!!!
I keep coming back for their oat milk lattes. YUM! Also a plus: Coffee is conveniently located near the 72 street subway station.

The male server here who works mornings with the cross eyes is extremely rude and dismissive. Short and condescending in tone- if you are so unhappy, find a new job and let someone who actually knows how to work in customer service and treat people with respect have your job. Paying customers do not need or deserve to ever be treated poorly because you are miserable at your place of work. I hope a manager/ higher up sees this and deals with this child like employee appropriately

This place looked promising but it was a little disappointing. We ordered a skim cappuccino but it took ages to come out (making us think theyd forgotten the order). It seemed like they made coffees out of order because people behind us got theirs first. A few people around me were also following up on their order. The batistas also seem a little glum (as confirmed in other yelp reviews).  There is no real food selection so really it is just about the coffee. However the coffee wasnt special.  Also the music in the place was aggressive rap. For a morning coffee it is not very relaxing to come into a place and have to listen to that music.  Probably wont come again given there are lots of other coffee places to try.

Really cute coffee spot with a cozy minimal vintage feel. They have specialty lattes like the Vanilla Bourbon or Maple which tasted great at the beginning but got a little too sweet later.  They have a really solid cold brew though - smooth, rich with a slight thickness to it and not watery at all. It's just what I needed on a Sunday morning!  SIDE STORY: I saw their raspberry croissant and got super excited because I thought it was a hot cheeto dusted one LOL. It should definitely be a thing though (just sayin)
Great coffee. Good WiFi speed. Great ambiance. Good for groups and great for the remote worker looking for a comfy chair. They have a back room for the casual reader a small extra space

Came here to study but ended up people watching instead. The store is super bright inside since it's so white and it's nicely decorated. There are a couple tables by the windows and two high tables opposite the coffee bar. Not a lot of seating overall, but it was never packed.  I got an iced chai and it was your typical iced chai.  The baristas are friendly.  *free wifi *bathroom is in the back through the barber shop  I would come back to people watch.

Great local coffee shop. I discovered this while staying across the street at the Hotel Indigo. Loved the lattes and the matcha muffin was incredible! This place has great energy. It was calm and relaxing. Perfect for a morning cup of coffee. I loved it so much, I went both days I was in New York and preferred it over the full blown coffee bar my hotel had.
Without a doubt my favorite spot for coffee in the LES. Best staff ever and I love the atmosphere.

We got a hot choc and a raspberry & almond croissant on a rainy Saturday. The hot choc was below average, just didn't taste great and quite watery. The croissant looked really good and tasted just ok. It's a bit of a lackluster atmosphere in there, not sure I'd go back.

I have seen this cafe for many years as I pass by. The cafe is sleek and exuded fine quality cafe vibe.  As soon as I walk in today it felt like an unclean bodega down any block in nyc. I still wanted to try the coffee.  Got a small iced mocha. With tip it was around $7. Quite pricy compared to other good options.  The coffee has no body and lacks flavor. No taste of coffee beans being roasted nicely. I had to throw away the coffee because it was so bad!  They would be well served if they changed their coffee beans quickly.  Such a shame that for a great looking cafe it lacks good quality coffee.

I bought coffee and juice here. The coffee was good but the juice was spoiled, don't purchase here! I got the grapefruit juice, it looks like no one is checking or putting expiration dates on them-- I didn't realize until I drank a third of it since grapefruit juice is sour. After sitting on my desk for an hour I saw the white foam forming at the top - this is when I realized something was wrong I was sick for 2 days, a lot of stomach issues... Will never return, worst $5 I've ever spent PUT EXPIRATION STICKERS ON YOUR FRESH JUICES

I've had very mixed experiences at this place, which is frustrating. I've had GREAT lattes/cappucinos (thus the four star rating before) and very meh lattes. The last two times I asked for my lattes extra hot (because they tend to go cold within 2-3 minutes when I head out the door), and they have still been giving me lukewarm (barely warm), watered down drinks. Today's drink tasted completely watered down-- like the milk wasn't fresh, and I couldn't taste the espresso at all. I've asked for double shots of espresso before and am pretty sure I have never received the second shot. They also once messed up my drink and gave me a mocha instead of a latte.  For $4.50+ a latte, it's expensive for what can be undependable morning service?  That said, the pastries are fantastic! And the staff is always friendly.
I'll be back for more coffee, etc. Like the ambience and clean, comfy setting.

Same as the other Macchiato Espresso bar. The coffee here is delicious and so are the muffins. The service is friendly and the decor is very Euro Chic. I love the layout and wide open spaces. My new favorite coffee bar. I have been to 2 of these.

A friend who worked with me would often ask: has it been too long since we've been to the sexy European lunch place? She meant Macchiato Espresso Bar...  Apart from the eye candy of impeccably dressed men and women, the espresso drinks are very well made by an always friendly -- if not a little too flirty ;) -- staff.  I would recommend the avocado or the health salad. The grilled veggie sandwich is really good, too. I often eat half for lunch and save the other half. It's super moist so it reheats very well. As someone else mentioned, their chocolate chip cookies are to die for. Treat yourself!
Great sandwiches from the menu. I always stock up on coffee and buy a 5lb bag for home. Trust me, their coffee is amazing.

Its always been quite busy when I've come in, which I don't mind when I'm grabbing something to-go on my way to or coming from nearby Grand Central but if you are trying to meet someone for coffee, I wouldn't bed on finding seating. I always feel like the food must be pretty good here too because its packed and everyone is eating, but that could also just be the nature of midtown. I don't vibe with the atmosphere  in here, so I've never stuck around to try the food.  The music euro electronic ish.. which can be cool in the right setting. I can see how a lot of people dig this place, but it gets a little overwhelming for me to hang out here for more than a few minutes. I like to feel more relaxed and get a break from the hustle and bustle on my caffeine breaks. Its strange to feel calmer when you walk OUT the door into busy streets outside Grand Central haha.  Espresso is good and strong, but I prefer the lighter and sweeter flavor of the Cappuccino's at Joe's in GC.

I'm not sure if I just had a one off bad experience because based on the cappuccino I ordered I can't think of any redemptive qualities for Macchiato Espresso Bar.  Let's first review the technical details:  - Locally roasted coffee beans: No. They source from Fonte roasters in Seattle. - Baristas with proper training on pulling espresso & steaming milk: No. -  Quality Milk Brand: Elmhurst Dairy - Microfoam quality and Latte Art: No  The Cap I ordered looked much more like a latte than a cap in terms of size. What's up with people not understanding the difference between these two drinks? A cappuccino should not exceed 6 oz. The drink they served me was easily 8+ oz and even if I judged it as a Latte it was still not made properly. The milk lacked proper microfoam and there wasn't even an attempt at latte art. I couldn't even finish my drink and had to bail on it after a few sips. Just didn't taste right at all. For this I give them 1 star. Sorry!
Great coffee joint, they use a really rich chocolate for the mocha and the hot chocolate.  I found this place based on the reviews of other yelpers, and it didn't disappoint.

Although tiny..this is a great "real expresso" bar...it can make you a perfect coffee so strong it will wake the neighbours.. but I have always loved this place..it has a cute sophisticated charm .... check it out if you are in and around grand central...its just off lexington.
Excellent and fast service. Tasty and unique.

Indisputably the best coffee in midtown - nuf sed!  Ok - maybe I'll say a little more.  In the coffee wastelands of midtown  (littered with overcrowded Starbucks franchises and down at heal Dunkin Donuts dives) is  *angels sigh* -  Macchiato - an oasis of coffee bliss.  Cappuccinos that will make your toes curl and choc chip cookies - oh, those chocolate chip cookies - be still my beating heart!  I only wish it was closer to my office...

Five stars for their incredibly good coffee, lovely presentation, nice decor and great staff,  but one star off for the noise/crowd.  We did manage to find a seat but we were unfortunate to be seated next to a pair self-important women with piercing voices who felt that everyone around should count themselves lucky to hear their vapid utterances.  That cannot be blamed on the cafe, but maybe on the low ceilings. The quality of the coffee and the service totally made up for those voices.  Service was really friendly, professional and quick.  When I looked up to the register to see if I could catch the cashier's eye, she seemed to be anticipating my question and was friendly and quick with an answer.    If you read my other reviews, you will know that I have Battered NYC Consumer syndrome, a result of too much time spent around surly cashiers in places like Kinkos (shudder) and Whole Foods (ptooey).  I curl up and purr when I hear "please" and "thank you"...and then I start doling out the stars like a drunken sailor.  I give them out to Machchiato with pleasure.  p.s. boy watching wasn't too bad here, if you're into that.  9/17/08 update: a friend, who was alerted to the great coffee at Joe's, a few scant blocks from Macchiato, went into Macchiato carrying a coffee from Joe's (only went in because his friend wanted an egg sandwich). When they got to the counter the cashier asked my friend where he got his coffee.  He told them Joe's and they offered to replace it with a cup of their coffee.  Because they put him on the spot he decided to tell them the truth that he prefers Joe's coffee, but thanks anyway.

I will echo what everyone else has said- chocolate chip cookies to DIE for! I also got an iced latte which was good- strong coffee aroma and very tasty. A little pricey ($6 something for iced latte + cookie), but I'd definitely come here over Starbucks (and the price is comparable).

Everything is fresh and I'm pretty sure its organic because the sandwiches and the salads are top notch. The croissants, the muffins and cookies are baked on the spot and they keep 'em coming. The stronghold, as Israelis have proven time and time again is the coffee. If you're fortunate enough to work close to machiatto then you'll most likely give up Starbucks soon enough. The quality mixed with the knowledge over coffee makes the ingredients for a perfect cup of coffee every time.

i'll borrow lisa's words and agree that macchiato is, indeed, an oasis of coffee bliss.  met a friend here and i loved the vibe. tucked behind GCT, there was not a single tourist-looking group in the area. the coffee was strong, the sandwiches were fresh, and the cookies were to die for.

I've been working in the area over 3 years and continue to frequent this place. It's curious this style isn't more common or popular in the City - Euro, chic and minimalist (not to mention a good coffee). A refuge.

Either you like paying more than you should for food that is tasteless? Do you like smelling like a burnt diner after you leave the restaurant? Than this place is for you.  My friend and I ordered brunch items which were the breakfast sandwich and the hash brown bowl with smoked salmon. Both were completely disappointing. The salad which came with both plates was old and brown, and the hash brown were grey and soggy. Disgusting, and inedible.  We left reeking like the restaurant, which was filled with smoke from the food being cooked in the kitchen. That gross smell stayed with us all day, it's such a letdown.

Super cute place. I love the artwork on the espresso machine. Was intrigued by the honey lavender latte -- previously had some similar drinks that I really enjoyed -- was very surprised/pleased, as my initial reaction was "wow this tastes like grass" (not in a bad way). I assume this means they use real lavender. Or my taste buds are just WAY off. Either way, I really like it. It can be a bit slow to get your drink, and in the few times I've been there, I've never not been surrounded by selfie-takers.

Of all the picturesque coffee shops I've been to in NYC, Maman is my favorite! I came here on a Friday afternoon to enjoy a late breakfast. The Sloane earl grey tea was great and went perfectly with their raspberry rose tea cake. I wish I had the recipe for that raspberry rose tea cake because I would literally eat it all day.  I also ordered a slice of the carmelized onion quiche which was a generous portion and tasted great!  Overall, this is a really cute place to come with a gal pal or even alone. I will definitely return!

I love this place! It's perfect place to grab brunch or lunch with a friend. The aesthetic of the cafe is adorable and the food is delicious. I got the Annabel sandwich and a coffee and it exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend!!

It made me stomach sick!! I never write bad reviews but thanks to this place I spent my day between my bed and my bathroom feeling awful. The interior is lovely and I wanted to like this place. Me and my husband had breakfast here, we got cappuccinos, pastry basket and the banana waffle. That the only meal we had today because it made both of us sick for the entire day.
Great food, great service!!) Love the matcha almond drink and the quiche ester. Lovely ambience and cool AC on summer ;)
Alright hot chocolate but the service was terrible...took them almost 15-20 mins to give us water. The waiters are also inattentive and seems to choose who to serve...will not come back.

If you don't care about the cleanness of their products good for you! I know I won't go there again.  I was in a really good mood to pick up a box of chocolates from this place a few days ago for my bf since it also has been one of my favorites for holiday gifts (recommended by my boss who is French) but the people who worked there totally ruined it for me.  First of all, the lady who was helping me dropped the lid of the chocolate box to the ground but she picked it up like nothing had happened, I instantly felt really uncomfortable but was too shocked to voice my concerns. I normally wouldn't make a big deal out of it if the staff drop products by accident but that is part of the container to hold food, and when incidents like this happened in the past at other stores the staff threw away the box right away and picked up new ones.  Anyway, I eventually asked her to give me a new lid when she was about to close the box and she was like "okay...?" and gave me the face like I was overreacting. I apologized when she came back even when I really didn't have to and explained why I asked for a new lid, but she gave me this awkward silent treatment throughout the rest of the experience. Whoa! On top of over-priced chocolates now I have to put up with the attitudes? MarieBelle is too much for the good holiday vibes.  After I gave my bf the box of pretty chocolates I realized there is also a piece of thin layer of protector that they put on top of the chocolates before closing the lid, and I think she had dropped that as well when she dropped the lid "by accident"... I am now telling my bf to throw away those chocolates and I am buying something from other places that take hygiene seriously. I saw the lady who helped me just put the lid that she had picked up from the floor back to the tack and it has probably been purchased by someone who doesn't know. I also read one of the past reviews saying that they sold expired chocolates and when the costumer reached out they simply asked them to peel off the expiration date label... who knows if their other stuff is even safe to eat.  I will never ever buy their gross chocolates again.
Very nice place for great hot chocolate drinks in Soho, New York. There are many style of hot chocolate and very intensive. The place look very classy and also has beautiful ganache cake.

This place is pure magic. Once you get in you feel in a parallel world of fairy tales and factory of chocolate. The music and the settings are just on point. The guy who runs the bar then... I mean: where does he come from? He is just perfection! His attitude, accent, courteous spirit! Everything is just a perfect experience since you get in till you leave the place. Well, the desserts are fantastic too! Lol

The white hot chocolate is maybe the most delicious hot chocolate I've ever had. The seating area is hidden behind the chocolate shop and is beautiful and grand looking with chandeliers and dainty little tables. The hot chocolate is super tiny for $5 - finished in 5-6 sips, but is creamy and delicious. My friend ordered a different flavor and the waiter brought me a little cup to sample hers, and same for her. One star down for the price and the size.
This place has the best, best white hot chocolate. So amazing. It's what my dreams are made of.

Best hot chocolate I've had in NYC (5 stars) and I drink a lot of hot chocolate. Also, the priciest hot chocolate I've had in NYC (so deducting 1 star). The hot chocolate comes in small ($5) and large ($7), with the small being the equivalent of a shot and a large the equivalent of a small at a cafe elsewhere. I've only ordered the White Hot Chocolate with Tahitian vanilla because it is amazingly good, but they also have numerous other milk, white, and dark options. The hot chocolate is simply decadent and tastes high quality, but is not too rich that you can't enjoy it. The cafe in the back is super cute and a great place to enjoy your fancy hot chocolate.  Overall, a must try for chocolate lovers.

Much better experience during our 2nd time. The server remembered us and was very accommodating and apologetic for our past experience. Food is still pricey but worth it! Love the salmon crepe and Aztec ice!  Definitely recommended coming here if you're in the area!

I went there yesterday afternoon and had a dinner with a friend of mine at the coffee bar in the back of the store. It was superb! Johnny, our waiter, took very good care of us, the food was very good and we were also introduced to the pastry Chef, a tiny, pretty and adorable woman, that was also very pleasent.  After such great time, we decided to shop for some treats at the front store, and for our surprise, we had a very very bad time. The sales person - INBAR her name, if I am not wrong - was very rude trying to rush us, saying that "they were already closed and that she had more things to do". Just horrible. We were buying more than a hundred dollars in chocolates and we were being treated like SH%#.  At the same time, she said to a guy that was waiting for her if he could "help her out with the vacuum, so she could get THE HELL OUT OF THERE SOON."  It has been a very long time since I last saw such horrible sales person. I really don't know what she is doing there. She cannot work as a front person, she hates her job and she probably hates people in general.  I have been working with customer service for a long time and I know how hard it can be sometimes, but I would never, ever, treat someone like that. And if someone under my management have this kind of attitude, he or she will be fired RIGHT AWAY.  As a business owner myself, I recommend to MarieBelle Shop to get rid of this person that is just ruining their business and hire more people like the waiter Johnny and the sweet pastry Chef.

I had limited time in NYC yesterday and the goal was good food, then good chocolate, then a good movie. MarieBelle was the "good chocolate" portion of the whirlwind trip. You walk in to an adorable bit of "fancy" and are in the shop. The cacao bar is in the back of the store, so we moseyed on back and were seated pretty quickly. My gods was it good! I had the Iced Hazelnut chocolate and Blueberry Mousse cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. My friend had the Iced Aztec chocolate with their Louvre cake. We nibbled/sipped from each. As the gentleman behind the cacao bar made chocolate drinks for patrons, he'd bring thimbles of excess to other guests to try. So, on top of what we ordered, we also had a taste of the spicy hot chocolate.  So, here we go:  Spicy hot chocolate: Smooth with a little hint of a kick. Not enough to make anyone be scared of the heat, but enough to notice it. I'll absolutely get this sometime, and I am NOT one to order hot drinks. Iced Aztec chocolate: Wonderful and somewhat sweet. Classic flavor, just cold. The perfect iced "hot" chocolate. Iced Hazelnut chocolate: Delissssshhhhh. I'm also biased for hazelnut. But, it wasn't overpowering like hazelnut syrups can sometimes be. It was great cold. Louvre cake and Blueberry Mousse: Both were perfect. I don't know where their pastries are delivered from, but they were both quite tasty.  Tl;dr: Must Go Back.

Best ever iced drinks! Iced cardamom chocolate was my pick for refreshment on a hot day! Wow, was that good!  They also had fruit smoothies available, and ice cream. I knew they were the best for hot chocolate--did not know they would be so good for the summertime, too. AC in the cafe worked wonders, too. And the guys who worked there couldn't have been nicer.

If you come for the hot chocolate (why wouldn't you?!), just get the small.    I know the worker will say, incredulously, "it's so small, like the size of an espresso!" and make you feel bad / want to size up.  But the chocolate is SO RICH* and you won't be able to finish the large cup.  Stick to your guns and get the small!  Or, you can ignore me, get the large anyway, and then take the rest to go in a tiny little cup and enjoy it later.  :)  *this is a good thing.  trust me.

Stumbled on this place by surprise, but it was a great experience. This place is cozy and elegant. We ordered the Aztec hot chocolate and Americano, and a small matcha desert that i can't remember the name of. The hot chocolate was unlike any other I've had. Rich and chocolatey with hints of coffee. The small room was intimate and fun. The decoration was beautiful, the chandeliers were the highlight of the room. Service was decent. Furthermore, a great place and I would definitely come back.

We stopped here for some coffee and late light lunch after some Soho shopping. What a pleasant surprise! We were offered samples of hot chocolate and chilled spicy chocolate. So yummy! Personal and friendly service. Very enjoyable.

SUCH a pretty store :) From the moment you step in, it's as if you were in a cafe in Paris! The chocolates are VERY expensive. We tried the banana hot chocolate as an after lunch treat. SO GOOD!!! They use real milk and banana pulp. A great combination and very very rich ! A small sized hot chocolate is the perfect size.  They do offer free hot chocolate shots which is nice. Tried their Aztec hot chocolate. Was delish too :)

This SoHo gourmet chocolatier was decorated like a cute French boutique. I liked the shop a lot, and the chocolate and  gelato were delicious and refined. The flavors were natural and organic, like someone had used a mortar and pestel to craft the treats by hand. I will have to say most things seemed too expensive, regardless of SoHo or gourmet standards... how much can you really charge for a bar of chocolate?  I got a small dark chocolate bar for $6 and a single scoop of hazelnut gelato for $3 or $4. Both were delicious.

I sometimes want to take a quick walking break in the afternoon, and then I come here. The place is gorgeous -- it looks like it should be a salon somewhere in Paris! Also, it's filled with chocolate :) They have tons of pralines, truffles, bars, desserts, gelato... yummy!  My friend and I like to get the small hot chocolate ($5). It's a small cup and seems expensive, but it's very rich, so just the right amount.  Make sure to ask about ingredients in case you have any food allergies, as I've not seen the ingredients written down anywhere.

(Part Three of the NYC Food Crawl - Hot Chocolate Crawl; 1/15/12)  I have been a fan of the Mariebelle boxes for years now. I've enjoyed the rich chocolate in the comfort of my own kitchen. When I came across this storefront during the hot cocoa crawl, I just about jumped with joy!  Then...reality hit me.  For every stop, one person of the team "bought rounds" for the rest of the team. That amounted to three medium-sized cocoas and six cups for everyone. Before arriving, I said I'd buy the rounds at Mariebelle. I immediately regretted that decision upon seeing the 10 oz.
