This is our "go to" place...absolutely adorable and quaint with an eclectic flare and warm vibe! Diagnosed with Breast Cancer in Aug. '12, Java Girl has always made the trip into the City a little sweeter...our highlight if you will! I haven't been back since April, but when I returned yesterday, Jerry remembered me and immediately asked how I was doing.  Now he's a true gem that cares about his customers! Highly recommend the almond croissant, apple turnover, yogurt w/ granola, coffee (oh my!)...heck! It's all delicious...go today!!! Thank You Java Girl!
Excellent coffee!  I regret not buying beans when I stopped by this morning before returning to Chicago.  Tasty baked goods.  Very efficient and kind staff.

For a time, this place had gotten marginally better as far as wait times. Today, not only did the barista (for management: African-American woman with purple hair) not only work at an absolutely glacial pace but was incredibly rude in her ineptitude. Glacial pace: took 10 full minutes to get a drink. In front of me was one cappuccino and one latte. (I also ordered a cappuccino.) Rude: when I finally picked up my drink, I expected her to apologize for the wait. When she didn't, and I didn't explicitly thank her she VERY sarcastically remarked "You're welcome" with an eye roll. Definitely will not bother going in again when this woman is working. Still feel the location at 73/Amsterdam is far better.
Three strikes You're out! Rude service Twice  the price as other local spots Muddy thick acidic coffee

Yesterday morning I stopped in for the first time. Colleagues of mine raved about this place, so I figured that I'd give it a shot. Cute place, no waiting, but crowded and I couldn't find a seat. I ordered a cappuccino and proceeded to wait on the side. When I saw the barista making one to stay, I asked if I could get it to go instead. He very rudely raised his voice and annoyingly stated "This isn't yours" and walked away. I was taken aback. When I did receive my cappuccino, I had two sips and then threw it out. It was terrible for it tasted bitter and burnt. I wouldn't waste my time or money to go here again. It's too bad because I really wanted to like this place.
Stopped by and ordered a few lattes on the way to Central Park. This was our favorite coffee place while visiting NY!

Really great cold brew here, strong and great depth of flavor. There's a small seating area, it's definitely more manageable in the summer time as they have outdoor seating but it's also a popular place to hang out on Columbus Ave. It's not necessarily the cleanest location of this NYC coffee chain and it feels like one of their busier ones (based on the size). I usually just grab and go here.

I walk in at 630am on May 9, the rudest employee tells me they're closed. I ask when they open she says, "Could you step out please?" I obliged but not before asking why she'd unlock the door to a closed shop. There's a reason I get my coffee every day at the Starbucks on 86 and Columbus. Who wants to walk down 3 blocks for that rudeness?
My Favorite morning ritual forget Starbuck this is the best coffee around !!! + Staff is Awesome
Sugar free vanilla latte extra hot. I get this every time, and its just perfect.

The best.   Come here every time in Ny.  Tall guy Barista (don't know his name) who made my cappuccino this morning crushed it, as he always does.  The microform is so fine it's like silk.  It's what cappuccino is supposed to be like but never is -- except here.  Also much better vibe than coffee shops in tourist areas -- here it's mostly locals, lots of regulars.  Highly recommended.

My favorite cup o joe in manhattan was at Joe's. I went to a few of their locations and was impressed by their quality and consistency. They lattes and coffee are perfect. I would say better than blue bottle and rivaling stumptown.  Their locations are all very tiny with enough space to comfortably seat 10 ppl. They have no wifi. And they sell doughnut plant donuts. The perfect place to satiate a quick caffeine craving. I highly suggest Joe if you're in the manhattan area!
Cute little coffee place, yummy chocolate banana muffin. Seating for about 15 inside and has wifi. If you need some Joe or a quick pastry in the area, definitely a solid option to keep in mind!

Great coffee. Terrible service. Came here the last two days and ordered an almond milk cappuccino. Yesterday they gave me a cortado and today they gave me a latte. The cashier also called the group behind me annoying while taking my order. Get it straight and be kind!
My wife has been getting on me about rating too low for places that are decent. I got the house blend. It was drinkable. Joe Coffee, you are the benefactor of my wife's criticism. 4 stars.

A perfectly executed cappuccino & a jelly doughnut.  I'm very happy. The service here is friendly & relaxed. I really enjoyed my window seat where I was able to charge my phone & watch the world pass by.
Excellent Cortardo. Possibly the best coffee we have had so far in the USA. Meets South African standards, friendly staff and decent pricing. Really enjoyable vine
Best cappuccino I've had in the city, closest to the ones I've had in Italy. Excellent latte as well - delicious even when made with almond milk, unlike at other coffee joints. Friendly staff.

This place had a great atmosphere and a great cup of coffee. It's a pretty tight squeeze so finding a seat is a toss-up, and if you do, it's pretty cramped. This definitely isn't the kind of place to hunker down with your laptop for a few hours, but it's ideal for a quick pick-me-up or meeting a friend. Awesome place in an awesome area! Highly recommended!

I stopped in for a mid-afternoon coffee and to do some computer work.  I was unfamiliar with the coffee options in the area, so I went to Yelp. Kahve was close, with good reviews/ratings. The interior is pleasant. The drip coffee was mediocre, at best. Counter service was distracted. The internet did not work for me.
Every time I go here the staff makes me feel like a nuisance. Sorry for taking your time today with my coffee order!! They make it painfully obvious they're better than you. Who does the hiring?

I came here to have a nice brunch with my friends because the reviews praised the food. Well I can't speak for the rest of the food but I had the traditional avocado toast with arugula and the iced vanilla mint latte. The avocado toast was terrible. I think it was the lemon juice (maybe vinegar) but it was sooo sour. And it smelled strange. I tried a couple bites but I couldn't stomach it. The latte was alright but not worth the hype. It was a little too bitter and I couldn't taste the mint or vanilla- just tasted like a plain latte. For a total of $16 it was definitely not worth it. And there's not much seating either. The only reason that I gave 2 stars is because of the presentation. If only it tasted as good as it looked.

One of my favorite coffee joints in manhattan. It's a tiny/narrow coffee spot in Hell's Kitchen. I love the bright pink which makes it super easy to spot from the curb side. I am a big fan of matcha and I find it really difficult to find this in the city without sugar. Kahve is one of the few spots that actually serves matcha correctly. I usually order that either in latte form or iced (in the summer). They do a great job. I also had a lemonade from them in the summer (basil) and they actually blend pieces of basil into the drink and it's so refreshing and delicious! I would recommend that for the summer months. The cookies are also very good, chocolate chip or oatmeal raisin, both delicious. The atmosphere is extremely welcoming inside, a great little place to read a book or catch up on some work. If you're passing by, be sure to stop in for a matcha or coffee for sure!

My favorite coffee place in New York.  Such a refreshing change to your typical Starbucks coffee shop.   Beautiful interior with great seating. I hade the Cuban coffee which was amazing.  Probably one of the best coffees I have ever had.  Also had the breakfast avocado toast which was also perfect.  Finished it all off with a refreshing glass of Turkish ros̩. yummm!!  Keep it up guys can't wait to come back!

This Kahve has more seating than the 9th Ave location. Productive place to get your work done, although not many outlets and it is all high table top seating. Also, the drinks are a little pricier and it is always freezing inside.
I've been coming here for a few months and the service has been mixed. Today I encountered a staff member who was so petty and rude I walked out and won't go back.
Cute little spot wit great coffee and delicious avocado toast. The service is friendly and the prices are fair. I'm a fan and want to come back to try their hot chocolate with wine drink! :)

Based on the reviews I had high expectations. When on the road I always look for and appreciate the local coffee scene. Not much here, their coffee is rather poor. Shocking for a place that has Blue Bottle, Joe and Jolly Goat just around the corner.

Review is just for the black sesame oat milk latte. Verdict: Latte had a grainy thick unpleasant texture due to black sesame. I could not finish the the latte due to the texture. Maybe worth a try if you really like black sesame, but I was not a fan.

Small cozy spot! So far I've only tried their americano and sesame latte, which were both amazing. It was very quiet when we went there, and the staffs were very nice. Prices were reasonable, and I'll come back to try all their latte :)
Modest little place. Free wifi, no password just sign up. The iced chai latte was the best I've had in a while. Stop in to work, take a break from walking and charge devices.

Iced Chai Tea: Comprised of 80% whole milk, 19.99% ice, and 0.01% Chai concentrate flavoring from a box that looks like the concentrate sold at CostCo (plus a sprinkle of cinnamon on top).  Price $5.41.  Definitely not brewed here. Total rip-off, unless your are looking for a glass of overpriced milk with ice.  It was not Chai Tea. Would be one star but nice staff and decent music.  Uncomfortable seating.

Great coffee and great staff. I have been getting my daily morning cup of coffee here for the last 3 months or so and can't seem to find any better alternatives !! They also have some unique flavors like Kyoto rose cold brew ! Highly recommend it overall !!

Great coffee and even better staff. They truly know their coffee. The owner apparently goes around to various conventions and tastes all the coffees before purchasing them. It this attention to detail that you can taste in their coffee, making it completely worth the trip to Prologue. But if coffee isn't your thing, their hot chocolate is more than amazing and definitely worth a try

Their coffee and some of food is ok however one particular employee an asian lady that wears a hat most of the time, it soo unpleasant I decided to bring my business to somewhere else. It is sad we purchased regularly from here but her nasty attitude is something I don't want to see every day!

Came around 12 on a Friday, lots of seating! Got the cortado, I thought it hit the spot-- im not a big coffee person and wanted to try something other than drip coffee and this worked. My friend liked the cold brew, and came back again shortly afterwards. A great place to study and find peace. Bathroom is also clean.

I had the cold brew coffee, which was brewed overnight. It's kept in the fridge in a plastic container. They use JOE coffee beans. Coffee was good but not great. Great decor and feels very zen. Clean shop, friendly staff, served with a smzile!
Great cafe! Super friendly and great space. The ambiance is nice and the drinks are A+

I've always liked this place in spite of the $30 glasses of bad wine.  It used to be dark and sexy, the service was classy and attentive.  The last couple of times we've come here, it's cold, careless and sad.  It feels as though it's under new management and the clientele has morphed into loud, tacky tourists.  We arrived both times and there was nowhere to sit.  The last time we were there a couple of weeks ago, we ended up sitting on the far end near the outside door.  It took nearly ten minutes for a server to greet us and when she did, she was short with us and when we tried to order food with our drinks she looked annoyed and let us know it would be 15 minutes before food would arrive.  Uh....why?  She also told us she would be leaving and another server would take over our order.  A better table popped up near the other side of the bar, so we moved there.  We let the new server know and 15 minutes passed.  In desperation, my husband walked to the bar to check on our drinks as our server was nowhere to be found.  Mind you...the original server was STILL there.  She admonished my husband for not waiting for her to arrive with the drinks.  At that point, we kind of gave up.  Her attitude was terrible.  The manager arrived and apologized and said she would take the drinks off of our bill. The one bright light was that the drinks were actually pretty good (not wine).  Alas the bill arrived and the drinks were still on the check.  They had removed the much less expensive food items.  Nice.  Not sure I'll go back.

This cafe acts as a passage way between the Avenues. It isn't a good workplace as people are constantly rushing through. Many businessmen having meetings as well.  He hostess and bartender were not very friendly, almost sarcastic and pretentious. The menu is limited and the coffee is not very good.  People are drawn here due to the pictures of the high ceilings, etc, however, in person you will be disappointed.

It's an adorable room, but the prices are insane, even for New York, and it's full of hotel traffic.  You know, I even get the $20 cocktails and glasses of wine, but $30 for three cups of tea? I doubt they're ashamed to charge me that, but I'm definitely ashamed to have paid it.

Prior to attending a matinee at City Center, I decided to treat myself. Knowing this place's reputation for both good cocktails and high end espresso, figured I'd get a proper, traditional Irish Coffee served in a nice tall glass with a layer of heavy cream on top. To my great disappointment, I was served an oversized regular (and mediocre for that matter) cup of coffee with no cream, and a cordial of whiskey/Bailey's on the side. Didn't taste right at all, and was certainly not the experience anyone is looking for when ordering this drink. I'd keep my lips tight regarding this matter if not for the fact that, not including tip, the charge for this cheaply executed and disappointing drink came out to a ridiculous $22 and change. When I brought this matter up with the staff, who were thoroughly gracious, they informed me that they are aware of this issue but that management has instructed them to serve this drink this way and that they will not listen to them. Therefore, I'm hoping that management will listen to me here when I say you shouldn't assume that you know better than what the public wants. Would give one star if not for the fact I don't want the workers to receive much in the way of flack. You can't fault folks for doing what they've been told. However, they have been told wrong, and until you start serving proper drinks that are in line with atmosphere you market, and steep prices you charge, I will not be returning and will urge others to stay away.
Pretty nice place and quiet enough for a conversation.  But way too expensive. 22+ tip for a Manhattan....

Great location, atmosphere, drinks. Lousy service. Stopped by for a great Manhattan Saturday afternoon. Only a few people there, but the waiter acted as if he had better things to do than even look in my direction. Spent most of his time chatting with baristas/bartenders.  Finally condescended to deliver my check, but after about 15 minutes of trying to get his attention, gave up and walked it to the bar myself. Asked waiter for glass of water, and all he could say was "ok," like he was doing me a huge favor. I don't expect or like obsequiousness, but for the price ($17/manhattan) and location, I expect better than being blatantly ignored.

After years of passing through the Knave I did not know until the NYTs article entitled "Unwelcome Mat Is Out at Some of New York's Privately Owned Public Spaces" dated Sept. 7, 2015 that the Knave is apparently part of a "privately owned PUBLIC SPACE."    "Le" Parker Meridien sure does a good job of not advertising that fact to the public. See the post before mine where the reviewer says  "the Knave is located in a swanky hotel" ? No, it is not. It's located in a public space. The swanky hotel's lobby is located in a public space. Get it.  PS, It means you don't have to buy food at the Knave to sit there in case that wasn't clear.

This place is pretty decent. I've been coming here for a few months with friends to grab coffee and catch up.  The atmosphere here is delightful, the staff is nice nothing extraordinary about them. It can get pretty crowded here depending on when and what time you go, and obviously the staff will seem less interested, and perhaps even rude in giving you an above average service when they are overwhelmed with mass amounts of people. It's New York people are are rude... You're probably rude too so get used to it.  The prices for drinks are high but again it's New York, and you should already be mentally prepared to splurge on drinks when you're going out.  The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is because I've been to other places I like more.
Nice little lounge in between 56 and 57th. Delicious cappuccino and biscuit, lovely, engaging staff. I stood at the bar and had a great time.

My present condition has led me to keep coming back to Knave as a coffeeshop and nothing more.  However I have to mention, that their coffees are top notch. They brew a counter culture blend, and the whole range of espresso based drinks are simply delightful, topped with the simplest of latte arts. What truly won my heart over though, was the hot chocolate - it is served as in no other place. A generous cup filled up to the one-third mark with a rich chocolate fudgey truffley sauce, into which you pour warm and generously foamed milk, just as much as you desire.  The service can sometimes be a bit slow, but it only makes me spend more time at this lovely lounge, and that in general makes me happier about life. The tall ceilings are beautifully painted. The large mirrors on either side are shyly covered with velvet drapes. The chandeliers complete the old world charm they're going for. And they're always playing either a lovely jazz piece, or a carribbean tune. I wonder who created that mix.  It just makes me regret each time I used this section of the hotel as a mere trespasser crossing over to 56th street. This is right in my hood and I find myself here very often now, sipping on some of that truly delicious hot chocolate.  (P.S. In fact at some point we were coming here so often the servers thought we were staying at the hotel!)
I reserve $6 latte's for special occasion.. It's a big splurge   Well having one at Knave made it worth every penny.   It felt rich and heavenly !!

It's inside one of what I consider New York's iconic hotels in an iconic part of the city. Due to it's proximity to Carnegie Hall and upscale stores, you will always find a respectful and quiet crowd here.  Thus it's perfect for a cozy conversation with your significant other.  If you are in a group, you can always try to squeeze into a booth at the Burger Joint nearby.  I just wanted the tea (they had Earl Grey, English Breakfast, and Peppermint when I went) and they served it up in an a manner that I hadn't seen before.  The tea leaves are rough cut in a pitcher and you put a sieve over  your drinking cup to catch the leaves.  The smaller ones inexplicably fall through which you try like hell to avoid swallowing, but the unique setup (at least for me) was charming.  I also had the chicken pesto sandwich which was small, but edible.  I would suggest you skip any of the panini options when decent burgers and fries are only a few yards away.  The reason this is a 4 star review however, is the decor and the furniture they provide for  you to sit in.  The benches and chairs are very plush and comfortable.  If it wasn't for all the decorum I would have lay down on my spacious couch to start the head shrinking process.

Let me put this place in perspective for readers, it is a hotel bar.  In the realm of a hotel bar it is well superior, almost magical.  The prices are high, yes folks, because - guess what - in a hotel everything is overpriced - welcome to hotel pricing in NYC.    The cappuccino was great, and the ambiance is cosy and VERY romantic.
This is a thoroughfare - people taking a short cut from 57th to 56th. Beer wasn't chilled and was half-way flat. Service was non existent. Crowd was a weird mix but none interesting.

Very cool use of a space that looks like the narrow hallway of a monument in DC, but has incredible paintings, chandeliers, fancy red squishy sofas, candles everywhere. I, for one, love creative spaces -- like this lushly decorated hallway that also serves as an alleyway for folks passing through the building, including my husband and my Vibram-clad feet after a run through nearby Central Park.  So the $6 mocha mentioned in the review was delicious, used a better-than-normal type of chocolate, and had impeccably executed latte art.  The 5th star is missing because sitting in a major subway-like thoroughfare in a place that's supposed to be fancy / cozy just undoes the effect for me, even if Bach's six suites for cello are playing in the background. And you heard about the $6 mocha, so I won't reiterate.

Fun..swanky. ..sexy.  A quiet place to enjoy a good cocktail or a cup of tea.   With comfortable seating and intimate surroundings,  enjoy good conversation with friends and unwind in a tranquil atmosphere.

I think the decor is gorgeous and the customer service was great.  The server even gave me free snacks to munch on. I love the fried olives that came with dish of nuts. Loverboy and I both had the Knave Martini which is pretty much a chocolate/mocha martini. (yelp.com/biz_photos/4TPN?).  Our server was very nice and attentive and she even went the extra mile and asked us if it was ok if she told the bartender to add Godiva Liqueur to our martinis because she found it more delicious if it was made that way (at not extra charge!). I also liked that the seats were comfortable and it was nice to just sit, relax and people watch with my loverboy. The had the heater blasting since it was snowing/raining outside and that made us even more comfortable. Their drinks are pretty expensive (and standard for any hotel bar establishment) but they were so delicious so I didn't mind. I would definitely come back here on my next visit to NYC.

I usually stay at Le Parker Meridian when I visit NYC. Krave has great drinks. I usually don't care much for cosmos but, they use fresh juice and drinks are great!  Expensive but you only need one or 2 drinks  Too bad they don't let you bring your burger over from just next door.

I think this is a nice place to have a little break during a day, high ceiling, nice decoration.   There are not many choices on the menu.  it is not a huge place but there are comfortable sofas.  Coffee was ok.  I think it is a great place to have chat with friends or business meeting.  It was crowded when I came here once around 6pm!

really neat bar attached to the Parker Meridien - the space is massive and the environs are tr̬s sacr̩. The pew-style seating was really neat. and loved the gothic chandeliers.  didn't so much love the prices. $12 for a draft beer. but the drafts all come in unique-to-the-brew glasses. so you've got that going for you.  oh, and they also serve salted nuts.

feeling indulgent? love wine? this is your place.  there's nothing more proper than knave on a dark, cold january new york weeknight.  though a little narrow, the space is intimate and chic. you aren't just meeting up with your friends for a glass (or three) of montepulciano wine. you're immersed in the energy of everyone else meeting up with their friends.  the waitstaff is attentive but not pushy, and the drink selection is varied. it's cozy, it's sassy, and their breaded olives to snack on are INCREDIBLE. finally, knave is definitely a place good for getting together with friends or to meet someone for a date. i appreciate versatility.

This place is whatevs. I don't think the mocha is great but I did really enjoy the lemon shortbread cookie it came with. The croissant was less buttery/greasy than most places, so kudos! The service was pretty bad. The waitress gave attitude to some poor japanese tourists who were also staying at the hotel. Are you kidding me? The service industry thrives on the $ tourists shell out. Ungrateful!
I just had a blissful afternoon tea with my mom here. The place is lovely! If you are in the area and need a quick stop, pick Knave.

I was drawn by the rave reviews and also the claim that they have the 'best sandwiches' in NYC. Sadly, neither the reviews nor that claim lived up to my expectations.  I ordered a flat white and the egg, cheese, and ham sandwich. The bread was only half toasted, so the other half was cold. The scrambled eggs in the sandwich were sad and soggy...my sandwich literally dripped the entire time I was eating it. The only redeeming part about the sandwich was the cheese. It was nice and sharp and added great flavor. Otherwise the sandwich was a disappointment overall.  The flat white was also quite disappointing - it had way more foam than would be expected, and it tasted watered down. I try not to throw away expensive espresso drinks, but this was one that I could not finish.

Location: Lena is very big profile , neighborhood friendly, good looking coffee place. But to me, it's just one unworthy visit .. FYI: The place is small, and they don't have wifi.  Food: I had their cold brew  ugh... ugh.. ugh.. i ordered large and they barely fill it up to the top...  lol... this is manhattan. a city never sleep

Such a wonderful experience. We he owner is super great and the Basque sandwich was fresh, delicious and the baguette was perfect. Great coffee too!!!! Perfect little afternoon chill place for coffee and also for later  because they have great beer and wine selections
Staff was very friendly (and French). I got a jambon beurre which was nice, and reminded me of France. No nonsense but tasty!

Needed a late afternoon caffeine fix and stumbled across Lena as I was strolling the neighborhood for a place. This is a nice small spot with a nice decor. The chai latte was on point. Staff was also very friendly. We came by when they were about to close but never did they rush us or turn us away. A great place to visit if you're looking for a small, quiet, place to just unwind or even catch up with a friend.

A cup of tranquil peace... I was so cranky it was Monday and just worked 24 hrs extra this past weekend... I took a sip of my almond latte...& literally felt happier !!! Had a great Monday...  Oh love the Gluten free Blueberry muffins !!!!

Oh no! I have to give a bad review even though the girl was so nice. I don't even think it's her fault, really... I was so excited to get an almond milk latte that I ordered a large one. It was TERRIBLE! I had to throw it away. I think it must be the brand of almond milk? It was watery, bitter, no almond flavor... Please change your almond milk! :( the cookie was nice though...
Best coffee in New York. Very friendly staff. Perfect way to start every weekday morning

Ohhhhh myy ohhhh myyy..I walked into this little coffee shop for a cup of joe and I got a cup of heaven lol. I got an iced Americano and I heard someone order a macaron so despite the macarons not looking as colorful and shiny as I'm used to, I went for it. I bit into it and it was perfection soft and chewy centered and just delicious. I had to get another one before leaving. I can't wait to take my macaroon loving friend here. Definitely will come back.

But the milk/creamer isn't organic and when I asked the barista said "haha no, not organic, just good ol' whatever the hell this is" yikes. I guess if you wanna spend $6 for nonorganic latte, go for it it. I ended up ordering the matcha (learning about the milk situation after) and it was decent. Wouldn't go back though

I think the only hype of this place is because of its owner.  Yeah, but speaking of coffee bean quality, their roasted coffee is pretty sour and light. If that's what you like, go for it. But this is definitely not what I want.  Location: it is close to the brookfield hall, where I have not pay enough attention to. I got lost everytime I was at Tribeca, this time, I did it again.  The place is pretty lonely on a weekend because the surrouding stores are all closed.  I had ice americano. Light, soury Not what I want.  AKA BAD.  Service: nice.  overall: 2.5 star..

I really wanted to love this place... the owners need to know that things are not good. The barista was disinterested at best. The closest entry door was locked and he made no attempt to motion us to the far end of the building, which was the only open door. When we ordered he seemed bothered that we found our way in. The latte my wife ordered could Not be made because they were out of one of the main ingredients. The flat white I ordered was quite good. But as we sat and had our drinks there were no less than 20 potential customers who tried to enter through the locked door, that all would have left if WE had not directed them to the only open door (at the far end of the building)! Mr. Jackman needs to pay closer attention to what goes on here... please.
Conveniently located near the WTC. Good selection and high quality.    Definitely worth stopping in for your morning joe fix.
Wonderful coffee, amazing Donuts, great service, all while benefiting a good cause! Also super convenient for commutes to & from the WFC ferry!
interesting location and nice seating arrangement overlooking the water. flat white is ok. carries paleo goods and generic snacks side by side

The clean minimalist space seems slightly out of place at NYMEX, but the character and caffeine fit. On a hectic morning, the last thing I want is a generic cup of coffee - a velvety and delicately foamed flat white from Laughing Man is a much better way to start the day. Throw in a doughnut, and it's even better.

First of all, best latte I've ever had.  Period.  The scenery is unbeatable and the espresso machine looks like a spaceship!  I also had a long chat with the barista/manager about the craft of coffee and it was truly eye-opening. This coffee easily beats Starbucks and that coffee lunch truck outside the building.  Amazing drinks, amazing view, can't wait to come back here to satiate my need for craft brewed beverages!    P.S.  Hibiscus Donut.  Do it.

Outstanding flat whites, and just an all-around nice place to stop in.  The barista seemed like a great guy, introduced himself, and I loved our brief chat.  And they are extremely proud of their coffee, as they should be.  Loved this coffee joint, as well as its beautiful view.

Other reviewers suggested ordering a flat white and so I did. Easy order - nothing about skinny, double shots, tall or grande. Just a fast and tasty cup of coffee. Staff is pleasant and hardworking. No line at 7:30 am and lots of empty tables. Lovely daffodils in the park nearby and a pretty decent view of the Statue of Liberty if you walk a little bit. Will visit again next time I am in NY.

This is one of my favorite spots to go when I want to see a movie in Battery Park. The flat white is good, the whole bean Mocha Java Tamandor a tight close second to my favorite Illy. They serve a chocolate almond croissant that is so good I have to restrain myself from buying 2, that's if there are any left. The Mercantile Exchange place has seating, & an awesome view of the water @ the NY Water Taxi. Great to watch the boats or sit & view a nice rain storm! Tranquil. Not always air conditioned. Not their fault it's a shared space.

Love, love, love this place!  A COFFEE SPOT FOR ADULTS in Battery Park City!  Yes! Wonderful drinks. Tasty treats! Not soiled by sloppy parents or unwatched children! Sweet, wonderful baristas! Let Le Pain Quotidien and Kaffe 1668 take the suburban "stroller" crowd! This is the place for real New Yorkers that want to have ADULT conversation, great drinks, and fine service!  Their profit goes to charity, too!

My drink was fine. Service was unpleasant. They call out the names of your drinks, not your name or order number, and if you miss the call or aren't sure, bad luck, the person who called it out is gone. Ask if your drink came up yet and you get attitude. Not many seats and they aren't comfortable. Oh, and the doors will open frequently and blast you with cold air. I won't be back.

So uh...was I one of those people who thought that $4 would get me a drink..? Like at least a 12oz coffee? Maybe I was still in my California mindset when I ordered what i did but I was a little shocked that I didn't know it was an espresso. Well I'm more of a tea lover than a coffee lover anyways. However, the espresso was very rich and one of the better espresso's I've had. Also, the people working at the registers were also friendly.

I stopped here once for the coffee.  Although hot and fresh, it was as insipid as a cup of black tea.  I drank a fourth of it and looked for a person on the sidewalk to hand it to.  I couldn't find anyone as I marched up Fifth Avenue so I ended up throwing most of it in the trash.  I stopped somewhere much better to erase the disappointment and to move on with the day.
Macchiato at $2.25, Starbucks prices, but much better quality.

I stopped in here for a drink to go and ordered the specialty rose oat latte advertised out front. The sign didn't have a price on it but I assumed the drink would be in the regular NYC latte range ($4-$5) plus maybe a dollar or two for the oat milk. It turned out to be a whopping $8.25. Even worse, it was way too sweet, with the rose flavor completely overpowering the coffee, and the consistency was very watery, not creamy at all. I was extremely disappointed and would not return. Service and ambience were fine but $8.25 for a mediocre latte is ridiculous when there are so many good coffee shops in this neighborhood.

SMALL cafe near union square with coffee, pastries, & food to boot  they've got maybe 6 counter seats inside with 2 facing the sidewalk so you can people watch through the window ---iced soy lavender latte: not enough lavender flavor, definitely better at bibble & sip  FREE wifi so a great spot to get some work done except there's no bathroom so you can't stay too long!  NOTE: soy OR almond milk options for the lactose intolerant PLUS they have balthazar croissants & dough doughnuts

This place is straight up amazing. OMG YOU HAVE FOOD THAT ISNT A DONUT, CROISSANT, OR CAKE POP - what a concept! You can work done with their free wi-fi, sip solid and well priced coffee drinks, and eat freshly made sandwiches. Great music jams too...  Cons: no outlets (whatever - charge your @$&!), and the place has bar seating only...in case you're looking to play Magic the gathering or some nonsense.  Life is short, Starbucks is lame.

Definitely try the rose latte- it's sweet but doesn't overpower the coffee. It also has 4 shots of espresso in the large which is a plus. The only downside of this shop is the lack of seating, but it's only a short walk from union square.

OMG can I give this place 10 stars?! Cause that's what it really deserves. I got the Rose latte, and it was amazing! There was a nice amount of foam on top with a beautiful design and it wasn't too hot which is something I'm not fond of with hot coffee; is when it's so hot that it burns my mouth when I drink it right away. I also got an almond croissant that was just as amazing as the coffee; soft and filling with just the right amount of sweet - I love the powdered sugar on top!! The manager/owner, whom I believe to be of French origin was so friendly and accommodating, that I will definitely be back again! Make sure to get a loyalty card punch card so you can get some free drinks!
Beautiful coffee place! They really succeeded in creating this industrial, modern type of interior design. The iced latte I took was very refreshing and the coffee was very good quality.
Great coffee, friendly staff. The place is a bit small, but they maximize the space. Also, they have outlets and free WiFi.

I stubbled upon this gem of a coffee shop one day while I was shopping in union square. I have tried many of their drinks, which never fail to disappoint. The pastries and sandwiches are also very good. I go back every time I am in the area. Nice staff I would highly recommend!
Expensive sandwhich for $13. The sandwhich was small.  For$13 I should have gotten more salmon on the sandwich.  I was mainly tasting the goat cheese.  It was tasty sandwhich.

My favorite spot in the neighborhood! Best place to grab your morning coffee/tea + breakfast, they have delicious soups and sandwiches, sweets, and my FAVORITE croissants! Everything is fresh and made with great quality ingredients and everyone is so welcoming and accommodating. I can't say enough great things about this place! I always miss Le Petite Parisien when I travel - definitely stop by if you have the chance!

Great place to get a quick bite in midtown east! I ordered an iced french coffee and the gainsbourg with camembert and both were delicious! The cafe has a few small tables outdoors perfect for parties of 1-2. Quite a lovely experience!

I discovered this gem of a caf̩ upon returning from a trip to Paris, nostalgic and on the hunt for a Parisian cup of coffee. While my search had initially been fruitless, I need look no further than this cozy oasis of the City of Light, just a few blocks from my office. If you ever feel like taking a short walk that transports you across the Atlantic, I highly recommend Le Petit Parisien for its delicious brew, delightful conversation and interlude of jazz. The owner and staff serve everything with care and a personal touch rare to New York City's usual pace, so that stopping by is as much about the ambiance as the taste. It is truly a wonderful way to start my mornings!

This place is a fabulous addition to the neighborhood. The sandwiches are made on wonderful baguettes and the croissants are warm every morning.  The owner and staff are all wonderful - so friendly and welcoming. They are also very dog friendly and keep a bowl of water for the pups.  I was sorry to have missed the grand opening but I stop by a couple times a week.  Another fabulous evening eating great bread & wine. The staff is wonderful. I can't wait to be here in the fall.

I really wanted to like this place. As a frequent NYC restauranteur, I had a pretty bad experience.  1) The menu is not clear. The breakfast/lunch menu is not very clear to what they offer. Good luck trying to customise.  2) The price is outrageous. I paid $14 for a bland egg-white sandwich, a cup of coffee and a smaller-than-average almond crossant. Breakfast shouldn't cost more than $10.  3) Owner acted pretentious. Anywhere you get breakfast in the city, there should be the basics like having ketchup. I asked politely for ketchup to the owner, and he replied "No ketchup, sorry" with a dismissive tone. I had to eat a bland egg-white sandwich now with salad (who TF serves salad with an egg sandwich???)  The ONLY redeeming quality would be the baguette and crossant were actually soft and well baked.  Conclussion: There are way better places to go. Try Gotham Cafe a block away. It destroys this place in all the mentioned criticisms above.

I've frequented this small cafe several times since it's neighborhood debut.  I wanted to give it a chance since it's so close to my apartment.  I'd argue that it's difficult to deliver a truly differentiated coffee experience.  So, with that said, La Reveil brews up a decent cup of joe at a slightly premium price point.  I'm partial to Cafe Grumpy, Starbucks, and Dean & Deluca to provide some context here.    The major issue I have with this place is service!  Indifferent, slow, gruff, and unfriendly is how I'd characterize the baristas here.  I must give credit where credit is due - the chef has some serious brunch skills.  I ordered the Poached Egg Smoke Salmon plate to-go.  Mind blown!
yogurt parfait has the stalest granola included, even though it's separate from the yogurt.

This cafe is located right at the entrance/ exit of the 72nd street Q spot. I decided to check out the spot because I realized they just opened. When i walked in around 6:45am the cafe smelled so delicious and yummy. I believe they bake their pastries at the back. Their display of pastries looked so yummy and it was really tempting. I ended up ordering a chai latte with soy milk. I really liked it because i love how it was not super sweet. Other places use too much syrup or sweetened soymilk. The price was alittle on the high end but i think this is common for alot of cafes in the city.

Love this new coffee cafe addition in the UES! Super convenient to stop in and grab a cuppa joe before heading onto the Q. Bf and I have been here a few times, and service is a little slow (mainly because there's only one woman, bless her soul, processing all the orders and making the coffee too, as well as putting the pastries on display). When I'm in a hurry, it's unpleasant to have to wait for 4-5 people to merely order and then wait again for those 4-5 people to get their drinks. I loveee their banana bread, it's so good! The yogurt cake I'd pass on since it was kind of dry and lacked flavor. Grateful for independent coffee shops that are still reasonably priced in the UES!
Delicious and consistently good coffee! And the croissants are rich and buttery. This place is a little gem on 2nd ave!!  Staff very friendly as well. Happy to call this spot my local :)

Great quiet spot to relax, get work done or have a coffee with a friend. Top notch service with welcoming staff providing a homely feel. The Poached Egg Avocado Toast and Cortado is bomb! They're also the only place I've seen in the city that provides Turkish coffee. Definitely worth checking out !

Finally stopped in st the neighborhood spot. It's really cute. Great calm music playing. Cafe tables,  water carafes. Really wanted to love this place.   I see they have omelets w potatoes on the menu board. So I ask for a mushroom omelet. The counter person says she isn't sure they have mushrooms. Points to a paper menu. Which doesn't even list omelets. She asked the cook,  no mushrooms. So I ask about cheese. I order it with cheddar. Five minutes later the cook arrives at my table with an omelet. No potatoes,  no toast. I ask. He says potatoes would take more time. Do I want them? Seriously? I paid $10. Of course I want what it comes with. Five minutes later,  2 egg omelet with yummy potatoes. No toast.  $10! Also ordered an iced cappuccino with almond milk. Almost no taste of espresso. If you own this place you might want to supervise your staff a tad more, fix your menu and maybe consider providing a little more value to your customers.

I love this place but the music is extremely loud, even with headphones. Very charming cute place with breakfast and coffee, but I couldn't hear myself think :/ I think they do it to keep people moving in and out

Service was not the best. Ordered an avocado toast and paid and was asked by the manager, who was talking to the chef, if I wanted a poached egg. I said yes. Cashier then rudely told me I did not tell her I wanted a poached egg even though it was nowhere on the menu. Food was fine though!
My favorite place that I am going to every weekend with my best friends! The coffee is number one and the food is so delicious! I can highly recommend it to everyone.
Excellent turkey and egg French baguette , comes with tasty greens at a great price with a coffee its $11.  Good stuff
Definitely my new coffee spot in the area. The service was great and coffee tastes incredible! The food also looked very good. I'm excited to go back.

This place has amazing nitro and avocado toast, must checkout if you are around UES.  They have a rich selection of break fast options if you are looking for a quick bite on the way to work.  Friendly owner.
As an upper East side resident this coffee house is a go to I love the employees I love the aesthetic and I love the product. Space all-around a wonderful spot

Normally I don't post reviews but I believe the service provided to me this morning was unbelievably rude and unprofessional. From the moment I walked in the young man taking my order had an attitude. I was not rude to him so I don't understand why he was behaving that way. I was waiting for my drink for awhile (did not hear him announce it was ready). I had headphones on but they weren't on. "Long story short," both of the guys working this morning saw I was waiting and didnt let me know my drink was ready. When I told him he should've told me. He sarcastically said "It's not his fault I wasn't listening." Then continued to tell me to have a good day (in a very sarcastic tone). He was very rude and unprofessional from the moment I walked in.

We stopped in to re-caffeinate after a heavy lunch at Katz's Deli. Cortados were in order, since they pack the same juice as a latte, with a lot less milk volume. They were as delicious as they were artistically crafted. I highly recommend.

Popped in for a coffee this morning and the lady making the coffee was rude, impatient and didn't listen to what I had asked for. No eye contact, no friendliness, no communication, not even a smile.  A little customer service can go a long way. I'd pay extra if it meant I could be greeted with a little kindness, especially first thing in the morning!
Great hot chocolate (yeah, I coffee shop like a 9 year old). Relaxing and comfortable vibe. Seating is decent but if I were coming to work for several hours I don't know that it would work very well

First ordered a salted caramel iced latte--it was so salty that it was not drinkable, as if pure salt was just poured in there. The barista was nice enough to trade my drink for a vanilla latte--it was average. The espresso was very watered down and could barely be tasted. Not what I would expect for a $5 latte. I will not be returning here.

I liked this place.  Good selection of drinks - both standard and some with a twist, giving me reason to come back and try other drinks (ie. Salted caramel latte, maple latte).  Spacious for a coffee shop, several sofas and plush chairs to lounge on, and two bar tables that fit up to 6 people each.  I liked that it's not pretentious, but definitely popular so you have to come early if you want to get a seat.  Many people with laptops.  Free wifi.  Would come again.
What a lovely spot and they make such great coffee no matter which barista is on board.

If the opening time says 8am, it's when you should be ready. Apparently this place doesn't know this simple fact because when I arrived at 8am this morning, the girl barely looked at me and told me she was busy with other stuff (cleaning trash off the street..most people do that 30min before opening btw). Change the time to 9am or something if you're going to ignore customers who come on time.
Liked the coffee shop. Coffee and service was good and WiFi working. Only giving 2 stars due to: *Not ideal for studying or reading. *Section was blocked for a party. They went all out.

I was working next door and needed for a drink. The place it's big and looks like a good spot for working, friendly staff and helpful.  I had a special drink - black sesame latte and was naah ... I wished the milk was properly steam/foam instead I got warm milk with crushed sesame seed, didn't impressed me

Any joint that uses whole wheat instead of white bread for a grilled cheese sandwich is automatically third-rate.  Any legit ny-er knows that whole wheat bread is a conspiracy theory. It's not any healthier than white bread, and it tastes like cardboard.  Duh.  Also... the tomato soup is just ok. How do you make a mediocre tomato soup when you have TWO grilled cheese menus?  Hard pass.

It's hard to get an Iced Americano wrong, but it wasn't bad by any means. I also got the Almond Croissant, which wasn't bad, but for $4, I would've expected something more.  However, this place has ample seating, and is a pretty low-key spot to go and study or read, or to just duck in and escape the bustle of the city. There are plenty of outlets around the cafe, and the music selection was mellow enough not to have to plug into my own playlists. Pleasant surprise to hear the Sunday in the Park with George soundtrack!

I came here for Taehyung's birthday event and I think I found my new favorite cafe in Midtown! I got an Iced Americano and a Matcha Latte with soy milk. Both drinks were basic but great! Mind you, it was early in the morning when I came, so I needed some caffeine in me. The prices are decent - not too expensive. The staff are super friendly and that's really what makes this cafe so great. I got to choose my cup sleeve at the cashier but the barista asked me again (when I was waiting for my drinks), if that's the color I wanted. They have seats located near the door and towards the back where the bathroom is located. They also decorated the cafe for Tae's birthday event... super cute! Definitely will be coming back here for some other drinks or treats!

Not sure why the reviews are so high for this place. The only good thing here is the ample seating for a midtown coffee place.  The coffee was mediocre, the almond croissant was a bit stale, and prices were higher than anticipated for the quality.

Luna is definitely an interesting spot to pay for a visit if you are into some locally brewed coffee and more importantly, a chill place to calm down. Have been to there downtown location once, so decided to stop by this midtown one today.  Loved this location more, probably because I was able to sip the coffee inside, rather then grab and leave. There was a motorbike and a grand old piano secretly hidden inside as well, making the whole place a bit ancient.

Latte was really good. Almond croissant is one of the better ones I've had in awhile. Stable WiFi. Decent amount of seating. The communal table in the front has outlets available. Bathroom is in the back. Another perfect place to work/study :)
Lovely space, lovely staff, delicious croissant and decaf iced americano is different and really tasty!

I discovered this place 2 weeks ago while walking from my office on 34th and 6th Ave, looking for a new place for my coffee break. Once inside, I immediately liked the ambiance. The pastries on display got my attention right away. I got the almond croissant and cup of coffee, both of which tasted really good. I've been back 3x times now. The staff and service were great. Special shout out to Tobey, who is very friendly and professional. I plan to have many more coffee breaks at this place.
Amazing brownie, the luna blend is good as well. Very nice space. Great place to spend your afternoon here.

This is a great spot.  We popped in for a light breakfast before sightseeing, and we're thrilled with both food and coffee. We both had the oatmeal, and it was delicious.  The coffee was perfection. The woman at the counter was gracious and fast.  I love her!  This place was not packed, and I was surprised.  I'm sure we just got lucky, as there were only chain coffee places around.

Came here for breakfast to see what all the hype was about. You walk in and there's a seating area and then you go up to the counter with a display of baked goods. I got a latte and an almond croissant. Latte was nothing special. The croissant was really good but $4 is too expensive to be coming back for it again. There is additional seating in the back if you want to come and do work where it's quieter. I don't think I'll be back just because I can get baked goods cheaper at Zaro's. I did get 10% off from a Yelp check-in so that was good.

Excellent coffee!! So glad I stopped in this small coffee shop on 29th. I got a soy latte it tasted great. Smooth espresso with just the right amount of soymilk for creaminess. Did not need any additional sugar.  Average price, quick service. Small variety of pastries if you want a snack with your coffee.

Every time when I am around K-Town I try to stop by the Luna. It's one of my favorite coffee shops in midtown Manhattan. I love their Latte, Cappuccino, Iced Coffee (and if you heard from someone that they have ice coffee cubes - I can confirm that it is 100% true!!!). There is a lot of place to sit inside as they expanded the coffee shop recently and now they expanding the menu too and adding more food to it as well as wine (I guess now I will have to go there more often). Last time I went there I ordered habanera chicken salad while my friend had an avocado tuna salad. The portion of my chicken salad was good, enough to make you full but not too full, chicken was seasoned perfectly not overly spicy, but it had heat to it. Tomatoes, mushrooms, and peppers were a nice touch to salad and completed the whole dish. My friends' salad was an elevated version of peoples favorite tuna salad. I didn't eat the whole but I've tried and I can say it was good so as my friend. It was not too heavy, although it had mayo in it. And avocado cup in which the salad was served made the simple dish looking more interesting. Definitely going to steal this idea for my own recipe book. Overall as I said it an excellent place to go grab coffee or pastry, and now it is a place where you can go have lunch or dinner with a glass of wine. Recommend it to everyone!
Great coffee. We ate breakfast sandwiches and they were very good also. Very nice people and a good clean place.

Fantastic coffee shop! Joe the proprietor really takes the steps to address the little things, from decor, to lighting, to having damn good coffee, tea and pastries and extremely friendly staff! It's right across from Simple Studios so it makes a great spot to study lines before an audition for us actor types. Awesome gem that deserves your support!
Pros: nice decoration, friendly staff.  Cons: undrinkable coffee. Had a macchiato there, it was so so bitter I couldn't even have a sip. Stay away.

I was waiting for my Vamoose bus near Penn Station, and this was an EXCELLENT place to wait (as compared to Starbucks, Pret and the like)....  - great coffee - friendly, cute guy - pain du chocolate, which he warmed for me - SUPER CLEAN venue - LOTs of outlets - Free password-only wifi - nice, mellow music (blues, jazz, etc)
A perfectly made macchiato (and a lesson in how it's usually made), a great grilled cheese, and LOTS OF SPACE. Least crowded and least pretentious coffeeshop in Manhattan. I'll be back.

This coffee shop is the real deal! They put coffee ice cubes in their iced coffee so your drink never waters down, even as the ice melts. This place has everything - ample seating, free wifi, good music, and a great atmosphere. Plus, the staff and owner are always super friendly. One of the best coffee shops in the city, honestly.

This is such an amazing coffee shop located right near my work. The workers who work here are one of the most friendliest workers I've ever encountered in a coffee shop, and they make my morning when I stop in for my iced coffee or regular coffee. You definitely get what you pay for, even though it is a little expensive, and there's many coffee places around, but the attitude makes this a top notch place to come.

A 5-star cafe not necessarily for anything awesome in itself, but moreso for the oasis feel the place gives. I was the only customer on a day when nearby Starbucks and Stumptown were overflowing.  Really friendly cashier, casual atmosphere, and great (clean!) counterspace with power for some work. And free, speedy wifi! Great place to work while other cafes are cracking down on laptop usage. My latte was good, but not great.  Music could use some work, but that's about it. I'm surprised to one of only a few reviews ... go check out this place!

Amazing coffee!  It actually has flavor and isn't bland or flat. I always get the iced latte and that first sip is just MAGICAL!  The guys who work there are super friendly and you get an award winning smile from them every time.  No joke. Get yourself a cup.
Excellent coffee and superior customer service. Owner and staff make this place a rewarding coffee stop during the day.

Luna is such a fabulous find in the heart of Chelsea. This modest neighborhood coffee shop boasts delicious iced and hot coffees freshly brewed each day, and decadent mid-afternoon treats!  This is the only coffee shop with iced coffee cubes, homemade pumpkin spices lattes (yes- they bake their own pumpkins, Starbucks) as well as NEWLY INTRODUCED empanadas and abuela's homemade salsa. You will be in Latin heaven upon taking your first bite.  I'm so glad I found this place. It makes the workday less stressful being able to sit with my laptop and delicious purchase, among coffee-loving New Yorkers and a friendly staff. One of the baristas is pretty cute too. Always a fan of eye candy with my coffee ;)
Cute atmosphere, plenty of outlets, good wifi, friendly staff, awesome coffee. Nothing bad to write!

After years of Starbucks dedication, a caffeinated epiphany has altered my coffee-drinking experience for as long as I wander the streets of midtown west. The Luna Cafe (121 w 29th) houses a strong brew, french-inspired pastries (authentic macaroons), and a trustworthy staff. this is no "press a button coffee comes out" type places: these guys do it right. plus the prices beat grumpy & stumps
Wicked expensive and not very good. Watery espresso and small sizes. Barely mixed my mocha. Only used one shot so it was very milky. With the other options in the area I'd hunt those out.

Another day, another sandwich...but at an espresso bar?  I'm not a big coffee  drinker, so I've past Macchiato countless times without even giving a thought to going in. It wasn't until I was strolling through the area looking for an interesting lunch that their menu posted on the door caught my eye. The sandwich choices were unique considering the other options in the area, and for the most part it's affordable. I got the prosciutto sandwich sans olive tapenade and it was great! It's lovely to be able to select from their fresh breads...although the croissant was a bit too light for the contents of the sandwich, it's buttery flakiness was the perfect compliment! This sandwich got me coming back and I accidentally forgot to ask for no tapenade--completely changes the sandwich. I'm really not a fan, but I do feel that even if you were it overpowers the other ingredients of the sandwich, so avoid it!  As for their other offerings, my co-worker raves about the espresso, and their macarons are provided by Macarons and Cookies by Woops and aren't half bad.  All in all, I'd suggest Macchiato if you are looking to mix-up your midtown lunch.

I had a positive experience with the Beet Salad (goat cheese, hard too large walnuts, light dressing, and fresh greens), Chai Latte (spicy, but more sweet), and Drip Coffee (unremarkable).  The service was prompt, professional, and efficient.  I stayed eating an amazing pecan danish (can I have a woo hoo), and chocolate chip cookie, and Mighty Leaf (?) tea.  During the lunch rush (1230 - 1330), there was a steady and slightly loud flow of traffic, and the place became packed.  Otherwise, it would've been good for working.  The facilities are located in the hotel next door, which was of average quality.  Total, $36.00, and 6 hours.
Love the coffee here. Girls in the front know what they are doing and they are super fast. The cappuccino is not a joke!

Macchiato was a staple during my days as a paralegal in mid-town.  Great for a quick lunch during the week, along with a soy mocha.  Those were delicious.  As for food, I always got either the egg salad sandwich, the caprese, or the macchiato (with salumi).  Their bread is also very good.    Only bad thing about this place is that they are not open on weekends! At least in the summer...
Nice coffee shop that offers an alternative to the big coffee chains in the area. Space is kind of small but it's definitely a nice atmosphere.

The cappuccino and espresso-based beverages are terrific. Unlike the Styrofoam-like froth you get at many other places, the milk is skillfully coaxed into a creamy, delicious pillow of joy. The place is small, so it can get tight. There is an occasional mixup when it is busy, but most of the employees are very nice, so anything is quickly amended. You tend to get treated as a respected customer, rather than a soy, no foam, number in line.
Very cozy and nice staff. Good Coffee would go there instead of that S joint in a heartbeat.

I have been a Macchiato regular since it opened a few years ago (I work on the same block). I'm not a big coffee connoisseur, so won't comment on that. It's the inconsistency of their food preparation that bugs the hell out me--especially given the premium prices they charge. For example, they have frequently skimped on the feta or left out the bread. This has happened far too often to be mere employee spaciness.  Even if the food itself is excellent--only the freshest, highest-quality ingredients--I'm just plain fed up with being left hungry after shelling out nearly ten bucks for a salad.

It's a huge pet peeves of mine when restaurants don't post the correct prices and then charge you more. The small coffee is $2.99, not $2.  I come here occasionally for pastries and coffee. The pastries are fine when the craving strikes, but average in New York where there's a sea of excellent pastry options.  The cookies are overhyped- I found them incredibly sweet and texturally uninteresting. I like the variety of savory breakfast options. But all in all, I find maman overpriced for what you're getting.

What a fantastic little treat I found. The nuance and subtlety of this place is exactly what I needed on a Wednesday.  Walk straight to the back to order, (I got the Bridget sandwich, absolutely delicious and unexpected.) If you order coffee, pick it up from the front when you are done ordering. Don't skip on the cookies either  The seating is comfy and airy for New York and the interior is super homey with greenery on the ceiling and a floral print on the wall.  This place is very welcoming.  Along with the food, they also have laptop free tables that promote conversation. A nice touch in this year of 2018.  4.5/5 recommend.  I will definitely be coming back to try some other savory treats!

Lavender latte WAS SO GOOD. You can definitely taste the lavender and it was not sweet which was great. The food however, was good but not amazing. The almond croissant was very dense. It had s generous amount of almond filling and was not overwhelmingly sweet like how some other croissants can be. But being in New York, there are definitely better options nearby. Hopefully I'll get their specialty croissants next time and it will be something that I come back here for. The other brunch items didn't really stand out to me; they seem just okay. My friends got the hash and lavender waffles and said they were fine. Service was mediocre. I asked for water and was left thirsty with my throat like the Sahara Desert for about 20 minutes until I finally got my water. Very cute place though! I love the decor.

The interior is nice, but I waited long for my coffee and the waitress didn't bring enough milk. Then as soon as I poured the milk in it curdled, making my coffee disgusting. I asked for a new coffee and did not get one

I have now tasted what could only be made from magical French fairies! The Blackberry/Vanilla beignet was one of the most incredible things I have ever ate in New York City! My coffee and breakfast sandwich was tasty too. I have now been

Mmmm, overrated.  I was super excited when I found out this place was moving in the neighborhood, but reality just doesn't meet their hype.    The sweets are sickeningly so.  It's not that they don't taste good, but like overdone American versions of what a real French bakery would have.  Everything is just kind of...extra.  Sandwiches and salads are fine, nothing memorable, nothing you'd crave. But just fine if you are in the neighborhood.  Drinks are a bit on the over-priced side.  The smell in the place is sort of like stale grease. I can't figure out what it is but it's pretty strong and sticks to your clothes and hair.  I can tell when someone has been in there when I stand next to them in my office.
Perfect pear tart-  not too sweet, fresh, flaky, soft, super delicious.  Nice atmosphere too.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Found MarieBelle while on the search for a hot chocolate to warm me up on a cold day. I was a bit let down. The "cafe" and store front were extremely crowded and the layout didn't lend itself to guests like this. We finally found out where to order (which is not in the cafe itself but at a register) a small hot chocolate. Dazzled but the chocolate in the store, I was excited for this epic cup I was about to drink. No exaggeration, the cup was the size of a double shot glass and that was $6.50. For such a price and small serving, surely this hot chocolate would be delicious. Wrong. Somehow the chocolate was bitter and solid. Probably would have been better with a packet of Swiss Miss

My goodness is this place adorable. Styled like a Parisian cafe, MarieBelle offers absolutely delictible chocolate treats. I came here specifically with hot chocolate in mind on one of the subzero days we had in NYC recently. I wanted to get it to go but they have several cute little cafe tables in the back. There were several hot chocolate options in dark chocolate, milk, and while chocolate. I decided on the Aztec which is on of their dark chocolate choices. You can get a small, which is only about 2 or 3 oz or a large which is about 7 or 8 oz. The small is $5 and the large is $7.50 so you're much better off just getting the large.  The hot chocolate was ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE. It was so rich and creamy and full of flavor. It is hands down one of the best hot chocolates I have had in the city. I can't recommend this enough. I will absolutely be coming back with the plan of getting a few of the other flavors in the small size so I can do a bit of a DIY hot chocolate sampling with my husband when he gets back from helping restore power in Puerto Rico!  The staff here were so friendly and lovely as well. This was a great experience all around.

Came in after brunch, did not notice this place before, but it caught my eye because of the gelato booth outside  Went in and was amused by the interior, it was spacious in there and decorated like the European dynasties. You walk in and the first thing you see is more gelato. everything is well decorated and you feel pampered just by walking in.  The more you walk in, the more chocolate options you see, this would be a perfect place to get someone a gift, the packaging are just amazing.you will then see chocolate bars of different kind of flavors, even in matcha green tea flavor. The wrapping of the bars are also very interesting. to prevent spoilers, go check them out yourself! you wont be disappointed.  There are also samples here and there for the chocolate. and there is a whole counter of more delicate chocolate pieces where you can get them in boxes  The inside, is a cafe! i bet no one really knows about - they have cakes, pastries and of course you could enjoy coffee or hot chocolate in there. Very relaxing and definitely very classy and pretty  will definitely come back and get the chocolates as gifts and check out their cakes!

This is a hidden secret in the city. I love the paintings and the decor of this place. Though, I am not a big fan of eating chocolate or sweets (I'm a fruit girl), the chocolate drinks and goods tasted really good.This is a place where you bring a special someone or have a co-worker with. There is something about going to a random place and being surrounded by people using their low voice taking the time to taste chocolate delicacies makes the experience surreal.  I will definitely come back here again.
Here is marvelous chocolate cafe.  If enjoy eating sweet things, must go there. Then, you can meet pretty deco, a lot of beautiful cups, and very sweet chocolates.

When I walked into this shop, I felt like I was transported to a beautiful shop in France at the turn of the century.  It is beautiful and decorated as if Louis IV or Marie Antoinette commissioned its decor.  Sadly, I cannot comment about any of the chocolate as I didn't buy any.  It was loaded with chocolates, gifts, a beautifully decorated caf̩ in the back where one could order hot chocolate.  My daughter and I were actually en route to somewhere else, but I had read about this place on Yelp and wanted to see it for myself... I'm just sorry I didn't make any purchase.  Maybe next trip esp. now that I know where it is.
Love the atmosphere. Loved the chocolate cake with icecream. Guava tea is so good! We split the combo for two. Just the right amount of food. Will come back next time we are back in NYC.

Just finished having 3 delicious hot chocolates, one large white chocolate with Tahitian vanilla, and two cups of small milk chocolate. Totally divine.  What ruined a usual great experience was the behavior of their immature and pushy store associate behind the register named Inbar. I had brought forth two boxes of their clusters that I believed to be $7 each. They were tiny boxes so it was a safe assumption. When she scanned them, I had already given her my credit card, as I was sure it would be $14-20 at most. When she said it was $37, as in $17 each plus tax, I wasn't even afforded a slight moment of thought before she completed the transaction and gave me the receipt. Whilst standing there, I, of course was having second thoughts and figured I could exchange them for something else that I was looking at (their dual tins for $29). Keep in mind, I was still in the store, I hadn't moved from my previous spot. When telling her I wanted to at least exchange them for some other item, she nastily replied that she can't help me, no matter what the circumstances were. No refund, no exchange, nothing. I was with my family who were looking to shop afterwards, so I didn't want to bring it up with a manager and make a huge ordeal of it. But I'll definitely be contacting their general manager and disputing the charges. I love their shop for hot beverages, but I would never buy one of their products ever again. That nasty woman treated me as if I had taken the box outside and rummaged through them. I hadn't even moved from the register!

Hot chocolate and chocolates were good but the three pastries I took home all tasted stale. It was either old or wasn't wrapped properly while it was in the fridge. I can definitely taste the fridge taste.

Their chocolates are very good, but they're more on the expensive side. They're very creamy, with subtle flavors of ginger or basil or cardamom, etc. which I really enjoy. I still think they are up there with some of the best chocolates I've had. And the patterns on the chocolates are fun. The shop itself is reminds me of Versailles because it's very opulent. I like it a lot. In the back they have a little salon and a display case of chocolate mousse and mango mousse pastries, etc. I've tried at least 4 of the varieties they had at the time and they were delicious. I like them better than the ones at Maison Kayser. However, I do not think they have the best hot chocolate, as they advertise. I think I got the milk hot chocolate with cinnamon stick and nutmeg, but I can't be sure. I thought it was overly sweet. I liked the waiter, he was very friendly and came around a few times to offer me little tastings of a few of their hot chocolate flavors. Like I said, I think all of them were overly sweet for my taste. I still think the best hot chocolate is at LA Burdick or City Bakery because both of those have a deep richness to them and they're not overly sweet. I also got the quiche and I do not recommend that because it did not have enough of the egg filling and tasted dry and bready. If you go here, I suggest sticking with their pastries and their chocolates, both of which you can take to go. They packaged up 4 pastries very nicely for me, which I appreciated.

I've been here a few times and stopped by recently on a weekday afternoon.  Ordered lavender and pistachio gelato, which was delicious.  This is one of my favorite dessert spots.  They also sell chocolate, smoothies, and have a small selection of lunch items.  It's a nice place to grab a quick bite or afternoon tea with a friend.

Mariebelle is an absolutely gorgeous space, with a fully equipped (think dramatic chandeliers dripping with European charm) dessert parlor in the back room and walls adorned with boundless teas and chocolatier products. All of this boutique's artisinal chocolates are exquisitely presented (box sets have pretty embossed ribbons!) and are all quality 60-72% single origin chocolates.  Tenka.com had a free trio of chocolates, which included the truffle, ganache, and champagne heart. The champagne heart is absolutely spectacular. I also bought the Dark Chocolate Obsession Rose tea (the pretty tin in the photo), and I am so not used to salivating over teas.  Mariebelle is also supposed to have the most ridiculous Aztec hot chocolate (though City Bakery's Hot Chocolat Festival is having some wear and tear on my body). And I cannot wait for the warm weather to arrive at my destination so I can enjoy Mariebelle's plum and banana sorbets and cardamom iced chocolate!

My new favorite dessert spot in NYC. I cannot stress how much I adore this place, from the Parisian decor to the ethereal aroma of chocolate that embraces you as soon as you walk through the doors. The teas, brunch, desserts, and most importantly chocolate are just perfection and worth the price.

This is usually the chocolate place I go to when I need to find a gift for someone. I particularly like the pinup girl chocolate bars. They are very good (just not sure whether they are $17 good) The boxes with small little cubes of different flavors are amazingly cute. I've visited the cafe they have in the back several times as well. The spiced hot chocolate is my favorite.
The secret secret spot for me to buy my chocolates for my love one. Pretty edible artful snap shot on head square chocolate.

The Best White Hot Chocolate I've ever had. Strong, chocolaty flavor without excessive sweetness (which a lot of white chocolates end up being). Consistency was thick and smooth.  Their standard hot chocolates though could use some work. The chocolatiness is there for everyone and flavors are good, but they should probably filter the drinks before serving because there was a lot of leftover gunk at the end of the drink.

It was a rainy day. I was in New York. Walking in the Rain. Classic Buildings. Beautiful Moment.  Totally felt like in the old movies. What comes up in my mind? Yes, that thought of doing "Singing in the Rain" thing did come up, ain't going to lie about that.  I was so drenched in the rain and the umbrella my twin bought was crap, it went all the way up after half an hour. It was a rainy thursday night, and it seemed it would go all night. Right at our doorstep is Maribelle. I do believe in love at first sight, and yes I thought it was fate, it brought us together. Maybe I'm being silly, I felt the butterflies in stomach, it was so beautiful the moment I walked in. The store is so unique and had all these differnet kind of chocolates and its varities.  I went straight to the back where it has little coffee shop. Forget Serendipity, I've found love. I sat down and they welcomed me with warmness. Maybe it's me, I brought them prosperity. I was the first customer at that time I came in, and three of four others followed. I had the hot chocolate with a hint of espresso in it. They asked, what kind of coffee do you do, and I responded, Coffee is my family business, I take it strong and black, no weak American coffee. They read my mind like a book and initiated the Italians. You know it's true love when ones can read each other mind, no words exchanged.  The Cup of hot chocolate was perfect. It was so think and concentrated, it tasted exactly like a dark choclate metled into my cup, with strong coffee sense in it. It was just like I imagined it. Thick, Strong, and Dark. The hot chocolate cake is the icing of everything, it's a must, I say. I cant' describe the word of it, just pure heaven. Thank me later.  Bare in mind, this place isn't a local starbucks or other shops, they can be pricey, but toally worthed it. You pay for what you get, I mean it. My bill came out way more than I expected, but hey Love don't cost a thing.  I'll give up another second just to be with Maribelle again..

I hate to be the voice of dissent here, but I think that MarieBelle is way over rated.  I bought a bunch of chocolates here after a good friend (who live in Chelsea and buys gifts here a lot) recommended it.  I give this place a big, resounding "Meh."  The packaging is cute and the store itself attractive.  Even the chocolates are pretty.  But I think that the flavoring is too subtle or too much but rarely just right.  Their mojito chocolates are too much and I could not taste any real flavor in either the cardamom or the spicy varities.  I am all for subtle flavoring and have a refined enough palette but I just find their chocolates bland and slightly chalky.  The only reason I am giving them 3 stars is because I think that their caramels are fantastic.

A charming Tiffany box of a chocolate shop that whisks you off to a magical Paris where the people are nice and there's no need to mangle their language. Pass by the glass vitrine filled with elegant painted truffles and the lavishly wrapped bars of single-origin chocolate, decorated with hand-glittered pinup girls and settle in to the tiny cafe hidden in back to extend your vacation over savory crepes and tea, or warm peanut butter cookies and liquid drinking chocolate. Thick European hot chocolate is offered in several varieties each of Dark, Milk and White. it's far too pretty a place to make full-throated Homer Simpson-esque gurgles of joy as you taste the thick, rich, creamy chocolate, but  a few small gasps are unavoidable. The menu also features sandwiches, savory tarts and dessert crepes. A wonderful place to take a girl of any age, also a darling place for boys feeling smitten.

MarieBelle's Cacao Bar, located in trendy SoHo is a must for all Hot Chocolate lovers. Walk through the double doors and make your way to the back. Sit in the 'best seat in the house' (Left most corner of the room) and have the friendly barista whip you up one of their delicious concoctions. You have the choice of either the thicker European style (made with water) or still thick but not as thick as the European style, American style (made with milk). Whichever you choose you'll soon realize why their hot chocolate is served with a spoon and a glass of water. Thick cannot quite describe the consistency, no, rather, it was rich but rich without being too rich, or in other words, perfect. Down your cup and you'll be asking for more. ($6)
