Every time he's there you can feel an energy shift in the coffee shop. I assume he's the general manager (talk with dark hair).
Its called "Think Coffee", but they play terrible music on blast. Good luck "thinking" about anything or getting anything done here.

It's surprising to be the first to review a place in Manhattan.   Especially for someone who no longer lives here.  But passing by on my way to the Highline I stumbled on this place on 39th street.  Just near the Highline stairs.    Super friendly employee greated me.  I had a mint ice tea, medium was $2.75.  Small 2.50.  It's NYC.  This is a "chain", perhaps another 6 locations I guess.  I like the feel.    Outlets near the standing bars.  Useful.    Lots of foot traffic.    Old Hendrix type music may have been a little heavy for 7 am but ok.

My wife and I ordered a regular latte and a decaf latte. They don't mark the cups and the barista didn't know which was which when we went to pick up the drinks from the bar.  My wife gets very sick if she has caffeine, so we asked if he/she/ve/they could remake the decaf at least so she wouldn't get sick.  Then came the attitude comprised of sighs and accusations that if we hadn't picked up the drinks (to find the decaf/regular label) that person could identify which was which. But it was too late by then to be sure and they were unwilling to refund the drink.  My wife did say she would sue him If she got sick, which upset them at which point he/she/ve/they starts yelling at us to "get out of my coffee shop!" and "I'm going to call the police".  All of his/her actions were very dramatic and irrational.  People were standing around looking embarrassed that the barista, who claimed to be the owner, who ever treat customers that way.  Two ladies actually approached us outside and asked if we were okay and apologized for how bizarrely this person acted.  I had a few sips of one of the latte's, decaf or regular, I wasn't sure, and it was bitter so I tossed mine in the trash and left the other at the bar.  I suspect this place won't last long.
Nicely done cold brew and a great stop for coffee before/after strolling the High Line.
Love this place! Always cute shapes in the lattes. Staff is friendly and efficient. No wifi.
Very small space with a few chairs. No wifi so not ideal for working between meetings. Good for a short chat w a friend !

A total bummer. I saw great reviews and was excited. I ordered a Chai Latte and a Goat Cheese Quiche with Greens. Oh man, that was $20. Even for NYC that's steep.  I was still hopeful but then the food arrived. The Quiche was frozen in the center and it was the size of a large mug; the greens were less than a handful with a drizzle of olive oil. The Chai was OK at best. I should've gone to a restaurant instead!  Fine, I said to myself. Bad luck. At least I can study here. But at 6:30 they turned off the light and stacked chairs in the back half of the Cafe. So I moved tables. (The Cafe closes at 8:30 according to the sign outside)  In short, if you need a place to sit and have an expresso. Yeah you can come here it's spacious and expensive enough so you'll probably find a seat. If you're looking for a snack stay awaaaaay. Away.
I got matcha latte, 5.99$ total. Taste is very weak and disappointed. I feel like drinking milk instead of matcha. Not worth at all. Place is quiet and cozy.
Quiet Saturday morning. Barista was friendly and quickly prepared our drinks, and on our way out offered water.

It is just a bag of tea. The WiFi is 30 mins free, like what year is this? I saw a fly in the bakery area. I sit on the side of the coffee shop, this wood chair designed poorly, I almost turn back several times until I lean the chair on the wall, I don't recommend to come and I personally won't come back.

Absolutely love this place. So serene, great place to grab a coffee and read a book or get some work done. Lots of seating compared to other places in the area and the women who work there are lovely.

I came in here needing a place to work.  I read the other reviews on it's serene surroundings and thought, why not let's give it a try.  I had the Moroccan mint tea, thinking it was going to be something spectacular but it turned out to be just a tea-bag...um OK, fine.    And then I turned on my laptop, and it had "free access" wifi.  I logged in, accepted, and then it said "30 minutes only" for wifi...ARE YOU JOKING!?  What is this, the beginning of the internet?  What coffee, tea, store, restaurant, mall, park, subway has a limit on wifi use?  But by then, I already ordered the tea and could not bolt out the door.  The decor is calm and peaceful for sure, there's even a fountain in the back.  Not sure if this is a Falun Dafa backed book store/shop but there is nothing but Falun Dafa books in every language imaginable as decoration for the tall walls.  While it is neatly organized and aestethicgally pleasing, I just can't help but shake the feeling I was being indoctrinated and absorbing Falun Dafa via osmosis...anyways, THAT is my own personal view...but if you love Falun Dafa, I'm sure you would find it very calming.  Tried it once, but not coming back as it is not my cup of tea...pun intended lol.  But have to say the servers were extremely kind and nice.

So unbelievably overrated; I honestly can't believe this has a 4.5 stars on yelp. First off, it's seriously problematic that this Asian cafe is run by entirely white people. Not a bad concept space wise but it was ridiculous to see a white man giving a meditation lesson based off Asian meditation techniques surrounded by books in Asian languages.  My friend ordered a $9 tea -- completely outrageous (I think it was a rose tea?) I didn't even know you could charge that much for a cup of tea. It was pretty good but nothing special. I ordered an earl Grey latte, which tasted extremely watered down and couldn't even be called a latte (it was basically tea with milk and sweetener). Also not worth the price (around $5).  The heat was also off THE DAY AFTER A HUGE SNOWSTORM. They were relying on these tiny intermittent space heaters that really didn't do much. My friend went to order another hot drink, and the guy at the counter finally got the hint and offered to turn on the heat.  That being said, it's generally pretty empty and a great place to work since it's quiet and spacious. Limited outlets and an annoying water machine, but you can stay for the day and they don't care.
Spacious, peaceful and humble atmosphere, which is a break from the touristy Midtown neighborhood this place is located.  Would definitely come back to study or such

Awesome refuge from a terrible area (though it seems they moved here and didn't separate the listings), but unfortunately too-limited hours that mean the commuters who could use it most (well, I guess they're too rushed to, but I digress) can't really experience the wonder that is a lot of seating, a great little cafe, and an excellent selection of reads.

An oasis on 8th Avenue. Quiet, serene place to chill and sip an espresso. Sit towards the back and enjoy the sounds of the waterfall. Soft classical music softly plays although would have preferred something more Zen-like. Staff is gracious and I like the peaceful vibe they exude.

For the niche that this place fills it's really excellent. They even had classical Chinese books like the 3 Character Classic. The tea house was A+ as well. Only downside is the door/stairway up looks sketchy, frankly. Once you're inside the cafe is quite spacious.
This place is an oasis. Peaceful, calm, quiet, and with good tea and excellent service.

A very unpleasant experience at UT47 I ordered a hot chocolate and started working about 11am. Till 4:50pm I've been ask 3 times whether I need something or not. I said I'm ok for now but that Korean old lady just keep asking. And the last time she even checked my receipt and said "on my"... guess just shocked by the fact that I sit here for a very long time but only had 1 drink. Or another way ask me to leave? Objectively, 1 star for the hot chocolate and the other for its maker.

Visiting from California and my daughter and I wanted a "bubble" tea (more commonly known as "boba" where we live).  Saw the great reviews of this place and decided to try it out.  Went with the honeydew matcha milk tea as the cashier said it was their best seller.  Unfortunately, I found it undrinkable.  I don't typically drink milk plain, but love a good milk tea.  This just tasted like milk with no matcha, no tea flavor, and barely any honeydew flavor, and the boba had a bad texture.  I see that most of the good reviews are for other items on their menu.  All I can review is the bubble tea, which I definitely don't recommend.  I give them zero stars for the drink, but two stars for nice customer service.  I'm gonna stick to the yummy boba tea we have in California.
Pros: Very spacious and cozy Free WiFi Friendly staff  Cons: Latte doesn't taste good. Music is a bit too loud..

Intentional and sweet staff. Great recommendations (I throughly am enjoying the ginger latte as we speak). I am super excited for the dumplings that I'm about to eat as an app before dinner!  They made everything sound so delicious. Their is ample seating and the music is FAB.  recommend!
This place provides a decent coffee and a cozy environment, with a cheap price. I defintely think it is a good place to go with your friends to have some chat.

The best place I have found to study and relax in Midtown. I had been looking for a place to study and grab a good latte that wasn't a chain shop. I had seen the other Yelp review and thought to give it a shot yesterday. It is an adorable coffee shop and the owner is absolutely amazing. It feels more like home than a coffee shop. The owner helped me find a comfortable seat - she even suggested a favorite spot in the seating area. And most of the seats have power outlets which was fantastic!  All the mugs are different like what you would have in your own kitchen which I thought was lovely. Pastries were delicious, had a soy vanilla chai that was excellent and the Iced Ginger Honey Tea is everything!  Loved the vibe and the excellent customer service. Cannot wait to go back on Monday!
People are so nice I was drenched from the rain and the nice guy gave me towels! Coffee was worth it!

Can't say enough about this place! My wife and daughter stayed nearby on a trip to the city, and they ended up frequenting this shop on their stay. Unlike most coffee shops, they always had a place to sit :-) The service was so very friendly! The pastries were delicious, and the coffee was superb. Great reviews for the house ginger latte. An absolute treat!
This is my favorite coffee shop in town. Bubble tea, bagels, and sweets are super delicious here.

This coffee shop is like no other.  As a Cali native and newly NY settler, I was in dire need of finding a cafe. I now have to look no further.  The coffee, hospitality, hours, & space is perfect. The coffee is tasty & strong, which will keep you alert to finish your work. Also, the owner Mi-Young & Hok (I think that's how you spell their names [if not I apologize in advance you two!]) are nothing but great. Do you plan on working? Yes? Go on and visit! There are several outlets located by each table inside & if you need fresh air to do work, there's a patio as well.  Honestly, this place fits all the criteria of an ideal study cafe. However, I would suggest one thing: more mellow music.  I have found my home cafe. Thank you!
Omg so delicious, friendly and wonderful !!! The ginger honey tea is to die for !! So so good :)

Went in for some coffee and breakfast sandwiches. When we asked for sugar they told us they only had spenda. When we asked for some ketchup, they offered hot sauce... hahaha..  good food and coffee with nice folks working, but didn't have basics down. Management should be embarrassed for not ordering their inventory on time .

Was walking through the neighborhood and wandered in. So glad I did! The owner is a gem, the coffee is delicious, and the bagels are out of this world! Quiet atmosphere that's warm in the winter. Great place to meet a friend or do some work.

LOVE THIS PLACE!!  Kinda hoping it stays a hidden gem so I can always have a seat to do homework! I usually come in week nights in my NYU hoodie warmly welcomed by the owner right away. Located right by Time Square area tucked in right between Hells Kitchen is UT47! The coffee shop is a block away is from my place and as a student it is so convenient. The space is really big and even has a patio for you to sit outside. The drinks are greatly priced and they come out real fast. The bathroom is literally five stars on its own!! Super clean and spacious things we do not hear in NYC. The music is just casual cafe music you would hear anywhere else. The lighting is bright, but not too bright where your eyes can not manage any longer. The wifi works super fast and they are so nice about giving it. The staff is super interactive and makes you feel at home. I usually don't give yelp reviews, but the past two weeks doing homework and studying for midterms this place has been amazing!!! Thank you to everyone who works here :)
Delightful cafe in the midst of the mid town madness. Lovely decor and a nice chill vibe. The staff were friendly and fast service.

I love how this cafe is set up and the decorations! Great location! The staff is very friendly and pleasant! But here's why it's getting the 2 stars:  I bought the Aussie Waffles to go (Waffles with Bacon and Eggs) and it wasn't great:  1. The waffles was super bland.  2. The syrup it came with wasn't as thick as any other syrup. In fact it was a bit watery.  3. Some of the waffle/breakfast places usually gives you butter with waffles along with the syrup. This doesn't come with butter at all. I don't know if they forgot to add the butter or they just don't add it at all.  4. The bacon was a bit too salty.  5. The eggs wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best.  6. The sad part about this is that all of this was $11 something. There's other places (even at lower income neighborhoods) that have better tasting waffles, bacon and eggs for half the price. I feel that this was overpriced.  Nice staff and atmosphere. The food, not so much.

Both me and my bf ordered the bacon waffle because it sounded really good but it was nothing close to what we expected. We both didn't like the food, the waffle was bland and had no taste but the bacon was way too salty, and the hot chocolate was the worst of all! How can someone mess up on making hot coco? It tasted nothing like hot coco and it wasn't sweet at all. Terrible experience, wouldn't not come back.

Got the "Toads in a hole". Simple yet so delicious. Service is great here. Cafe is a bit small but there are a few tables and tools by the front facing the street and some by another wall. Great place for a snack, quick meal or break. Kind of cramped to do your studying or work on a laptop but if you have nowhere else to go still a good place to get some work done (they have outlets!)

Disappointing.  Came here for lunch really looking forward to great waffles - pictures online looked very enticing.  We ordered the chocolate waffles, the Aussie waffles, and the cocoa waffle with mashed avocado.  All waffles were soft and chewy and cold - major disappointment.  Aunt Jemima waffles heated in my toaster oven come out crispy and soft on the inside, much better than what we got here.  On top of that, no butter was offered for the aussie and the chocolate waffles.  Also, when I asked for syrup, they pointed me to the two bottles next to the napkin station - one was for honey and the other one for a very liquidy syrup, which I believe might have been for the coffee.    Decor is cute, but seating is lacking.  Tables were taken by guests who were lingering over their cup of coffee.  There is limited counter seating along the window and one wall.  Will not return.

In person this place is awesome!!!    For Delivery- I am extremely disappointed. The food was edible, and some of it good. What I am not happy with is how much it cost & the quality for the exorbitant pricing. The oats bowl was $9 and when we got it I was so shocked with how small it was and how it was watery. $9 I expect something much larger than 5oz of oats and watery milk. I understand that Nyc is expensive but there is a line. And they crossed it.

***Small seating area, Great service, WiFi available***  This review is only on their drinks. I had a matcha latte and it was delicious. There's several seatings available but it is small. I definitely would come back to try their food, but otherwise, nothing that unique about the cafe.

New York is unfortunately way behind in the coffee culture. I've spent three weeks here and have gone to various cafes across Manhattan with average to poor results when it comes to getting a simple latte. They definitely don't get coffee especially the latte types. If you want a creamy smooth perfect coffee this place is by far the best coffee I've had in New York. Being from Melbourne, "the coffee capital of the world", I must say I now have a new home. Thank you @wattlecafenyc !! Their simple and fresh breakfast menu was also a feel you have from our cafes in Melbourne. Staff are great too. Thanks again.
Came here on recommendation and doesn't disappoint, nice decor, reasonably priced food and nice staff- it's a gem in this neighborhood to check out

We had the smoked salmon and smash avocado with truffle eggs and the dark chocolate waffles. The smash avocado was amazing and the truffle eggs truly enhanced the flavour of the dish. However, the dark chocolate waffles were quite terrible. They were dry and pretty tasteless and disappointing. However, the staff was helpful when we complained and gave us some house jam for the waffles which was better but charged us an additional fee for the jam.  For drinks, we had the latte and the milo milkshake (iced). The latte was great, however the milo milkshake could have been more chocolatey.  The Tim Tams were a wonderful surprise and are must to try if you have never had it before.  Overall, wattle cafe is a cute new addition to midtown, with great eggs and avocado and is worth coming here just for that.

Health comes with price. Travelled all the way from queens to Manhattan to go to this cafe for waffle, but instead tried the Mocha Mud Smoothie and Hummus Avocado Smash Sandwich where lets just say enjoyed every bit of it. I could feel the roasted peppers in my taste buds. I dont know maybe add a bit of Honey and it might taste something different. However please give it a go. It was worth the money paid for. Will come in next time for the waffle!!

AMAZING coffee! If you are looking for the authentic Australian coffee experience, you've found the right place. Couldn't have been happier with my flat white. They also serve TIM TAMS! Don't miss a chance to experience Australian coffee culture at its finest.
I would never come to this place again. This is too pricey for a single espresso $3.75. And the coffee cup was just almost empty.  They are very rude on the counter as well.

Unexpected but wonderfully delicious flavor combinations with all organic ingredients. Service was so hospitable and when we discovered a slight error in our order, the owner went above and beyond with a free dessert (and a friendly chat!). Would say I'd return to support them, but if I'm honest it's for the tasty food!
Very nice little place to take a break, listen to music and of course enjoy very yummy house made waffles and house made jam.
The place is nice and friendly. The coffee is quite good but not the best New York has to offer. Food looks great. Ruth Haephrati. Michael Haephrati

Only tried the food. The cheddar biscuit was delicious but the salad was pretty bad. I had a chicken salad and the chicken, aside from being dry, was clearly old (the surface was tough). Seems like it would be a pleasant place to work/read though.

Wasn't thrilled with anything about this cafe. The coffee was okay at best. I was looking for a good place to do sim e work and the space was empty for reasons that became obvious. The chairs and tables are at awkward heights, not good for working. The music was loud and the machines are as well. Better place if you're looking to just grab some quick coffee and go.

Cute little cafe (only 3 tables - the window table is more spacious and has a bench with pillows though) with at-home vibes. Great service with tea recs. I ended up with a lemon ginger tea that cleared my sinuses right up!  Only problem is that they don't ACTUALLY have wifi. Their wifi was the Time Warner Cable free wifi that every electronic device user can login to for 30 minutes per month (if not a Time Warner subscriber). Your wifi connection goes dead after 30 minutes of use.  I would come here to catch up with friends or do some reading and writing, but it's basically impossible to do any work that requires internet service.

Such a charming place, and they serve nutella lattes!  Key word: nutella.  Also, the girl working the day I stopped by was insanely gorgeous, which may have altered my perception of everything.  Seriously though, she was a talented barista, and was extremely welcoming and genuine.  Take that Brooklyn coffee shops!
This place is quite cozy with a great local coffee shop vibe. I had the chai with almond milk today, and it was delightful!

First of all, this is my favorite coffee in nyc. I would usually travel to midtown from the east village just to enjoy it. But this new branch is suffering from a very poor attitude and customer service, the employees were not hospitable and apparently even if you are standing in line for coffee, it doesn't seem like you should be rewarded the code to the bathroom. Gave it two starts only because the coffee and pastries were excellent, but the staff should be replaced. Will not be going back there even when I have business conferences in the building.

High quality espresso (super wide selection), pastries (highly recommend the apricot cookie), and sandwiches (try the prosciutto and ask them to heat it up for you). They are a bit pricey, but very fast and convenient. IMPT NOTE: they do not serve normal coffee/iced coffee (only espresso beverages).

I love this place. Their espresso is consistently delicious and their staff are warm and welcoming. They have great biscotti and baci di dama along with a killer sfogliatelle. I gotta try their little sandwiches sometime - the sopressata and mortadella look beautiful. I love espresso and I do like variety so I enjoy other shops too, but this is just a lovely location and I find it easy to pop in once a day (twice if I have the time) to enjoy great coffee and a friendly spot al banco.

I live a block away from this place and go there on a semi regular basis.  Pros: They have an extensive deli-like menu with some healthy options.  Coffee is generally decent.    Cons: They often mess up orders.  It's actually kind of ridiculous and comical at this point.    The orders can take forever to get made, so if you're in a hurry go somewhere else.    Overall, this place is a block away from me so I will continue to go there.  However, if you don't live in the neighborhood I would suggest going elsewhere.
A great cozy spot in west village to take a coffee, a bagel or even a smoothie. One of the best place for me held by French people. Merci pour l'accueil !

A convenient, quick, friendly place to grab a bite and get your caffeine fix. The coffee is above average, but not something that I'd seek out if not around the corner. The breakfast wraps have been just OK. The few that I've had were rather soggy. A fine option for a relatively inexpensive meal, but nothing special.
my favorite coffee and breakfast spot in the West Village. Very authentic. I love the truffle sandwich and they do great juices.

Very seldom do I feel compelled to write reviews - but this place deserves to have its praises sung. This west village hot spot is incredibly welcoming. "To go - or to stay?" I will always prefer the latter. The staff is engaging and friendly to everyone that walks through the door. Not to mention, jamming to indie rock beats while cooling off with a delicious iced latte made my first encounter even more joyous. As a West Virginian who comes from the land of southern hospitality - the 11th street cafe is as good as they come. A+ in my book.

I stopped going to this place mainly because the owners run it like a little chatty social club, and if you're not a member, don't expect to get any kind of decent service.  MANY times when I used to go in, there'd be a decent-size line while the owner chatted away with a customer/friend/club member at the front of the line while I waited and waited and waited.  There was even a time or two when a person in line in back of me was "recognized" and served before me.  I started an informal, unofficial, personal boycott and then realized I wasn't missing much anyway by not coming here (everything's overpriced at least by a little compared to competitors in the area and the coffee isn't very good -- tea is better they bag it to order)  and so I just stopped coming.

Simply love the coffee here and like the croissants too. The staff is polite and pleasant. They have a nice seating area upstairs. Haven't got anything else here so can't say much on the quality of other items.
I recommend the cheese cake cone. The service was good. We sat on the second floor, it was a bit loud but very good place overall

I came across this place while looking for somewhere to sit have a coffee and do some work on my computer. Immediately when I arrived I was greeted by an upbeat pleasant manager who helped me find seating in the busy lounge upstairs. A friendly server took my order and within 5 minutes I received a delicious cappuccino. This place is amazing, the manager Zak introduced himself, made me feel welcome, and made sure everything was okay. It was like he knows new faces walking into the building. Not many places in NYC have such attentive staff like this! You guys won me over! I'll definitely be back!

One of my friends recommended that we catch up at 2Beans and I'm glad that she did. We dropped in on a Saturday and found plenty of comfortable seating upstairs. If you have ever struggled to find just one wooden chair at Starbucks, then you will appreciate how nice the ambiance is here.  2Beans makes their specialty drinks too sweet for my taste - I ordered the Autumn in NY cappuccino but will choose something more basic next time. My drink was also really small (more of a tea cup rather than a standard coffee cup size). They did serve my drink with a small piece of chocolate which was delicious, and a glass of water which was thoughtful.
Love this place. Mellow atmosphere, sweet staff... a bit too sweet (mocha) but still delicious.
Good coffee Small place good for an in and out or just to chill out for 15m or so. Not a lot of food options but it's cute small and clean.

Hate to give this cozy, unassuming coffee shop a mediocre review- but folks should know that this isn't the place to visit for pastries/food. While the coffee is decent and the service is good, the pastries are some of the most disappointing I've experienced. The chocolate croissant, for example, had zero fluffiness- tasted like a bland, day old stale croissant even though it was only 8:30AM. The same was true for their ham and cheese croissant. This was especially disappointing because both looked so good and were semi-egregiously priced between $3.50 and $4.50.  That said, the coffee is decent and this is a more low-key cafe alternative to Dominique Ansel around the corner.
Favorite coffee shop in soho. I love this place because they serve Gimme! Coffee which is from my hometown in upstate NY. Has the small coffee shop feel which i love. Will continue to come back
Really good espresso drinks and solid pastries. Friendly staff. Fairly small but actually a decent place to do some laptoping or writing.
Super cute coffee shop. It's super tiny and doesn't have air conditioning, but very quaint with nice employees. The wifi didn't work when I was there, so might not be the best for working.

The owner is SO nice and so kind. The coldbrew has complex flavor but a simple clean finish in taste-- all in all, great coffee. Was in and out in under 2 minutes, but not before the owner/barista wished us a nice day. Fun to find that kind of friendliness in this city, and not to mention such a pleasant experience. Make this your regular stop, not starbucks! Much quicker and MUCH tastier!

This is a really cute and calm space, at least for the time I went. I love the white brick walls, wood tabletops, fresh flowers, etc.  Not to mention the food looks stinkin' cute in those glass jars. Talk about hip!  Ironically, I craved a chai latte (even though it was nearly 80 degrees outside in October, go figure) so that's what I ordered. Sadly it just didn't hit the bar for chai lattes; felt like too much hot water and not enough chai, if you know what I mean.  Anyway, my drink was meh but the space is cute and I got some work done. I'd be willing to come back and give this place another try in the future.
Really nice French coffee shop. Very good bakery and coffee. Served by owner (French also), so authenticity is assured.

I love this beautiful little place! The food is healthy and delicious, and the concept behind it is eco-friendly and creative. The owner is so sweet, and it's a lovely place to either run in and pick up something to take to work, or sit for a bit with coffee and a friend. They also have WIFI and a lovely counter space where you can sit and watch the passersby. I will certainly keep coming back and telling my friends!

I wanted coffee on a cold winter day.  The Yelp reviews were great for this place so I took the short walk from my hotel in 25 degree temps and honestly my coffee was nothing to brag about.  I got a honey latte but the flavor of the coffee wasn't dynamic to me.  I probably won't return here on future visits or recommend.  My 3 stars may be generous for my experience.

This is a nice interior coffee shop! I felt the customer service was a 3 because the server seemed really hasty to take order and not really communicate with the customer. She asked me what I would like twice when I was trying to decide and when she made my drink, there was no latte art. Beside that it's nice there is WiFi and bathroom. There is some space/seating to do work and meet with friend. My matcha hot latte was 5.40$ ish and that's pretty $$ but it did give me a lot of energy. It is near battery park and Nyack college so convenient. The mood is definitely rustic and it's above UPS store so it's easy to miss it! Their ice chai tea is great but also 4.90$ for such a small cup. #NYC haha I would come back for their pastries, and to work there.

We stopped here for breakfast on a Saturday . It's a cold stainless steel place. I suppose very urban and I guess based upon its location is good for those who work nearby. Very limited menu including coffee. You'd get more out of a Starbucks. Not impressive in any way. It's fine but I'd look somewhere else unless you just want to stop in and leave with a basic coffee maybe a bagel with a pot of Philadelphia cream cheese

FREE WIFI!  Around $5 for a medium iced honey latte, which was fine in my books (considering how it's NYC and everything). But, the coffee itself wasn't anything special. For a coffee shop that boasts about its organic nature and all that fanciness, I honestly did notice anything more robust or different about their coffee. Interior-wise, the industrial-like interior felt quite cold and uninviting. But on the plus side, I stayed for around 3 hours just to do some work and wasn't kicked out or anything. So that was nice!

Contrary to what other yelpers said I found the espresso to be not on the strong side. Ordered a Soy Cappuccino here and expected it to be have a strong coffee flavor like other shops in the area...i was a bit disappointed. To be honest, i'm not sure if it was something to do with the ground they used, but i really wanted to like this place as it's got a lot of other pro's (Plenty of seating, great baristas, free wifi, moody lighting)  maybe I will come by another day and see how it is. But so far not so happy with the coffee. If you guys like all the other menu items this place offers, feel free to check it out.. better luck next time for me!  (CUPS friendly coffee shop btw)

Good-quality beverages and fast but smile-less service. Does it hurt to smile?  Very limited baked goods selection and extremely bare-bones industrial feel to the interior. No art. No warmth. Connected to an office building and has entrances from the street and from the lobby.

Incredibly rude service and I have been to a lot of coffee shops around the country. I have never had such a rude service as this place.  I bought a coffee and was not impressed. I will hang out at another coffee shop instead.
Great coffee and services. The manager here is really nice that she provided a complimentary replacement after I had accidentally spilt my coffee.

Bean and Bean has become my afternoon pick me up coffee spot. Small cozy little coffee spot in FIDI with great customer service. The staff are always super sweet when I come in. My new addiction is there ice coffee with vanilla syrup and soy milk. Yummy!  With so many coffee spots in FIDI, this place is one of my favorites along side Starbucks of course. On the plus side there coffee is organic. I feel there prices are cheap which is great!!! When you drink as much coffee as I do and being able to paying under $4 for a large ice coffee makes me a very happy camper.  The only con to this place is the lighting it's really dull would be nice if it was brighter inside. All in all I will continue to return here and enjoy there yummy coffee and great customer service.

First the disclaimer:  I'm in the coffee business, but do no "official" business with these folks.  I do, however, stop in from time to time for a cup of coffee and a muffin on the way to work.  The coffee is excellent - been enjoying their Tanzanian Peaberry pour over lately.  Staff is chill, good music, not too busy, definitely not overcrowded, and they keep it moving.  The muffins are so good I now have muffin handles, which is not a good thing.  Drat!  No more muffins for a while.  Nice place to stop for well selected, well prepared coffee, caring staff, and a place to sit if you are so inclined.  Pour over and muffin comes to $8, which is a reflection of drinking a single origin coffee prepared lovingly with patience.  Your bill probably will be less.

Really good coffee shop in Fidi, a neighborhood overrun by fast-paced cafes and starbuckses.  Staff is super nice. Great place to sit with laptop and do some work. A few more savory food options would be welcome, however.
Much more comfortable than Starbucks and close to the office. Ice coffee is reasonable.

First time here! I always pass by and see the Organic Coffee sign and was in the mood to try it today. Just ordered a regular coffee, and put 2 RAW sugar and half/half. The coffee is quite true to it's description: full-bodied, aromatic and balanced. Not sour, and a pleasure to drink. Just finished it and I'm left wishing I ordered a larger size :) This is kind of of coffee that would go well with dark chocolate.  The decor is rustic old style kind of feel, but the cleanliness is so-so. There was a fly entertaining itself near the cream/sugar/napkin area, not very appealing. 4 stars for the great coffee, but I'd give it 3 stars for the lack of cleanliness.

Best iced matcha latte I've ever had. Heavy on the matcha, but well-mixed and not clumpy. It's very lightly sweet -- I don't usually add sugar to my matcha or coffee, but this was juuust the right amount to make it super delicious but not make you feel guilty.
Great place to work out of. The environment was very relaxing and quiet for the most part. Also loved the music playing throughout the day!

I'm very picky when it comes to coffee, so when I say Bean and Bean has some of the best coffee I've ever had, it means a lot.  First off, the atmosphere here is welcoming. You walk in and its like you've escaped the hectic city life. The baristas are friendly and knowledgeable about the coffee they're making.  The espresso drinks are made to perfection every time and the brewed coffee is always hot and delicious.  All in all this place is a great spot to get an awesome cup of coffee and chill out for a while.
Yum! The coffee was perfect and my mom loved the hot chocolate. The staff was very friendly and made me a beautiful latte. I wish they had this coffee shop where I live!

The matcha lattes here are my favorite! Apart from the fact that it's close to the subway and is fast/moderately fast service when you're on the go, they accept CUPS and I got $10 off using a promo code I found through Yelp (2zbgi)
My drink was pretty much just ice.. Easy fix yeah but still wouldn't return as the flavor itself didn't impress much

This cafe boasts its organic origins, and it makes a big point to mention its organic nature throughout the store.  Some great things I noticed: 1) It was well heated! 2) The door is a revolving door, meaning that the cafe does not get chilly with each new customer. 3) Quick service. 4) Variation of seating choices (e.g., wooden chairs plus more comfy chairs).  I got a large tea for $2.35. I kind of wish they had had more decaffeinated choices.  I read here for an hour. The music here was all over the place: r&b, pop, folky... Maybe I just noticed because I was reading, but it was almost as if two people were fighting over the radio. It was a little odd.

A comfy spot with good drinks is all you can ask for.  I get the honey latte and usually chill in one of the comfy chairs not close to the door.  One minor gripe - why only a one stall bathroom?! Not great when you have a diuretic but much appreciate that it is clean and always functioning!
Hands down one of the best coffee in the city! Love their Latte! It's silky, smooth and leaves no after taste!
Excellent staff wonderful customer service really enjoyed being there they should be proud of their work getting ready for New Year's eve partyBest of luck to the staff and their customers

I thought these guys pick up their game! I come here probably once a year,  whenever I'm in the neighborhood. With all these amazing (3rd wave) coffee spots opening throughout  the city, i figured a spot like this would elevate their coffee making abilities. Kinda disappointed. They have an espresso machine that's terrific but they're making steamed milk like  Starbucks :(

My favorite morning coffee (& occasionally) bagel spot. Best coffee in the area, hands down. Don't let the long line fool you - this place is super efficient and the line moves fast. And even if it doesn't, do yourself a favor and wait that extra minute because you will be rewarded with a coffee that will make it all worth it... Also worth to note, their milks (regular, skim + soy) are all organic.

This place is super cute and cozy. Pricer than your usual cafe, but I had a tenka deal and tried their organic latte YUM!!!  The staff are nice and the cafe is clean. They also have these super comfy armchairs. I would go back to treat myself once in a while to a latte, but too pricy for a cup o' joe.

With its close proximity to Wall Street, you would think this place is filled with stressed out ibankers and traders, downing caffeine while discussing "liquidity of the capital markets."  Fortunately, this little coffee shop with its even littler revolving doors is a cozy place to get away from the stresses of FiDi and relax over a cup of joe. The service is speedy and the servers are sweet (Jinna adores alliteration, can you tell?)  The coffee itself is of  very good quality; (good for all you black-coffee-drinkers out there). The seating area is small though, with little round tables that seat 2, or 3 at best. Definitely stop by for a warm cup of java sometime!

A strong aroma of coffee hit me when I entered the elevator @ work.    What is that? Oh..Bean & Bean. Thanks & Exit the elevator walk straight to Bean & Bean. They offer a variety of organic and fair trade coffee and tea that will make your Monday easier, Tuesday getting there, Wednesday I almost see the beach, Thursday Cabs are here and Friday yeahh Buddy!!  This place is unsuspiciously roomier inside with comfortable chairs/tables.

A pleasant alternative to the ever prevalent Starbucks.  Advantages of the their coffee includes the beans being roasted daily, and all of their beans being organic and fair trade.  The taste holds up too!  Additionally I opted for one of their chocolate brownies.  It didn't look like much through the display window, but it ended up being rich and delicious!  I really thought the richness of the brownie played well with the robustness of the coffee.  I was pleased.  Quick, courteous service too.  The only drawback is the inflated prices, even for Fi-Di.

it's true, you really do feel like you are walking into a Starbucks when you go here, but the taste of the coffee is markedly different.  It's organic, which adds to the higher price point, but the quality and taste is better.  I really like their lattes and we have also bought beans from here to make coffee at home.  A little overpriced, but again, better tasting than Starbucks.    If I feel like doing a splurge, I'll stop here for a latte, but honestly, I prefer the Big Love coffee truck on Wall Street.  The coffee here doesn't really stand out, but it's doable and the staff here is super friendly.  They will grind your beans for you also if you chose to buy beans in bulk and go organic!

Clean, large space, not too loud music, outlets and comfy chairs! It's a great place to study at. Plus, they make the drinks fast. Reminds me of when I play diner dash. Thanks for the smiley face on my cup Erica! It made my day!

One of the better iced coffees I've had, and AMAZING bagels. Fresh, spot on fluffy-to-chewy ratio. (Although to be honest, I haven't eaten many East Coast bagels to compare them with)  Quick and friendly staff and baristas. I don't know why the listing states three $'s, it's not any more expensive than neighboring establishments. Slightly cheaper and light years better than Starbucks.
This place is a great hideaway when you need a little break from the workday and don't want to deal with a crowded Starbucks.

$5 dollar minimum for credit/debit cards but other than that, awesome! I had the fresh organic parfait this morning with blueberries and strawberries in addition to my medium iced coffee. Great place for healthy snacks and yummy drinks. Also lots of seats to do work or meet up with a friend.

Disclaimer: I don't drink Coffee.  I love this coffee shop. Free Wireless, lots of tea choices. They serve  hot cereal in the mornings with fresh cut fruit. Many many Organic and healthy choices. No credit card minimums, and not overpriced at all.
Some bourgeois organic coffee.  Albeit, they serve up a mean Americano.  Prime location and decently priced.

I work nearby so I come here about once a week. The place is very hit or miss. Sometimes I get a great cup of coffee. Other times the coffee is so weak I might as well be drinking hot water. Other times, I get a mouthful of coffee grinds especially towards the bottom of the cup. I don't know if the staff is aware of these problems.  The staff is always friendly but busy.

So after some thought, I'm giving you another star, Bean & Bean. Here are my reasons:  more food: try the multigrain berry muffin or the cappucino one. I remember they had these muffins at Dean and Deluca in Soho and I liked them then too.  and! the secret passageway from the 4/5 train to Bean & Bean.  I would give 5 stars if they weren't so damn expensive.

Coffee is all right but DAMN the wireless Internet is ABYSMAL!!!!!!!!!!  Can't do work!  What is a coffee shop without WIFI?  Thumbs down!  This mars the ability to enjoy the Financial District experience.

I got a caramel macchiato (macchiato as in Starbucks style) and my friend got a peppermint hot chocolate. She really liked hers, and mine was pretty good as well! I'd get it again even though it's kinda pricey. It's fair trade and organic, a much better and ethical alternative to Starbucks. Service was nothing special.

The coffee is generally pretty good but the skill level of the staff is inconsistent. If you're lucky, you get a trained barista who can foam milk into a velvety canvas before painting a pattern on it with your espresso. Unfortunately, once in a while you'll get a "dunkin donut" trained employee and end up with a weak bubbly mess.
Their chai latte is amazing...as is their marble cake!

The coffee preparation is inconsistent and most of the baristas are dim-witted at best.  When there's a good one on board, the coffee is delicious.  But the service is inconsistent and occasionally with attitude when called on mistakes instead of apology.  If you can afford the prices and want to deal with inconsistency, you can occasionally get a very good cup of coffee and a generally pleasant atmosphere.
Pretty crazy overpriced, but not surprising given the ear. Very busy on a weekday afternoon. Desserts good/ok, not really above average. Service was fine.

I just love the vibe of this cafe, from its dim lighting to its warm atmosphere. They serve some of the best drinks and desserts in the city, so be sure to drop by for a cup of coffee or a macaron. I myself come here occasionally for a cup of coffee with a sandwich or a macaron (usually Nutella or chocolate), and they never disappoint.
Adorable little bakery/cafe. I had an incredible Brie and truffle panini and two delightful macarons. Highly recommend!
Phenomenal coffee, great pastry selection, and friendly service. Wish it was closer to my apt but either way I'm definitely returning.

I just had coffee but I really like the place. very cute, very french, very pleasant to have a coffee with a friend. I don't go out to UES much but If I found myself in the area I will go back because it bring you this cozy feeling that you are looking for in winter.
How cute is this place?! What a fun area - their soups are always fun and fresh - and the people working there are so friendly!! Definitely worth a stop - their marble cookies are so amazing!

Needed a coffee. Badly. And a snack. Was on Madison. Sooooo hard to find anything anymore to eat (reasonably) on Madison in the 60's or 70's. And I didn't have the cash to buy any Haute Couture at Gucci to snag a free coffee from them. Fell into Bel Ami. Lovely staff, lovely environment, lovely owner, and a great iced latte and mini pain au choc. I wish I didn't have lunch plans or I totally would've gone for one of their tempting sandwiches and stayed longer.  C'est la vie; next time I find myself in that enclave to over priced (and ugly?) clothing I most definitely will... A bient̫t...
Great coffee, pastries and sandwiches!!! Prices are fair, nice staff. Ham and brie was delicious

Came across this patisserie on the way to Central Park and immediately fell in love. Even my brother loves it, who is at some times hard to please. Their coffee is delicious as are their pastries. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is so comfortable you almost don't want to leave. Can't wait to go back and try more!

I came here when I had to kill about an hour in the area. The sign outside said they had cold coffee drinks and it was cold inside, so I said why not?  I ordered the cold brew -- don't judge me! It tasted pretty great even black, which always says good things about the coffee.  The shop was pretty tiny with one communal table and a few seats by the window, so there isn't much room. The staff was pleasant enough: not overly friendly but decent.  My biggest complaint is the lack of Wifi. I was pretty sure that's a staple at coffee shops!
Cute coffee shop! Decent coffee for fair prices. Would come back here again!  They don't have free WiFi.

Mmmmm... coffee.  I love good coffee. Sadly my cold brew tasted very bland/watered down, or something just didn't taste right :( However my friends said their cappuccino and macchiato were pretty good. The staff were quick and efficient but not the friendliest. They gave me this look when I asked for milk to put in my cold brew.  I did like the interior/ambience of the cafe. It's a bit small so it's a nice spot to stop by for a quick coffee, but probs not the ideal place to sit down and get some work done.  I'd def be down to try their hot drinks next time when I'm in the area!
Came here because of nice review but nothing really that makes it stands out.  Coffee is decent and service is just okay.

I stopped into Birch for the first time on a sweltering summer day to finish up some readings for a class. The interior is tiny, with enough seating for perhaps 10, which turned out to be more than enough spots for all the patrons sipping in. It  at first seemed quite warm inside, but I got used to the temperature pretty quickly and gene really thought the room felt pleasant.  I ordered a large cold brew with a splash of milk and settled in on a stool facing the street. The cold brew was exactly as it should be: bold and aromatic. The cold brew that I've sampled tends to taste pretty similar most places, but that's fine because it's usually good.  One minor complaint is that the establishment has no public bathroom. I was directed to the library down the street, which wasn't a problem, but the bathroom there was a little gross.

Love Birch coffee, but the staff in this outlet were awful. Very rude and on telling them that the coffee wasn't as I desired, I was told - made it as you asked.  I'm going to stick to the one on 27th street. They are the best.
Incredible coffee. So glad to have a top notch coffee spot by me now. Great service and staff. Always plays good music.
Great spot to start your day. Top dudes here put a smile on your face, cosy spot to take in what lies ahead and the joe hits the spot. Nice work guys.

I had the chance to visit this Birch Coffee location while catching up with friend who was visiting the city. I've been to several Birch locations but this was my first time at their spot on west 14th street.  Walking in I instantly noticed that it's smaller than their other locations around the city. It has about four high top tables and a small counter top where you're able to enjoy your beverage. Honestly though I'd say this spot is best to grab and go with your coffee since the seats fill up pretty fast.  I ended up ordering a small 12 oz. coffee that came out to be $2.75. Compared to other options in the area I'd say this was a little steep as well, especially given the fact they only had one brew.  Overall an ok spot to grab a quick coffee and head out. There are a few other options in the area with larger seating spaces I'd check out first though if that's something you're looking for.

I had a good experience here. The space is very small - smaller then most other coffee shops. There's no space for lingering...you come in, get your order and have to move on your way.  The cold brew was decent. I was in and out quickly during rush hour. There were a good amount of employees on, so everything moved fluidly. Got caught snapping a photo of the menu for my Yelp check-in. Always feel a bit strange trying to snap those.  I will likely return to try something else on the menu. Sounds like some of the other menu items may be worth another try.

Birch a solid little coffee shop on the edge of the West Village.  It is less of a coffee shop in the classic sense, where you pull up a table and do work or snuggle up in an easy chair and read a book over your chai latte.  It is more of a coffee kiosk.  It is a very small shop, with only a few stools.  Also, the menu of pastries, etc. is limited as well.  However, if you are looking for good coffee to get in get out and go on your way, this is a good place for you.    Personally, I am not a huge fan of their coffee, but it is pretty good.  I think the taste part of coffee all comes down to personal preference.  Regarding the get in/out/go part, they are located about 50 feet from the 1/2/3 14th Street stop.

I've had birch before and liked it, so I went to quickly stop in this evening for a cappuccino.    Walked in at 7:49, they close at 8, and the employees told me they couldn't serve me anything but iced coffee or tea because the machine "shuts itself down" and was already turned off. I used to be a barista so I'm pretty sure that was a lie. Even if it was hypothetically true, the machine should shut down at 8 when the store closes. Bad experience.

A nice place to pick up a cup and do a hang out for a short bit. Not so much for working or intense conversation.  The cold brew we had was solid (and popular, as evidenced by the ability to purchase growlers of it). The iced latte I had was pretty forgettable. The chocolate cookie was good. Overall, definitely worth checking out if you're interested in New York coffee.  * 1 visit

Great coffee, though it took forever (they're on par with Blue Bottle waiting times here). I get it, though - it takes time for the good stuff. Anyway, I had a great skim latte and my friend liked her cortado.  Edit 7/2018: iced coffee is excellent and they serve Underwest Doughnuts now. Can't go wrong with the Car Wash!! The cheddar scone was a bit of a letdown so definitely go for the doughnuts instead.

Just a quick tip for this one -- it was on the Yelp "accepts Apple Pay" search results map for me this morning, but they do NOT accept Apple Pay here.  Great cold brew, though!! And the interior is very nice. They have a selection of pastries for breakfast (sweet almond croissant, muffins, etc) and I bought a LENKA nut and berries bar for $3. Pretty good!

Birch risks feeling pretentious with a tiny area and fairly high prices, but the friendly staff makes it feel more human. There are only three small tables inside and some room at the bar, but not restroom. The coffee is solid, about what you'd get at Stumptown, not as good as Blue Bottle. The water jug inside is nice though as I tend to get dehydrated with coffee pretty easily.

I work in the East Village and this location is closest to my job. Since I enjoy the Upper East Side location, I wanted to give this one a try. I've been here twice and twice I've been disappointed with my latte.   Not only is the cup tiny, the latte itself is extremely acidic. I don't know if it's the beans they use or it's just not prepared well, but the coffee tastes acrid.   The place itself is very small and can feel cramped. There's also no wifi and no bathroom. Even though I love the location and service is friendly enough, I probably won't return.

My only complaint is the door creaks like a raging demon each time somebody exits or enters- being that I like to hang out in coffee places for a long time while I write, I get to hear that door many dozens of times. Aside from that, I always love Birch for its high quality beverages and top notch staff, I'm not an expert on coffee but I've only gotten great cups here. This is a terrific stop off for anyone in need of some Joe while crossing thru the neighborhood or getting some errands done- they also have a nice atmosphere (even better whenever that door gets some grease) and a casual coffee meet, or a place to get some typing done, great place. They only have a few seats so only a few folks at a time can hang, but it's a cozy and nice place when you get a table.

Awesome little coffee shop in the West Village! I had some time to spare before meeting my boyfriend for lunch, so I made the walk over to grab a cup of joe. I got a small iced latte...wow, that's some strong coffee! It was delicious and really hit the spot since it was so hot out.  The interior is cozy. There are maybe 3-4 tables if you're here with friends. There's also 3-4 counter seats that look out of the widow towards the street.  Great spot to grab a coffee and breakfast pastries!
Awesome vibe and coffee.  One of the best roasts in town.  Smiling cool people who work there and frequent the place. A wonderful place to start the day.
Homemade pop tart (aka Megpies ($4) on the menu)! Go Blueberry!  And cold brew on tap!

This place is super adorable and what an amazing find! They have vegan pastry options and even serve soy and hemp milk (though it's not on their menu). I had the decaf almond tea and it smelled amazing along with tasting great. The staff were friendly and polite. They even do the leaf designs in their coffee much to my delight. My friends loved their cappuccino and cortado.  Will return for sure!

Wow!! Perky, vibrant, inviting and fantastic. Well you think I was talking about the coffee, right?? That's just the friendly barista before the cup of Joe arrived.  Real cozy place stopped by on a Friday nite and ordered my usual but the service of the wonderful female server made the Iced Latte more enjoyable. I mean come on get service with a smile and polite banter in New York City very organic feel to this place.  Plus they were putting the cookies away as i peered the peanut butter cookie which was chewy and delicious. Off the beaten path this place makes a really good cup of coffee. I would skip the major chains and stop by here anytime.

Great spot for coffee and beer and chinwags with the bookish English major you're trying to slip it to.    But come on, Birch: you're located in NYC! WiFi needs to be a top priority when Starbuck's is around the corner. Dios mio, man!    But at least you guys have a bathroom that doesn't require an 18-digit password!

I have high standards for coffee and this was a smash hit. If I could give 4.5 stars though, I would because the prices are a little ridiculous (and I'm from CA so I am used to paying a lot for good coffee). Didn't have to wait long and my cortado was perfect. It is a little cramped inside but, hey, it is New York City.
Not a fan, very similar to your franchises (starbucks's, peets, coffee bean). Coffee wasn't special, drinks were too milky. There are much better options in the city.
Overpriced. That is all that needs to be said but since Yelp won't let me be succinct in my reviews I have to blah, blah, blah on.

I got a decaf iced americano and it was very good. The two guys seem to love what they do and their regulars come back.  A nice choice of tempting pastries that I somehow was able to look away from.  I would definitely go back.

Around the corner from my friend's place. Was looking for a place to get coffee, food and kill a little time. Birch delivered.  The space is tiny. It almost looked like there wouldn't be a place to sit, but there are just three tiny high tables and a little bar by the window. Probably would hold about 10 people total.  Their menu offers coffee, grilled cheese and soup. I got a latte and a grilled cheese with tomato and avocado. I'm not a coffee snob, and I thought the coffee was good. The food was also pretty tasty.  The counter people were friendly and definitely not pretentious.
This is my new  favorite coffee place in the west village. Delicious! You'd get five stars though, if you carried almond milk.
Amazing coffee shop. Limited seating and ok service, but quality of drinks are always top notch.

Tiny little coffee shop with fun baristas and good coffee. Hubby and I got a large latte and sat by the window people watching! I liked the concept of the book shelf (leave a book, take a book), but none of the books were too interesting. :)

5 stars for their lattes. The best (or at least one of the best) I've had in the city.  Definitely a step up from Irving farm coffee wise.  No credit card minimum!!! When it was Irving, the annoying minimum forced me to buy random crap just so I could get my coffee.  Minus one star for the teeny tiny size and mediocre food selection. I appreciate the gluten free and vegan options but I wish they had a little bit more of a selection... Then it would be my one stop shop every morning! Irving had bagels I think...  Staff is efficient and the owner is super involved. Don't forget to use your loyalty card! 10 drinks gets you one free!

The coffee was definitely high-quality, but my latte had an odd burnt aftertaste. I'm sure it's not usually like that though because the baristas were very friendly and definitely knew what they were doing, so I'm willing to forgive. This place is really tiny, so don't come with more than one friend!

So good!  I love that they have a wide variety of non-dairy milks to choose from, and their coffee is super tasty and very fresh.  I usually stick to a regular or iced coffee, but I've heard good thinks about their espresso too.  The store itself is very small, so not great for big groups, but perfect for a cup on the go.  The staff is polite, quick, and the d̩cor is really relaxing.  Glad to have em in my neighborhood :)

Stumbled across this place while walking across town and popped in for a quick iced coffee. It was delicious. Just a simple black, iced coffee, but oh so good. If I am near this place in the future I will be sure to stop by again.

tiny space, no bathroom- but came here to try their coffee, heard it's good. asked if we could charge our phone - behind the counter (place was empty). but no- barista didn't want to make the effort and move the grinder a little bit. not willing to help out and not friendly at all. hm, disappointing, since we left without having coffee and went to another place. will come back at some point though and give them a try with a charged phone ;)

they have extremely good coffee here.  I had the Flat White which is some Australian version of the latte but slightly richer...got it to go as I was in a rush ..but they made it pretty and tasty.  great spot.  Next time I plan on lingering here for awhile and trying out the food.

I love this place! I was sad when Irving Farm closed because I stopped there every day on the way to work- but was glad to know a new coffee shop would be opening in its place. Their cold brew is delicious and I even get the jugs from time to time to enjoy at home. Also love their rewards program- simple and effective! Staff is always friendly and gluten free granola bars are amazing

Officially one of my favorite coffee spots!! I love warm espresso drinks and they gave me an amazing hot mocha without me having to tell them to actually make my drink hot! Huge plus! The place is cozy. Only thing I would change are the stools to comfier seating. Either way I will definitely be coming back

Really cute coffee shop. Very clean and nice serivce staff. The coffee was on point and better than starbucks...no surprise there. There's not much seating area because it's a very small place but usually not too many people in there so you could probably find something. Give it a shot! It's reasonably priced too!
Good coffee. Good staff. Good place. Small so not a spot for lounging but excellent spot to grab a morning cup, especially with subway stop a few feet away.
Nice coffee shop, good for working or for a break from work. Matcha latte looks really cool but taste average... Wouldn't go out of the way to try it.

My kind of coffee place. Cute, cozy, friendly service, and yummy coffee. It was my first time here. After walking by it and reading so many great reviews about it, I had to stop by. I love supporting the non chain coffee spots. The iced macadamia milk latte was creamy and delicious. I also loved that they use metal straws. They have unique lattes and delicious food items. It makes me want to try everything on the menu. Will definitely be returning and taking my mom here as well when she visits. I don't think they had a bathroom though. Apart from that, the decor and ambiance were really great. It's an awesome spot for reading, working, socializing, or even for a first date! I already know what I'm going to order next time.

Came here for a yelp event & you can just tell this place is surrounded by good! The owners are humble & selfless and you can tell they run their business in an ethical way. Everything they serve is high quality here. They don't blend their beans here and keep the coffee true to the source. These people really know coffee and aim to deliver the highest quality experience and coffee to their customers!  I was able to try a variety of their desserts and I was blown away! My favorites were probably the matcha and sesame cakes. They were both so moist and flavorful...I'm not usually a huge fan of dessert, but these two items surprised me! Absolutely delicious. I have no complaints--the product is high quality and the owners are wonderful as well. Come here to support an ethical, local business that also just happens to serve amaaazing coffee and snacks.

As someone who goes out of their way to try new coffee shops, I couldn't resist stepping into Bird & Branch when the shop opened a few weeks ago.  The interior is spacious, modern, and clean. But more importantly, the coffee is the best I've had in recent memory. The drip origin changes frequently enough, but it's always unique and never bitter. The shop also offers a decent pastry selection, with classic croissants to new, interesting pastries.    Something I find important, the staff are incredibly FRIENDLY and happy to have new customers!  Summarizing, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Bird & Branch to anyone looking for an incredible cup of joe. It's great to sit and sip, or grab and go!

Made a bulk order 48 hours before a surprise birthday party at my office. My order was ready 1st thing in the morning and coffee was freshly brewed.  The pastries and coffee were a hit! Thanks Bird and Branch!

Beautiful new coffee shop with great drinks and coffee. I love the calming aesthetic with lots of green plants and pleasant ambient music. Pastries are very well executed. There's some seating along the walls and near the windows. Will definitely be back!
Cute nice place. Bright and cozy. Good for working on your own. The homemade almond macadamia milk latte was surprisingly good -- super rich and smooth!

This place is adorable. Their pastries are delicious (legit addicted to the black sesame pastry), and the coffee (Coffee Flight!) is even better. Perfect place for a first date/friend date/work date. It'll also look great on your IG...

Last time I was here, I was on crutches. Ordered a mocha. They serve their coffee without a lid on it, to show their coffee art. That's great, but I was in crutches, so I politely asked for a lid.  The Arista looked at me and looked at the condiment stand and said, "the lids there". I showed him my crutches and replied "I am in crutches, I don't want to spill the coffee all over the floor". He looked at me for a few seconds and reluctantly handed me a lid that was right in front of him. He must have spent more energy trying to get me out of his face than just handing me the lid to begin with.  The coffee was not memorable. Service was sub-par. Probably not going back again.

This cafe is so cute! It looks like a great place for studying and there is free WiFi. There are cute looking donuts and other pastries. I got the maple and it was quite good. Much better than good was the (admittedly cheesy but hey whatever) waffle cone macchiato. The only downer is for coffee  folk like me two may be necessary? It's petite so more like a side coffee than your real coffee if you're all bleary eyed on a weekend. All in all I loved the mix of coffee and chocolate. Yum. I'd go again if I'm in the area.

Typical cafe for coffee. The coffee was pretty good, definitely better than Starbucks.  The desserts and pastries looked delicious. My friend got the lemon blueberry donut and seemed to enjoy it a lot!

Good for getting work done - wifi is strong, free restroom, quiet space.  Coffee-wise, I was not impressed by my mocha latte. Not hot enough, not enough chocolate. Foam and presentation were there but would not order again.  Conclusion: If you're looking for a solid public spot to work from, and do not care much for coffee quality, this is the spot for you :)

this coffee shop is really cute and pretty suitable for getting work done. it's not super busy or crowded and the music is kept at a reasonable volume.  first time coming here, i got an iced oat milk latte. they source their coffee from parlor coffee, a trusted and locally grinded coffee bean company located in brooklyn, so their espresso was spot on! i only wish perhaps they offered to warm up pastries :)  it's easily accessible by train on the lexington avenue line, too! will definitely return if i'm ever in the area again.

I stopped by here since we were in a hurry and I needed my caffeine fix quick. I saw that it was on the way so we went in right after a quick glance on Yelp. It's a very cute little coffee shop a decent amount of seating (for a coffee shop). I was excited to try it since the ambiance was so nice.  Oh man. I got a latte and it was the most watered down coffee in New York. I was surprised since it had pretty decent reviews. I think the fact that the coffee wasn't hot made it worse. I saw that another reviewer mentioned that as well. Maybe if they work on that, the quality might be better?  But for now, I think there are better options available around the area for similar prices.

This is a quaint coffee shop near the hustle and bustle of Lex Ave. The barista is attentive and friendly; and the coffee is good. WiFi, seating, and outlets are available. I recommend and will be back!

I'm so happy this coffee shop opened a block over from my apartment! I've been here twice so far, each time ordering a decaf latte with almond milk, and both times it was delicious! Their coffee is so smooth and not bitter at all. The staff is all smiles and super sweet. Hoping this place sticks around!!

We had a white chocolate chai latte and a lava cake with toppings. We LOVED the drink but the cake was meh. Lava cake should have warm gooey chocolate flowing like LAVA when cut in the middle but it had jelly like filling inside. We asked but they said this is how they meant it to be.... (?) So my recommendation is not to expect lava when you order lava cake here.

Blue stripes cacao shop is a restaurant opened by the brother of the nearby Max Brenner. This is a much smaller (and much less crowded) version with lots of chocolate. The vibe is very homey - filled with plants and light and a little library in the back where you can pick up a book to read. They have a separate communal table where you can use your laptop, and then another set of tables along the wall for people looking to enjoy their food.  We got the nutella hot cocoa and the lemon donut fondue. I thought the hot chocolate was amazing - it wasn't too sweet or heavy, but was really rich. I was less impressed by the lemon donut fondue - the lemon in the mini donuts was overpowering and they only gave a really small thing of chocolate. For $11 I thought it wasn't worth it.  Overall, would come here again for another hot cocoa and perhaps a pastry. I like it much better than Max Brenner. Would recommend for a casual date or meeting up with a friend (who really loves chocolate).

We had a great second experience at Blue Stripes. Tried four unique and delicious chocolatey treats.  First was the chocolate cloud. The cloud dispenser has been updated since our first visit a few weeks ago. The drink truly tasted like chocolate mousse in drinkable form. The chocolate flavor was richer than the Nutella I previously tried - I would recommend it for a dark chocolate lover. It is best to drink it fast as it gets a little less fluffy the longer it sits.  We also tried the Nutella roll. This was my favorite. The bun is soft and moist, coated in layers of Nutella. So delicious.  Next was the lemon poppyseed donuts with milk chocolate fondue. I've never mixed lemon and chocolate flavors before and I thought it worked very well.  Finally, we tried a chocolate smoothie with fruit and pistachios. They are apparently the only place that they know of to serve drinks made of this particular part of the chocolate plant, which is a known superfood. It was delicious and not overly sweet, in fact quite refreshing.  As a chocolate lover, I appreciate the creativity that the shop is going for. Thanks Oded for a unique chocolate experience!

I was in the Union Square area and was looking for a coffee shop to grab a hot beverage and escape the frigid weather. Luckily, while searching Yelp, Blue Stripes Cacao Shop showed up and was in walking distance. I decided to give it a try and ordered a mocha. Service was friendly and my drink was served up quickly. There is a lot of seating however it was pretty packed on an early Friday afternoon. If you wait around you can definitely score a seat though, as there is a lot of turnover. There is also a clean bathroom which is nice and they have a self-serve water station. Since this is a cacao shop the mocha was extra thiccc and chocolatey. I'll defintitely be coming back again when I'm craving something sweet.

Such a great and unique experience! Ive been a couple of times and it never fails to amaze me. I recently tried the cacao tea infused with cbd. It's a healthy option to drink pure chocolate. The flavor is sensational and wild. The second one is the cacao juice chili which has a great texture and great flavor as well. add cbd to give it a kick! seriously, this is one of my favorite shops to go. The ambience and staff are super sweet too. Chocolate lovers rejoice lol, this is definitely a spot to check out.

I really think this place might be underrated. I haven't seen or heard much about it prior to actually going. And wow it was amazing! Just the smell of the place was amazing! I got the Nutella bun (wow SO delicious and served warm!) and a blonde. They also let you sample the chocolate cloud drink if you ask! The staff was so nice! I highly suggest this place! Because who doesn't love chocolate

Wow this place is out of this world! The best Nutella home made chocolate The best ice latte and such a fun and great ambiance! Hubby and my kids really loved the whole chocolate experience. Can't wait to go again and try more delicious things from the menu!

Went here for the first time yesterday and it was great!  It was the perfect place to go on such a snowy day with so many choices for hot drinks.  I went with the dark hot chocolate myself and it was delicious  I also got the avocado toast, which was super tasty, and took home a piece of chocolate mousse cake which just looked too pretty in the case not to try!

I got the egg avocado salsa croissant sandwich and it was amazing!!! A little pricey but still very delicious, a perfect breakfast. The staff is very friendly and it came out really quickly, definitely will be back! Cute area to study, do work, or just hang out!

I would give this place 3.5 stars.  I really only come here if I'm in the area and don't feel like walking to go to a better brunch place.  I usually order the green baked eggs (spinach, eggs, feta cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms. chimichurri, Balthazar toast) on the brunch menu.  I really only order it because it has the most vegetables.  It's fresh, delicious, and not too heavy.  It's a bit watery (due to the spinach and the tomatoes) but if you add chili oil, it tastes really good.  As of late, it's getting harder and harder to get a table for brunch.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table at 11:30 AM which usually is not a busy time.  Also, their service has gotten super slow.  I have to wait a long time to get anything: water, check, etc.  I will have to have to come here earlier to get a table, at least they do open at 8:00 AM.

Good coffee and summer lemonades. However they are really really slow. We ordered take away for seven people and it took them 20 minutes to get our drinks, and the shop was not even that crowded. They also forgot to bring any straws when they hand over us the coffee. Not recommended.
Every time I visited Bluestone( either I am in rush or just relaxing), they offered me the best food and services. Yes it's crowded because NEW Yorkers are smart! But they know how to handle us!!

Rude servers.  Abysmal hospitality. I know the Aussie lifestyle is carefree and all... and they normally just have Aussies working there.. the best coffee in the city but sometimes it isn't worth it when you want to just chill without any headache.  If you want to see Instagram models posing all day, every day... come here!

I had a fantastic brunch experience at Bluestone today. I am visiting NY from SF and will definitely be checking out the location in SF once I'm back home! My server, Robby, was super friendly and when asked what his favorite thing on the menu is, he told me about his "secret order" (avocado toast with fried egg & salmon) and hooked me up! It was DELICIOUS!!! Everyone on the staff is super friendly and the spot is very charming. Thanks for a fantastic start to my 3 day weekend in NY

Cute interior, but otherwise nothing special. Got the brekkie board: avocado toast + yogurt parfait were pretty bland, and smoked salmon had an unpleasant texture and overly-fishy taste. If you can resist the clean aesthetic, I'd recommend going somewhere a bit cheaper + more flavorful!

I went with my family because we saw it on Yelp. It took quite some time - an hour - to bring us four dishes. But the waitress was nice and the manager later wrote to apologize, which was very nice of them. Food was interesting!

The drinks here are interesting. They have beetroot latte which definitely has beet flavor, golden latte which has turmeric to make the golden color, and also matcha latte which has rich matcha flavor. I like that they have the brekki board that has half of Collective granola and half of Avocado smash. The granola is ok. Personally I think the yogurt is too thick with no flavor. The citrus curd gives the sweet flavor but they don't put enough. I like the avocado smash. It has thick layer of avocado and a bit of salad on top and you get to choose the topping: egg, salmon, bacon, etc. This place is small but they have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The service is half self service.

Typical hipster place so I get it and I get the hype. However, management is poor and service is all over the place. There is no system whatsoever and our food (which should've taken 20 minutes MAX to make and serve) took over 45 minutes to come out. This was even after asking FOUR times to just bring it out as it was ready. But the waitresses/ waiters were just running around manning random tables and doing random things. We had like 3 people helping us to had to repeat the same thing to three different people.  However, I will give them 2 stars as the food was good. I got the brekkie board which is half avocado toast and half the yogurt with granola. Avocado toast is avocado toast. The yogurt and granola however was very delicious. My bf got the green baked eggs which he said was good but the portion was too small. We also shared the banana bread which was good but for 13$ I expect more than 2 small slices of bread.  You'll definitely leave with a pretty picture to post on instagram though.

This cafe was a cute place for brunch, but I wished it was bigger. I felt cramped where I was seated and I was lucky enough to have a corner spot.  Service - The service was pretty decent and accommodating and good. No complaints  Food - Was also decent but honestly, I feel like I could make the avocado smash with smoked salmon myself.
