Knowing that I'll be in the hood a lot, I needed to Gordon Ramsay this place, and see if it's up to snuff.. but I don't have his wallet, so I ordered the thing that is always a testament about the place.. shakshuka. So easy to ruin. I've had my share of meh shakshuka.  This one came in a little metal hot pan with artisinal bread. The eggs were perfectly poached. The tomatoes were nice and spicy. Not watery. The hot pink labneh on top was a perfect creamy component to the dish.  The outlets running throughout pushcart are gone. But there are still enough of them in the front with some communal tables. Yay for the sva peeps.  The coffee was great too. I'll be back.

Came here on a friday at 11AM. My friend arrived 15 mins before me and she was able to be seated first! Waiters were quick to take our order but the overall service was ok only. We had to deal with a few annoying flies throughout the meal - most likely because of their succulent plants placed around the tables.  Absolutely LOVED the Brekkie Sandwich ($13). Get this if you're indecisive like me! The scrambled eggs were more like a thin cheese omelette and the biscuits were perfect - not too dry or rich! They were generous with the bacon portion and the jam added a nice sweet touch to this savoury dish. I was pleasantly surprised by this simple dish!  My friend had the Smashing Avocado ($14) and the portion size was bigger than expected! The multigrain toast was packed with a very THICK layer of avocado. My friend said it was good!  Not sure how we feel about the Belgian Waffle ($14). The size of this dish was quite small - just one piece. The waffle was crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside, but not a big fan of the dragonfruit panna cotta on top. It had an over-powering taste and it was too sweet to our liking. My mouth felt kinda dry after eating this dish.  I would come back! The food was great overall but the service was mediocre.

I have to say, this place is a huge win for east Gramercy. It really stands out among the food options along 2nd ave in this area. It's a well decorated, open and well lit space with very friendly staff. The owner is especially nice, when they were first decorating before officially opening he invited us in to give a short tour and talk to us about the food and how they got started.  The food itself is outstanding. I highly recommend everything on the menu, having tried it all, but the salmon eggs and shakshuka are real winners. Coffee is very good too. Very glad to have this place as a go to option in my neighborhood.
Amazing brunch, to go coffee, fun chill vibes, a welcome neighborhood spot. Pulled pork benny, breakfast sandwhich and waffle are my favorites, but everything is amazing.

This coffee shop is the one I would have loved to explore more. They do pour over coffee, so you get the best taste. I was able to taste the Peruvian beans and it was a delicious cup of coffee, no sugar/milk needed.  The shop is super small, about 8 seats, and long lines form quickly. The playlist is super good, the baristas are fast, they even have some pastries. The big plus: the kids behind the counter are cool. No hipster B.S.  Available also: coffee beans by the pound. Do it!
Had the mint matcha latte and it was delicious! Cool space and friendly staff. Only con is that they don't have a restroom here.

Excellent cold brew and a delightful staff makes this hidden gem of a coffee shop one of my favorites. In an area that is surprisingly congested with disappointing coffee offerings that often taste burnt and stale, one can rejoice with this nice little discovery. The baristas are very friendly and a pleasure to deal with.  Prices are also very reasonable for the quality being offered.  This coffee love is just glad that this little spot still appears to be able to avoid the crowds and tourists!

Met up with some friends here around 6pm today. The space itself is very clean and welcoming, with a decent amount of seating. I ordered a small almond milk latte and my friends ordered a hot chocolate and a chai.  I thought the latte was decent but a little too bitter for my taste. I loved the creaminess of the almond milk though. The small was $4.50, which I think is a little high for such a little cup. My friend's hot chocolate was watery and I thought the chai lacked flavor.  While the space is nice and everyone is very friendly, I probably wouldn't come back here.

I stopped by City of Saints for a coffee break since I had some time to kill before dinner in the area. They close super late, which is a plus. The caf̩ is very spacious and offers a well-lit spot to do some work or just enjoy a cup of coffee.  The baristas are super nice and very friendly. The coffee is solid and the prices are reasonable. I sat in the caf̩ for almost two hours doing some light work (aka catching up on Yelp reviews!).  If you're in the area and need a quick coffee break or a place to quietly work, definitely give City of Saints a try!

I stopped by for a quick pick-me-up of their apple cider. I really liked that a bag of spices was steeped in my drink to-go! Only drawback was that the string kept getting in the way of sipping the cider so I ended up taking it out. Regardless a nice touch. I'd come if I were in the area.

Mmm their Lavender Agave Iced Latte  I happened to run into this place as I was looking for a subway station, and I'm so glad I did! The interior is bright and perfect for relaxed morning coffee or to get things done. The display of their roasted coffee beans adds a touch of color to the place and made me hard to resist buying a bag  I tried their Lavender Agave Iced Latte, and AHHHHH I love it!!! You get that classic good latte with a hint of lavender sweetness. Definitely a must visit place if you are a coffee addict like me or even a willing first timer! :)

Pour over was on point. Good flavor and extraction. They had plenty of beans on hand for purchase. My simple latte was  prepared well (maybe a tiny too much foam) and tasted great from start to finish. City of Saints also serves doughnut plant. The seasonal coconut and lime was one of the best I've ever had. Worth coming back to.
The best coffee in east village! Super nice baristas and great vibe.  Their cortado is clean, malty, and delicious.

No bathroom and no wi-fi but a great place to hang out - if you can get a seat.    Coffee and treats are SO good and the staff are extremely friendly - especially Caroline!    I love that they use organic milk - so good.

The best service around! Coffee was delicious too -  their cortados never disappoint. Conveniently located near the Strand bookstore -  buy a book, grab a seat, read, and stare out of the window at people walking by. Plus one of the baristas has the cutest, chirpiest, friendliest voice ever - never fails to brighten up your day.

Ok, gritty grainy coffee problem solved --just order an americano instead of the regular hot coffee. No grinds bro, no grinds. The flavor is very smooth, definitely more like Blue Bottle than Colombe.  And they have Doughnut Plant donuts, hooray!

It is virtually impossible for a coffee shop to be transcendent these days, but with their mint matcha latte City of Saints comes close. Come here to chat with a friend, get warm, or to simply enjoy people watching out the large windows. Don't expect to study - - there are no outlets available!

This place has a lot of potential but isn't quite there yet. The space is large with a lot of seating - unlike many of the coffee shops in the area.  The coffee itself is fine - there is better coffee in the area but it does the trick. The food menu is pretty limited. They have some baked goods and have recently expanded to have a few hot items. I have been hoping that they expand their menu to include fresh cooked breakfast sandwiches, but haven't seen any indication that they will. They pride themselves on their desserts, which I've tried and wasn't blown away by. I don't think the coffee/dessert combo really works here.  The restaurant is never really crowded, so I would suggest this place if you are looking for somewhere to work or to have a quiet conversation. I've heard they also have a printer you can use. I think the staff is nothing but friendly.  I look forward to seeing what they continue to do to evolve this place!

Coffee clock has the best cup of Nutella Latte! Mind blown! Stumbled upon this neighborhood cafe with absolutely no expectations. I was blown away by their array of pastries on display. The Nutella Latte is probably the best I've had.

I have been to Coffee Clock about a dozen times since it opened. Usually I go on Tuesday mornings to get a large Americano on my way to work after the gym. (I try to make coffee at home the rest of the week). The woman who works Tuesday mornings is very nice and makes a great americano. I have also gone in during the evening a few times to sit and enjoy my coffee. There is a lot of seating which is nice if you want to meet a friend or just sit for a bit. They have mugs etc if you want to enjoy your coffee and/or sweet treat there. I really like that aspect because I hate the waste of a disposable cup if I am not taking my coffee with me. In summary: the coffee is good, the staff for the most part is very friendly, and they have a nice space with lots of seating.

Stopped by for lunch and appreciated the service and good portion size but was disappointed to see some of the food wasn't super fresh.  I got the flower power salad and was very pleasantly surprised to see the insane amount of avocado topping the salad-- there was probably an entire avocado's worth; if not more. However, most of the mixed greens were seriously wilted, to the point where they were seriously shriveled and wrinkled. Perhaps this was a one off thing, as the avocado was certainly quite fresh, but will probably stick to the drinks if I end up coming back next time.
Good for working on a laptop though seats are not comfortable and A/C is too strong. One of the workers was not friendly whatsoever.

I was on my way to Adorama when I passed by the newest branch of COFFEED, with a small blackboard outside proudly proclaiming: "We're (Finally) Open!". Having been to both the LIC and Astoria locations, I was delighted to see that they were finally in Manhattan and promptly made my way inside. The space isn't completely finished, as several workers were hanging up the final pieces of decor against the walls, so there was the occasional sound of hammering and drilling; but otherwise, everything seemed to be running smoothly.  The interior leans on the smaller side, with a row of 8 or so counter seats against the window and a handful of two tops. I can imagine that the venue will get pretty busy later on, especially as they're located on a well-traversed street, but it's not a bad place to stop in for an hour, plop open the laptop or book, and have a warm beverage or two. COFFEED also has an extensive edible menu available, spanning tempting-sounding breakfast items, sandwiches, and salads - perfect for a lunch stop - or a handful of sugar-infused treats.  I will note that especially in the cold weather, the constant opening and closing of the door can get rather painful - a vestibule would definitely help with this; otherwise, do your best to seat yourself as far away from the door as possible. Also, as the prior review mentioned, the service appears to be across the board. I placed my order for a coffee with a rather sullen-faced cashier who replied to my questions with monosyllabic answers, but was given a bag of chips from a smiling barista, who apologized for the noise and thanked guests for visiting.  I'm hopeful that once COFFEED gets into full operation, they'll work out some of the kinks. Either way, I'll be dropping by again to try something aside from my typical drip coffee... which, by the way, I'm tempted to get seconds on.

First time stopping in here - fabulous service, quality coffee, plenty of seating in a bright space. I ordered a large drip and made a comment about their La Marzocco. The barista pulled me a delicious shot on the house with the sweetest crema.  Overall, the shop seems understated in the quality of their coffee. I would recommend Coffeed over Think Coffee a few doors down based solely on the quality of the coffee and the level of service provided.

Truly a great concept, lovely ambience. Perhaps most spectacularly (other than the charity aspect of course) is that it is very wallet friendly, especially compared to most west village/Chelsea eateries that cost an arm, a leg, and your firstborn child for a small cappuccino. One caveat, however, is that they stop serving food at 3 pm. This is a bit of a buzzkill  if you're like me and eat at extremely odd times of day and don't adhere to breakfast/lunch/dinner norms. Otherwise, lovely place!

Coffeed has excellent cold brewed coffee, complete with coffee ice cubes. For a caffeine junky like me, this is a must have. Who wants to water down their coffee with little chunks of frozen water? They also have very good (and very large) hand rolled bagels.  Industrial chic decor and some fantastically large windows make this a nice spot to sit and enjoy a coffee. The staff is very friendly and if you happen to frequent the place they will certainly take the time to learn your name and remember you.  Not the cheapest coffee joint on the block but hey, 10% goes to charity so that's always a plus.

Great new Manhattan outpost for this charity minded coffee cafe on Sixth Avenue between 16th and 17th street.  They've got 3-4 cafe tables. Eclectic breakfast and lunch menu. Salads are sourced from a farm on top of a building in LIC and named after nabes in Queens. Produce is fresh - I recommend the Jackson Heights salad ($9 for baby spinach, avocado, corn and beans, cotija cheese).  $3 more gets meat or tuna on the salad. $3 more after that gets a Greek yogurt w/chia seed.   It's next to The NY Foundling npo and donates up to 10% of this store's gross revenue to the Foundling. No brainer - coffee is good too.

The food is terrible and the service slow.  The free WiFi cannot make up for those two things.  Then there is the attempt at feel good charity. "Up to 10% of the profits are given to a local charity." seems like a complete scam.  Up to 10% means it could be 5%, 1% or 0.  I went across the street to Fika, where the food and coffee are actually good.

The last time I was there I tried the dirty chai latte. It is interesting (in a good way) having a shot of espresso in a chai tea latte. If you like espresso and chai, give it a try. I used the cups app on my visit (use code u38af for a $10 cups credit and basically get a few free cups of coffee here).Update: the app has been updated and the code gives you  $5 now.

This place was next to our hotel and I walked past it every morning to go to take the subway. I got an almond croissant and it was super cold. I don't know if they had an option to pop it in the oven real quick. They were so packed and I guess I was supposed to ask for them to warm it up. It also didn't help that it was 30 degrees outside with a cold croissant.
Wow coffee and pastries 10/10. Got an almond milk latte & some random apple pastry. So good!

5-stars for the concept here. $2 for ALL coffee drinks? Yes! La Colombe? Bonus yes! A small spot with 8 seats, Corvo is the perfect place to stop for a coffee to-go while in whatever part of NYC it's in (port authority, yuck). There was no line when I stopped in and I was helped and served rather quickly. Don't think bc everything is $2 they skimp on menu items or preparations either. Everything is served as it would be at your local coffee shop or at the 'bucks. What a great concept. Love the local coffee scene, but I'm about done paying $5 for a cold brew. Go Corvo!

Nice, small coffee bar just south of the Port Authority building on the Ninth Ave side, entrance on 40th St.  I had a large cappuccino and a blueberry muffin, both fine, which came to something over $5.00 with the tax. Seems like the large size coffee was an up-charge from their $2.00 menu. But still cheap enough.  Counter staff were pleasant and processed orders quickly.  Very small area to line up to place your order.  About eight seats at a counter against the window.  Fine if you are in the area, especially if your order is to go.
Simple menu, fast service, good coffee, and great prices. These places are rare in NYC. I'll come back.

A solid large iced latte at $3.25, with a deep roasty flavor. Service is quick and the location next to port authority is great - you're much better off relaxing here before a long bus ride than at the Starbucks inside

The food and coffee here are good and very well priced at $2 for each item. However, the cashier was a B and was barely paying attention to me when I was asking her about a few items and she started having a convo with her coworker while I was literally telling her my order. So of course she misunderstands me and when I tried to clarify what I wanted she started being RUDE. Get a damn grip and listen to your customers when they are talking to you.

Looked inviting from the outside if you stumble upon it like I did...however this man I assume is some kind of manager was SO RUDE. Didn't acknowledge me at the register when he was standing right in front of it. Then he doesn't even greet me, I'm telling him my order and for this whole interaction he will not make any eye contact, looking down, barely speaking. Said "2" I give him a five he says "2.18" doesn't say thanks, nothing, turns around and goes about his business. Croissant was awful, was hard. The only reason I give it 2 stars is cause the girl working was nice to the customers who came in.

Everything on their menu is only $2. Including Very good coffee, fruit juice and small sandwiches. Corvo coffee is a Great choice for breakfast. The cafe is simple and clean, not so spacious, good for take away and they also have places for seat in.

I love these 2$ places but corvo does charge you extra when it comes to certain drinks it's not straight forward like espresso matto. The iced mocha is great and the food is great but I got an iced matcha latte recently and it was awful. Basically tastes like chalk. I informed them that it wasn't like a normal matcha latte to which they responded theirs is a "light" matcha. Regardless do not get the matcha latte they charged me 4$ even though it says everything is 2 and it was disgusting. Stick to plain old coffee and the food if you go here.

I found myself with an extra hour before work, so I walked down to this place. Their $2 pricing was the main draw for me, but I was pleasantly surprised.  I ordered an iced coconut green tea and a plain bagel, toasted. When I ordered my bagel the guy behind the counter yelled something at me and I didn't understand him, so I just nodded. I assume that's why he included a little tub of Philadelphia cream cheese in my bag, which was very nice! I suppose this would be a bad thing if you prefer your cream cheese to already be spread on your bagel, but I personally don't care either way.  The coconut green tea was really good. I like coconuts, and I could definitely taste them in there.  Overall, this is a great spot for a reasonably priced breakfast.

Sometimes I wonder; why do I pay so much for quality coffee in NYC? When you seek the fuel to get you through a hard days work, that nagging feeling of 'something doesn't feel quite right', is ever present when you dish out $5 on a cappuccino or a macchiato just because x corporation says so.  Lately it's not just the Starbucks, Dunkin' Donuts to overprice your choice beverage. Even when you seek local coffee shop places, you're bound to dish out $4 on a small shot of expresso. Imagine my pleasant surprise when I came across Corvo!  What New Yorker doesn't love a good deal? $2. For. Everything. I have had their regular coffees (delicious), their flat whites (delicious), iced latte (delicious), their pastries (delicious). All without having to justify me spending this money.  Aside from the great food, drinks and the friendliness of the staff. That feeling is what keeps me coming back and I hope you will as well.

Can't beat the value you get for this price! Cappuccino plus almond croissant for $4 (plus tax) total.. unheard of in New York.. best part is that the coffee was really good. I've had better croissants but it was not bad.  It's a fairly small place, so not ideal if you're planning to get work done. Having said that, I would highly recommend this place if you want to grab a well tasting espresso drink to go or sit at the window and people watch.

I spotted Corvo Coffee over the past few weeks and yesterday I went in. It is novel in that all selections are $2. They have a large selection of baked goods ( muffins, croissants etc) as well as coffee choices. I got a regular cup of coffee and a chocolate croissant. My mistake was that I did not have the croissant heated. Otherwise, I would return-it is very reasonable and staff pleasant.

$2 for anything and everything that this place has to offer and while that is an amazing deal I was not a fan of the coffee. Yes, compared to Starbucks it's a deal (why does one spend $~10 on drink) but compared to Dunkin I can definitely get a bigger cup for $2 and change. However, I would come here for a pastery or two.
Great spot that serves La Colombe coffee and delicious almond and cheese danishes. It's a hidden gem next to the Port Authority that serves items for $2 each.

Not only is the coffee good and prepared well, the interior is very pretty. The $2 schtick is genius and they more than make up for the gimmickiness of that by being very good at making coffee. Banana nut muffin was also great!!

I can't believe my good fortunate stumbling upon this cafe oasis amidst the dreadful Port Authority area. $2 for anything/everything? Flat white and heated egg & avocado sandwich for $4? Yes please! And they are fast! And service is so friendly! (So tip well with the deal and great service you are getting!) I can't believe I am saying this but I actually dread Port Authority area less in looking forward to visiting this sweet cafe.

This area needed a gourmet coffee shop badly and I was tired of the Dunkin Doughnuts and Starbucks routine. The La Colombe coffee is amazing and I always grab a mocha or an espresso here, and it never disappoints, and this location has very good prices and top notch service!  So happy they opened this location.

I am pretty pleased about this place opening up a block away from my office! The entire menu is $2 and they offer the best quality of coffee, pastries, and sandwiches. The service is amazing, I am always greeted when I walk in and the staff is always happy to help. They opened up in October and ever since then I have visited at least 3 times a week. They have the best Chai Tea Latte in the city hands down. Their pastries and sandwiches are always fresh and tasty and their prices are unbeatable.

A+ best coffee and pastries in all of the city. Such an amazing deal I am here everyday getting my coffee , pastries, and they have delicious sandwiches . All for $2 each it's almost to good to be true
This store is amazing!!!! I stumbled into Corvo coffee one day and I ordered an iced coffee and an almond croissant. The coffee is top notch and this is my new coffee spot!!! LOVE IT!!

Upon walking in this was an adorable little cafe. The children's play area was such a sweet touch and made for a great first impression!  The menu was unique and fresh. Everything was clean and the service friendly. We ordered toast, an empanada, and an a̤a? bowl.  This is where they lost two stars. We waited over 30 min for our food. They only had one girl working but it was still unacceptable. I would have been fine with it if they gave us a heads up but we had no indication.  The woman did apologize and gave us a free macaroon but it hardly made up for the nearly $30 breakfast that took an hour

If only they didnt mess up my mocha order.... i wouldve given this place 4 stars  Lady forgot that I ordered 2 mocha since she got distracted and made me a regular latte instead. When I asked if the cups she made were mocha, she said they were lattes. She corrected this by wasting some fluid from the cup and then added the chocolate to make it into a mocha. I dont even think i got my whole shot of espresso in those cups.

This is a lovely bright cafe on one of the most low key gorgeous blocks in town--Duncan Ave. Great for lunch, coffee, working, or a quick bite. Wonderful cozy neighborhood vibe that's quite welcoming. The staff is great and the food is pretty good. They also have vegan options.
Amazing place! Love their lattes, toasts and ICE CREAM! Crema is a jewel in the neighborhood.
The quality is really great here, from the coffee to the toasts to the ice cream. Definitely destined to become a neighborhood fixture.

Noice level in a Sunday afternoon: super loud!  People screaming, shouting and play pokers. Maybe the coffee is really good so they got extra hyper.  If you need to wake up or break you ears, this cafe is for you

I went here yesterday morning and it was completely empty. I heard about the hype of this place and when I asked the woman at the counter she said this location isn't the main one that gets all the traffic. The popular one was on 38th.  I was tempted to leave and just go to the 38th location but it was so empty I decided to buy something. I had an iced chai with a shot of maple. I have to be honest I didn't like it at all. The maple was just not good to me at all in the chai. The only flavor shot option she said they had was maple and vanilla. Should have gone classic with the vanilla!  The 3 is because it was clean, quiet and the woman was so friendly to me!  Side note: I went around 7:44am and the cookies weren't done yet.  They said another 15-20 until they would be... so I guess go around 8 if you're on the hunt for their infamous chocolate chip cookie!!
Cozy atmosphere to meet friends for catch up times. The coffee, staff, branding, choco chip cookies are 100%
Cortado is fantastic.   But also fantastic- three words chocolate chip cookie.  They sell out fast in a New York minute.

Culture 36 has the best almond croissants in New York! Their croissants are flaky, soft and gewy all at the same time. Living outside of the city, I desperately wish they would ship their baked goods to me.

Cute spot. Good coffee. Good food. Good staff. Nice seating area.  Wish list: *I wish they played better music, with a name like "Dear Mama" and "You are appreciated" on the back of the t-shirts you'd imagine that they would at least play socially conscious hip-hop but they don't.  *I wish they had a changing table in the bathroom. As a lady with a baby I can attest to the fact that I am now 33% caffeine and it would be nice to be able to go there and enjoy my coffee and breakfast sandwich but also comfortably change my baby's diaper without having to play Tetris with my boy.

Clean coffee shop with good sandwiches to hang out and use free wifi. Their price is a little bit expensive though, especially if you add avocado to anything. The staff are friendly and the crowd is hip. It's not a regular stop for me though because I don't think I can afford my daily caffein here.

Everything is delicious here. Trust me. Just go and order everything on the menu! My favorite WAS the CardiB breakfast burrito. It's no longer on the menu and I am HIGHLY disappointed because it was AMAZING! Please bring it back!!

This place is fire. For the new implants in the neighborhood, let me rephrase: the coffee and ambiance are really good.  We got cortados and a latte with oat milk. This is the first place I've had oat milk and it's very delicious. The art on the walls is a nice touch and the music is always solid.  I've been here about 3 times. Once just to meet a friend, once to interview a prospective student, and once to kill time before a dinner reservation.  The barista this most recent time time was super cool and showed me how to pour milk into coffee to create a heart shape on the top. That was cool. 5 stars.

I live nearby and decided to check out this cafe on a weekend. It's a great place to go if you want to study. There were a lot of people with their laptops and books. There's a decent amount of seats inside along with outlets everywhere and WiFi! The menu looks good with coffee, tea and some snack options. It was ok busy around noon and soon became very packed by mid-afternoon. I recommend to come a bit earlier in the day to beat the crowd. It was a bit cold though so if you're planning to stay a while, bring a jacket/cardigan. Overall, a neat little place in the neighborhood and I'll be back.

Great service, great atmosphere, great decor Cortado- strong and creamy Mimosa- perfect pour, sparkling wine with a splash of juice (not the other way around!) Pretzel croissant- warm from the oven covered in seeds and salt - perfect pairing Steak and eggs - filling -steak and sauce perfect pairing (creamy sauce in top) a good dose of healthy fats, over easy eggs, a pile of roasted peppers, tomatoes Excellent Our new breakfast spot for a few days :-)

I can't believe I found these guys through an Instagram connection. So glad I made my way down on a Wednesday afternoon for a cold brew while running errands.  The coffee was great, and the baked goods looked tempting, but it was the setting and service that really caught my attention. First of all, even though it's a little heavy-handed to play Nirvana in a coffee shoppe, I kind of dig the Brooklyn-meets-Seattle vibe they're going for with the decor and music. Will definitely come back during a weekend pit stop and maybe during the week to do some work.

Looking at it from outside I thought it would be super small and I'd have to wait for a table but it really opens up when you're in there and I'm looking forward to going back to try other menu items and to sit down and get some work done on a weekday. The music was a little bit loud but overall an awesome experience! The avocado toast and dry rose cider were top notch!!
Love this place simple but really good  Breakfast all day cmon!  Sergio is a good dude always remembers my order always good vibes

Have been a regular customer here since the day it opened.  Used to love the espresso.  Recently they changed their espresso and it has been so awful I have had to throw out two lattes in a row.  The first time I thought the milk went bad (hence my return for the second latte).  I really like the staff and the vibe and used to love the espresso but unfortunately if this change is permanent I am going to have to head elsewhere.  The new beans are just bad.

Love the coffee here! I've been here twice alrdy and it's a great place to get work done. There's a lot of space, and the 2 times I've been there, it has never been crowded or busy, then again I'm usually there in off hours. My usual concern is being able to find a seat and table to write. I've only ever has there coffee and a piece of banana bread, they do have a couple menu of sandwiches and salads, but not a place I would do for lunch. I only wish there small circle tables were a been bigger, it's ok if you're sitting solo and sipping coffee, but if you want to put a laptop and a couple of books/notepad/journal out, it's kinda like Tetris. They do have bigger tables, but those are for bigger groups, which I usually try to avoid hogging, if it's just myself. I will be back, for more coffee and for more lounging.
Nice clean/ great food/ positive vibe. Recommend a check in.  Great cappuccino with awesome desert.  Free WiFi/ great study cafe. Big place with great service.

I live in the neighbourhood and am so happy to have stumbled upon it! It's a cute cafe restaurant with amazing sandwiches. I had the smoked salmon tartine and the El Barrio egg sandwich and they were both delicious! They also home make their chai lattes which were yummy as well. The staff were super friendly and nice too, definitely going to hit this place up more often!
Amazing drinks and food, and the staff is very friendly. Good vibes (a bit hipster though). Clean and spacious. Only giving it 4 Stars because it's a bit pricey and service is slow.

Went there last Friday for a Birthday party. The place has an industrial feel to it and I'm told that they have an art opening every month. The art on display was very good. I had their delicious rose hard cider as well as prepared food. The servers were very accommodating, everyone had a great time. I finished with a coffee. It was a good place to have a birthday party. The only bad thing about Dear Mama is that it is quite far from me. Other than that, no complaints.

Fantastic little caf̩ in East Harlem. The coffee is of course good, as well as the pastries and cookies, but they also have an amazingly wonderful light meal menu. We tried the beet and goat cheese salad, their famous barrio egg sandwiches, and their avocado toast as well as the house soup, which at the moment is summer garden vegetable. Every single thing we ordered was excellent. Unique and delicious. Highly recommend.

Great new addition to this neighborhood. I had a delicious iced latte served by a super nice barista. Hope to come back and try the food, prices looked very reasonable. There are quite a few tables with  comfy seating, and The air conditioning was even on, sometimes a rarity around here.
Best coffee shop in the area by far. Great space to chill and do work, great food, and the owner is always there and very personable! My go to for breakfast and lunch sandwiches

I've only been here on a Sunday night so I don't know if the atmosphere changes, but I found this place great for reading and working. Nice drink and food selection with a happy hour every day after 5.

Not sure how I got so lucky as to live around the corner from this gem of a coffee shop, but I won't question it. I come in for the amazing coffee mostly but the food is insanely good, as well. The entire staff is so super friendly and the ambience is v chill. You guys are the best, seriously.

Great spot for my first breakfast here in New York! Nice people and good food, just wished the menu wasn't mainly Sandwiches, but that's just a personal preference. The place is clean and their music is great. Not what you'd expect to hear when eating breakfast but still really good. Really recommend the place!

One of the most genuine, cool, and classy places in the big apple. Totally worth the journey there, and its a crime not to pay a visit if you are in wonderful Harlem. Great coffee, exquisite, service, and marvelous avocado toast/sandwich! Will surely make your morning perfecr. Enjoy :)

I came here a few days ago and ordered the  barley soup with chicken. The soup was good but I wasn't too happy with the portion. I got the larger size & felt like a $10 bowl of soup should be more filling than that but maybe I live in Lala land and my expectations are beyond what NY food industry is willing to accommodate. Otherwise I enjoyed the ambience, it's cute simple  & very clean and brings an eclectic mix of people which was surprising for the neighborhood. But I guess east Harlem has really changed!  Overall I'd come back and I'm hoping if I order an actual meal will be satisfied with the portion size. Fingers crossed.

The place itself is nice, the atmosphere is good for working, meatballs are delicious. But first it is really cold inside, second the staff doesn't care about customers. The table on the second floor was dirty after people before us, I personally went down and asked 2 people twice to clean it up, they didn't. We stayed for at least 3 hours there and all this time we sat with the garbage on out table! That's terrible!

This place is a pretty big place, and I like that there's a second floor for more seating. I met with a friend there to get some work done, but it was slightly difficult to find a place with plugs for our laptops. I was lucky enough that someone vacated their table right when I was getting there, so I just plopped my stuff down and got right to work. There were quite a few people there, which made it quite difficult to find spots anyway (this was Saturday afternoon, slightly after 11). It was also a bit cold inside, so I did end up having to wear a thicker jacket.  It was easy to order, and there seemed to be a good selection of pastries. Unfortunately, I didn't get to try them. I got some coffee and later, because I was a little hungry, got a sandwich. The sandwich was really expensive! I do not recommend the food there--it's decent food, but on the pricey side.  TL;DR: This location is worth going to, but if you're trying to study there and have study habits like me where you have to buy some coffee or snacks while you're studying, it may be slightly expensive if you're trying to spend an entire day there.

While I want to leave a better review for this location because it's my everyday go-to for the past few years...I'm stunned at how dirty its become. Literal filth. I don't think they sweep or mop that place but once a month. The cloth chairs are completely stained and you're hesitant to sit on them. I don't ever want to bring people here for a coffee chat because it's so utterly gross to sit in. The amount of crumbs, dust, and hair on the floor are enough to make this place seem icky like it should have a B rating. And judging by the cost of coffee, you would think they could afford cleaning supplies.  The staff is 50/50 when it comes to you feeling like you're inconveniencing them for wanting to order a coffee or anything in general. Especially the guy in the morning with the long beard. He couldn't be less interested or more rude.  If they would clean the place daily and have employees that were nice- it would be more inviting. My recommendation: go to Rex up the street. It's much nicer and friendlier.

3.5/5  I was looking for a coffee shop to do some work in, and I happened to see that this FIKA is nearby. I've always appreciated the care FIKA gave to developing its coffee spaces (plus the coffee is decent), so I opted to check out this Hell's Kitchen FIKA. I ordered a drip - it's as expected, nothing wowtastic. The space itself is very nice, with two floors and ample natural lighting via a skylight. The internet works well.  BUT  I'm docking 1 star from the otherwise 4.5 star rating, because the staff hasn't kept this beautiful space clean. There is garbage and dirty dishes on tables, crumbs and coffee stains on others. No matter how beautiful the space is, these remnants of old customers make this space unpleasant to work in.  So, a word to FIKA: a little goes a long way. Maintain your beautiful space, or lose out on potential repeat customers.

My experience here was pleasant. The workers are awesomely kind and love hearing your feedback about their latt̩ taste and art (I love a good barista who wants to be the best and accepts comments from customers).  The green tea latt̩ was a bit bitter but it was good (sugar can be added on the side according to your preference). This was about $7.  Wifi here is good and the bathroom is great and super clean.  If there isn't space downstairs, there's more seating on the second floor.  The space overall, is clean and modern.  Treats/small chocolates are sold here, as well as various brunch specialties.

First of all, the space is amazing! There was a good amount of tables downstairs as well as upstairs. The staff is friendly, but the coffee and pastries are mediocre. I had a cappuccino and all I really tasted was milk. Was pretty disappointed with that. My friend and I were also not able to connect properly to the WiFi. We ended up doing some work for a few hours here. Good study music. Clean bathroom.
Excellent.  1) This is one of their main branch. They always have the items available. 2) I got the princess cake and chocolate truffle. 3) The ambiance is great.
One of my fave study spots - high ceiling, bright lighting (natural and ceiling lights), huge windows, plenty of seating, modern style decor. There is an outdoor garden to sit in as well.

Great spot to chillax! Quiet, serene, elegant, soothing playlists, spacious setting with 2nd floor and terrace seating. Hungry? Got sweet tooth? They have a good selection of healthy sandwiches/plates, bakeries and chocolates to keep you happy for the duration you're in there. I'm sold and will be visiting more FIKAs to come.

Passed by a few times and decided to try it out. The menu is posted up where you order. Ordered a macchiato and the meatball platter.  The macchiato wasn't bad, but wasn't spectacular either. Side note: I felt like my finger was going to get stuck in the handle.  The meatball dish was great. It was served with a side of mashed potatoes, a salad, and lingonberries. The portions were great and felt adequate. Their was a mixture of baby tomatoes on the salad, including little heirlooms.  I would not only eat the same dish again, but I would try some of their other menu items as well.

Filicori serves Italian style coffee which is a bit old school if you compare to the third wave coffee culture. They don't have any selections of brews, or  offer different preparation methods so you get your classic latte or cappuccinos etc. I think this cafe is more suitable for people who consume dairy! You can find non dairy milk options but that's about it. The almost croissant wasn't flaky, it was a bit stringy after being warmed also the size of the croissant was way too little in comparison to other cafes but not in price. In total I paid around $9 with tax and tip. Wasn't really worth it if you are looking for the best coffee.

Coffee shop seem like a great place to hang, and the place was packed on a Sunday afternoon with patrons sipping while on laptops or books. However, underwhelmed by the Americano, the flavor profile was really one dimensional and muted and not enhanced by the splash of half and half.
Excellent coffee shop. You can't ask for a better location, the store is well maintained and the coffee is phenomenal.
Omg! The best coffee I've ever had. The stuff is nice and polite and very very very generous! The pastry is a bomb! Will totally go back!
Superb service, good amount of space to work, and fantastic food. Would definitely come here to work or socialize. Single gender-neutral bathroom for customers.

Great spot for working/meeting a friend. Please keep in mind that the establishment is Kosher, so truly do avoid bringing in outside food. Strong WiFi connection, though it does get pretty busy so you might have to proactively swoop in on that last outlet.
Good coffee! Even got it free for checking in on yelp. Manager was friendly and nice.

Maybe I came at a bad time. Two girls who handled my coffee doesn't seem to know what they are doing. I asked for hazelnut latte and they gave me a non flavored one and thank goodness I  asked them before I take it because they forgot to put the hazelnut flavor and then just add a dash of hazelnut liquid without stirring or any kind of work. And for those who cares about the quality of the milk, they didn't steam it the right way- so the milk wasn't creamy nor foamy enough.

I used to look forward to going to Fillicori Zecchini; they were one of my favorite espresso bars in the city. Now that they've been rebranded as Espresso Matto, their quality control has gone down - some of the baristas have absolutely no idea how to make a proper espresso, although I think there are one or two who still know what they're doing. Not only the espresso has gone downhill - the overall level of cleanliness of the storefront has also decreased.
Filicori is back from its former glory (under its original management) and more. One of my favorite nooks at the UWS.

Places like this are making nyc neighborhoods lose their charm. It was so snooty I felt like I was on the upper east side: the baristas wear matching caps and the dramatic Italian music playing at 10am was out of a satire film.  As for the coffee, it was pretty good, but definitely very milky, in accordance with other reviews. Their pastries were average.  I will say that the service was very accommodating.

Thank heavens for Filicori's arrival to the upper west side!! I am a huge fan. Not only is the espresso the best there is, but the customer service is top notch! It was because of my consistent satisfaction that compelled me (one who never publicly shares my opinion) to create a yelp profile just so I can write a 5 star review. It also thrills me to have vegan options as they are so vegan friendly. Today, as they saw me walking in the door, they made sure to grab the almond milk out to be prepared for my order with a smile! The perfect way to start my day and all the more reason to break my yelp virginity.

The place is really pretty and they have a lot to offer. Coffe is very good but I rather tea, specially Honey Camomille. You have to come early if want to find a place to sit and they have almost No plugs for computers . Overall is a very nice spot.

I have never reviewed a place that serves food before (I've only written one yelp review ever, for an optical store). However, this place is so fantastic I logged onto yelp for the first time in years to review it. The coffee and pastries are ALWAYS excellent, no matter who is staffing, and the service incredibly pleasant and attentive. Today I was helped by Daniel and Marissa who were fantastic as usual. I cannot emphasize how great the service and quality is here. The iced cappuccino is particularly amazing to me since they managed to get great foam on an iced drink, and I usually get a mushroom pastry that is nice and doughy as well as flaky (which they always heat up). The macarons are delicious too. I've also bought their roasted whole beans to brew my own coffee at home, and they helped me determine which beans to get (I'm new to whole beans). Of course, the beans make fantastic coffee which is so good I drink it black. Finally, the space itself is comfortable and great for studying/computer work/relaxing, and they have wifi. They offer both to-stay real mugs and silverware as well as a to-go option. I've started making excuses just to go here.

ave always struggle to find a great coffee in the States. But have found it!!! Exactly how a flat white should be. The avocado smash...YUM....great start to the day. Did not realise this was not full cafe. But seating was available. Staff very friendly. Great value. Would try other locations on next visit.
For the cost of my coffee, this place was not worth it. Sure the interior is nice, but its hard to justify any shop that out charges Starbucks by more than 1.5 dollars for the same product.
I love this place. the cappuccinos come with milky hearts, and always a dark chocolate treat. I use up my 7 drink punch card as fast as I can. this place is a treat.
I've been to this coffee ship so many times since it opened. The coffee is extremely good and strong. This is also a good study place, and has a great atmosphere.
Excellent coffee, service and cookies! Churro cookie, matcha lavender... I need to go back to try them all.

Delicious coffee and an amazing environment. Their wifi is great and this is a great little getaway in the middle of the times square area!  To drink: got the macha latte with macadamia milk. Creamy and delicious. For the specialty milk fans this place is absolutely great!  Ambiance: great place to get work done. Amazing music and vibe. Very comfortable seats!

New place. Clean. Friendly staff. $5.99 for a small almond milk latte. That is not a typo. I will not return.  Update to above: Derrick (apologies if not spelled correctly) one of the owners, called me back directly after I had emailed them about the pricing this morning when I wrote the review above. He stated the POS was incorrectly configured and "there's no way you should be charged 6 bucks for that." The pricing, when correct, would be on par with the area coffee houses. He was friendly and took the time to make that call which I appreciated. Given the quality of the product, I will be happy to try them again.

Our IT guys love this place. I didn't. I asked for a medium regular coffee. It was $2.50 (reasonable cost), but it was a small cup compared to other area coffee places. The coffee itself tasted old and it was only 7:45am. The barista didn't ask if I had the loyalty card or wanted one. I certainly won't be back, and I won't recommend it to anyone. The only good thing was the barista was cute.

As soon as you step foot into this coffee shop, it becomes obvious why it has so many great reviews. The staff here is AMAZING... everyone is so friendly, the coffee is great, there's a good amount of seats and there's wi-fi... what more could you ask for in a coffee shop? Great spot to meet someone for coffee in midtown! Love!

Be ready to wait if you are getting coffee in the AM.  Good grief are they SLOW. Super friendly staff and great with taking your order, but then you wait...and wait...and wait. Baristas are going as fast  as they can but they can't seem keep up with volume with the equipment they have.  Also. If you are used to Starbucks coffee,  this will be a shock.  Everything is much stronger and borders on bitter at times.  Definitely an acquired taste.  I had the caramel latte and it was hard to taste the caramel or anything else but bitter coffee.  Their goodies are delicious, superior to Starbucks however, so ill continue to visit this location when i cant get to my regular places. (It's closest to my work) but only when I have time to spare.

Gregory's coffee is an extremely convenient stop on my way to work and I am so thankful that they are open at 6 am because a lot of other shops do not open until 7. I think this is because Gregory's is a chain as opposed to a locally owned shop, nevertheless, it's convenient. However, what's not convenient about Gregory's coffee is the price and the really filthy bathroom. When you come into a coffee shop at 6:15 am and the bathroom is absolutely filthy with a vanity that looks like a gas station bathroom with the most offensive smells, you know that this bathroom was A) not cleaned that morning before opening the shop and B) not cleaned the night before when the staff went home because from 6 am to 615 am I doubt someone went into the bathroom and wrecked it. The gross bathroom is consistent too. Also, there are no hooks to hang your coat or bags in the bathroom so when you go in, you are most certainly not putting anything on the floor so you have to hold your giant purse on your lap, it makes the convenient coffee shop on your way to work, not so convenient.  It's a shame because I think the set up of Gregory's is cool. I like the high top table seating in the entryway. They have a lot of goodies in their food window. Protein balls, fancy toasts, baked goods galore. They also have water bottles, hard boiled eggs and some other things in their refrigerated section. They almost always have bananas on the counter too. They have a house blend, which is what I always get. I think their coffee is a little expensive, however. $3.10 for a medium is steep. I don't know if they are charging me an additional fee for the almond milk I have added, but I always ask for the teeniest drop so now I am curious if that's why the cup seems so expensive. Also, even with a sleeve on the cup, it is very difficult to hold for three avenues, burns my hand and I've been in the restaurant business for years, my nerve endings in my hand are minimal due to burns in the past so if I think the cup is hot, others have to agree tenfold.  So moral of the story is, their coffee is really good, their blend is unique and delicious. If they cleaned their bathroom and added a hook it would make a world of difference. Also a couple smiling faces behind the counter wouldn't be the end of the world.

First time at this location. I had $5 from Level Up app. I Ordered the Dirty Chai. So good. This place is very clean, plenty of seating, lots of pastries, lots of lighting, bathroom and free wifi. Great place to chill after work, weekends or just to grab a cup of joe. Very cool coffee place in the city.

I can't comment on the coffee. I ordered hot chocolate. It was pretty good. It wasn't too sweet. Hit the spot. The pastries looked amazing.  However this particular Gregory's was so hot. I felt like I was inside a furnace. The vents were super loud. Hard to chit chat or do work on your laptop.  I would come back and grab a coffee but wouldn't hunker down there and do work.
I went back to California thinking of how crappy our coffee was in comparison to Gregory's Coffee.  They have very strong coffee and decent pastries.

I've heard so many good things about this spot so had to check it out myself.  I got a pumpkin latte with soy milk and my cousin got a mocha. Both drinks were really good.  I love that my drink wasn't super sweet which is what I feel from getting starbucks PSL.    The service is executional too.  Very friendly baristas!  I loved the set up of this one.  We chose to sit near the window and it was a small table with bar stools facing the window so you can peopl
Got an iced vanilla latte! Tasted great and the people working were very friendly.....definitely going back.
Cool little coffee place up in midtown. Nice cashier, plus the barista did a fine job with my cappuccino. I like their logo as well.
Gregory's has definitely uped their game! They used to be kind of mediocre but have followed in line with the 4th wave coffee movement and now create some very tasty caffeine treats. I'll be back. :)
Great coffee, nice people, room to sit. My cappuccino was strong and smooth with the right amount of foam. The pastries look better than usual but I showed uncommon restraint and didn't buy one.

This place has tons of seating so that's a huge plus! The drink menu is pretty extensive. I went with a mocha and to be honest it was alright. All I tasted was milk and just a hint of chocolate and espresso. The croissant was very underwhelming. For over $3, I expect it to taste good. It tasted very stale, dry and plain. I am not sure on how I feel about this place but I probably will not be quick to visit soon.

I have mixed feelings about this place- this is my first visit to a Gregory's, so I will definitely try other locations, but the baristas at this particular location are rude and seem like they hate their jobs. I got an orange cranberry scone and it is completely tasteless, but the mocha I got to drink is one of the best I have ever had. Also, the space is great, there are tons of tables and the music is just the right volume for getting some work done.

LOVEDDDD Gregory's Coffee. WISH they had locations in LA. Amazing coffee, amazing food, amazing service. Perfect place for afternoon coffee and doughnuts. Can't wait to get back to NY and visit again!
This is a great place to work in. The staff are friendly and there is a good selection of baked goods. I live in NC and the prices here are what I would expect there.

Needed coffee on a break between classes and decided to give this place a try. Very trendy atmosphere that comes through by way of the decor and starbucks-esque menu/prices. There was no line, or any other customer in the shop, for that matter, when I came by around noon on a Wednesday. Every staff member near me behind the counter (there were about three of them) greeted me as I walked up to survey the pastries.  I ordered a vanilla latte and chocolate croissant, both priced at a point that let me know I was on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. The croissant was not warmed before it was served to me, but it was still perfectly flaky and delicious (I am not sure if there is a warming option; I did not ask). I watched my barista make my latte with care, taking her time and creating a leaf design in my milk foam. It was the perfect temperature for immediate drinking but tasted mediocre at best.  I have since returned three times and ordered the same drink, and each time I've been disappointed. I guess I just don't like their brew.
Really nice spot, with good coffee and comfortable seating to just chat or get work done.
Love the coffee.  I think they need to donate their left over pastries instead of throwing them out in the trash, that bothered me.  That's it.

Honestly the best place to get great tasting coffee. I come here frequently and have nothing but positive things to say. Not only are the staff friendly and knowledgeable but they're really sweet genuine people. From the plethora of blends to choose from to the calm quiet atmosphere this is my go to for all things caffeinated!
Best coffee available around here. I love stopping by on my way to class

I was snagged in by the pun! I do love a good pun, especially when reminiscent of Central Perk from Friends. Alas, I wasn't as smitten with the coffee.  It was bustling when we popped in on a Saturday morning. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. I ordered a black coffee and a berry scone. The coffee was just so-so; the scone decent enough. My friend says their espresso is very strong, so usually gets only one shot in a small latte. With so many other spots for coffee nearby, I'll give the others a go before popping back in here, but when I do I'll give the lattes a go.

The cold brew is good and they have a good selection of pastries/snacks, but service is crap. Baristas aren't friendly. The brunette with the glasses, white hat, and purple sweatshirt that says "Jeu" who worked Easter morning (4-21-19) is rude. She was cold to begin with, but then she got downright huffy when I asked politely for more syrup for my cold brew. She pumped it almost hostilely into a little cup and practically shoved it at me. I don't know what her problem is but she needs a major attitude adjustment, and I see I'm not the only one who's had a bad experience bc of her. I won't be back because of it.

I walked 16 blocks out of my way, with my luggage in tow, to stop in at this location of Ground Central in between meetings.  With so many coffee joints in NYC, especially Midtown, Times Sq, and Hell's Kitchen, why would I bother?  Lemme tell you why...  When you walk in the door at 888 8th Ave (an auspiciously lucky number!), you already feel like you're home.  Cool music and friendly, engaging folks behind the counter make you feel welcome.  This was my second trip here in a month (I'm from Chicago) and it's hard to imagine going elsewhere.    Probably my favorite part is watching other customers.  They can feel the vibe, dig the excellent music, and most all break out in song or dance.  Baristas too.  Today, I was greeted by a tall drink of water, Chad.  He was very helpful, made smart suggestions to my broad, random questions (get the egg fritatta on brioche, BTW), and saved me from double dosing on my dirty chai.  Seamless handoff to Olive, the barista with the mostest, where she made a flawless almond milk dirty chai.  It was the PERFECT temp, smooth and balanced, and poured with love.  No, really, check out the heart in my pic.  :-)  Food is top quality as well so don't hesitate to add sweets and savories to your Ground Central experience.  You need this in your life.
There are inviting spaces to hunker down in.  The drip coffee is very strong which is my preference. I like taking a break from the chains. This is an option if you are looking for a change.

This is a great coffee shop with a cozy vibe and tasty drinks.  I love their selection of non-dairy milks. I'd never had macadamia milk (or "Mac sauce", as they call it), until I'd stepped foot in here. They also have oat, almond, soy, and probably a few other milks. Honestly, it all tastes more or less the same to me when it's made into a latte, but I appreciate having options.

This was right down the street from where I was staying on my visit to NYC, and I could not have been luckier.  The coffee was delicious, both their lattes and their Americano were perfect. I also had some of their pastries: their egg frittata sandwich was great, the bread they used for that is SO good! Have no idea what it was, but it gave the sandwich a nice, unique kick. I also had their Nutella Brioche - and oh boy, was that good! I could have that all day every day.  The music was different every time I came in, my absolute favorite was my first visit where they were playing jazz music. I sat there for way too long working on my computer.  The staff is some of the friendliest staff I met in New York. Highly recommend this place!

Overall 5 stars Coffee 5 stars Baked goods 5 stars Atmosphere 5 stars Value 3.5 stars will i be back? Yes*  Needed a place to chill while the family was busy with other things.  found this gem via yelp.    Coffee: The coffee was excellent.  I assume (hope?) roasted on the premises?  Baked goods: i had only one baked good so take this fwiw.  It was good. :-)  soft buttery chocolate chip cookie, just the way i like it.  Atmosphere not much seating area, but not that big. The back has a few couches, and a bookshelf full of books.  If I lived nearby, i sense i would be coming here quite a bit to just read.  Value It was expensive.  I assume that's par for the course for manhattan, though.  will i be back? If I need to, and am in the area yes.  But I don't need to usually when i'm nearby. (hope that makes sense)
Friendly staff and good cup of joe. Great decor. I was there late and the staff tried to give me the rest of the sandwiches to take home! Would return.

This place is very quiet and the perfect place to have some coffee or tea along with a yummy treat! I had a small cafe white mocha with a double chocolate muffin and it was delicious ! The staff were friendly and nice - made me feel like home! I would definitely come back and recommend.

Cute corner coffee place right next to the train station , the decor is nice and they're trying to go for that cool downtown vibe but coffee was burnt and watered down , I took few sips and threw it in the garbage .
Worst latte in my life. If I had sipped it before walking down into the train I would have asked for a refund. I immediately threw it in the trash. What a waste.

Let me start by saying I've worked in the specialty coffee industry for over 8 years, so my standards may be above average, but I rarely write bad reviews.  Pros- Nice, clean ambiance. Friendly staff. Solid selection of sourced pastries.  Cons- This place has the look and feel of a specialty grade, third wave shop, but lacks the coffee chops. I've been here on two occasions, the first was on their opening day, and I ordered an espresso. Espresso is, in my opinion, the best way to test a coffee shop, as it's the most difficult to do well. Sadly, I never got to taste the espresso because it was served to me at no less than 230 degrees! I'm not exaggerating when I tell you it was so hot that the roof of my mouth was peeling dead skin for the next 2 day's... Remember this is my profession, I'm very used to drinking espresso and black, fresh coffee so I would dare to say, I have a higher tolerance for heat than most. I've NEVER had an espresso or cup of coffee this hot. Aside from burning the coffee, it destroyed my mouth... I went back a couple days later and asked to speak with the manager, because I believe in addressing "bad reviews" with the management first, to give them a chance to explain/apologize/adjust. When I told him my concern I was met with a look of disbelief, and annoyance. No apology was made, no effort to correct, nothing. Just an "ok". Fast forward to today, I decided to give the place another shot, and ordered a drip coffee for my wife with 1/2&1/2. I was given a coffee that had steamed whole milk instead? Coffee was a very dark roast, I asked for a medium roast.  Summary- Fancy looks, Good pastries, Bad coffee. This place serves the type of artificially flavored beans you would buy from fairway (hazelnut, vanilla, etc)  Do yourself a favor, and go to Joe's or even Oren's. Your mouth will thank you.
GREAT AMERICANO. They are really trying to keep up with the flow of the busy corner but in their attempt to be fast they got three orders wrong, including mine.
Really like the coffee. Goes great with the waffles they sell. Love the combo. Perfect location.

This place looks legit and I'm sure they make a very good hot coffee in all of its variations. But as an iced coffee aficionado, I was truly disappointed to learn that they do not carry Cold Brew Iced coffee. I gave their iced coffee a try but was let down as it was lacking flavor and seemed watered down.

I love their turmeric latte and friendly nice staffs. But their mushroom toast was kinda disappointing. The saut̩ed mushrooms were very very very salty. Even I ate them with the toast and the hummus-like paste (which, btw, was delicious!!!), it left just saltness on my tongue but not much mushroom taste. What surprised me was, when I opened the box (they put the toast in a box), there was only the toast. No sides or salad, and still it cost $12.  Overall things here are kinda expensive. The prices of signature drinks are too high for the size. Their toasts, too, have no sides and cost the same as those stores that serve sides. Cute interior and nice atmosphere, but I may not come back for their food. I really wish I could love this place :(

Be honest, this place is a bit overwhelming for me. The place is tiny and the line is long, there is no table services it's a cafe style, so good luck finding a seat! I came here for their avocado toast ($12), no matter you eat in or take out they serve your food in a paper box/container, food taste was good but i just didn't enjoy the whole experience. Brunch for me supposed to be relaxing not stressed, because looking at how long the line is and even you are seating, you don't feel to stay because you just feel bad for people still standing and waiting. I also had a latte on the side, total cost $20 with tips for a "brunch" and i didn't feel money was well spend. If i wanted something fast, $6 is my top!
What an amazing vibe this place has. Even for the non coffee drinker I want to be here as long as possible! Great music amazing space. My BF favorite coffee. Highly recommended!!

Straightforward and stylish food served in a dialed in, stylish spot. I've never been to Australia, but this place is supposed to have a bit of a down-under vibe, for me it ends up feeling a lot like Venice Beach/LA situation complete with a post-yoga crowd. We had a delicious "brekkie" sandwich and avo toast and both were very, very yummy. Fresh bright flavors and very good bread. The dine-in space is a bit small if you're with more than a couple other people -- there are spots outside if it's not super steamy out. The only thing that missed the mark for me was the overly acidic and moderately strong cold brew. But I am a little bit picky like that about my cold brew. I would definitely go back for the food and the adorable laid back beach vibe on the UES.

So excited to see this awesome little coffee spot on the UES. I stop on my way home from yoga and love the avo toast, it's delish. The use a bit of sea salt and delicious little heirloom tomatoes. It's the best I've had. The staff is real friendly and it's a great atmosphere. Can't wait till the weather warms up and the large front door is open. Fabulous neighborhood gem!
Hot coffee and even hotter staff . And the Australian owner Al, I'll take a sip of that. Great chat by that beauty behind the counter, can't recall his name, but what a gem.
Great coffee! Great to have places like this in the UES  a little pricey but good fresh food

Absolutely exceptional coffee, service, ambiance, food, and Aussie eye candy. Screw Starbucks, I'll never drink coffee from anywhere else. The best hot bean juice this side of the Mississippi. YOU WIN LOVE IT. Must stop while visiting the back Apple and a must be daily regular for us locals.

Cool isn't everything when you order a avocado smash with egg whites and the dude tells you we don't do egg whites., so I say ok my wife had it here but make it with whole eggs. You get home to find a poached egg on top of the avocados, then you see picture in the front page of the website with avocado smash  w/scrambled egg whites. Cool isn't everything when ask if you can leave the mayo off of your breaky sandy get home a find globs of mayo. The real treat is seeing these guys charge astronomical prices and watch people line up to be part of the "scene" Personally I like a little less cool and a lot more substance to the food preparation
Dog friendly! Great coffee. Cool little place. Good pastries.  Looks like a piece of Brooklyn dropped onto the UES (without the pretension).
The exterior is cool, but it's overpriced and quality is meh. $6 for a coffee. :/ There are cuter and better spots on the upper east side.

I've found my new favorite coffee spot on the Upper East Side! The staff is incredibly welcoming and quick on their service. The avocado toast is absolutely amazing and some of the best I've had in New York. Most certainly a great place to stop if you're in the area and need a morning snack!
Lovedddd this coffee shop! Run by really sweet, personable Aussie who poured AMAZING coffee. Cant wait to go back
The teas were very good, vibe pleasant, the place is cozy.  I was disappointed by tea being served in disposable cup. Even though we stayed in and didn't have takeout. What a waste

This coffee shop is POPPING I couldn't believe how busy it was! There were like no seats available and not much room to stand because people were waiting in line to order.  The design includes large high ceilings which reminded me of an upscale log cabin in the woods.  I wouldn't come here for the food. It's pricey (almost $10 for bagel with lox!) and I'd say they're known for their drinks more than a few baked goods. I tried the everything everything bagel (~$3 with cream cheese) and it was alright. I expected it to have a stronger flavor, be warmer, and just overall taste better.  I also cracked and got the green light drink, and considered a special drink inspired by a kpop star called the kookie latte. The green light drink was refreshing and healthy, and surprisingly sweet given the fruits and vegetables it contained. Do it for the 'gram and keep the cute bottle and light--people kept asking where I got it!  Service was alright. They seemed harried and busy, and weren't very personable for a Saturday afternoon that seemed like prime business time. I probably won't be back given the large amount of coffee shops in Manhattan to choose from, particularly ones with better service and food.

Idea is a nice well run coffee shop. They have some food and a good amount of work space. I ordered the green smoothie which was on the thin side but pretty good and made with coconut milk. That alone would have warranted 4 stars but I also order avocado toast and it sucked. It was $10 it was on the small side for the price and as good as it looks it was pretty bland.

After passing by this shop many times on my way to work, my friends and I decided to stop in and order the lightbulb drinks.  Although I'm aware that these are mainly for show, I would expect a better tasting drink when I'm paying that much. It was an odd consistency. Sort of like juice, sort of like a smoothie.  I will have to go back in and give their coffee a try, but would not really recommend the lightbulb drinks unless you're a huge foodie and have to try it!
Cool and cute coffee place. Nice big tables for working and meeting. Coffee is pretty good.

This little cafe is really nice, even though its always busy.. the food is good, the coffee is great and the atmosphere is pretty nice if you aren't in a rush.  The staff is friendly, helpful, fast and are attentive to guests, as an avid coffee enthusiast I dislike going to places with burned coffee beans.. but in this place, everything is fresh.  This is definitely a must if you are in the area.

One of the best coffee shops on the island, it is spacey and has great light with a lot of windows.  The iced coffee was life saving after walking around in the heat, before exploring the Museum of Sex around the corner!  It was so comfortable and relaxing we stayed a few moments longer than expected to relax.

Had the yummiest chai latte ever when visiting NYC here. It was an apple pie chai latte. I would HIGHLY recommend if available. We also had a flat white which was decent. I liked the decor. It was perfect for a cold holiday experience.

I'll admit it. This whole light bulb trend is what got me to try Idea Coffee. I had a very short stop in between my train from CT to Philadelphia so I power walked to Idea Coffee. I purposely checked beforehand to see which items on their menu came in the light bulb. The juices weren't really calling out to be so I opted for the cold brew in the light bulb and it was not cold. Because of the shape of the cup you really can't get ice in there. I wish they pre chilled the cold brew so when they pour it into the light bulb it's actually a 'cold' cold brew. The coffee was dark and fragrant. But it was also pricey. I can't speak for the other items on the menu though.  The interior is great; plenty of seating, modern, spacious, and free wifi. They also have a food menu so this is a solid cafe. I think this is a great spot for studying while sipping on a coffee and pastry. Honestly speaking, this was a place I wanted to hit up to get it 'out of my system.' I saw these light bulb cups everywhere and just wanted to get one. There wasn't a 'wow' factor but if I had lived closer this might have been my go to spot to hang out locally.

Even though this is a coffee shop, I went there to check out their cute and trendy light bulb container. Basically, their light bulbs are just gimmicky, but I have to give them a credit that their smoothies in the light bulbs are refreshing and yummy. I tried red light and yellow light. My fav is yellow light. The only downside is that the light bulbs are quite pricy ($7.25) but I can accept that because I'm a kid who always loves gimmicky things. LoL    Service is friendly and enthusiastic. The staff even asked me what the color of the straw and light I prefer :)  Note: Their light bulb containers are now my new flower vases. See, you pay higher for the souvenirs. LoL

Oh, how happy I am to have stumbled upon this place.  This is my new favorite spot!  Very cute place with adequate seating.  It's nice that there are a variety of seating choices as well - benched tables, smaller tables, bar seating against the window, etc.  The lighting is variable as well, so I'm sure it can cater to anyone's needs.  I love the feel of this place!  So, while I've only been here twice so far, it's been quite pleasant both times.  The people taking orders are nice, particularly the guy that works up front with the longer hair.  Food and drink always come out in a timely manner, and they seem to be sure to announce that your order is ready twice right off the bat so you'll know it's there to grab.    Ah the food and drink ^-^ Macarons : Best S'mores macaron I've ever had - and I've had my fair share.  Wonderful surprise in the middle, unlike others I've had ( where I expected it and was disappointed each time).  The Matcha macaron had a very delicate flavor, but great nonetheless.  The Pistachio macaron was just okay - it didn't really have many hints, and I would really have loved to experience more of that nutty element. Everything Bagel Toasted w Cream Cheese : Oh my geezus, this place sure doesn't skimp on the cream cheese! Fantastic.  Just how I like it lol There's seriously nothing worse than getting a bagel, and getting the tiniest amount of spread, and my mouth becoming a desert.  So, thank goodness this place doesn't make me suffer.  The bagel itself was delicious - actually one of the better bagels I've had in New York...go figure. Savory Cheese and Bacon Waffle : Need I say more?? The waffle itself is so nice and buttery; reminds me of a croissant, only much more dense.  It was sprinkled with chopped up bacon, melted shredded cheese, parsley (?), and these bigger sugar granules which gave a great texture change and touch of sweetness.  Amazing. Iced Matcha Latte : This was a little light on the matcha flavor, so I do wish it was a bit more robust.  However, it is still a wonderfully refreshing drink, and the milk seemed a bit frothy which was nice! Yellow Light : Ah ha, the light bulb drink!  First of all, can we talk about the cute light bulb bottle/cup it comes in?  WITH a working light and bendy straw.  On point. The drink itself was fantastic as well.  Fruity, cool, refreshing.  Seriously, an awesome drink to brighten your day figuratively and literally. Plus, you get to take the bulb home ^-^  I shall certainly keep coming back and filling up that drink card of theirs (another perk. who doesn't love those things?) Definitely recommend giving this place a try!!

Came here for the light bulb drink. There were 3 flavors- red light, yellow light, and green light. I think the cold brew also comes in a light bulb if you ask for it. I got the red light, which was a pomegranate drink with beets. The beets flavor was really strong, it tasted like a juice that you would get at a pressed juicery. The price was $7 for a lightbulb drink, which came with a straw and a light. The juice was great, but it was pretty pricey for a drink though. I would probably get something else if I were to come back again.

Nice atmosphere but didn't care for the PSL. Also the waffle that I tried was dry and lacked flavor. I only gave the place a three rating because I think maybe a tweak to my order would make the experience better
Can't speak to other items, but I had to throw out my cold brew after about two blocks of walking, it was that undrinkable.

I stopped in before work and was in a bit of a hurry. The people were friendly and the service was quick. I am an avid cold brew drinker so I thought I would give it a try here. Honestly, it tasted like dirt. After a few sips I had to throw it out. Seeing the other reviews, I feel like people like this place. Maybe the other drinks are better. I'm a bit hesitant to return...
Came here to get an iced vanilla latte and it was perfect. Nice and strong and not to sweet!

i have an appointment in the area once a week and three weeks in a row i've come in for a hot chocolate. i had previously been going to the starbucks across the street, but ditched them for a variety of reasons. idea coffee is cool, comfortable with a lot of options for food and drink. they always seems bustling. and their regular hot chocolate is always the perfect temperature, chocolately and delicious. a small is $5.44, but i really enjoy it.
Seems like a solid spot to grab a juice and quick bite. The green power smoothie was delish and the NYC pizza bagel was pretty good (albeit very greasy). Nice big communal tables.

We went for brunch around 10-11 am on Saturday. Place was pretty full. I thought menu was pretty good with lots of healthy options. I ordered Nordic Bowl which had only tiny piece of salmon, lettuce, onion and tomatoes.. $15. Regular packet tea was $4. The bowl tasted so plain and I was starving after eating it. Not sure why is it so expensive when it had nothing inside. I definitely would not order that bowl again. I honestly though bowl means they put something inside, like rice or barley. But it was the saddest brunch I ate in a while. The bathroom was the only place I enjoyed, it was very clean and smelled good.
