A long time Hell's Kitchen'er, I've been eating at El Rancho (yelp.com/biz/el-rancho-b?) for years, formerly La Paloma Burritos before they had a fire and remodeled. In my humble opinion they've got the best cheap burritos in town. Plus they are a BYOB establishment, as long as you're 21 of course.  I'm a bit late in the game here, but the other day I visited Bird & Branch with my mom to have some java. It was her recommendation as she said she loves the place. It opened in Feb 2018 and I just haven't made my way over till now, although I've walked by it several times. It's a cute, clean, friendly little cafe and I see why she likes it. I had one of their special season features called 'The Wren'. It was absolutely delicious. My mom's Almond Macadamia Milk Latte was spot on too. Our barista Alex was really nice and told us that the place is the child of Faith and Brandon, a married couple that I think live in Hell's Kitchen.  There's a few tables to sit at and they have wifi, but it ain't Starbucks so don't plop yourself down to stay and surf the net all day nursing one Cup of Joe. They don't have a public restroom, but there's one right next door at El Rancho that they'll probably let you use.  In the summer Bird & Branch has a nice long wooden bench set up outside to sit at. I'll sure I'll be doing some coffee lounging there come summertime. Definitely worth checking this place out if you haven't already.

While waiting for a table for brunch, we decided to kill some time here at this relatively new cafe. We ordered a cappuccino with low fat milk and a flat white with almond milk. The cappuccino was very smooth but the flat white was a little sour, not sure if it was because of the almond milk but it felt a bit off. There are a few tables, probably able to fit maximum 10 people, which is relatively normal for an NYC cafe. Very clean set up and friendly staff!

Never heard of Bird & Branch so when I passed by, I felt compelled to check it out.  This immaculate little cafe serves nibbles and beverages. I was browsing the menu when the barista had given a sample of the Starling iced tea (sencha tea that is cold brewed and carbonated) to a customer.  He had done so because it had quite the unusual flavor. Not all taste buds will go for it.  He also offered me a try and of course, could not refuse. I instantly liked it whereupon the other customer passed and ordered something more traditional. Fear not, they serve  familiar foods and beverages.  I went ahead and ordered the Starling. Two sizes---$5.50 for 16 oz or $6.00 for 20 oz. Yes, kind of steep. I thought it was very good especially since it was slightly carbonated. Also for sample were their spicy brownies which were very good.  I only ordered a beverage but they serve baked goods and sandwiches, coffee and tea. Also available was a refrigerated section containing other bottled beverages and chia puddings, etc.  Cute.

Bird & Branch is one of my new favorite spots in the city!!  I came here for a Yelp event, where I was able to try a variety of their desserts and their single origin coffees. Everything was absolutely wonderful! I particularly loved their Columbian coffee. As far as their desserts go, everything was delicious. My favorites were definitely the black sesame square (I'm admittedly biased; black sesame is my favorite dessert flavor by far!), their spicy chocolate brownie (actually spicy!), and the peanut butter chocolate cookie. I'd definitely order any one of these (or all, if we are being realistic and you promise not to judge) next time I come back here. The matcha square and ginger molasses cookie were also great.  I loved everything so much that I stayed after the event and ordered some more things from the menu! They make their own almond macadamia nut milk and it's to die for. I had their almond macadamia milk latte. I normally am a black coffee drinker and don't really "do" lattes, but this was one of the best things I've ever tried. Not too sweet at all. If this is your first time here, I highly recommend this drink!  Outside of having phenomenal coffee and desserts, the staff really stands out. Everyone is very knowledgable and passionate about what they do. The atmosphere is very small and cozy and incredibly popular in the neighborhood.  It's a must try. I'll come back whenever I'm in the area for sure, and would even travel out of my way just to come here.

Wanted to try some new coffee so decided to check this spot out. I initially wanted to try their Snowy Owl but found out it was a winter season drink. So I tried The Wren from the spring seasonal drinks menu. Cappuccino made with peanut butter and chocolate, topped with smoked salt. It was definitely new to my taste buds but I loved every sip of it! The place was cute& clean. Def wana try other drinks here.

Trendy coffee shop with quaint interior tables and a little oasis on the street outside, a seating area to sip and people watch. Friendly staff and quality items for order. I got sucked into a name, the DIRTY PIGEON. I mean, when in Rome....It is an egg cream with espresso and it's intense. My partner enjoyed her almond macadamia milk latte immensely. The earl grey shortbread cookies were the best I've ever had! Some toasts and croissants are other light fare food offerings. Located in the theater district, so if you have some time to kill before a show this is a perfect place to do it.

I try not to spend too much money on drinks, but wow I just dropped $7 on a latte here and I'm not even mad.  I've been to Bird & Branch a couple of times now. It's a 5 min walk from my office so I take ALL my walking meetings here. Now some coworkers love coming here too (spreading the word one meeting at a time)! It's such a sanctuary in this hellhole of time square/midtown (gotta say it like it is). I also sometimes go to the dance studio across the street so this cafe is just super convenient for all purposes. The interior is nicely decorated with enough space for probably ~10 people and they have wifi in case you want to work. The owners/workers are all super nice and pleasant.  I've head the matcha latte, matcha affagato, the sparrow, and the blackbird so far. The matcha affagato rivals the one you can get at Bluesone and the Blackbird is my favorite non matcha drink so far. I don't drink too much coffee but it gives me a nice kick and it's not too bitter. Prices are the expected $5-7 for coffee drinks in NYC (insert cry empty wallet emoji) and a little less for tea. They also have some pastries which I haven't tried before. I did sample their chocolate brownie once and didn't know it was spicy lol.  Overall, great vibes. The best cafe I've found in this area. I wish they had a stamp card/loyalty program though ;)

Literally stumbled upon this quaint coffee shop on a Saturday morning. We got there around 9am and they weren't busy but the crowd started coming in.  I think what really makes these place is the vibe and minimalistic decorations. It is such a cool coffee shop feel with nice owners.  I had the almond macadamia milk latt̬ iced. They make the milk in house which is neat. It was $5.75 but so worth it!  Not a lot of seating inside so plan ahead if you're having a coffee date. The pastry options looked really good but didn't try any. Will definitely try it again!

I stumbled upon this place one evening while a friend and I were looking to kill 30 minutes before going to see a show. The theater district is not the most relaxing area to hang out given the large number of tourists and all of the hustle and bustle, so we walked west and ran into Bird & Branch. It's close enough to the theaters to grab a quick coffee/tea/latte before a show, but feels sufficiently out-of-the-way enough to allow for a nice and quite chat with a friend. I ordered "the robin" which is essentially a tumeric and ginger latte. It was smooth, not too sweet, and had a nice spicy kick to it. The tumeric really adds to the uniqueness of the drink, and the color of course! My friend had the hot chocolate which was also quite nice. I really like this place. The drinks are unique and delicious, the staff is super friendly, and the space is really cute!

Saturday latte day  Pros: Great place for insta photos. Nice decor and friendly staff Great ice latte. They have stainless straws if you stay. It's reusable and environment friendly.  Cons: No bathroom for customers

Lovely gem, intimate and high quality, amid the 45th Street bustle. I come here almost daily before work and have only had good coffees and good experiences with the friendly, efficient staff. My favorites are the wren and turmeric-y robin; I love the bird themed bevvies and their merchandise! The only issue: 3 of the 4 times I've ordered tea, the baristas have grabbed the entire tea bag in their hands after ringing me up (instead of just holding the tea bag by the string); that's not sanitary and in my experience in coffee shops, baristas are explicitly told not to pick up the tea bags like that. I just don't order tea there anymore; problem solved?

Cool spot in Hell's Kitchen for coffee and quick bite. I got a latte and a ham & cheese crossiant one morning. Both were good, there are also more selections for food. They also have some cool stuff for sale as well!

This place just opened ~6 weeks ago and I decided to give it a try given how the photos on Yelp looked.  I'm always a fan of trying to find good matcha near my office.  Bird & Branch didn't disappoint - the owner was very helpful and explained anything we had questions on. When we asked if we could try the house made almond macadamia milk, he was eager to give us a small shot to try before we buy. The milk is so nice and creamy, sweetened with dates rather than sugar!  We ordered matcha lattes with the sesame brownie. The lattes are a good balance of milk and matcha and very smooth.  Definitely try the black sesame brownie! It tastes like the filling in sesame tang yuan (glutinous rice balls). Very nice and strong sesame flavor, but also not too sweet. It's also very moist!
I love Earl Grey tea and coffee but I would have never put them together. Bird & Branch did in their nightingale and it was so amazing I came back 2 days later for another one before leaving town!

This is such a CUTE little shop! I ordered a mocha and it was seriously the best I've had in my life! Not bitter, super smooth, not too sweet & they put real vanilla bean in the latte which was a super nice touch. Their pastries also look out of this world! I didn't get one, but I definitely will be on my next stop in...which will be soon! They also have cute merch on sale and you can buy their beans! Go check them out!

Amazing cashew milk lattes and avocado toast. I also bought a bag of coffee to bring home and was very happy with the taste and quality. The owners of the cafe are so kind and engaging. Definitely the best coffee shop in NYC!
A super cute cafe right across from Schmakary's with specialty lattes. Definitely recommend the spicy brownies.

I found the coffee flight quite acidic for my taste. The place has just enough sitting. More of a grab and go place but has enough outlets and chairs in case you want to stay for a bit. It's not that spacious and they don't have a restroom (they're not required to since they are a small place). The guy barista earlier was very entertaining and helpful with his suggestions. It's a cute place to visit and I might even come back to taste their lattes.

This new kid in the block is definitely a place to watch out for. The owners are the most amazing and humble people who truly care for things and make sure to bring out the best coffee from across the globe to you. This place is heaven especially for people who love black coffees. I didn't know there can be so much to know about my coffee that i mindlessly drink every morning until they described it in details. Just like wine tasting, you should come try their coffee flights and let magic beans cast the spell on you. The decor is very modern and neat. Big space with seats around for you to sit. Their bakes goods are amazing. I got the pleasure to try the matcha cakes, sesame cake, chocolate with spice in it! yess you read that right. This was so unique, as the chocolate melts in your mouth, the spice will kick right in. My fav was matcha cake. Don't miss it. And don't miss this place. Thanks to the yelp team and Rafi, otherwise i would have taken ages to discover this  gem.

Got off the bus at Port Authority & needed a coffee or something matcha badly. Found this new & pretty cafe on Yelp & decided to check it out, as their menu looked interesting.  1st impression, the place is unassuming & just off the Avenue of Hell's Kitchen, on a quite tree-lined block. Their BEAUTIFUL parking spot public seating "installation" is a work of art. I sense a West Coast influence? A former architect/artist? Their space is sunny & spacious, with a small high top counter & 2 small seating areas at both windows. Great Design- everything's pale pink & white with clean angles & pops of greenery. Their octagon white tile coffee table looks homemade, fitting the short danish?-style stools perfectly. Their small retail section is interesting to look at & shows a #zerowaste mindset. The garbage sorting/sugar/untensil area is Amazing. Can you come to my house & make me one please?  The owners seemed to put in a lot of care and hard work into the business. The menu also reflects that, with a tumeric latte, good coffee, fig & cheese danish, earl grey & black sesame shortbread cookies, and strawberry & pistachio kouign amman, chia cups, to name a few. (They are displayed in clear glass boxes that you'd probably find at the Anthropology jewelry section.) The staff was very nice & patient. They seemed to already have regulars, with cute dogs.  However, my lower review is about the product. I appreciate the quality in The matcha brownie ($3) was dense. But it was *too* intense, I guess that's why they have small bags of brownie "ends" for sale, scared to eat that whole brownie! It tastes more like a blondie with matcha notes at the end. Left mouth feeling dry/tart in the way good matcha does. The Blackbird latte ($6) was tasty at first impression, coffee was strong & nutty, you can taste hints of blackberry & a hint of herbal, (not sure about the sprinkles of dried thyme on top though) a few crushed seeds at the bottom of the cup. But the homemade almond macadamia nut milk they use (like heavy cream) was *too* heavy after a few sips & a bit nauseating. The initial coffee & sweetness seemed to disappear & I was mostly tasting creamy stuff. Later on when the ice melted, it was easier to drink, but by then it tasted like a regular latte.  The pricing is higher that what I would normally pay for similar items (well- never had a matcha brownie before!), & I'm sure to to cover all the extra work for quality ingredients (squeezing all those nuts!) and manhattan location. I would only visit Branch & Bird as a special treat & very rarely. I hope they do well though, really great ideas & attention detail, nice staff. But only a rare return visit from me. Too bad.
Great filtered coffee! Had a fruity smell and taste. The brownies are to die for good! I would definitely recommend it to anyone to try it out.

I came here with a friend after having lunch nearby. I wasn't expecting much in terms of cuteness for the place, but it was actually really cute! There is outdoor seating and the place serves the drinks with reusable straws. Their inside could be brightened a bit more with natural lighting, but the decorations are still pink and pretty. As for the drinks themselves, I'm not a huge fan but I don't hate them. It's something that's good enough to get through a hot summer day. Unfortunately, this cafe does not have a public bathroom.
So far I've tried the almond macadamia milk latte (both hot and cold), the blackbird, and the starling.. gotta say the blackbird is #1-- esp if you're a fan of sweeter drinks.

Inventive, delicious coffee served in a muji-esque atmosphere. we tried the summer special coffees, the dirty pigeon and the swallow. Both had slight amounts of carbonation and sweetness. The swallow had lemon syrup while the pigeon had cinnamon and chocolate. They were both great and i would have them again! I would definitely come back and try more coffees here. The matcha square was also delicious.
Drinks(lattes) are extremely loaded with milk.. we ordered three lattes and they were all way to heavy on the milk/cream

Place is very nice. Service was exceptional and environment was very pleasant: lots of light, comfortable. We got matcha brownie and black sesame brownie, both were good. Tea was very nice as well. Nice place next to Times Square.

This place is so ridiculously cute. Think pinterest and your favorite insta-blogger combined! It's kind of a small shop, and there's not a ton of seating, so it's not a great place to work, but if you can snag a seat, it's very cozy.  The staff were very nice, and didn't make you feel like they were just trying to hustle you through (but they were still efficient!).  I got the iced macadamia almond milk latte, it was a little over $6 for what seemed to be about 16oz. Seems about right for the neighborhood since they're an independent shop. It was a good latte, but not very remarkable, I guess I just wanted more out of it.  If you want good pictures, make sure you get the drink to stay, the glasses/cups are very cute.

Their homemade almond macadamia milk is so fresh and tasty!! They have this instead of almond milk. I always get the matcha latte with the almond macadamia milk. So good!!!! They whisk their matcha powder with hot water which is what is traditionally and supposed to be done instead of stirring. I haven't tried other espresso items on their menu, but my mom has tried their latte and loves it! Their space is a bit tight, but there are a few tables here and there for working, but it's a little awkward staring straight behind the counter to the baristas/owners (haha). Prices are kind of expensive, but I recommend! Place is clean and new!
Cute place and comfortable, perfect to chat with a friend. Their nightingale was really good although their snowy owl wasn't that great. Lighting in this place is really nice.

When I stepped in I immediately felt at ease. Such a peaceful and calm start to the day. The white textured decor accented with the life of plants and people make the coffee and breakfast a level higher than any other place in the area. I love the choice of coffee, St. Franks, and the variations of lattes, cold brew, espressos and more make the selection just right. Definitely do the coffee flight if you can, to get a sampling of the offerings. Add some dessert or croissants and your day is set. I highly recommend a visit.  ----  Update: even after just a few months the cafe as grown so much! More coffee cocktails, more creative toasts, so much to try out every time! Sesame squares are a must.

I'm a former coffee shop owner, a trained barista, so I'm always looking for great espresso. I found it at bird & branch, a nice-sized, super-clean shop tucked off 9th.  Had the Burundi single origin as a macchiato and it was bright and smooth. Had some shop talk with the friendly, knowledgeable staff. Definitely going to add this to my collection of best coffee places in NYC.

Very nice reasonably priced good-quality coffee shop, spacious (in Manhattan) with nice yummy pastry  **Please ask selfish customers not to hoard the full table and more than 1 chair per person    **coffee can be a tad stronger

Points for fresh clean dogwater outside the shop on a summer's day! In fact, a hot doggo was lapping some up when I arrived.  This morning was my first time here. I ordered an iced cold brew and a vegan chocolate chip cookie. Both were very good. The coffee stayed strong through some ice-melting, and I detected no bitterness. The cookie was tasty and fresh with no lack of chips, if not particularly large. (My hips thank you)  Service was friendly and quick. In my pre-caffeinated state I was unable to open the simple syrup bottle, but the barista didn't try to make me feel like the simpleton I was, instead she kindly opened it for me with a smile. :^)  My pre-tip total for the iced cold brew and the cookie was $7.25 so not cheap; but we knew that going in, didn't we? Precious Manhattan cold brew comes at a precious Manhattan price.  A bright clean slick interior; a brick wall. A pleasant and non-distracting backdrop for a superior brew. Let the coffee be the star here, it seems to convey.

A nice place to sit down and do work in, limited in seating though. Clean bathroom is a plus! Came and tried their waffle cup macchiato. I think the chocolate from the waffle cup kind of masked the espresso flavor a little bit causing it to taste more sour than bold. They can also do the waffle cup without any coffee and just a shot of milk. I wanted to sit down and get some work done so I ordered a cortado as well because the macchiato is pretty small ($5). Cortados are usually what I get when I'm in the mood for a stronger latte (aka less milk, stronger espresso flavor, or maybe even cappuccino with no foam) this did not disappoint, the espresso flavor in this was pretty strong and bold.  The barista was super nice and worked quickly. I definitely will be back if I'm around the area and craving a good cup of espresso.
I luv it here. I enjoy my morning here. Not to mention Carly and Taya , from my small town , give me such comfort. Love this place
Adorable coffee shop. I got the waffle shot- a combo of bitter (coffee) and sweet (chocolate). They also have pastries like croissants, cookies, donuts, etc. The workers were super nice and friendly.

Omg my new addiction. This place is right across my work but I had been avoiding it because I was super loyal to another spot 2 blocks away. However, I have turned! Their coffee is so delicious and flavorful and never tastes burned. The staff is super friendly also! It's a small space but never too crowded and has a clean and warm atmosphere. First time I went was yesterday and I already went back today. So happy I tried it! Would highly recommend to all!!

Great coffee and service. A little tight and not usually a place to sit, so don't recommend it as a place to get work done. But the coffee beats other small shops in the area. Staff is splendid and drinks are always made to perfection.

Excellent coffee, excellent service, they still have oat milk.  Great place to stop by if you're in the neighborhood. Feels very warm and inviting, with the walls papered with the coffee-related patents and Edison bulbs shining on wooden tables. Seating is limited but sufficient, with a long bar by the window and a few other tables scattered throughout; have a bathroom you can use.  Coffee is great, I like the cortado with oat milk. They also always have some specialty drink going on. Baristas do it with care and seem like they're having a good time. There are pastries too, which look good though I've never tried them.

love this spot!  the ambiance is really chill, a great space to work with four smaller work tables, a counter against the window, and two standing tables for coffee chats.  the lattes / cold brew here are great, love that they take the cups app and have loyalty punch cards. staff here is always friendly, wait time is short to normal.  the only cons are: - their music is a little on the louder side (and not quite my taste but totally a personal preference), so when i'm here working for a longer amount of time i'll just put in my own music - it gets super cold bec they blast the ac (also personal because i'm always on the colder side)  otherwise i'm always down to stop by because it's quick and convenient and clean!

This cafe is pretty small space, but very cozy. They sell very cute "shot" for espresso! Actual, I thought I ordered this one, but had a miscommunication with a shop staff. However, a kind staff remade it for me and I could get the shot made of waffle!! The edible shot is very good! I really like this place and want to go there again!

Cute environment and great work space! My iced chai order came out quickly and the WiFi was helpful, barista was very friendly. I'll definitely be stopping by again, great quiet location and great drinks. Highly recommend for the busy professional looking for a small coffee break in the middle of this bustling busy city.
I tried their waffle cone coffee and it was amazing! The coffee was a bit on the bitter side but it complement well with the chocolate-covered come.

I needed coffee with my bagel and found this place via Yelp (and then walked by it). I like the decor - it's clean and cozy. There's 3 sit down tables, a few standing tables by the exposed brick wall, and a bar facing the window for good people watching. It's 32 outside but I got an iced latte. It hit the spot. If I'm back in this area I'd come back. Happy I found this spot though!

Ok yes I got really mad because their push door looks like a pull door. But don't worry, I gave everyone working there a PIECE of my MIND about it -- so I'm sure they'll fix it.  Other than that, everything about this place is great! There's great window seating for sitting and staring at all the beautiful people of Flatiron. Delicious coffee! Cool staff! Free fast wifi! And maybe it's just because this place hasn't been discovered by the masses yet, but it feels very chill and relaxing in here. I kind of hope it stays a little secret. But I'm also writing a 5-star review to attract people here... so I don't know what I TRULY want. Will head to therapy after I grab another latte from Black Press, brb.
I had just a fantastic experience at this cafe! The espresso was pulled just right, and the customer service was excellent! This is a place I would came back to many times over

This place opened up about a month ago and I've been dying to try it out. National coffee day they had a special where drip coffee was $1 for a small. It's adorable and clean inside , and very relaxing. My review though is based off the staff , who weren't friendly at all. Maybe it's because I came in here looking like a mess after a workout, or they had a rough day. I'll try it out more time, but a cappuccino.

The coffee here is so delicious! I always get their lattes (iced or hot) and they are so flavorful and definitely perk you up! The interior is so cute- rustic yet chic. The staff is very friendly to customers (and amongst themselves which is always nice to see). Overall, and most importantly, great coffee. Will absolutely be back!

This is my go to coffee spot since my college is only a few blocks away. And I can not stop raving about it to my friends! Where do I begin? I'm a sucker for Caf̩ aesthetics and it's just so beautiful inside! Also I take my coffee pretty seriously and there's not a thing on the menu I haven't tried that I liked. But my absolute fav are their cortados and cappuccinos! Also a big fan of their newish loyalty cards and WiFi, 10/10 would recommend!
Ducked in to get out of the rain. Maple Cinnamon Soy Latte.  Asked for a little less maple...Very nice. Nice quiet place (yet full). Fair price. Highly recommended

Good spot for some quick coffee. No line, even on a weekday morning. It's a small cafe but there's a few tables for getting some work done.  Their cold brew is $4 and pretty smooth, but I would've liked less ice and more brew (about half the cup was filled with ice)
I feel really lucky to have this place a block from my apartment. I went for the first time today; the coffee was great and the brownie was was of the best I've had.
Great coffee! Love the location off of the main avenues. Super nice staff and very good vibe. Like that supplies are locally sourced and locally owned. Highly recommend it!

I'm here for fashion week and I couldn't be happier to have stumbled upon this coffee shop gem. Make sure you try their cold brew, you won't be disappointed! The baristas always have a smile on and will answer any questions you have. I look forward to getting coffee everyday I'm here!!

Amazing service! Very relaxing atmosphere with an amazing Piccolo drink provided by Walter, the teacher of swans. I appreciate baristas that are friendly, smart, and talented due to hard work and determination. Thank you to all the employees of Bluestone for providing an amazing atmosphere in the midst of busy Manhattan.

cute cute cute! This location is one of the more adorable Bluestone Lane locations.  Btw, the macchiato's here are true macchiatos (meaning they are single/double shot espressos).  THEY HAVE OAT MILK!
Another new place for me in my quest for healthy Matcha. This place has it. Outstanding.

My go to Midtown coffee house. Walter always greets us with a smile. They're quick and efficient. I go here when I want to treat myself with an oat milk latte, though their drip coffee is pretty good too.

Decide to check another location, since my last visit was midtown 37st and the staff recommended to visit 48th Madison since both stores is run by the same manager. I was around visiting the area  doing some shopping, and i came across Bluestone Lane, the store is quite small but the team has an incredible energy as soon as you walk in. Joshua and Ruddy were both amazing and made my day very special, the store looked spotless and very cleaned. Overall both locations that i came across the service has been amazing, staff are very well trained, and both locations are tidy and clean.
Great service and great coffee! Quick grab and go spot that hits the spot. Banana bread is good! Lives up to the hype!

I tried a golden latte for the first time at Boulder Tea House in Colorado. Ever since I've been back home in New York, I couldn't find one I loved as much until I came to Bluestone Lane!! The staff is super friendly and there are so many different choices and options.

I was contacted personally on this matter and CEO Nick has gone above and beyond to rectify this issue.  I will give them another shot and hope this was an isolated incident.  I appreciate the follow up customer service. Thank you!

I love the availability of cold pressed juices and various toast selections. I ordered the smoked salmon toast. Smoked salmon are layered on top of thick-cut whole grain toast. Highly recommended. For drinks I tried Yarraville, which includes beets, carrots, apples and ginger roots. The juice tastes very refreshing. Great breakfast choices.
One of the best places for coffee in the city and the friendliest staff (Kelvin, Josh and Walter to name a few). Relaxing and chill atmosphere while you enjoy a great cup of coffee.

Great little coffee shop. I got a chai latte and, at the barista's recommendation, got it with oat milk. It was DELICIOUS. Spicy and creamy and sweet and generally just fabulous with a kiss of cinnamon sugar on top. I also got the chai bundt cake (yes, I was in a mood), which was delightful. Very moist and well-flavored cake with a super sweet icing. I could see it being too sweet for some folks, but for me it was just perfect.  On the savory side, we got the tumeric sweet potato toast. Normally I'm not into the "toast" phenomenon (I know how to make that at home), but this was really, really tasty. It had a little heat and a hint of sweetness and generally was just excellent. I'll definitely be back again.
The only place in NYC that has coffee as good, if not better, than back home in Australia. Proper espresso coffee and great food. I just wish these were on every corner instead of Starbucks.
Friendly staff, nice, bright place and a darn good cold brew with a nice area of milk options. The Chai Bundt was nothing special, but solid. I'll definitely be back.
Awesome service from Joshua , great location! Love this place. Great vibes awesome music. Fun place to grab a great coffee and escape the cold.

Goodbye Gregory's, I've found my new go to coffee spot in midtown east. The coffee here is smooth and non dairy milks like oat are no extra charge, whereas typically at coffee spots the soy isn't extra charge but everything else is, so it actually ends up being cheaper and better here if you prefer non dairy!

Plus 2 stars for the British girl and the tall dude with the beard. They were both super cool and helpful. I'm glad they were there this time to help us. They were really genuine and took time to explain some of the lesser known drinks on the menu. I want more shops like this in area - smaller who still care about coffee. A good way to combat the rampant Starbucks invasion around the area (49st has two Starbucks on the same block in sight of each other.. Seriously).  Plus another star for the owner who actually took the time to care and not just reply with a generic "We will do better" answer. I love blue bottle because their coffee is good and their employees are awesome. The matcha latte from here was bomb diggity. I guess my first experience was a timing kind of thing, but I'm glad I gave this place another try. Cheers mate

The coffee here is so good, but expensive! A basic latte is $4.75 + tax; and if you get soy milk it's an additional $0.50 add on. I usually get Bluestone Lane coffee on days I decide to treat myself to a good cup of coffee, otherwise I stick to that water down office coffee (yuck). Unlike Starbucks, they do not burn the beans which makes my espresso based drinks very smooth and creamy tasting.

This is perfect coffee and excellent service.  Get the Australian specialties, the Flat White and the Magic.  Today, a Sunday, I went in at 8:30 believing they might be open only to discover their opening time was at 9 am.  Any heartless chain coffee would have told me to come back in 30 mins but the owner, taking pity on my confusion and seeing the bleary hungover appearance, stopped his prep and whipped up two drinks for me on the spot, explained the menu, and at no point let me feel like I was screwing up his morning routine (which I definitely was).  And the coffee was outstanding--the Magic (similar to a cortado) is a new favorite.  Intensely flavorful.    Bottom line is you don't have to take a 14-hour flight to Sydney to enjoy an Aussie-style cup from an actual Aussie (judging from his accent) barista.

Really good but EXPENSIVE!! FYI the small Aussie iced latte ($5.50ish) is a giant cup of iced coffee with a scoop of ice cream in it - very yummy but it is very decadent (but not overly sweet). FYI - no table seating or bathroom in this place.

The coffee is delicious, made even better by the fact that they offer Oatly oat milk. The staff could not be friendlier, especially Ruddy, who remembers my name and my order every morning. The roasts are also delicious and perfect for a filling breakfast .
Super friendly staff and love the milk and gluten free options. The banana toast was yummy! Looking forward to going back here.

Love bluestone Lane. How else do I describe my passion for coffee. Some would say that Colombian coffee is great, but Australian coffee takes the cake. We love Sam and Emily - they always rock it out and the coffee is top notch. Oh yeah, did I mention the avocado toasts. Or how about the best deal in NYC - the banana toast!  Don't miss out and don't waste time at other shops like Greg's or Sbux.

Great spot, with the best coffee and crew.  My go-to coffee place every morning.  The staff is phenomenal - there might be a line when you walk I but they always keep it moving and keep the orders straight.  Cliona and Johnny are two faces I see every morning and they are very customer service oriented.  I go to several blue stone locations and this one is by far is the whole package - clean, great coffee, and awesome staff!
Nicest baristas, BEST gluten free avocado toast! Made my morning. Can't wait to try their other GF, vegan options!

I give em a couple stars for friendliness and cleanliness, both of which they have in abundance. But no cash (only cards, with a somewhat coercive onscreen tip option)! Extremely loud ultra-hip electro music, first thing in the morning. And the kicker: my coffee, regular, not some hipster espresso thing, was poor.  Tasted unfresh, one-dimensional. A little grounds-y flavored. The stuff I normally get from the cart vendors is at least as good. And even Starbucks serves up normal coffee immediately. This place took like five minutes, which makes no sense.  I get that people like coffee in a hip environment, and I like friendly. But not me, not for $3.50 for 16oz. I don't mind paying up, but it better be good...

Bluestone serves the best coffee in all of midtown. There's plenty of alternatives, but this new shop is by far the best. Not only was I impressed with their coffee, but I was also impressed with their customer service. Emily and Rudey were super friendly, helpful, and made my coffee experience very enjoyable. I'll definitely be coming back!
Disappointing; very expensive, and very slow service.  I don't see the justification for the high prices unless you work across the street and it's raining, etc.

Stopped by here on my way to Hillsong Church (btw y'all should check it out on Sundays 10am/ 12pm/ 2pm/ 6pm/ 8pm) and I liked it! I was actually just looking for a warm drink, because it was super cold outside and I yelped the nearest place around me.  The inside is small and dark with hipster vibes and there wasn't too much on the menu except coffee. But as I'm lactose intolerant, I was skimming through to find non-dairy options. They offer almond and oat milk (no soy milk), so I decided to try out the Chai tea latte with oat milk (my first time)!  It was surprisingly not bad, so me and my bf were able to finish it together before going to church! Overall, if you want a quiet, hipster moment with dark selfies, y'all should check this place out! ;)

My Americano was good. But I'd be lying if I said coffee was the main reason I came here...  The real reason is that the most underrated chocolate chip cookie exists in this coffee shop. It's the perfect standard textbook chocolate chip cookie. It's the chocolate chip cookie you failed to bake at home when you were a kid, the one you saw on kids shows/movies, and the one that pops in your head when I say 'chocolate chip cookie'.  If you want a really good, simple chocolate chip cookie, get this one. It's not mindboggling or one of the 'best' cookies in NYC, but we're human. Believe it or not, some days we're just not feeling an over-the-top Levain cookie rock. I call this "The Real People's Chocolate Chip Cookie".

I normally don't like sweet things, but their cookie might have converted me. It's just slightly crispy on the outside, and fluffy with chocolate on the inside. The cookie is also the size of my palm!  I really liked their coffee and the interior as well, it was quite cozy but still felt spacious. Will definitely be back if I'm in that area.

It's good to be back in NYC enjoying the hustle and bustle in another amazing coffee shop :) This is a branch of the amazing Culture Espresso, and is located along midtown-West side. Pretty close to Penn station if you're looking for a good pick-me-up in the area. This shop is a small space, but decent size for NYC. Depending on the time of day it can be busy or slow. When I arrived there was a small line and seats were filled inside. But after a few minutes of waiting I was able to get seated with a friend. There's a large glass window with booth seating to people watch or have a good convo, and there is a large table space in the center for people to do work. There are a few 2 people seating tables along the side as well for those who want a bit more privacy.  The coffee is AMAZING here. The baristas are fantastic. They make amazing espressos in a quick amount of time in the business of the lines of people. And they get their beans from Heart Coffee Roasters out in Portland, Oregon. For those of you who are still new to the coffee world - let's just sat Heart Coffee is one of the best out west, if not in the states :P I ordered a macchiato and was made to perfection :)  They are also known for their amazing Chocolate Chip cookies and Oatmeal Cranberry cookies. My friend ordered the chocolate chip cookie, and I had a few bites of it :P It was delicious! It was nice and warm on the outside, and warm and gooey on the inside with a ton of chocolate chips. Macchiato and cookie - my cup of tea. The barista also told me they won the Cookie Competition this past year..apparently it's the new cookie and better than Levain Bakery's cookie now! I have tried both and going to be honest - hard to judge which is the better cookie. All that to say, please do yourself a favor and get a cookie with your espresso drink..you won't regret it. They also have amazing baked goods around the City from places like Ceci Cela, Blue Sky Bakery, Ovenly, Dough Doughnuts, Corner Caf̩, and Magpies.  There are also two more locations in midtown-west area. I haven't checked out the other places, but imagine it's just as amazing. I'm a pretty hardcore Stumptown fan, but this might be my new fav in NYC. Love Culture Espresso and will def be having another cup of coffee and cookie during my next trip to NYC :) Always good to be back in the city that never sleeps ;D

The cookies here are heavenly and are my favorite guilty pleasure.  I try to stop here at least once a week for a cookie, but i find myself here twice a week sometimes.  Definitely stop by and check them out.

Culture 36 is a casual coffee and tea shop with some baked desserts. They carry Dough doughnuts and chocolate chip cookies. The latter is warm and soft in the centre while being crispy on the outside. Definitely a place to stop by to treat yourself with a cookie. Worth it! They offer milk substitutes for all their drinks, which is great for vegans/lactose-intolerant. The caf̩ is also fairly spacious given its location with a decent amount of seating. I have never had a problem finding a seat and enjoying my tea and chocolate chip cookie.
Nice coffee and cool space. Good for meeting, working, resting. I recommend this place. The coffee is very tasty.

Adorable ambiance with sweet service. Cozy, cute, and hipster spot that the garment district needed.  Their latte is smoother than Robert Downey Jr - didn't even require flavoring or sugar, not bitter at all, and so foamy. Maybe one of the best I've had.  Also split their chocolate chip cookie. It's so thick and chocolatey!!! Will have to return for their oatmeal cookie immediately.

Ran in here to take a quick cold brew break from the office and wanted a pass on the usual DD & Sbux in the area. Friendly staff, looks like they had a good selection of hot coffee drinks too. Cold brew was good - smooth, not too acidic. I'd go back for sure.

Cute cafe shop made simple and elegant in a city where the competitors are all trying to be too big, too much, and too extravagant.  They confuse you with a plethora of options where you walk in and forget you where there for a cup of joe.   My hot chocolate was tasty and soothing.  The last hot chocolate I got from a pop up competitor wasn't made with much effort.  The service here is superb and they are very knowledgeable.  They almost seem vested.   Everyone should stop by and try something because they will not be disappointed!

probably the worst Flat White I have ever had. I just returned from London where its a staple. Its $4 for a small. I was disappointed and would love to try again as I walk past this place everyday. but the coffee is weak and bitter. Its got a nice look and many $4 a pop muffins etc. I will walk a block over to get much better. sorry - I want to like this cute place but ....never had a winning coffee.

Great space, Great coffee, and the barista took pity on my story about having my backpack stolen though miraculously recovered, and gave me a free, delicious chocolate chip cookie.  highly recommend this place if you're anywhere in the neighborhood, great Wi-Fi, beautiful, great coffee, Great staff.
good coffee. really good pastries. bad customer service.

So beautiful and PEACEFUL walking in to the open airy cafe. Cute paintings and colors on the walls. Not crowded at any point. More seating in the back.  We ordered: Iced chai - A- Smoked s'mores latte - A (you get a cool "show" when they smoke the drink and torch the marshmallow at the bar) Matcha croissant - A  There's also free tap/sparkling water you can serve yourself, which I appreciated. And homemade nut milk, which was interesting to try!

"Most girly coffee shop in NYC"  Came here for a biz meeting, but this is such an ornate place.....it's looks a bandit from Versailles attended a musical from Liberace..except more pink  Haves 1) The most beautiful coffee shop in nyc 2) The most chick friendly coffee shop anywhere  Wishes 1) more seating 2) faster service

Smore's latte, espresso, matcha croissant, salted caramel donut  all very good! Friendly staffs! Especially s'mores latte was so good and it was fun to watch them making it :) Love the interior, clean, lots of paintings. Great ambience as well.

Since September 2018 Felix has been creating a buzz not only with the caffeine they serve but the aesthetically pleasing decor that includes blush and teal walls, rose gold accents, and a round wooden coffee bar.  The creators of this java oasis were not setting out to make THE most Instagammable coffee-shop in The Big Apple but rather a beautiful space for patrons to have a unique experience.  Felix is becoming known for their creative coffee creations but also the only other place you can grab Supermoon Bakehouse pastries in the city.  During my visit I ordered the hickory smoked s'mores latte which comes with a price tag of $14 and not jolt of caffeine as well.  The drink is made using their house Ethiopian coffee, and prepared inside of a graham cracker dusted rim glass and then smoked inside of a large glass bell.  If you are not in the mood for one of the coffee creations they do offer the traditional coffee beverages with a more modest price.  They offer wifi at this location but no electrical outlet, so you won't be camping out at Felix.    I highly recommend you visit this fab place to grab a cup of coffee and really just take in the location.

So beautiful and so worth spending time in. I couldn't believe this place was right on Park - it seems much more Greenwich Village-y. Of course it's must appreciated for those of us who are stuck in midtown for work - a nice reprieve from the ugly!  Two drip coffees and a croissant came to $10 so prices are totally normal. Nowadays pastries run for about $4-5 and coffee at a spot like this is $2.50. Reasonable in my opinion especially given the beautiful design of this place. Also, they have different creamers on tap and don't charge extra if you opt for almond milk (or their very own nut milk).  I noticed they serve wine as well so looks like you can go with whatever you are in the mood for at Felix.  Ps- I kept the pretty paper they serve their pastries on. It was too gorgeous to just toss away!

Popped into Felix Roasting Co after a morning workout and was pleasantly surprised.  The space is absolutely gorgeous. Total coffeehouse vibe, with beautiful tiny tables all with flower centerpieces. The barista is located in the middle of the room, sandwiched by ample front and back seating.  This coffeeshop resells Supermoon Bakehouse baked goods: they're enormous and wonderfully delicious. I ordered a green tea croissant and flat white. The croissant was flakey and oozing with sweet custard - not too much where it was overpowering though. The flat white was tasty and rich.  Definitely recommend this spot as a coffee date spot!

Aesthetically pleasing coffee spot.  I don't need anything else.  Oh, of course the lattes are amazing and the pastries to top it off.  I had wanted to try the s'mores latte, but decided to save it for an occasion or when with a friend.    Did I mention how much I love the classy interior of this place? The decor accentuates the middle where the cashier/barrista are.  I will definitely make more trips to this haven.  My only grip is that in the back the proximity of patrons to patrons is quite close.  It appears otherwise in the front part of the cafe.

Beautiful and chic coffeeshop located in Park Ave and midtown. Felix Roasting Co is a new coffeeshop serving delicious, pricey espresso drinks and Supermoon Bakehouse croissants... well worth your wallet! Elegance exudes the interior of every corner, even the bathroom! It's so intricately designed and picture-worthy. The wallpaper and colors compliments the drinks served. There isn't a lot of seating nor a big place to particularly work in, but at slow times, one can get some things done!  Accepts card. Bathroom available.  Drink up!

I am no different than any other New Yorker. I find a nice coffee shop that will allow me to sit hours on end with only buying a black coffee.  This place had me second guessing my normal routine of taking over a table and not speaking english when someone asks if I am leaving. This is the cathedral of coffee shops. The decor is stunning, I didn't want to touch anything in fear of breaking something and having to pay for it (with the 4 bucks I had in my pocket).  I asked the barista what he suggested, and to no one's surprise he picks the most expensive thing on the menu. I wasn't upset, that's just smart business. I didn't want to be that guy who chooses the least expensive, so I went with the deconstructed tonic latte. Super super fancy. This gorgeous long stem glass filled with botanicals (I could only identify the mint) filled with this smooth pink nectar that I could only suspect came from the sweat of a unicorn, with a side of some very strong espresso.  "Sir, how do you suggest I drink this?" "Smell, sip, pour, swirl, drink."  And so the adventure begins. Was it worth the $12+ I spent? Did I feel the eyes of every patron waiting to see me drink it? Were the customers on line glaring at me with my laptop on my lap?

I'm convinced you won't find a more aesthetically pleasing coffee shop anywhere in New York City. This place is stunning. Most coffee shops seemingly grab some salvaged building material from a construction site in Bushwick, buy a La Marzocco espresso machine, then swing open their doors and sell you a $3.50 drip coffee. Not here. They went big, and it's something to behold.  Their decor isn't the only thing turning heads, as they make some seriously impressive coffee drinks as well. I got the deconstructed tonic espresso, and it could have easily missed the mark with ingredients I'd never consider pairing. But the result is a sweet, bitter, and aromatic beverage that was unlike anything I've ever had before. They have plenty of other interesting coffee drinks on their menu, but you should make it a priority to try this one first.  I wouldn't say it's the most comfortable place to hang if you're more into the cozy, broken-in couch type of cafe. But it's certainly a nice place to order a creative coffee drink.

This will not be a daily or weekly splurge for me. It is very crowded on weekends and finding seating can be challenging. But I did enjoy the inside decor of this very atypical and overpriced coffee shop with a decadent and Instagram worthy feel. It would be a great venue for meeting friends or going on a first date. It sure beats Starbucks. I did notice a lot of tourists there and the price point is much too high for me to ever seriously consider being a regular. A very delicious donut and ice chai late came to almost 13 dollars. They both looked beautiful.

What an interesting, spacious, and pleasant addition to the cafe scene in this area! With the Wes Anderson inspired decor, supermoon bakehouse pastries, and soon-to-be in-house roaster, Felix Roasting Co is taking it to the next level!  The cafe is spacious with high ceilings and has a warm, slightly vintage feel with the wallpapers and pastel pink & green color accents. Most importantly though, the servers/baristas are so friendly! They bring you your order if you're staying in and bring you cups of water after a little bit (this is not a full service cafe). I was here for a few hours in the morning and it was a nice place to get my work done.  The drip coffee is also great - not too strong, not too light, and it's awesome that Felix Roasting Co will start roasting their own beans just down stairs and holding classes, tastings, cuppings as well! Super excited to check out these classes myself!
Felix Roasting Co: Recommendation: 1: Smoked S'more Latte 2: Deconstructed Espresso Tonic 3: Supermoon Croissant A great place to take photos!

I absolutely love Felix Roasting Co.  Aesthetically this caf̩ is perfection, something out a Marie Antoinette fever dream!  Experientially, the staff is pleasant and always happy to answer questions. The coffee is smooth and consistently topped with expert latte art, which lends a sophisticated and professional air to their operations.  You are able to enjoy coffee/tea/croissants (from SuperMoon Bakehouse) during the day, but then easily transition to a happy hour mindset as they begin serving wine in the afternoon.    Overall, what you will get at Felix is smooth coffee, visually enticing pastries, and a consistently lovely customer experience. Bravissimo!

There's an Instagram account called @FomoFeed that features pop-up museums, stores, and experiences designed for the Instagram dwellers of Manhattan and social media users embedded in the constant search for the next trendy spot for a totally-not-staged photo in a perfectly curated setting.  Felix is the perfect place for a photo of yourself pretending to be blase as you sip a $13 speciality espresso cocktail (sans alcohol) in front of gorgeously ornate wallpaper. The lattes are worth photographing, too.  Felix will turn up on @FomoFeed--mark my words!

Ummm, am i in midtown or in Paris?! Stumbled upon Felix Roasting Co after a workout down the street. Wasn't even looking for coffee, but it looked so cute i decided to go in. The place is chic AF. I would have camped out there for hours!  We ordered a couple of $6 lattes, with the added homemade nut milk blend (including pepitas!) and enjoyed our bespoke beverages in a tranquil setting. The employees were nice and helpful, and I'm happy we stopped in. Check it out if you're in the hood!

This is a gorgeous new cafe that just opened, and most importantly, they are the first wholesale client for Supermoon Bakehouse.  Based just on the beautiful decor and the nice spacious seating area combined with the fact that we can now get Supermoon pastries in midtown, this is an obvious 5 star spot. They don't even have Cold Brew or any of the cool sounding drinks yet (S'mores Latte??), so expect this to be one of the best places in NYC for a drink and a snack very soon. I will be back all the time for Supermoon stuff, especially because they are making stuff that isn't available at the bakery. I just had a Salted Caramel Donut, Raspberry White Chocolate Croissant, and a Chorizo Brioche, which were all glorious.

This is one of the most beautiful coffee spots in the city. I don't mean that lightly. There is serious detail in the decor, furniture, wallpaper, and even the cups and paper bags. If you want to impress someone on a coffee date, take them here.  Felix gets bonus points because it is Supermoon Bakehouse's first wholesale seller. So you can accompany your coffee with the most whimsical croissants and doughnuts that exist.  I'll definitely be back to this stunning cafe. I won't be surprised if this becomes my go-to whenever I'm in Midtown East.

The interior of this cafe is so beautiful! The seats, the wallpaper, and everything about this place is an instagrammer's dream! The only problem I have with this place is that they have a very limited menu to choose from. Only coffee, I'm not a big fan of coffee but I really wanted to come here because I saw people posting about this places. I was expecting them to at least have a matcha latte or a chai latte but none. But they do have pastries for you to order, which are from Supermoon. If you're looking for a nice place to grab a cup of coffee with friends this is the place!

So,,, me writing this review is very unfair because i HATE coffee. It's my biggest flaw! I can't stand coffee at all, but I really wanted to try this place out because it was beautiful. I just thought there would be more options that didn't feature coffee, but there weren't so I was disappointed. No tea. No hot chocolate. Just coffee. I got a chocolate croissant and even though it was supermoon bakehouse, which I usually love, this was just eh.  Def beautiful tho

This place is super cute and a nice place to catch up with friends. Despite the fact that interior looks fancy, the teas and coffees are reasonably priced, unless of course you order something like the s'mores latte. The chai I ordered was really nice and pleasant to drink. My only gripe with this cafe is that the seating is so limited and the tables are tiny. There is a lot of space in this tea room and the owners should really add more seating and tables.

Taps everywhere. Milks on tap, still and sparkling water on tap, taps behind the bar, taps on the side of the bar- i'm surprised I didn't see a tap that just dispenses more taps.    Taps aside, I had an amazing flat white here the other day, one of the best cups of coffee I've had in the city to date. As has been well established, you'll be paying a premium, but the quality of the coffee makes it well worth it - the espresso was some of the smoothest i've ever had.  Also - take a look around. Designed with a central counter, plenty of seating, and decor that makes you question the fact that you're at a coffee place in midtown (in the best way), Felix makes you want to go out of your way to have a coffee to stay.  Starbucks has too many people and Gregory's is expensive for no reason. Felix is not inexpensive by any means, but you feel much better about paying $5 for a delicious cup of coffee here than you would most places in the city.

Stopped in looking for a place to work for an hour or two, which can be quite challenging... not enough places to sit, no outlets, shitty wifi, and so on. But... this place has it all! And really good coffee (I only tried their drip coffee). To be fair, I'm rating this place 5-stars based on how nice it is to work and not necessarily based on food and drink. I didn't try the food, but read a bunch of other reviews about how amazing the pastries are supposed to be... and they're very unique! As far as a place to work though... wifi speeds were 500+ mb/s... outlets at every other table... easy to find a place to sit (although there aren't a ton of tables, so maybe I was just there at a slow time)... and generally nice atmosphere with friendly people working here.

This is definitely a pretty (IG Worthy) coffee shop. I found this spot on IG by NYC Bloggers, so you know I had to check it out.  The space is beautiful and well thought out, I mean they even have their Diary & Non-Dairy offerings on tap, I mean if that isn't fancy I don't know what is.  The way they serve (presentation) their teas and coffees are definitely things you take pictures of prior to tasting!!  The taste of the lattes we ordered (1 hot & 1 iced) were actually really good. I did add some sugar to mine which obviously changes the taste.  The service was really good. My barista made recommendations and offered guidance to when my requests were gonna change the taste of my choice of latte.  I will definitely come back

If you take away the hotel-ish decor, the floral velvet cushions, the Supermoon pastries, and the sparkling water on tap, the coffee here is overpriced and mediocre at best. The filtered coffee blend that they have (Ethiopia Guji Hambela) doesn't taste as extravagant as it sounds; if I had to choose between Dunkin and this, I'd pick Dunkin in a heartbeat. The fancy cocktail glass drink at most if not everyone's table? That'll be the Hickory Smoked S'mores Latte. At $14, it's a beauty and the latte art is lovely but...I expect Hickory smoke infused coffee or even a small whiff of it at minimum but NOPE. NADA. You're just paying 3x a regular latte for yours to be served in a cocktail glass + a branch + a marshmallow. Unfortunately, it's a hard pass for me so I'll be sticking with my trusty La Colombe.

Forget the coffee. Just look at this place. Sure, when dating you want a thoughtful conversation with substance, but you don't turn down eye candy.  The coffee here is great. I had a flat white with their nondairy blend of nut milks. The barista made me a heart. My friend's drink came with a swan and I was immediately jealous. Thus, I posted her drink to Instagram instead.  The wallpaper, printed upholstery and mix of pink and green paint make for the perfect backdrop for photos.

A colleague of mine brought this up when I was ready to go down for my normal Starbucks run. I was intrigued with this place when I heard about their raspberry croissant, but upon visiting, I came to realize that it was a special item so it was out of season.  I picked up a blueberry rosemary croissant since it was also a special menu item, but felt that the rosemary was way too powerful for the croissant. A little bit of a peculiar taste in my mouth, but the croissant was super crispy, a little burnt. Still, the texture was something that I was satisfied with. I also got a vanilla latte with their homemade almond, cashew milk.  After coming here and reading the reviews, I am definitely tempted to revisit to try out the s'mores latte. That sounds so good and it is definitely Instagram friendly!

AMAZING AMAZING coffeeshop!!!!!!. This gem opened two months ago! I enjoyed a tasty, fancy "hickory smoked s'mores latte" with a delicious matcha croissant!!! The place is so beautiful, it looks like a hotel entrance. Beautiful design and very friendly crew. Thank you Josh for being so kind!!!!!!! RECOMMEND 100% Will definitely go back soon!!

Lovely location. Great vibe. The entire place is styled so well. There also seems to be a focus on good coffee. I ordered an americano and it was perfect. They also offer pastries and mine was very fresh tasting. I would recommend this place just on looks alone but I would come back for the coffee for sure.

It's only been open for a couple of weeks but there's already a lot of buzz about it so I decided to check it out :)  SERVICE: Great! Everyone was friendly and helpful. You order at the counter and you can either pick it up there or they'll bring it out to you. We ordered a special drink (more on that below) that included a really cool creation process, so we stayed at the bar/counter area to watch. The barista was funny and personable and patiently walked us through the entire process.  DRINKS: my friend and I shared the hickory-smoked s'mores latte. It's pricey - $16 including tax - but it is a work of art. As I mentioned, making it is a process that includes toasting the marshmallow, smoking the entire drink and waiting for it to settle. It's made with a graham cracker-infused milk that's made in-house; the barista gave us a sample of the milk while we waited and it's amazing! I want a whole carton of it but sadly it's not for sale. Unfortunately, while the latte's presentation is beautiful, it was a bit smoky for my taste. He did mention it's a seasonal drink and they'll have different concepts for different seasons, so maybe the winter one will be more up my alley taste-wise.  DECOR/AMENITIES: this place is beautiful. Definitely Instagram-worthy and it looks more like a nice restaurant or hotel lobby than a cafe. Lots of light and open space. There are two sections: a main section in the front and a smaller, quieter section in the back (the counter is located between the sections). I saw a few people working on their laptops in the back but didn't check if there were outlets (I didn't see any in the front). They mentioned they're expecting to expand to the basement and use it as a space to host classes, coffee tastings etc in order to make the experience more interactive, so looking forward to that!  Would I go back? Yes! But I'll probably try a different, cheaper drink (and maybe one of those pastries...)

This place is just as cute as everyone says it is and then some. The staff makes a point to try to get to know you, which doesn't go unnoticed. It's nice that they offer up Supermoon Bakehouse pastries so you don't have to trek downtown to the actual bakery, but make sure to get there early as items sell out quickly. Looking forward to trying their $14 specialty coffee that they just debuted!

Came here on a Sunday morning. The ambiance here is so nice, and the music they played gave a great vibe. Love the fact that they have Supermoon desserts! I ordered an almond milk latte and the ham and cheese croissant. One thing I noticed is that they don't heat up the croissants. (I am sure if I asked, they might have?) The latte tasted great, plus the latte art was so pretty!

Every bit as aesthetically pleasing as you may have seen (an Instagrammer's dream!) - and that's referring to both the gorgeous seasonal Hickory-smoked S'mores Latte and the interior design of the cafe. You're paying the premium "cocktail" price for the extravagant presentation of concocting the latte in front of your eyes at the bar, which involves your espresso shot, dark chocolate, graham crackers, a toasted marshmallow, and smoking hickory - all ingredients apparently made in-shop (stick-whittling included!). Beautifully and mesmerizingly crafted. I would say it looks better than it tastes though (the smokiness leaves a bit of a bitter aftertaste).  Can't speak to the other espresso drinks, but other patrons seemed to be enjoying them just as much! Also, any cafe that serves Supermoon pastries automatically deserves a star for that alone.

Best coffee shop I've been to yet. The ambiance is so cute and classy. The drinks are well crafted and delicious and the staff was so kind! Of course I ordered the famous Hickory Smoker S'mores Latte. Tasted even better than the pictures and that's pretty touch. It came with a perfectly melted marshmallow on top. Definitely recommend.

Super cute coffee shop!! Perfect place to hang out, away from the cold outside! I would have expected the coffee to be more expensive because of the atmosphere but it's pretty affordable! I'm totally going to bring my friends here!
Flatwhite was good, but pastries werent fresh... Seats had blood stains... huge wind flew in whenever ppl walked into the store... had to leave before freeze any longer...
I'm at tea drinker, no black tea. I'm meeting a business associate or I would leave. Tea drinkers don't come here with your coffee drinking friends.  Looks cute but move on.

Just found my new go-to spot to take clients for coffee! This is such a beautiful space and a much needed addition to the area. Shout out to the beautiful copper and rose gold reusable straws you can takeaway as a keepsake!

From the interior, the quality of coffee, and customer service, this place has it all! Felix Roasting Co blew my mind with their unique seasonal drink, the smoked s'mores latte. Get it now before it's too late! If you're looking for something that will take your taste buds to new heights, this is the drink to try! It comes at a steep price ($13-$14), but they put on quite a show, showing you how they "smoke out" the drink. Their marshmallow is homemade and the milk they use in this drink is soaked in graham crackers, giving it a really rich, unique taste. I thought this drink would be too sweet, but it actually is the perfect amount. They have several small tables in the back and front of the store, but if you're looking to come with a large group (4+) on a weekend, it might be harder to snag an area without getting separated. They also get their pastries from Supermoon Bakehouse, a NYC native bakery. Free Wifi, one co-ed bathroom. Would come back again!

Super cute & instagrammable! I give this 5 stars  for the decor & staff... they have a soft opening so I can't fully comment on the FULL menu but they had very artisanal treats & strong coffee! & cute hipster boys serving it.... what else does a house wife need?

This unique and chic coffee shop in Midtown is definitely one to remember. This upscale cafe will give you a run for your money. The craft coffee options will run you $10-$14. I got the popular S'mores latte which was amazing. You can watch the latte being smoked, which is a show in and of itself. You come here for the ambience, rather than the actual coffee. It's simple and beautiful inside and uniquely set up. My friend and I spent almost two hours catching up here on a Saturday evening. Surprisingly lots of other people were doing the same and seats were hard to come by.

ALLERGY ALERT - their ALMOND milk has undisclosed CASHEW. Felix Roasting was recommended to me so I arranged for a morning meeting. I went to the counter, asked if they had almond or soy milk to which they replied "Almond milk". No indication of cashew. I ordered a latte with almond milk. After taking a large sip with my guest, I knew immediately I was going to go into anaphylactic shock  - brought my cup to the counter and asked if there are nuts in the drink and they said oh yes there is cashew milk as well - its on the menu. First, I was not shown a menu and I verbally asked for the milk. They have spigots of milk which also, in large letters, only say "Almond Milk". Almonds and cashews are VERY different - this has never happened to me before with almond milk.  Thankfully my guest was very understanding and the staff refunded me immediately and gave me coffee to finish my meeting while on Benedryl. Before I left, the manager listened to my diatribe of the seriousness of allergies, promised to update the signs, and gave me an apology gift card. Its a beautiful venue that everyone should enjoy but not worth me missing the rest of the work day to sleep it off. I will be going back soon to check for updated signs.

Found this gem last morning and promised myself to return in the evening with my friend. We were both impressed by everything from the interior design to the quality of drinks and service. Very beautiful, elegant, yet nice and cozy place, with the very warm atmosphere! The team who worked there Saturday night was very friendly and added the warmth and the real class to this atmosphere! Looking forward to return there more often and keep bringing my friends.
My latte with nut milk was excellent, and the shop was fantastically clean and roomy and well-decorated.

I didn't even want to drink my latte, it was too beautiful!! The coffee shop itself is new, spacious and exquisitely designed. They also make coffee cocktails. It didn't try it but they look awesome. They bring it to your table in a cute cup.

I came during break for my training and was pleasantly surprised. The decor was elegant and spacious and the coffee was very aromatic. The staff is friendly and they are a cashless establishment which is great for me since I seldom carry cash. The vibe is low key fancy and the environment is great to have a conversation. It would make a great date spot!

I am usually very picky when it comes to coffee. But when I got the cappuccino, the texture was very delicate and the taste was very well balanced. The staff there were also pretty generous and seemed to have a passion for when they did. The overall experience of this place was very pleasant.

Stunningly beautiful gem of a coffee shop in NYC. Great decor and attentive and friendly service. Everything on the menu was well explained and the barista patiently waited for us to make the order. Croissant was tasty and the coffee presentation fantastic. Wonder place - will be retuning very soon.

It is a good spot to sit, have a coffee, and do some work. The seating is comfortable, though limited, and the wifi is strong. The coffee is not the best, but certainly good enough. The music is a little loud for studying, but even so it's a great spot.
Terrible coffee and over priced I don't mind spending money for excellent product !!! All the money was spent on esthetic-the coffee game shit. I hate to call them out but it's TRUE !!!
So happy to have a decent spot for coffee nearby!  Nice looking place and the staff are friendly.  Limited eats available.  Coffee is top notch if a little pricey.
Unusually good coffee, nice (different) vibe and ambience. Ideal for small groups, professional meetings, couples.

We stumbled upon this charming gem of a cafe after a day of playing tourist in the city. The space is bright, refreshing and spacious while offering a refuge from the hustle outside. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the manager Josh. They opened three weeks ago and want to maintain their uniqueness in a sea of other coffee places. Their latte was delicious and the layout offers taps for adding your desired amount of half and half, almond milk or whole milk, as well as sparkling and still water options. We can't wait to go back to try more drinks and the delicious looking pastries!
An atypical, but incredibly chic, coffee shop. Delicious artisan coffee. Not only the baristas, but the staff run the place with great care. On the more expensive side, but well worth it.
Cute /pretty place with great atmosphere. Loved their Hickory Smoked S'more Latte! All I can say it was delciiusI would order it again. Everyone was very nice there.
Seriously as good as it gets!  Beautiful open seating anteroom, amazing staff, and delectable espresso.  So happy I happened upon this place today.

Taste in coffee of course differs across people but this is as good as coffee and espresso get. Had an excellent and quite caffeinated cup of joe as well as a nutty and sweet and creamy and balanced cortado. Thrilled to work a few blocks away.
I had an excellent experience. Staff was very friendly and  the Coffee was simply amazing. Also a  really comfortable place to bring your laptop and work. I'l be back for sure!
Place is so pretty and the people are nice, but when I took a sip of the coffee I literally laughed out loud. I'd go back for tea and a seat.
Great espresso, amazing design, friendly staff and delicious blueberry croissant  worth a visit!

Service was nice, place spacious, theirs not much on to choose from on their menu yet since they just opened. supermoon pastries were yummy and I can't wait till they hopefully offer more pastries and sweets to the menu  oh and their bathroom is glorious
Beautifully decorated interior, very quick and friendly staff. Latte was delicious and looked great. I would definitely recommend this coffee shop.

As a coffee drinker mostly of pure black ,their brewed coffee was one of the best black coffee I've drank in awhile. It was my first time visiting but I'll definitely go back again.The interior was nice especially the 2nd floor, nice place to do your work/casually hangout, staff were friendly and if you're visiting for the first time,download their app so you can get $3 credit  :D

I was amazed to find this shiny, sparkly gem in Hell's Kitchen, my old neighborhood. I had been to the small, UWS branch before. This one is a large, spacious two-story cafe - the balcony level looking down on the ground floor. The cappuccino is delicious. The furniture is of a modern Swedish style. And the bathroom has the first faucet/dryer device in one that I've ever seen lol.

So over on 10th Avenue in this part of Hell's Kitchen, there used to be no coffee places (and, frankly, there are still few). Then Rex moved in -- a wonderful coffee spot with excellent food, drink and very little seating. Then Fika came along, with its spare, minimal aesthetic, it's bilevel goodness, it's ample seating (with wifi! And a few power outlets!) and even an outdoor space. My god, it's every work-from-home's dream come to life.  I love that there's a bunch of seating, I love that there's so much space, I love the decor, I love the coffee here. It's getting more pick-up as time moves on, but hopefully the new Starbucks on the corner will deflect some of the less-ambitious traffic...

So I visit Stockholm and come back to NYC to see FIKA pop up everywhere a month or 2 later and I am not complaining! healthy food options and awesome coffee! the atmosphere is amazing - really takes me back to an awesome city!
Review for the cookie monster cookie!!!  Get it. Plain and simple. It's blue on the outside and then there's this soft chewy warm chocolate chip center that is phenomenal.  SO Yummy and very filling.

Cute coffee shop with great coffee! This coffee shop actually doesn't feel like NYC; it feels like Seattle (where I'm originally from). It's pretty quiet and mellow inside with old jazz music playing, and there wasn't too much of a line even though I visited in the morning. The baristas are super friendly too (also probably why it feels more like Seattle haha). It's definitely more of a take-out-and-go kind of coffee shop, but they have seating available for about 10-15 people. It's really clean and bright here; I can see myself working or reading here.  The coffee tastes really good, but their baked goods selection is good too. They have pastries (croissants, muffins...) and cookies (fruity pebble cookies, rainbow cookies, red velvet cookies...). I didn't get a chance to explore the bakery options, but everything looked really tasty.
One of my favorite coffee shops in the city! Stopped here before heading to The Tonight Show and it was terrific!

For Five is a very comfortable coffee shop in a not so comfortable area of the city. Lately it's been one of my favorite spaces to work in the area; there's free WiFi and I love the little space in the back with seat cushions and walls with dominoes all over them.  They roast their own beans and the coffee is incredible. The cold brew is especially amazing (just as good as Stumptown's, but slightly different).  I noticed that everything here is high quality, from the sturdy cups and straws to the awesome napkins. I also think the patterned cups and cup sleeves are look pretty aesthetic. You can just tell their materials are on a different level.  Oh yea, for the cookie lovers, For Five gets bonus points because it's one of the few places that sells the infamous (hard-to-find, amazing, sometimes stuffed, basically crack) Duchess cookies.

so many coffee shops to choose from...this is what the concierge at our hotel recommended. if you want a strong cup of coffee...you'll get it here... line moved fairly fast... i was a bit confused because it looked like there were 2 different lines ...but i wasn't sure. no place to stay and sit... so i went for a little walk then headed back to the hotel to finish up my coffee...

I've been here probably 50 times.  This is by far one of my favorite places to get an espresso in the area (they also have a full menu of coffee drinks).    The espresso comes out at the right temperature (somewhere between warm and hot, but never actually hot) Also, the espresso is never bitter. It is strong in flavor, but has a smooth finish.  The staff is very efficient and often friendly.  They also have some light sandwiches and salads as well as some pastries.  They do have some really awesome cookies, too.  There is some seating, but I would not expect to come in with 10 co-workers and expect to find a place to post up.
The fact that this place can keep up with the quality of the drinks they serve while dealing with the immense amount of customers they have is a huge feat. They are also friendly and professional.
