My dining companions got sandwiches, which they also loved, and we shared one of their gooey nutty chocolate chip cookies, which the guy behind the counter nicely let me select (I got one with lots of crispy edges).  The space is rustic and gorgeous. I could imagine some wonderful bridal showers or birthday parties happening here if they ever shut down the space for private events (not sure if they do). They definitely started to get more crowded during lunch time so an early  meal or off-hour hang is probably your best bet, but there are lots of tables to choose from.  I love this place and can't wait to go back!

I've always love Maman downtown. Visited the midtown location recently for togo. I got a slice of quiche, the one with blue cheese and pear. The tab said $6.5 but while I paid it was $13. The guy the tab was weekday price. Oh wow. Okayyy. I got ripped off. The quiche does not have any blue cheese flavor nor any chunk of pear. Disappointed.

I enjoyed their nutty chocolate chip cookie and decaf Americano on this rainy/snowy afternoon.  The cookie was particularly awesome.  The space is a bit loud; however, it felt super friendly and cozy.  Definitely a nice, casual spot to chat with friends or read a book.

My sister threw me my bridal shower here this past Saturday and it was perfect! The staff was so accommodating, food was so so good, & the decor was so pretty. Everyone had such a great time. Thank you so much! I can't wait to host someone's bridal shower here one day :)

Coffee was ok and the food was ok. I got the breakfast sandwich and my friend got the croque Maman. Everything was just too heavy and dry. Neither of us could finish our food. The interior and the cups are beautiful though!

Looked like a cool interesting place so checked it out.  Awful awful service. Had to ask and beg for water 3 times.  Food was mediocre at best. The icing on the cake was the roaches on the walls. Two of them. They gave us a coupon for a free coffee because of the roaches. When I tried use it for a cold brew, they said drip coffee only.. before they gave in because of the ridiculousness of it all and gave me the cold brew.  Best to avoid this place.

3.5 stars  I like to wear floral prints, spray floral scents on my wrist, & eat foods/drink beverages with floral elements. I couldn't decide between the Raspberry & Rose Loaf Cake slice and the White Chocolate Lavender Croissant in Maman Nomad's display case. I went for the latter & wished I'd picked the loaf. As it was later in the afternoon, the croissant wasn't super fresh. The white chocolate coating was ultra sweet & overwhelming. To improve its construction, I'd pipe some white chocolate (ganache?) & lavender inside & drizzle the same on the outside.  Despite a so-so first encounter, I'd absolutely give this adorable cafe another shot. Its decorative touches are irresistible (large spoon door handle, white & blue floral accent wall.) I'd love to spend a morning reading a few chapters, indulging in one of their caffeinated drinks, & finally trying that Raspberry & Rose loaf slice.

Walked by this place a thousand times and it never appealed to me from the outside, but man was I missing out!  Really cute interior, laid back, kid-friendly, delicious food at really good prices.  Came for brunch.  Tried the egg/ratatouille dish and the farro salad.  Both were yummy - good quality, tasty.   The farro got a bit boring after I was halfway through, but it was still a good dish.  Coffee is good, and although I didn't try them, the pastries looked amazing! I will definitely come back!

Maman said there'd be days like this:  Indeed.  I have long wanted to try this bakeshop cum cafe's famed Chocolate Chip Cookie.  Ever since the raves it received back in its early Soho location days.  And what do I do when I finally make it to Maman, which now boasts zillions of NYC outposts like this one?  What do I do?  I get a Nutella Brownie instead.  I don't know what I was thinking. Or maybe I wasn't thinking at all.  At any rate, I wasn't a fan of said Brownie. It hinted of Nutella, which was a good thing, of course.  But it was just too sweet for me, sadly.  I wanted it to be more fudgy too, but then I am a fudgy brownie sort of girl.  The space though, is beyond adorable.  And service on my visit was every bit as sweet as you'd hope for in a place like this.    Bottom line:  Three stars for now, though when I finally get to try that darn Cookie, maybe that will change.  One way or another.

Came here for coffee after strolling through Madison square park on a Saturday afternoon. This place is so cute! The decor is bright and open, very insta-friendly. There are plenty of outlets to charge your phones and laptops. We ordered lattes and they tasted soooo great! You can order coffee and baked goods to go or you can sit down and eat when their kitchen is open. I will definitely come back again to try their brunch menu- the options look great!

That was the most delicious avocado toast I've ever had.  Everything was so fresh. My only preference would be for them to mix in the sunflower seeds, chili pepper and salt in the avocado spread instead of being put on the side.  Personally, I dont want to be playing chef and figuring out how much salt and chili flakes i should sprinkle on for optimal taste. Just figure it out for me... it is too early.    Hot chocolate was good,  I liked that it wasn't overly sweet.  But it wasn't the best hot chocolate ever.  I didn't even bother finishing it.  After leaving,  I noticed they overcharged me for my orange juice. It is not by a lot, but they shouldn't be charging customers more than the price indicated on the menu.  The place is so cute!  I would like to come back and try the sandwiches and salads.

Great place for a fast casual brunch. The wait is usually no longer than 15-20 minutes. They have a variety of food items, ranging from breakfast foods and sandwiches to salads. I highly recommend the waffle-iron hashbrowns - smoked salmon, avocado, greens, soft boiled egg on a hashbrown. The lavender latte is the best I've had in NYC. The pastries taste great as well such as the white chocolate lavender dipped croissant. I like that their pastries have unique flavors compared to other bakeries. And the service has been great every time.

Great coffee shop in the neighborhood. We come here every morning for coffee. The espresso is done just right and the milk is frothed perfectly. We always order a macchiato which is a difficult drink to get a good latte art going, but they are able to do it perfectly. I also especially enjoy the serveware they use for the coffee and pastries. They always look like a piece of art.  Admittedly the baristas are not as approachable as what we used to in the village but that's almost the by product of being in the hotel and in the area.  The Mątre D' is very nice and friendly though. She recognized from dinner a week ago which I was quite surprised by.

Came here on a Sunday morning to study with a friend and there were a good amount of empty seats to sit. The place is pretty cute and very aesthetically pleasing! It is located in front of a hotel lobby so it sort of gets distracting and loud with people checking in and out of the hotel.  It was also loud from people who were casually chatting and catching with friends but it didn't bother me too much because I had my earbuds on.  I ordered the Honeybear Latte for $5.99 (including tax). I thought it was okay! It wasn't sweet, which was perfectly fine for me, although I was expecting it to be sweet because of the name. Nothing too special about it but it wasn't bad either.  Staffs are all friendly!  I stayed there from 11AM - 5:30PM. The coffee bar closes at 5, and the menu also includes a few food items as well! I got hungry around 3:30pm and ordered fries and a "Way to go Burger" (I think that's what it was called) and both my friend and i devoured it as soon as the server/bartender brought it to us. Food was pretty pricey as it came out to be $34 (including tips) and it was expected because it's located right in a hotel, but my friend and I were both enjoyed the food.  The place did get a bit chilly after an hour or 2 there so bring a extra piece of clothing for warmth!  Overall had a great experience at Paper coffee! Will definitely come back!

New Update - You can stay at the study/work areas up to 12AM! Great spot to study, the coffee bar does close down after 5pm, but the drinks bar will start serving in full force. Study areas tend to get quiet after 5pm, so it might be a good place if you have some late night work around the area.

Super cool hidden coffeeshop in MADE hotel. Didn't realize it was in the actual hotel, but Paper Coffee is in the front section of MADE. The coffee is great and strong and can be taken in the lobby of MADE. Lots of seating inside including the outdoors area upstairs. If you love a lively coffee shop with other young professionals, this is a great place to chill and chat or work in while enjoying a hot coffee. They also make a great latte with fun latte art. Hip interior and ambience.  Accepts card. Stamp card available! Bathrooms downstairs.  Drink up!
Great coffee and very comfortable seating. Highly recommend this cute coffee shop for weekend chilling/working!

Daughter strikes Yelp gold again!   This hip coffee shop is in the lobby of the Made Hotel.  Stopped there on the way to a meeting.   We ordered two skim iced lattes, an egg sandwich featuring a delicious beet slaw, and a chia pudding.    Prompt friendly service with great 60's California wood decor and a nice atmosphere.     Look for the street sign and enjoy.

Cozy space in a hotel, the street view is not great but the interior is very nicely decorated (especially during the holidays).  They have pour overs! I get that a lot of people out there is all about their espresso based drinks like lattes, but some of us love the heck out of quality made, 3rd wave, black coffee where you can really taste the flavors.  5 star in my book, for making pour overs with decent beans in a nice setting and central location that doesn't take an hr to get to (cough Bushwick).

Great quiet spot on the weekend to grab a cup of coffee and read or catch up with an old friend. Seating specific to the coffee shop is limited (couple of cozy window tables that in theory can seat a couple groups of 2-3, but individuals will bring work and the tables are small enough where it makes it impossible for others to sit around that same table even if there are stools across from them that are empty)- but paper coffee is located in the lobby of the Made hotel so there's more seating in the general lobby area that you can grab if the seats are all taken by the coffee counter. The cappuccino and lattes are served in the cutest mugs if you stick around vs take the coffee to-go. Will be back.

This place is really cool. The design is super neat. We accidentally ordered our food and drinks at the front counter and then sat down and realized they actually had a full service dining area. So the layout was a little confusing as it all looked like seating for the coffee shop up front. We got cappuccinos, which were delicious, charred avocado toast, granola and yogurt, and an egg sandwich. The avocado toast had so much flavor, the granola and yogurt was as yummy as it was beautiful, and the egg sandwich had house made chorizo sausage that was to die for. We were just looking for a place to get coffee, and instead, we found this little gem. The service was lovely as well. I highly recommend you go here!

A friend turned me on to this new coffee spot because of its ample seating and (reliable!) free WiFi. The space is great for getting hours of work done in a very zen environment or catching up with a pal.  This may sound odd, but their yogurt with granola and fruit was the best I've had. Large, recognizable fresh fruit from berries to plums, a drizzle of honey, homemade granola and Thai basil? In.  On my less healthy day, the everything croissant stuffed with jalape̱o cream cheese was also delicious ;)  I almost don't want to share this gem for fear of overcrowding, but it's going to happen eventually. Enjoy, coffee- and ambiance-lovers*

It's a nice spacious coffee shop attached to the hotel. They have few tables around the coffee station but there are also tables available inside the hotel lobby. My latte was nice and strong. They don't have milk out. I guess you have to ask if you need extra milk. It took some time to get our drink and the shop wasn't busy in the afternoon. I imagine it might be a long wait in the morning.

This is one of my favorite cafes in the city. Lots of deep, plush couches to sit in and spend the afternoon in reading and relaxing. This cafe in in the lobby of the Made Hotel and the interior is outfitted with plants, wooden accents, and art on the walls. There is a full cocktail and food menu so you can have your coffee with a meal or a drink. In the summer, there is an outdoor patio where you can soak in some sun.

TLDR this new spot is a better alternative to Stumptown in the Ace Hotel.  Best new spot to get some work done on your laptop in Flatiron!  Down the street from Stumptown and is also in the lobby of a hotel. However, this place is not a crowded (not for long), is bright and airy, has an outdoor patio (!!!) and good WiFi. And honestly I've been tired of Stumptown coffee for a bit now.  Coffee is good too. I'm not even a fan of nitro iced coffee but it was really good here.
Very good coffee in midtown! The oat latte and cold brew were very good, the aesthetic is nice in there as well.

This is a very cool new coffee shop with a beautiful alcoholic coffee menu! Andrew, the barista/bartender extraordinaire, was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in helping us select a coffee creation that suited us. We ended up getting a hot rum americano drink (delicious and pairs well with the sub-zero temperatures outside) and an iced gin espresso drink. Gin and espresso you say? Why yes, THEY GO TOGETHER. Hard to believe but it was one of the most delicious drinks I've had. This coffee shop is located in the lobby of a new hotel called ' 'Made' and it wasn't very busy when we walked in. It occupies a beautiful space and there are nice comfy seats to enjoy some quiet reflective time.
Beautiful space. Nice employees. Positive atmosphere. I got the Columbian espresso provided by devocion. It was very well balanced and delivered all the anticipated notes. Thanks Paper!
Really loved visiting even if just for the interior. High ceiling, lots of wood, and ample natural sunlight. Great Coffee certainly.

Love this place for coffee and meeting someone - because it's part of the MADE hotel it has some great sofa like seats to relax but also some tables if you want to do a little work.  The coffee is great and will be served in a glass (if you want it) - the whole vibe is great and atypical of a coffeehouse experience but more of a relaxing vibe.  There isn't much in the way of pastries.  Also you can't bring food in (I tried to eat my sandwich on the run - a no no) but you can spend some quality time there.

Good coffee with featured roasters! The esthetic is very pleasing and seems like a great place for doing work. I wish that there were specialty drinks on the menu, but that was the only let down I experienced. Overall, I would gladly go again and enjoy more of there pour over menu and cold brew!

This coffee shops appears to be little well known, which is a shame but also part of its charm. The shop is actually part of the lobby of the hotel it is attached to (MADE, a hotel). Further into the space you can also enter the hotel bar which looked to be worth exploring. The cafe itself is minimalistic with an emphasis on natural wood and earthy tones. I loved the large windows and plants. The product itself was very good and the staff were very pleasant. I did not try to access Internet but it may have been available. A perfect stop to read a book or chat one-on-one w/ a friend. Not very crowded; however, I did enter closer to closing time. The cafe is on the smaller side w/ a larger raised table top in the center.

As you walk into the lobby space it immediately welcomes you with warmth! The beautiful entrance door and furniture makes you feel so comfortable. The coffee shop is connected to a hotel lobby that has its own area. You order your beverage and wait on another side to pick up. Staff was friendly and made my drink delicious. Paper coffee uses Devocion coffee and it was smooth and made to perfection!

Great place to work or hang out.  Amazing atmosphere and you almost forget you are in a hotel.  They do a great job separating the two.  The food and the drinks are great.  I can't personally speak for the coffee but a lot of the people I have been with have loved it.  I can however tell you the hot chocolate is great!  blob:file:///59864a8c-e549-4284-8714-946afa2f1035

Great coffee and super friendly staff. And their playlist had me jamming the whole time. I had an almond milk latte that was perfect. My friend ordered a chai latte and it smelled incredible. Trying that next time. Say hi to Star!

Great coffee, cozy atmosphere. Love the coffee; their mylks selection is great. Two things: Need to work on the speed of the service and be open later than 5pm. It's in a hotel! It should be open at least till late!

I was walking by with an out of town friend, and was intrigued by the name Paper Coffee. I needed to get some coffee and figured this would probably be as good as any. I pulled open the door once I figured out it was the door (it almost looks more like part of the wall) and stepped in with curiosity. Instantly I was enveloped with indescribable wonderfulness. It was a completely unexpected oasis in the middle of the grime,noise and drudgery of the surrounding neighborhood. It reminded me of being somewhere in Europe.  There were a few people sitting around in the lobby of the hotel this is part of ("Made" yelp.com/biz/made-hotel-?), working on their laptops, and a few people getting coffee. Everything was just nice beyond description in a sort of hard to identify understated way.  I got an iced coffee and a delicious Kouign Amann with black sesame, and thoroughly enjoyed a 15 minute respite before heading out to the sirens, jack hammers and haze of the day. Absolutely wonderful place.

Hands down the best best coffee in New York. And I am serious about my coffee! The pour overs are the smoothest most delish. My husband and I jump out of bed on the weekend to get coffee :) also, try the macadamia nut milk - holy moly.  The vibe has a lot of doctors and med students since near the hospital so you can also meet really nice smart people.  Damian always makes our coffee special and knows our order. A true pleasure and you can taste his passion for the coffee.

Best coffee shop in the area!  A hot-spot for local med students and residents alike, PROOF is a coffee shop that uses their own beans to create sustainably-sourced and delicious cups of joe.  Not too busy depending on when you go, and there's a plethora of seating options depending on what you want: bar seating, large communal table, or small two-person table.  Often they're playing rumba music, which is a fun, upbeat chance of pace.  Decent prices and a variety of food options too if you're looking for breakfast, lunch, or a snack.  Will be back!

Nice and cozy cafe to study if youre a student at nyu. We all know it can get so crowded at the building so this is a nice quiet place to sit down and study away. Coffee beans are great and the pastries are delicious. New go to study spot!

So glad I found this place right near school! It's pretty tucked in this courtyard at 27th and 1st Ave, so it might be hard to find at first. Cafe itself is very cutely decorated with bear motifs here and there and a decent amount of tables for seating. I always see people there studying or chatting with friends.  Their lattes and mochas are very delicious (rated in the highest tier of Manhattan coffee spots imo), especially their lattes with oat milk. My only complaint is that the prices for some of their drinks, especially the specialty ones, will run you at least $6. Service is friendly...there's a worker there who's almost always there each time and he is so endearingly grumpy.  If you're associated with NYU, definitely show your ID to get 10% off!

My friends and I were lucky to stumble across this cute coffee shop!  It's really close to the NYU Nursing building, and it was a really good find. The guy working was also really nice, and the whole shop just had a nice, calming vibe!  The tea was good, especially the strawberry tea that one of my friends ordered. The sandwich was tasty and filling too!  I'll definitely be coming back because I love working in cafes, especially small, quaint ones like this!

My new favorite coffee spot. Great tasting fresh coffee every time. Staff is super friendly and service is quick. I frequently order the same thing and they start preparing it as soon as I walk in the door if they're not with another customer

This is what people have in mind when they say they want to open up a coffee shop one day.  Baristas are great and it's never crowded in here, but also not so empty it makes you nervous they're about to close lol

As an RN I know coffee and this place has fantastic coffee. Hands down the best coffee within a 10 minute walk of Bellevue. Highly suggest walking down the random side street to check it out, and also it's an excellent place to study. Two lattes up for proof!
Excellent service, delicious coffee and clean, upscale atmosphere! It's great to finally have a local, small-business coffee shop in this neighborhood.

I work at a nearby hospital and come here often during my lunch break. It's such a great little coffee shop to relax and have a conversation in. The coffee is great and the pastries are sooo delicious. The staff is super friendly too! I can go on and on but just go check it out!

Honestly I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars. First off, it is super hidden and I just found out about it recently. Living in the city I hate going to Starbucks and Dunkin, I like going to coffee shops that are different from the norm. First time I came in here I instantly had a smile on my face. The coffee is excellent and the food is perfect. I've come in here 4-5 more times and am greeted by Damian and/or Stephan. They are AMAZING!!!! Customer service is superb and they connect with all of their customers. They know exactly what to recommend and always have a smile on their face. It is truly refreshing because you can tell they love their job. Today I came in and Damian recommended avocado smash for breakfast and a macadamia latte. It was sooooooooooo good! I love coming to the place for the food and coffee but honestly more specifically for the conversations I have with Damian and Stephan . Please stop in!

This little joint is great! I was so pleased to get a nice little discount as a student, the environment is great and Damian always has the best energy, puts you in a good mood immediately. Love the cold brew with the macadamia milk. It's been a great experience everytime I've come by. Highly recommended!

Super cozy place with big windows and lots of natural light coming through. I love grabbing a coffee and getting some studying done here because the environment is friendly, the music is fun, and there's always an open seat. The owner and employees have an obvious passion for coffee and good service. The last time I went, one of the baristas went around making sure every customer had a cup of water (it's the little things!) and that our drinks were good.  Some of the drinks are a bit pricey compared to other places. An iced chai (16oz) was around $6--but this was the best iced chai I'd ever had. Come here if you're in the area and need to study or want to catch up with a friend because it's a comfy environment that never gets loud.

First of all, the coffee here rocks! Quality stuff. To boot, the staff is awesome and makes my morning. Damian, I mean you! Damian is personable and makes the experience of hanging out here cool. Great food and coffee selection.  :) Stephen made a killer matcha latte.

I am always happy to hear about new coffee shops in my neighborhood, therefore decided to check out Proof on a Friday morning. After a breezy and leisurely stroll through  the small park by NYU, I walked into a cute and bright coffee shop. The decor is minimalistic and modern, consisting mostly of light neutrals and wooden accents. The vibe is inviting indeed.  I ordered a cold brew and waffle to go with it. As many on here have mentioned, the cold brew was super smooth and easy to drink - it would be especially good on a hot day! The barista also toasted the waffle for several minutes before serving it, which really enhanced the flavor and texture.  I appreciate the abundance of natural sunlight and can see it being a great place to chill out or study/write. I will definitely be coming back to try some of their other drinks and snacks.

I found this gem on one snow day in NY. I came here to study for finals and there were plenty of seating available. The ambience was perfect with good relaxing music as well as beautiful wide windows to occasionally stare and admire the quiet path and trees outside. The coffee was great & the service was even better!
Love this cafe and its staff (Damien and Stephan)! It's an oasis of peace and quiet in the area. Highly recommend, especially for those who work at the nearby hospital.

[OVERALL]  This coffee shop has a really good atmosphere. The lighting is nice, and the space is pretty cozy.  [FOOD]  "The Dehibernator" (Famous Cold Brew) - I was impressed. The coffee was incredibly smooth but still strong. It was very easy to sip on.

Great coffee shop. Had a morning latte and pumpkin bread. The latte was perfectly strong and the bread was delightful. Great space to get some work done between meetings and a cool vibe. Cozy but spacious.

I've been here a few times and the employees are always incredibly friendly and accommodating. Coffee and tea are high quality, vibes are great for a relaxing work day, and the music is always great! I especially love the spicy chai latte.

I love this spot! I work at the hospital nearby and proof is great to grab a good, strong coffee. The staff is friendly and cool- Damien always hooks me up w a delicious latte or cold brew. Solid coffee joint!

This shop was hidden.. it was hard to find. Though I like the place and the staff here was accommodating and the coffee was aromatic and strong. Thumbs up to the staff who helped me pick the coffee that i want thank

Okay, if you're a serious coffee drinker, then Proof Coffee Roasters is the perfect place for you.  I tried their cold brew during their soft opening a couple months back and it was definitely not your average cup of coffee. I am an avid coffee drinker and I have to say they do brew VERY strong, delicious drinks. I actually got so much studying done the day I bought coffee from here  lmao  I would come back for sure, but only once in a while (or when I'm desperate to stay awake in the midst of exams LOL) because it's $$$ compared to other coffee shops.

Incredibly friendly staff that remembers customers and will make you feel welcomed. And the space is also lovely - well lit with hughes glass walls filling the space with natural light and plenty of tables to get work done.
Enjoyable coffee spot on first avenue. The staff is extremely friendly and they always serve a nice shot of espresso. I always stop in when I'm in need of coffee and in the area.

Super great coffee and have tons of milk alternatives like almond, macadamia, and oat. Their Nutella lattes and matcha lattes hit the spot. Great for studying or catching up with friends in between breaks at the hospital or dental school. Also lots of healthy snacks to take on the go! And friendly staff :))

Cortado was on point.  The location is a little odd but it's close to NYU Langone. My friends also enjoyed their drinks. Prices are NYC prices...with drip coffee being a little pricey. Atmosphere was great and I look forward to returning and trying other drinks on their menu.
Great spot for coffee and quick bites. Large windows and high ceilings, lots of natural light - which I like. Free wifi and plenty of outlets, which makes it a nice study spot. Helpful staff!

My second favorite iced coffee in the city. Good prices & great products. I got the cold brew & the coconut macaroon dipped in chocolate. Super yummy, staff was friendly & very calm environment. If you're going up first ave turn left on 28 & it's on the bottom of the building complex (confused me at first)

I get my work done in coffee shops, so I know the coffee shops in this area all too well. This one stands out. Exceptional customer service. It's the small things -- they brought water over when I hadn't requested any. The quality of the coffee is great. I second other recommendations about the macadamia milk lattes and cold brew. The monthly membership is a steal. Unlimited coffee and $2 lattes for $47 (and a student discount coming soon). New favorite spot.  Update: Most of the baristas are absolutely wonderful and it is typically a great place to do work. However, if you are going to do work, you may not want to go stay if Kian is the barista -- the one typically sitting playing with his phone behind the bar. He is always putting on show tunes, and it's very hard to concentrate.

Looking for a great study spot? Proof has it. Looking for the best almond crescent around? Proof has it. Looking for a solid cup of coffee? You guessed it, proof has it. Proof is the best part of Kips Bay and Damian will always brighten your morning.

Nice coffee. Great service -- very friendly guy behind the counter. It's actually a relatively sizable spot for NYC, and quiet & peaceful to boot! The avocado toast was not my favorite, though, as it was too spicy. I think they overdid it on the black pepper and chili flakes, and should sub half the amount of those for some olive oil and salt. A nice spot for sure!

Came here on a Friday late AM. Shop totally empty. Already a great experience.  Got a flat white, spinach quiche, and comfy spot on the bench / long table near an outlet.  The barista made my drink in about ten seconds. It looked and tasted great. Really smooth, not bitter, not too much milk (although espresso lovers would argue a flat white already has too much milk), but still full like it was made with real espresso underneath rather than some garbage from a starbucks machine.  He also warmed up my quiche, and not a lukewarm half-ass five seconds in a microwave, but five minutes in an industrial food oven. Flakey and toastey.  WiFi speeds: about 30 Mbit/s down, 50 up. Strong.  This is what I want from a cafe.

The 16 ounce latte has four shots of espresso in it, already, which I really appreciate. The shop is small, but the limited seating area is open, relatively uncramped and airy. They're playing smooth jazz, right now, including some old standards. Nice.

Nice and  cozy coffeeshop with a very friendly and attentive staff.They will go out of their way to deliver an exceptional customer service.I had a great experience and will definitely make it my go to spot.

1. Barista wouldn't give out WiFi code to a paying customer (would only type it after I bring my device to him) due to "not wanting random people hang around" 2. No milk options at the counter 3. Zero friendliness from the barista. Worst attitude I've ever got in any coffee shop (including Starbucks) in NYC (find another job bruh)  Drip coffee was ok. Would not come back. Such a shame cause the location is so close to me.

I stopped by here early afternoon on Friday hoping I could find a quiet and cozy place to study away from the hectic NYU campus and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is perfect and the space isn't crowded at all. However, the only odd thing about the ambiance was the Disney soundtrack playing over the speakers - I love Disney as much as the next person but it doesn't exactly seem coffee shop chic to me. Moving on to the coffee itself, I ordered a simple hot coffee as I feel like that's the best way to judge a cafe's product and it was delicious. The flavors were present but not overwhelming, and it was smooth on the palate. I ordered a spinach quiche so accompany it and that was warm and flakey as well. These two items came to a total of just over $10 which seems a little steep to me, even for NYC prices so that's a little off-putting. Nonetheless, because of the location and vibes I would probably return, but I may not purchase anything more than a coffee.
One of the best coffees I've ever tried in my life. Very nice place, friendly staff. Damian is one of the best ones working there! He makes the best drinks

Top notch espresso!  I was on the lower east side, needed an espresso and decided to try PROOF.  The atmosphere is comfortable, the shop slightly off the beaten path (the entrance is located inside the brick park on 27th).  Relaxed feel.    I ordered an espresso to stay.  I was told all they have is to go cups for espresso.  I was scared, but, decided to go for it.  I'm glad I did.  Rich crema and an amazing dark chocolate taste.  The flavor and crema lingered.    Definitely worthy of 5 stars.    I also ordered a plain croissant, it was served warm.   The croissant was flaky and delicious.    Highly recommend PROOF, it is worth the trip.
One big community table, a few smaller tables and window seats so plenty of seating space, great coffee (I had an almond milk latte) and free WiFi and lovely staff - a good little find in the area

UPDATED REVIEW: Guess they were going through some opening pains on my first visit. Jeff, the owner, invited me back to try the coffee done right and it was good. Great to have a good coffee place in the neighborhood  Really nice environment and clean, well put together space.  They have a number of milk alternatives for those looking - soy, almond, oat and macadamia.  If you're looking for a nice place to work for a while it's a good choice. Nice large windows and a good amount of space. Not crowded and in an are where there are definitely no alternatives near as good
Come here everyday! The coffee is delicious and the staff is very friendly! Highly recommend this place :)
Great coffee and awesome service. Damien remembers my order every morning and is fun to chat with when I pick up my coffee

I came here on a Monday afternoon at 4pm looking to find a place far away from the 3rd floor of the NYU Meyers building that was decent for studying. Thankfully, this was really close by.  I am in love with the large windows as they let in a lot of natural light even around 5/6pm. Although the space is small, they managed to make it look very spacious.  They were playing a good, healthy mix of Disney and musical songs, Colbie Caillat, cafe music in general--totally my jam.  I think I have found my go-to spot. My only regret after posting this review is that it might get crowded after all the good reviews they are getting.  I wish the stools at the bar area had backs though--my back was killing me. But I couldn't find any other outlets so I had to work there.  But the atmosphere is great. And that's what is important to me.

PROOF is the place to be for coffee and getting work done. I come here every morning and receive consistently great coffee and service. Damian especially brings the energy and ensures your day is off to the right start. Highly recommend to anyone dropping by for a quick cup and for anyone needing a place to meet or work.

I love this place! It's a hidden gem in area that is overcome with chain businesses and mediocrity. The staff are friendly and there is WiFi and outlets. My favorite drink is the macadamia nut milk mocha. Bonus points for being dog friendly. They keep water bowls outside.

Updated review- the barista kindly made me a new drink with regular milk, on the house. Was a nice gesture and the drink was much richer and had a better foam. In the future I'd recommend the regular latte... Glad they gave me a chance to try another one of their drinks

This place is so cute! Great work environment - the huge windows let in a ton of natural light, and the shop feels clean and spacious, even if it's not huge. There is a larger table with 3 chairs and a large bench, 2 small tables with 2 chairs each, and 2 table tops with 8 seats. Overall can seat ~20 people comfortably. They play good mood music too, real easy listening.  The barista Jeff is very knowledgeable and passionate about the coffee, eager to share his knowledge of the origins and taste profiles, and generous with the cold brew samples (clearly his favorite!). The coffee is delicious, and they're proud of the fact that they roast their own coffee in-house!  The place is still very new, so there's no menu (but they're working on it) and the decorations are sparse (which isn't a bad thing!). They have a cool membership deal which I would definitely get on board with if I didn't already make my own coffee most days.  Perfect way to spend a weekend afternoon getting some work done.

Stopped by here this morning after a very long night and so an urgent need for coffee. I decided to order a latte, which is my usual order at most coffee shops. Being the coffee lover that I am, I've had a lot of lattes and so had a variety of places to compare this one to. I was so glad to find out that PROOF makes some of the best lattes that I have ever had. It had the perfect ratio of espresso to milk, definitely recommend it. The place is pretty small but the decor and ambience of the cafe was lovely and very welcoming!
Best coffee I've had in New York! I highly recommend it to anyone that loves cold brew! It also is a pre-quiz to come study and the ambience is so nice!

Good coffee, cute store with relaxing atmosphere and some pleasant AND unpleasant employees working at the counter. I really liked the atmosphere and had good interaction/experiences with employees several times.  Somehow, the specialty latte I ordered didn't quite turn out the way it's supposed to be and the employees working that day offered to make a new one; I didn't want to cause too much hassle and gratefully declined but he insisted me on coming back again and they'll make a free drink on the house. I asked if he could give me something in writing or a voucher so I didn't have to explain myself if someone else is working, he pleasantly explained to just come in and they'll gladly do it for me, and I believed him as I actually have witnessed a very good customer service in the past.  So I went back on 2/19/18 in the morning and something I didn't expect happened. The employee working that morning was pleasant until I explained what happened and asked for a drink. His whole attitude changed towards me to such a rude and condescending manner, and asked me for a proof (or a voucher). When I explained that I asked for one but wasn't given anything, he snapped at me "fine!" in such an annoyance and started to make my drink in silence until I awkwardly walked out of the coffee shop.  I don't know if this man owns the store and thinks that I'm trying to take advantage of this coffee place, but this man really made me feel little and as if I was a beggar, it felt humiliating. I was really glad to see a new quality coffee shop open in the neighborhood and I enjoyed their coffee to a point where I would have gladly pay $6 for a cup of special latte but unfortunately one bad apple has ruined even my past pleasant experiences. I cringe thinking of my experience that day every time I walk by this place to this date. I walk by this place everyday but will never set my foot in this location again.

Open pretty early in the mornings. It's a really cute and aesthetic coffee shop with a lot of natural light. Their coffee is pretty decent, and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Their credit card payment system glitches though, so be prepared to pay cash if you don't want to be swiping your card and having it declined for 5 minutes!

Best Place for an afternoon Coffee and Snack!  I was walking by on 1st Avenue and noticed this great little coffee shop, the staff were so nice and they made me the perfect cup of Coffee!!  Need I say more?

Really awesome little coffee shop! Had a matcha latte that was very good. The staff are really nice and accommodating. Fast WiFi, communal table and some smaller tables to do work. They even brought me a glass of water while I was sitting and working. Definitely recommend as a spot for studying or a quick stop for a drink. Worth the detour.

Spending long hours in the hospital working, so this this gives a little oasis away from it. Great atmosphere/aesthetic, beautiful lighting, really friendly barista. Their card machine was not working and customers needed to pay with cash but  If they didn't have it he still gave a small coffee or espresso and told them to pay another time when they could.  Wish I took a pic, but I had an almond & blueberry muffin that was warmed up for me, so good!! Menu is limited and there were only a few things in the display case around 8am but what I got was still very good. A bit pricey I felt, a small drip coffee and muffin was over $6, but I'm not from the city so I'm not used to some of the pricing.

I stumbled upon this place after closing while walking around the neighborhood, and made a plan to return the next day. It's a rarity for this area which makes it really stand out--a quaint, quiet, and warm little cafe in Murray Hill/Kips Bay. I was able to sit for a while and get some work done. It also seemed like a nice place to meet up with someone. You can bet I'll be returning often!

Nice space, not too crowded. No bathroom. But more importantly the macadamia latte that was highlighted as their specialty was pretty bad. I don't think I've ever had a latte that tasted "watered down." Ive made lattes at home with the same macadamia milk brand and it turns out pretty rich and foamy, so i dont know if they actually dilute the latte with  water..?? It wasn't worth $6 at all. Might come back for a coffee break for regular coffee, but not the latte for sure.

The espresso is the finest in east Midtown. Such a find. Minor quibble is not being able to add your own dairy. Have had the pleasure of engaging am and pm baristas in conversations and it is clear that they are passionate about their work. Great job

I've come here several times on slow afternoons at work. Great friendly employees who have even made me samples when it was slow to try new things. Excellent small coffee shop vibe, love the large windows and free wifi. I certainly appreciate having a nice coffee shop by all the hospitals. The cappuccinos are great and they do some nice coffee art too!

Great place. Nice people. Good coffee properly executed. Great place. Nice people. Good coffee properly executed. Great place. Nice people. Good coffee properly executed. Great place. Nice people. Good coffee properly executed. Great place. Nice people. Good coffee properly executed.  Yup
Excellent Chai latte! A hint of sweetness. Great music and staff working there. Much needed addition to the area.

Excellent coffee and delightful snacks coupled with excellent service. This small yet cozy location hidden within a city block makes you forget that you're in the middle of NYC. A perfect place to study or hang out with friends. Will definitely be making regular trips

This is a welcomed gem in our neighborhood and so close to the hospitals! We needed an independent coffee shop and local roaster. Kian, the barista is wonderful! He's so welcoming and kind and his lattes are on point . Can't say enough good things about this place!
Really cute, quiet spot with very kind staff! Didn't try the coffee, but the iced cocoa was super yummy.

Been there twice so far. They have decent coffee. Although the prices are higher than the Starbucks if you are not enrolled in their unlimited coffee subscription ($6.25 and $4 for a 20oz latte and americano respectively, b4 tax).  Also, they do not have a menu for coffee beverages displayed at the store. The barista doesn't seem too welcoming and doesn't seem to be very knowledgeable about their unlimited coffee program. In addition, the neighborhood area is kinda "sketchy," and I wouldn't go there at night by myself. Personally I don't think it is a ideal place to get work done during the weekends since it opens at 9 am and closes at 3pm. I would come back here and visit more often if they have more extended hours on the weekends.

My new favorite place to get work done! The baristas are always so friendly and accommodating. There's a good amount of seating available and a nice ambience for reading, writing, or plugging your headphones in and doing what you need to do. The coffee is delicious - try a latte with macadamia nut milk.

Stopped by here while visiting NYC and staying down the street. The macadamia milk latte is to die for! Best latte I've ever had! The owner was also very friendly and knowledgable about the coffee - great spot. Will definitely stop by again next time we're here!
Great coffee spot. Owner and employees are very knowledgable about coffee. Friendly and quaint environment. My new study spot. Great addition to the Kips Bay area.

This place is ridiculous for a couple reasons.  First, it's ridiculous that this is the only really good coffee place in short proximity from the dental school.  Second, it's ridiculously good.  Third, it's ridiculously good x1000 when compared to the options close by (Starbucks...).  This place doesn't play around with their coffee!  Fourth, the membership is a ridiculously good deal.  I'm almost tempted not to tell people about this place just so it can basically be my own private source of coffee.  Favorites so far are almond milk latte and chai latte with macadamia milk.  Mixed drinks are just $2 with membership, whattttt.

I'm always on the look out for a coffee place that combines great coffee with a nice space. PROOF Coffee Roasters hits the spot. It's just fantastic. The coffee is great, and the space it's amazing. I spent a few hours on a Saturday morning, and I can't wait to go back. The staff was exceptional, and the whole experience was just amazing. This is going to be one of the top coffee places in the city!
Nice ambience! I like the music. It's a nice place to work.  The owner is very nice and gave us complimentary water along with our coffee/tea.

What a gem! A cute little coffee shop tucked away in kips bay. I was looking for a place to study, and this was the perfect fit. Lots of light, outlets, and a good WiFi connection (just ask the barista for the WiFi password). I got a dirty chai latte with oat milk and it was delicious. I will be back!
Super friendly staff, cold brew was delicious. Need to go back to try The macadamia latte everyone is talking about.

Coffee shop in kips bay. Its new so it seems they're still getting things together.  Coffee was good, but served in paper cups even when it is to stay.  The showtunes music playing loudly killed the vibe for me. Couldn't read with all the sound and had to leave.  Also, i paid by card and now my email account is being spammed every two days with their promotional mailings that i never signed up for. Very aggressive and invasive marketing

This place is the absolute best if you are looking for a place to study, work remotely, or catch up with a friend.  10/10 recommend for free Wifi.  Beyond welcoming - they never make you feel bad for staying.  The baristas are great - instagram worthy latte art every time, play great music, they have even brought me glasses of ice water without even asking, in cute mason jars.  The owner is awesome, he remembered my name after meeting me once and always greets everyone with a smile.  It's apparent he is looking to make this a place for community, so needed in Kips Bay/Murray Hill.  So excited to have found my local spot!

Owner is very welcoming , place is super clean and not to mention the coffee is off the charts. If your in NYC and you want coffee this is your place ! Nothing like organic coffee roasted right here on New York soil !

I got the drip coffee and it was good 4 out of 5 stars for the coffee). The staff is very friendly and the WiFi is great. This is a great place to get a cup of coffee and work on your laptop (5/5 for the staff, decor and space). The view out the windows isn't great but overall I really liked this place.

10/10 recommend. I am so happy this cafe is here now. The coffee is really delicious - I've tried their regular hot coffee and iced americano. Both are great! The interior is really clean and has a cool modern-industrial aesthetic. It's a great spot to study. The WiFi is fast and reliable. The barista is friendly, nice, and informative (if you're a coffee lover and like to learn about the coffee you're drinking). It's my new favorite coffee shop in this area.
This is absolutely amazing coffee.. tried the Nutella, simply put; FANTASTIC! You will not be disappointed.. would highly recommend stopping by if you are in the city

This is my fav new addition to the neighborhood. I'm a medical resident and so appreciate the discount and subscription model. The coffee is better than anything else around. It's the perfect quick coffee break - with great WiFi if I have a few more minutes to chill. The ambiance is inviting and clean and the courtyard bench is perfect for a few minutes outside. Highly recommend.

The New York coffee scene keeps sprouting (pun intended) these places with a little bit extra. It often comes across as gimmicky and destructive of the coffee house experience. But Remi Flower & coffee found a way to make this work. Plus it feels like a little garden of eden in the otherwise concrete jungle of nyc (near midtown no less!)  This is a coffee shop inside of a flower shop. There are so many other photos on here that do this place justice so I haven't added many of my own. There are flowers everywhere but it doesn't feel overbearing. There are a few seats and not too many outlets, so not really the type of place to spend the whole day, but I definitely preferred it that way!  The coffee is good, but expensive. And it's so pretty! I got a rose latte and enjoyed it thoroughly. I would highly recommend stopping by this place if you're in the area.

Absolutely adorable caf̩ flower shop hybrid filled to the brim with flora in every visible direction. The workers are very sweet. Their lavender latte is probably the best I've ever tasted. The matcha latte was unfortunately not my favorite ever and the portion size seemed tiny but c'est la vie I guess. The place is very teeny though, so expect a struggle for a seat.

Came here with 3 friends for a mini college reunion. I saw this place from a Youtuber I follow (shoutout to Ashley B Choi from Ladies Code!) and the interior design of the flowers in the cafe (as well as the drinks themselves) looked so beautiful that we all had to give it a try. And we were definitely blown away by this place!  The interior is literally a cafe within a flower shop. Upon entering, you'll be greeted by so many varieties of flowers and plants, which gave the space such a pretty and calming environment. It really provides a special place to catch up with friends while enjoying beautifully scented lattes and teas.  Speaking of which, we got the following drinks for our hangout: Lavender Latte, Rose Latte, Berry Good Milk Tea, and Berry Matcha Latte (which I didn't get to take as one of my friends had to leave early before we took the photo). I loved each and every one of the drinks! The Lavender Latte was beautiful as you can taste the lavender in the latte, and to the point that it wasn't overpowering. The same goes for each and every one of the drinks as the scents really mixed well with the coffee and milk to provide a delicious latte drink with hints of beautiful floral scents. Not to mention, the latte art is impeccable! I mean look at those flowers adorned with their respective floral parts!  My friends and I really enjoyed hanging out in Remi Flower & Coffee while sipping on delicious drinks. I'll definitely be back with one of my girl friends one day. Thank you again, Ash, for letting viewers like me know about and experience such beautiful and delicious cafes!

My friend took me here for a coffee one day and I'm so happy she took me here. It's a flower/coffee shop and you would think what went wrong but instead it just made the whole experience a lot better. Sipping on a coffee while being surrounded by beautiful plants/flowers just has something special. I had the violet coffee and not only do they make it into an art piece, it actually had nice balanced flavors. So if you're looking for a nice coffee spot that is different from any other coffee shops, try this place. You won't regret it!

Randomly stumbled on this place while searching yelp. I love their concept--flowers and coffee. You can have them make a custom arrangement or buy a plant, all while enjoying a latte that both tastes good and is nice to look at. If you're into the aesthetic, definitely try one of their specialty lattes. I ordered the rose latte, which was perfectly smooth and sweet and soooo pretty. I also saw other people ordering their berry latte (blue) and the London fog which is a grey color. Their iced lattes are pretty too, with a gradient effect. Super instagram worthy!
What a cute store! They sell a lot of different flowers, succulents and also floral latte! I really loved their rose latte, you can also get this without coffee and it's super refreshing and light.

An absolutely stunning and insta worthy cafe and my reason for going. I was gravitated to their beautiful drinks and the flower arrangements. I love the concept of a flower and coffee shop in one. While I was here I ordered the Berry Matcha Latte which was rich in flavor and had a slight sweetness to it. The cafe had a few small 2 seater tables and one bigger rectangular table. I would not necessary go there to get work done as there were already a lot of people there before noon and no outlets to plug in.
A cafe inside a floral shop. You can smell the flowers while sipping your beautiful coffee.

A flower shop and a coffee shop! The space is so small with about 6 small round tables that seat 2 people. The place has flowers everywhere! I really like the idea that I can buy flowers from here. I'm not sure what the pricing is on it so I'll update my review if I get something.  What I enjoyed was their lavender latte! They have a to stay option where they give you a mug but I got mine to go. The lavender latte was so yummy! And the latte art was so carefully done. This is a great location if you wanted to do a coffee date with a friend. I can't wait to try their rose latte next!  The wait time took a while when I came because it was only 1 person behind the counter taking orders and crafting the drinks but as soon as there was a line forming there was another barista who came to help. I can't wait until summer for their ice latte creations as well!

It's a cute little place with some unique Tea and Coffee flavors. Went there for my morning coffee and the placed just wowed us. All tables have beautiful fresh flowers arranged and provide just an amazing vibe to the place. You will find people taking a lot of pictures and Instagrammers doing their thing so sometimes it gets hard to find a table.  The coffees and teas are little expensive in comparison to your regular deli. Also, the flavored coffees and teas are little on a sweater and flowery side as expected. A lot of drinks have dried rose petals and other flowers parts.  I will definitely recommend everyone to give it a try.

Here's a list of things I like:  Pretty lattes (so fun to drink) Smooth coffee (I don't like it bitter or watery) Floral arrangements (I like to stop and smell them, literally and figuratively) Free WiFi (I have homework to do) Decent amount of seating (I got people to see) Quiet environment (I'm getting old)  Remi has it all, and then some! It's a standout of a cafe, for both its coffee and its gorgeous ambiance. Stop in, take a break, relax, enjoy one of their unique lattes, and feast your eyes on their flowers and even their lime tree.  If there is a downside, it'd be that the price is pretty high for black coffee and lattes, but inflation is a bitch and rose petals come at a price.

I came here on a Monday morning and it was packed. The place wasn't very big; it could probably only fit around 15 people. The decor was very cute and artsy. I got a lavender latte and it was soooo good. I can probably say that it was one of the best latte I've ever had. The coffee was strong but not overpowering. There's one corner of the shop that is very instagrammable. I believe they also provide florist service for those that are interested. One downside is that the coffee is a bit on the pricier side, but I would say it was worth it.
That had one hair inside the lavender latte I didn't know that when I finished

This flower/coffee shop caught my eye when I found it walking around my hotel. It's quite small and has only a few tables to sit which can be challenging if you're looking to sit at the cafe rather than taking it to go. The latte art was fine. It was a simple heart which is cute. I like the concept of the shop as it reminds me of the coffee places back home. Sadly I was disappointed by the drink itself. My friend and I both ordered a matcha latte, and it was very bland even with the honey. Also not quite sure what else was in the matcha drink, but we both felt a bit ill after drinking it. Overall I liked the setting of the cafe which makes it a nice study place or place to take pictures for Instagram but the matcha latte was sub par.

One of the most beautiful coffee shops I have ever visited!  It's a coffee shop and a flower shop all in one, with floral-themed lattes on the menu. Basically, this place is an Instagram dream come true.  There are a few tables inside for working or meeting, but I don't think they have a bathroom for guests, or outlets for that matter. Better for short visits without electronics.

Omg this place is so cute!! Run by the cutest Korean women, the coffee and baked goods are so good and this place is just so aesthetically pleasing, it's really worth a visit! They don't have outlets though so not the best place to study but really great place to socialize or hang out or grab a snack or even buy flowers!!

This coffee/flower shop is an icon. If you are tired of chain coffee shops with prototype designs and need a fresh look, fresh smell and also looking for instagram content :))) this is the right place. Every time I share a picture from my coffee I get tones of requests from my friends to go there together.

The boutique is super cute - a lot of flowers, nice atmosphere and a wide range of drinks to choose from. My friend got the rose latte, I went with a matcha. They have oat milk as an option, so that's a great advantage.  My matcha tasted great - creamy but light, not overpowering or watered-down. While the rose latte looked amazing, with real petals on top, we found it to be overwhelmingly sweet. So the drink can feel a bit too sweet, but it's worth the try - especially for that beautiful picture.

A super cute cafe filled with flours ! I came before an appointment and had a few minutes to sit and enjoy a drink in the morning. The atmosphere was beautiful and the latte was very good, however, I thought the service could have been friendlier. The spot was pretty quiet so they didn't have to worry about a large rush of customers, since it was early in the morning. I can see this place getting pretty busy around midmorning through early afternoon.  They are also a functioning flower shop so one can buy the flowers that are on display ! I think the concept is so unique ! Definitely will stop by again if I am in the area !

Both a cafe and florist shop, expect a crowd when going to Remi's. Came here with a small group on the weekend and it was packed! Although they do have a decent amount of seating our group of four was out of luck and had to stand. For the price, everyone agreed that the size of their drinks was too small, and flavor wise my chai was just ok. The rose latte seems quite popular here due to the bright red color is has (very instagramable). Unfortunately, they only had one person working the cafe section of the store, so it took forever for us to get our drinks. I honestly think the florist side of this business is better, they had lots of beautiful and unusual flower arrangements as well as high quality and decently priced for Manhattan potted plants. I'd probably come here for the flowers, not the cafe in the future. (FYI this is not a place to come and study or work on a computer.)

My experience here can be summed up in one word: repulsive.  Waited at the counter and placed an order for 2 lavender lattes, one iced and one warm. We ordered them "to stay" because we wanted to enjoy them in the coffee shop.  The place was crowded but we managed to get a seat at a small table for 2. The barista called our name to let us know the drinks were ready. The iced lavender latte was great tasting, great flavor, just the right amount of milk, ice, flavor, espresso. It came in a disposable plastic cup.    The warm lavender latte was served in a ceramic mug and it had someone's lipstick all over it. It was a dirty used mug that had been drank by the previous customer and never had been washed, it had only been refilled with another latte. We complained to the girl who took our order. She didn't apologize and said you'll have to be patient and wait for another latte.  We waited for the second latte, and the 2nd mug looked like it was dirty as well. The saucer had water on it and some other debris and it looked like the saucer and mug had not been cleaned. How could you do something so egregious twice?!  And to the same customer!?  I would NEVER return here. I prefer clean mugs when I drink my coffee or latte.  It appears that when they're busy, they take the used mugs and place them in one sink and the ones that are supposed to be cleaned are in the same sink--and they have a small divider between them. This is apparently something that's confusing for the barista who reaches into the dirty side of the sink and prepares lattes in dirty unwashed mugs.  Please be careful if you plan on checking this place out.
Delicious coffee with floral designs, cute caf̩ ! They have a few seets (15 I guess) and sell flowers and coffee specialties.

Lovely place, calming atmosphere. A perfect place to relax in a peaceful climate. The Lavender Latte was a bit disappointing, it didn't taste as good as it looked. I would definitely visit again and try something else.
Beautiful!! It was so lovely to drink my coffee and be surrounded by flowers in the middle of winter

This place is a gem! It's really close to my workplace so I went in the morning. It wasn't very busy even during rush hour and there was ample seating and WiFi for if you want to sit for a while. The store makes it feel like you're far away from the city and it made my morning so much more enjoyable and relaxed. For those of you who are sensitive to caffeine like me, there's lattes made with rose tea!

Wow. What an experience. I came across this cafe when I took a wrong turn on the way to work. I walked past the window, and had to go in. The atmosphere is fantastic. Flowers everywhere. Extremely unique in a very different location. They use La Columbe coffee I believe which you can buy in your supermarket or Whole Foods, but it is good. I had just drip coffee, but they have speciality lattes such as the rose latte, which look beautiful. The staff are friendly but quiet. I will definitely try to make my way back here!

This quaint little coffeeshop just opened up a block down from my house and I just had to check it out! With a dual concept like this sometimes I think one element overwhelms the other but the balance between flowershop and coffeeshop was great.  We tried the Matcha Latte and a drip coffee, which were both well-made. Seating was a little sparse but the tables / chairs are modular so we eventually found seats for everyone.  This is a great place to sit down and have a coffee but would not recommend it for a working space or a grab-and-go. Half the experience is being able to soak in all the greenery!

Extremely cute flower/coffee shop. Seats are extremely limited though so if you're trying to get a seat, I would come early in the morning. Also would not recommend to those people that go to coffee shops to 'study' (this isn't a library).  The lavender and rose lattes are yummy. Ice lattes are a must during the summer. Would also recommend the pastries.

This cafe is one of a kind in the city! I walked in and was greeted with a smile from both workers. They were extremely nice and even put together 2 different bouquets for my mother and my brothers mother in law! Probably the most beautiful flowers, it stole the show at my brothers rehearsal dinner! Over all I would rate this cafe one of the best in NYC. The coffee is extremely good, they have a variety of drinks and I enjoyed every moment. If your a coffee enthusiast and like the smell of flowers, this place is perfect for you! (Attached is a picture of the bouquets just stunning!)

Remi Flower and Coffee is an adorable coffee shop that doubles as a flower shop. The latte that I got was ok, the service is great, and the ambience is wonderful.  I loved being surrounded by bonsai trees, flowers and the kumquat tree. It was beautiful in there and so peaceful! It feels like you are within a greenhouse. What a great idea! A woman came in just to take pictures of the beautifully arranged plants and flowers!  I went here to wait for my friend for lunch and drink a latte. Remi was closest to our lunch location and away from the construction down the street.    I ordered a earl grey latte. The latte was ok. The earl grey flavor was not very pronounced. Next time, I will order a La Colombe coffee.  One of the waitresses was explaining the plants to a customer. Some of the locals came in just to pick up coffee or inquire about a plant.  I enjoyed this coffee shop so much that I brought my friend back to browse the plant selection!

I'm so glad I found this place, and it happens to be so close to school, I love It!  My friend and I needed a quiet place to sit down and catch up. This place definitely hit the spot. Not only is it a flower shop but it doubles as a cafe as well. It's so aesthetically pleasing we stayed there for over two hours!  My friend and I both ordered the matcha latte which came with latte art (yay). It had a subtle sweetness which paired so well with the blueberry muffin I also ordered (tasted great as well).  Seating wise there aren't that many but I'm not complaining because it would have taken away the beauty of this place. It honestly feels like you're sitting in a garden. It's quiet, but not too quiet. You can easily get some work done here and be surrounded by the most peaceful vibes ever. Definitely recommend 5/5!

OBSESSED! This two-in-one coffee and flower shop is the perfect place to satiate your eyes and tastebuds at once.  When you walk in, it feels like you're walking into a beautiful, tropical jungle of sorts. As a coffee and floral shop, all the fresh flowers and plants greet you upon entry along with the friendly baristas! My visual and olfactory senses were instantly in heaven.  I ordered the rose milk latte and so happy I did. Not only did it taste delicious (not overly sweet or floral but just right), the latte art was so pretty! They created a rose and topped it with edible dried flower petals. Also, for all you dairy-free coffee drinkers, happy to share they have tons of dairy free milk options!  Service is great, ambience is killer, coffee is delicious and flowers/plants and beautiful. I highly recommend checking out REMI the next time you need a plant/floral/caffeine fix!
Usually pretty coffees don't have flavor and taste pretty bad, but this one was amazing. Definitely a must try in NYC!

Came here after seeing on yelp, because I was hoping it would be adorable. And it is. I love a coffe place that offers the ability to have a relaxing cappuccino, not forcing us to get coffee to go.  It does have a lot of charm, and quite a bit of seating.  The coffee wasn't strong enough for me to love; but I would come back with someone. I like black coffee, which isn't as popular in the states so I expected this.  The price is the same as the Starbucks I got yesterday but worlds better.  If you're in the area, and love coffee check it out.
Super cute and great drinks! Beware though, there's very limited seating, so plan accordingly.

This place really frustrates me because I so desperately want to give them five stars. It should have hit all the marks: the space is bright and beautiful, and doesn't feel overwhelming despite the countless number of plants in the store; there are a good number of seats for the small space along with free wifi; the food and drinks menu looks good with your standard coffee and expresso-based offerings, pastries, and also very interesting teas (yuzu and jujube in particular stood out to me). It is a family-run business and I am a big proponent of these small coffee shops popping up in boring old Midtown.  But the espressos...are not good. I got the flat white and my boyfriend got the cortado. The burnt and acrid taste of the overly extract expresso cut straight through the milk and they were not the smooth drinks I expected at all. That's really frustrating because I can't, in good conscience, overlook it since Pennylane is only a couple of blocks away and pulls a much smoother shot. I really hope this is an issue with the beans / the new machine still needs some flushing out or adjustments for the right water to ground ratio. Probably will be sticking to the teas here until that's corrected. On the bright side, they have oat milk as an dairy alternative and that's an exciting new product I'm hoping more places will start carrying (as far as I know, Irving Farm in Midtown is the only other place that carries it right now).  Nevertheless, I'm pumped to see this place opened in my neighborhood and have my eyes on some of the cute poinsettias for holiday decorating!

It is really such a nice place to get away from all the NYC noise. Being surrounded with plants and sipping delicious coffee is quite relaxing. The owner and the people working there are very friendly and approachable, which makes it even a more pleasant experience. The shop does have a bathroom for guests, and there is some flowers there as well. :)
Cute shop filled with the smell of coffee and flowers. The lavender latte is a must try! The barista is very friendly.

Came here on a Saturday morning with sister. The place is a lot smaller than expected but super pretty in there. It's a flower shop / coffee shop and the plants in there are simply beautiful. Their drinks are just as beautiful and tasty as well! I got the lavender latte and my sister got the rose berry cold drink, and both were amazing. The presentation was on point and the flavor was just perfect. There is free WiFi too for anyone who wants to do work there. I will definitely be back.

Two of my all time favorite things combined into one place: flowers and coffee. The baristas and workers are really really nice. They were very welcoming and friendly. I ordered a honey latte with matcha Madelines to stay. The prices aren't bad and you pay for the quality of the espresso drinks. The Madelines were delicious and went really well with my latte. My honey latte was on point, it was smooth and delicious too.
Wow what a peaceful place. Lovely people. The caffe latte was amazing great place to relax and get your coffe

Visited Remi to get my friend a cactus flower she's been wanting to get for a while. As soon as you enter you get the beautiful fragrance of fresh cut flowers and greenery. It's a quaint little cafe that feels like a indoor garden with many different types of plants, not just flowers. Seating is minimal but sitting on the long table with a cup of berry-yuzu ade was very refreshing. I wouldn't say it's the best cafe nor the best florist shop but the synergy between the two is definitely worth dropping by. It's a beautiful little oasis in the hectic streets of upper east side.

Like most coffee shops in NYC, Remi was extremely crowded with few seating options. I was unable to find a seat. When I visited at 10:30am they were sold out of all pastries and food options. I wouldn't recommend this place for anything other than grabbing a drink to-go.
Very nice coffee place - just like the name, flowers and plants surrounded.  Liked the mocha!

A beautiful and aromatic place to caffeinate.  I met a friend here on a very cold day and we agreed that it was a lovely bit of springtime in the middle of winter.  Admittedly, I'm obsessed with rose ~everything~ so the rose latte was the clear choice.  Pretty latte art, quality coffee, fragrant floral setting.  I'm definitely coming back here again.

A lovely and heart-melting place! I had the latte and it was good! My friend ordered tea latte and it looks really nice. I would definitely try it out next time.  I saw bunch of ppl studying here. I guess it would be nice to get surrounded by flowers.

Fantastic addition to the neighborhood! My husband and I live around the corner, and we've made Remi our go-to for pre-work coffee and housewarming presents.  Coffee: they serve La Colombe. I don't drink coffee but the hubby is a fan of their espresso and drip coffee. Their earl grey lattes are worth a try too! We normally grab and go but there are a handful of tables if you want to enjoy the greenhouse-esque sanctuary.  Flowers: their succulents and cacti are especially delightful. And if you can afford it, their little trees are sublime! The staff wrap everything you buy with such delicate care. It feels like a true mom-and-pop place; they really put their hearts into everything!

Bought my beautiful money tree here and I couldn't be happier with my purchase! I was drawn to this cute flower coffee shop by its storefront and going in was even more captivating with the variety of plants and flowers they had. Remi was so knowledgeable and so patient with addressing all my plant questions. (Thank you Remi!) The shop had such a refreshing garden-like atmosphere, you can just sit and enjoy a cup of tea/coffee in here.
I like the taste of different coffees and stuff is so kind. You can try lavender latte
Love the place!! Remi is a very nice person and did an amazing job in handcrafting cactuses decorations for our home! Excellent and friendly service!

A very nice and unassuming store. I came here looking for a plant/flower to gift and the staff was helpful in picking one out. I ultimately went with a nice little orchid and it didn't break the bank. Would definitely recommend.

Aesthetically pleasing flower boutique/ cafe for fresh coffee and treats. Five stars for the ambience but the food is not at the same level. The coffee is decent while the pastries and croissants on display are ok for a  quick bite.

Can't say how much I enjoy coming to Remi. They have fantastic summer drinks - e.g berry rose latte, match mint yuzuade. Shown in the pictures. And what's better than sitting among beautiful flowers on a sunny afternoon, it's hard to find in New York City! Their flowers are very beautiful and have interesting design too! The florists seem to be very talented and attentive. A big plus is that I get to enjoy my coffee while my 10 months old get mesmerized by the beautiful vibrant colors and the magic like movement of coffee making. The barista is very good, the coffee drinks has the perfect balance of coffee and the other flavors - some places make the special drinks overly sweet but not here! H

I can't get enough of this place! It's a neighborhood gem and I find myself here all the time to enjoy the vibes and a cup of coffee. Their lavender and rose lattes are out of this world! They also have great pastry options, I'd highly recommend the almond croissant. Love that this place is in a florist shop - makes the decor and ambiance so charming! And smells great too :)
My favorite coffee shop. Friendly employees  yummy drinks and exotic flowers  chill vibe  smells like flowers in here  I love coming here!

This place is really cute with the flower wall and all the decors but I ordered one of their summer special drinks and I didn't really enjoy it. It was this sparkling strawberry rose drink I forgot the name of it, it was a 16oz drink for $6. That's totally not worth my money because the drink wasn't even good. It's so artificial, it's basically sparkling water with a few rosebuds, a slice of strawberry, and some strawberry syrup. I literally could have gone 7/11 and bought a bottle of sparkling strawberry water for $2. I would still go back to try their other drinks but I know for sure I'm not going to order that drink again. Also, don't take their paper straws because they will charge you 25 cents for it. I didn't know so I took one and I think they thought that I was trying to steal a paper straw... It's literally only 25 cents, it's not like I can't afford it, I ordered your $6 drink already. What kind of damage can 25 cents do to me?
This is the best place in the neighborhood! My favorite coffee is a flat white, which they do to perfection. And what's not to love about being surrounded by nature and beauty?

Love love love the interior of this cafe! So cute! The coffee was on point too Smells like flowers and it's so colorful and relaxing It's a small place with a few tables but it's a nice meet up spot on the off hours  Definitely recommend for anyone in the UES area

By far one of the cutest coffee shops I have ever been in. The staff members are all so kind and welcoming. Not only is the (la colombe) coffee amazing, but the environment speaks for itself- a floral oasis. Perfect for a place to sit down and do work or grab your morning coffee. I love Remi!

I really like the decor of this place and the coffee is good. However, I tried to purchase a plant but there appears to only be one person who can sell the plants and she wasn't there in the morning and when I went in the afternoon, she was not there again. I waited 15 minutes and then gave up. It was a waste of time going there and waiting to no avail just to get a plant. I suggest you work on a system where plants can be sold without relying on the presence of a single person.
It's been open for four months and I just discovered this little slice of midtown heaven! Perfect little spot for coffee meetings and flower gazing. You cannot leave empty handed!

A beautiful space and very pretty latte art. I feel I have to write because as a buyer beware. I came in specifically to buy flowers because it's so hard to find florists with this kind of gorgeous atheistic. I worked with the florist to create a bouquet. Most florists will ask how much you are looking to spend before they create the bouquet. She did not. the bouquet we created amounted to three ranunculus and three roses with some seeded eucalyptus.  At the most it should have cost 40 dollars. The girl who made the bouquet said something to the girl at the register and the register girl looked at her very surprised and they laughed and then charged me 78 dollars!
